Job_Description: About The Uncomplicated FamilyThe Uncomplicated Family (TUF) is a progressive health innovation company and passionate team who embrace commitment, innovation and compassion to enhance the quality of life for individuals, families and communities who are affected by disabilities. Our teams include: Speech-Language Pathologists, Occupational Therapists, Physiotherapists, Family Support Personnel, Software Developers and Engineers, Researchers, and Psychologists. The Uncomplicated Family Corporate Group includes Kids Uncomplicated Inc. (Clinical and Family Support Services) and Communities Uncomplicated Inc. (Software Development: Teleroo™ Technology).Teleroo™ is an award-winning group of technologies that has resulted in remarkable outcomes for children, families, and practitioners. Teleroo™ breaks down conventional barriers such as location, time constraints and budget to increase access to quality interventions to assist in service provision. Our technologies include a robust video-based platform for team collaboration, along with iOS therapy tool apps. The Teleroo™ Gateway platform was recently relaunched in collaboration with QoC Health. The successful candidate will work exclusively on Teleroo™ Technology with the Uncomplicated Family and QoC teams operating out of The Uncomplicated Family headquarters inCalgary, Alberta.About QoC HealthQoC Health is a diverse healthcare company that offers platform technology to design and build engagement-focused solutions leveraging new service delivery models. QoC focuses on connecting patients into circles of care and making it easier for healthcare organizations to get connected with their patients. Our engagement platform allows for perfect fit tools and solutions designed to integrate across a wide range of healthcare areas. From Wound Care to Aging Well and everything in between, our technologies help shift care to the community and keep patients out of hospital.The TUF/QoC CultureA passionate, cross-disciplinary team of technologists, healthcare professionals, and researchers, the TUF/QoC team loves what they do, and strives to achieve great things everyday. Motivated, genuine, and fun, the team is driven by innovation, challenging the status quo, with a focus toward the future. As part of the team you will have opportunities to bring solutions to some of our toughest client care challenges, across a diverse range of clients from around the globe, with opportunities to learn and grow from every project. We’re driven to improve care for everyone, help us shape the future!Role DescriptionWe are looking for a motivated Sr. Front-end Developer with strong front end, JavaScript, UI/UX experience who has worked with a range of frameworks to join our team. This is a full-time position based out ofCalgarywhere you will work with the development team, project managers and designers to build and customize robust frontend applications and libraries for our existing engagement platform and API’s. This is truly a leadership role, with excellent opportunity for ownership of an important and expanding aspect of the business.ResponsibilitiesAs a Senior Front-end Developer you will be responsible for architecting, building and optimizing reusable front end HTML5 / JavaScript / Java libraries, API’s, UI Modules, UI Widgets, and SDK’s to accelerate building robust web applications based on our engagement platform.In addition, you will:Participate in the discovery, design and specification of apps.Translate functional requirements into effective and intuitive applications.Build and customize front-end web applications using JavaScript and HTML5 based apps.Lead, train, and mentor new developers that join the team.Participate in the development and architecture planning for our engagement platform, providing insight and guidance on improvements to better support application development.Required Skills5+ years of professional software development experience3+ years experience developing front-end web applications in JavaScript3+ years experience with JavaScript, jQuery, TypeScriptExperience with web technologies (HTML5, JavaScript, jQuery , CSS3, SASS)Experience building responsive web applicationsAbility to translate functional requirements into effective and intuitive responsive web applicationsRESTful web service integration experienceExperience working with 3rd party data sources and API’sExperience with Analytics and VisualizationWorking knowledge of source code management tools (Git, GitHub)Ability and desire to write self-explanatory and reusable codeExcellent problem solving skills and loves technical challengesAttention to detail and a passion for qualityExcellent communication and creative problem solving skillsNice to Have SkillsExperience with encryption methodologies (SHA256, BCrypt, PBKDF2)Working knowledge of HL7Working knowledge of build management tools (Maven, Gradle)Working knowledge of Health Care related privacy policies, including PHIPA and HIPAAExperience with live/on demand Video Streaming (TokBox, WebRTC, Vidyo, Wowza)Experience with messaging service providers (Twilio)Work Arrangement: Position Type: Full-Time, RegularHours of work: 37.5 hours per weekStart Date: When a suitable candidate is foundCompensation: Competitive and will be discussed during the interview processBenefits: Three weeks of paid vacation; paid sick/personal time; benefits package includes Health, Dental, Vision, and Employee Family Assistance Plan coverage.If you are interested in this rewarding and exciting opportunity, please respond to this ad with your cover letter and resume.This posting will remain open until a suitable candidate is found and only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Thank you for your interest.Job Type: Full-time
Title: Senior Front-End Developer

Job_Description: At Vintri Technologies, we are on the mission to save businesses from losing millions of dollars as it relates to their assets during the construction and manufacturing phases. With constant changes to regularly requirements, Vintri Technologies provides viable solutions for data capture, data integrity and data integration.As we continue to grow, the Full Stack Developer (which will now be third to join the team) will take software requirements, develop detailed designs, user stories and guide other developers in project scope, coding, testing and troubleshooting. This position offers the opportunity to make a huge impact on Vintri’s future – especially if the candidate jumps right in and commits to making a difference!If you are passionate about what you do, are looking to make your mark on a growing company and believe there is such a time as beer o’clock, then this role is right for you!As a Full Stack Developer, you will be responsible for: Support the creation and development of a new product, with some future exposure to ‘Distributed Ledger Technology’Contribute to the development and maintenance of the back-end services of our produce, such as to manage content, search it efficiently, handle import and export capabilities, deal with user authentication and authorization, and more.Design, build and maintain high performance, reusable and reliable JavaScript codeProactively and efficiently find innovates way to improve efficiency and functionalityOccasionally visit customers to install or fix productsDesign, develop and test system interfaces utilizing various computer languagesDeliver user-centered, clean, simple, responsive, and intuitive interfaces with optimized codeManaging time while juggling multiple projects and working within tight deadlines; providing sound time estimates to major stakeholdersBut first…demonstrate the following: Proficiency in server-side programming with Node.js and working with NoSQL databasesExperienced in building and consuming REST APIsDemonstrate knowledge of JSON/XMLDemonstrate experience with GITComfort with Agile development methodologyHave Knowledge / experience in a Frontend frameworks like AngularJS/ReactJs/VueJsHave knowledge of Graph Databases and the Gremlin language, TypeScript and cloud technologies such as Azure (this is nice to have)Why work for Vintri?Great potential for personal growth, including potential advancement in the software development teamAn entrepreneurial environment, open to new ideas and expanding technologiesAn excellent remuneration packageA dynamic leadership team, fostering successAn unlimited vacation policy (just get the job done!)A belief that work is not a place you go, rather what you do (so yep, super flexible working conditions!)It’s true: this isn’t just your typical nine to five job. This position is for someone who is ready to take control over their career. An amazing path is ready and waiting for the right candidate. Is it you?To apply: To apply send all resumes to https://jobs-elevatedhr.icims.com/jobs/1472/full-stack-developer/job. We thank all applicants for their submissions, but only those deemed qualified by the hiring manager will be contacted. No phone calls please.Job Type: Full-time
Title: Full Stack Developer

With constant changes to regularly requirements, Vintri Technologies provides viable solutions for data capture, data integrity and data integration.As we continue to grow, the Blockchain Developer will aim to deduce and understand the limitations and implementation hurdles surrounding Blockchain / Distributed Ledger Technology. We will look to assess several DLT protocols and the associated values/restrictions that each offer. This effort will include the best approach and alignment for integration with our core software product, VintriID. Title: Blockchain Developer

Job_Description: Showpass is a ticketing and event management software company. We empower venue and event organizers to create a rich, connected experience for their customers through next-generation technology. We combine cutting-edge software and hardware for seamless on- and offline sales, while delivering event management tools on the same integrated platform.  But what makes us different?  Showpass offers a unique platform for collaboration between the key groups that power events. From venues, to organizers, to street teams, to event attendees, we are focused on bringing people together through the magic of live events. We also happen to be powered by a very talented team fostering innovation, creativity and disruption. These pillars support the Showpass culture which is built on a love for events, and all things food. That’s what makes us the fastest growing Canadian ticketing company.  THE ROLE: Full Stack Developer (full-time permanent role)  T HE LOCATION: Calgary, Alberta  THE PERKS: A unique and fun place to work – flexible hours and vacation policy, in-house chef, fully stocked snack and fresh pressed juice bar, gym membership, dog-friendly office and parking  Competitive compensation and benefits package  THE RESPONSIBILITIES: Work with developers and designers to make exciting new features and elegant pages  Learn new technologies, frameworks and concepts in a short period of time  Assist production deployment and provide post-production support and troubleshooting  Participate in routine standups, code reviews and testing parties  Write clean code in a testable, reliable and sustainable way  THE QUALIFICATIONS: Post secondary education in engineering or computer science would be an asset  Minimum 1 year experience working in a technology or software company  Must have experience working with the following technologies: Python, Django or similar (Flask, Rails, Node.js, Go), Git, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Docker, Kubernetes, Fabric, Chef or other infrastructure automation tools, AngularJS or similar frontend frameworks (Backbone, Ember, Polymer)  Strong testing and debugging skills  Must work great in a team and also as an individual contributor  Ability to champion new ideas and develop creative approaches  Analytical thinker with the ability to problem solve in a fast-paced work environment  Must have the hustle and drive to take initiative and make things happen!  NOTE: We will only contact qualified candidates of interest.
Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: Eagle is currently seeking an AWS Architect . This is a three (3) month, contract position scheduled to start in May.  Key Responsibilities  The successful candidate will be responsible for: Providing recommendations to clients with respect to cloud migrations and preparing technical implementation roadmaps for AWS adoption;  Creating functional design specifications, reference architectures, and assisting with other project deliverables as needed;  Designing state-of-the-art technical solutions on AWS that address customer’s requirements for scalability, reliability, security, and performance;  Collaborating with other project teams on technical solutions and help improve service IP; and,  Staying up-to-date on all technical developments related to AWS.  Skills and Qualifications  The qualified candidate must have: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, other technical field;  Knowledge of building product-quality software on AWS including experience in designing for high availability, building multi-zone and multi-region architectures, and designing across appropriate SQL and NoSQL data layer technologies;  Familiarity with various application stacks such as Java, C#, .Net, etc.;  Configuration and deployment experience in two or more of the following:  AWS apps technologies such as RDS, ElasticBeanstalk, DynamoDB, RedShift;  AWS IaaS Technologies such as EC2, S3, EBS, ELB, VPC, Route 53;  Deployed applications with Web UI frontends;  Deployed application with RESTful/SOAP services interfaces;  Experience building private AMI’s on VPC’s;  Firm grasp on cloud security, leveraging Linux and Windows operating systems, using the AWS console and CLI (command line interface);  Experience as a hands-on technical practitioner/specialist in client facing roles in large enterprises and demonstrated client facing consulting skills, including building strong client relationships;  Excellent verbal, presentation and written communications skills;  Strong team skills including the ability to lead and be a team player; and,  AWS certification in any of the following - Solutions Architect, Developer or Systems Ops (an asset).  Don’t miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!  Eagle is an equal opportunity employer and will provide accommodations during the recruitment process upon request. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that your application does not signify the beginning of employment with Eagle and that employment with Eagle will only commence when placed on an assignment as a temporary employee of Eagle.
Title: AWS Architect

Title: Application Development Manager

Job_Description: Description <br/>  <div>Do you want to align your work with your values and work for a company on a mission to inspire people to #trynatural products? <br/><br/> <strong>About Us</strong> <br/><br/> Social Nature, is an influencer marketing company that harnesses the power of consumer influence to drive results for the world's most progressive brands. We believe that marketing should be based on companies making great products, and that everyday consumers are your best marketers. <br/><br/> <strong>At Social Nature our core beliefs are:</strong> <br/><br/> + Promote good stuff not junk <br/><br/> + Everyday consumers have influence <br/><br/> + Profit with purpose <br/><br/> Over 100 brands have tapped into our community of 200K+ Everyday Influencers to get people talking about their products. To-date, we've influenced over 1.5 million people to #trynatural products! Over the next 3 years, we’ll be onboarding more enterprise customers, growing our community into the millions, automating our platform, and expanding our customer offerings. <br/><br/> <strong>What You’ll Be Doing</strong> <br/><br/> You will be a key player in our tech team - bridging the user interaction and data layers within our web app. You have a mentality of starting with the customer first and working backwards, while taking ownership over everything you ship. You love making things beautiful, and you have a strong understanding of usability and visual design. You believe that you can achieve more on a team-that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. You rely on others' candid feedback for continuous improvement. You know that Continuous Delivery is the norm and that being able to iterate rapidly and be flexible benefits the product and the company. <br/><br/> As we meet our ambitious growth milestones, the engineering team will grow, and so will your position in the company. Where you fit best and how your role changes is in your hands.</div> <br/>  Requirements <br/>  <div>  <ul> <li>Have 3+ years relevant programming experience</li><li>You’ve built highly performant and accessible applications in the past and know what is required to deliver and manage one</li><li>Design and business acumen. Whether you're working on an internal tool consumed by our operation teams, or a feature used by millions of users, your attention to details results in a delightful experience</li><li>Mastery of javascript, HTML5 and CSS3 and the experience and ability to build working UI quickly</li><li>Strong grasp of graphic/material design fundamentals, responsive layouts and CSS grids</li><li>Deep knowledge of at least one JavaScript framework</li><li>Awareness of cross-browser compatibility issues</li><li>Ability to turn hi-fidelity graphic comps into pixel-perfect HTML</li></ul></div>  <br/>Responsibilities <br/>  <div>Reporting to the CTO and collaborating with your fellow developers, a product designer, and the rest of the Social Nature team, your day-to-day will include: <ul>  <li>The creation of user-facing websites using the latest and best available cross-platform .NET tools</li> <li>Owning the overall reliability and performance of our customer-facing web application and back-office suite</li> <li>Keeping up to date with the latest trends and best practices, introducing them to your workflow</li> <li>Leading the requirements gathering and workflow decision-making process for the team</li> <li>Writing testable code using TDD methods; mentoring others to do the same</li> <li>A/B testing shipped features to establish data baselines and measure performance</li>  </ul> <strong>What We Look For</strong> <ul>  <li><strong>You are a strategic and analytical thinker.</strong> You are able to contribute your own ideas, and think creatively about how to get the best outcome for the company and the customer.</li> <li><strong>You are solutions focused.</strong> You embrace challenges and dig deep to come up with creative solutions that get us back on track.</li> <li><strong>You care a lot.</strong> You take full ownership over your role and the outcomes. As a result, you pay close attention to detail, never make the same mistake twice, and take initiative to continuously improve outcomes.</li> <li><strong>You're naturally curious and have a growth mindset.</strong> You have a high degree of self-motivation and initiative with a drive to learn and grow your role. You like to experiment with new and creative ideas.</li> <li><strong>You have strong organizational and time management skills.</strong> In a growing company, there will always be more things to do than you have time for. A+ team members are excellent at staying focused, prioritizing, and automating non value-added work.</li> <li><strong>You have an entrepreneurial spirit</strong>. You are adaptable and comfortable with ambiguity and change. You’re comfortable taking on multiple roles, sometimes outside of your comfort zone.</li> <li><strong>You are an excellent relationship builder.</strong> You quickly earn trust and confidence with your team and our customers. You foster a productive and empowering work environment.</li> </ul></div>  <br/>Compensation <br/>  <div><strong>Reasons to Work with Us</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>1. Join a forward thinking company on a mission</strong> to inspire people to #trynatural products. Be part of the consumer-powered marketing revolution. <br/><br/> <strong>2. HUGE opportunity for career growth!</strong> We’re a 10 person funded start-up that is doubling our team size this year. We’re at a critical high-growth stage, where our staff are encouraged to think big and embrace an entrepreneurial mindset. You’ll learn more here than anywhere else, and have the opportunity to make a big impact. <br/><br/> <strong>3. Competitive salary, employee stock opti</strong><strong>ons, up to 4 weeks paid time off and comprehensive health/dental benefits.</strong> We also enjoy a flat hierarchy, bright Gastown office with a green living wall, professional development opportunities, quarterly team events, annual company retreat, and lots of natural snacks and fair trade coffee/tea to keep you fuelled! <br/><br/> <strong>4.</strong> <strong>Development environment freedom</strong>, we are fully cross-platform and embrace open-source. Choose your weapon - are you a PC or Mac? <br/><br/> Learn more about our <strong>team culture</strong> and<strong>our founder</strong>, who was named Canada’s likeliest future entrepreneur queen! <br/><br/> <strong>What’s Next</strong> <br/><br/> If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, please apply directly on our website or send your resume and cover letter to careers@socialnature.com with the subject line: <strong>Frontend Software Developer</strong>.</div> <br/>  <div> APPLY for Frontend Software Developer: Vancouver, BC</div> <br/> <ul>   <li> <br/>  Email</li>  </ul>  <br/>
Title: Frontend Software Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Senior Full Stack Developer, Consumer Web</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Full-Time | Engineering | Regina, SK</em> <br/><br/> At GasBuddy, we take pride in helping people by building innovative, comprehensive products for millions of gas station owners, fuel retailers and drivers on the road every day - and our world-class team is always up the challenge. GasBuddy is a place that empowers employees to grow, build and thrive. Whether were releasing a new app feature or competing in ping pong tournaments, youll be a part of a team that puts in 110%. <br/><br/> GasBuddy is looking for a Senior Full-Stack Developer with a heavy focus on JavaScript to join us and lead the development and launch of new GasBuddy products on our consumer web properties. You will contribute towards the development of web properties, microservices, and internal tools. This is a small team that takes pride in their work and implements creative solutions. <br/><br/> You will be part of a new team to assess, evaluate and rebuild GasBuddy.com. The site receives a tremendous amount of traffic,1 million unique hits per month, and we need to mirror the mobile experience on the website. <strong><u>If you want to build a first class product and have a real passion for connecting with users this is the role for you!</u></strong> <br/><br/> What You'll Do:  <ul> <li>Work directly on gasbuddy.com and relevant web properties</li> <li>Opportunity to lead/mentor junior members of the team</li> <li>Collaborate with engineering and systems teams to deliver end-to-end solutions</li> <li>Encourage best practices for the web</li> </ul> What We Seek:  <ul> <li>Strong ability with modern frontend JavaScript frameworks (Ember, Angular, Backbone, or React)</li> <li>Node.js experience</li> <li>BA/BS or equivalent work experience</li> <li>3+ years of full-stack web development</li> <li>Professional experience with PostgreSQL or similar</li> <li>Experience with RESTful services</li> <li>Data-informed product development: analytics, A/B testing, etc.</li> <li>Ability to work in a fast-paced, startup environment</li> <li>Understanding of SEO methodologies</li> <li>Experience with universal/isomorphic React</li> <li>Experience with building microservices</li> <li>Experience with agile methodologies</li> <li>Experience with accessibility standards</li> </ul> <strong><u>About GasBuddy</u></strong> <br/><br/> GasBuddy is a smartphone app connecting drivers with their Perfect Pit Stop. GasBuddy is the leader in crowdsourced information to help drivers find the best gas prices, closest stations, friendliest service, cleanest restrooms, tastiest coffee and much more. GasBuddy is the leading source for the most accurate, real-time fuel prices at more than 140,000 gas stations in the U.S., Canada and Australia. The Companys B2B Retailer Software-as-a-Service (SaaS), known as GasBuddy Business Pages, provide Fuel Marketers and Retailers their best opportunity to maintain their station information, manage their brand, and promote to their target consumer audience. For more information, visit www.gasbuddy.com. <br/><br/> GasBuddy is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, colour, religion, sex, age, disability, military status, national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or applicable local law. <br/><br/> To all recruitment agencies: GasBuddy does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, GasBuddy employees or any other company location. GasBuddy is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes received will be considered our property and will be processed accordingly.
Title: Senior Full Stack Developer

Company: Sodatone, a Warner Music Group company
Job_Description: Sodatone helps the music industry find the best undiscovered artists through data analytics and predictive intelligence. We’re a Toronto-based startup that was acquired by Warner Music Group in 2018, where we’re building a large-scale analytics engine to understand how the world interacts with music. <br><br> There are two core components to our technology. <br><br> <strong>The Sodatone Platform:</strong> The industry’s most comprehensive data analytics and visualization platform, used by the most influential people in music. They depend on it to find emerging talent that deserves their attention, and monitor critical insights and data on their own roster of artists. <br><br> <strong>Sodatone AI:</strong> Using deep learning, predictive modelling, and our ever-growing database of billions of data points, we’re developing algorithms that use social, streaming, and concert data to find the next Bruno Mars and Ed Sheeran. <br><br> Help us find and share the music that will be heard, loved, and remembered. At Sodatone, you’ll help shape culture globally. <br><br> <u><strong>Position Overview</strong></u> <ul> <li>We’re looking for engineers who can work across the stack, and move fluidly between backend, frontend, data science, machine learning, and infrastructure. If you don’t have experience in all of those categories but are willing to learn, we'd still love for you to apply!</li> <li>We’re a new division within an established, global company. You’ll be getting in on the ground floor, as a foundational employee to lead and execute Sodatone’s vision. You'll be leading the design and implementation of mission-critical projects from start to finish, speaking directly with users, and learning a ton along the way.</li> </ul> <u><strong>Department Description:</strong></u> <ul> <li>With its broad roster of new stars and legendary artists, Warner Music Group is home to a collection of the best-known record labels in the music industry including Atlantic, Asylum, Cordless, East West, Elektra, Nonesuch, Reprise, Rhino, Roadrunner, Rykodisc, Sire, Warner Bros. and Word, as well as Warner/Chappell Music, one of the world's leading music publishers, with a catalog of more than one million copyrights worldwide.</li> <li>Sodatone itself is a small, founder-led team of engineers that happens to love music. The complex engineering problems you’ll solve with us will directly influence culture and impact the music billions of people listen to everyday.</li> <li>Our team works out of the Warner Music Canada office in Toronto.</li> </ul> <u><strong>Technology Stack</strong></u> <ul> <li>Backend: Ruby on Rails</li> <li>Frontend: React, jQuery, HTML5, CCS3</li> <li>Machine learning: Tensorflow, Keras, Python, GPUs</li> <li>Multi-TB PostgreSQL database with data on millions of artists and billions of data points</li> <li>Redis for caching and job queues</li> <li>Cloud hosting on AWS and Azure; Ubuntu systems</li> </ul> <u><strong>Responsibilities</strong></u> <ul> <li>Lead the design and implementation of new features for the Sodatone Platform, based on feedback you collect from users</li> <li>Develop novel, large-scale data ingestion and processing pipelines to power both the Platform and AI</li> <li>Build nimble and delightful UIs that make your advanced data processing algorithms seem effortless</li> <li>Extract insights from data through statistical analyses and, when you’re ready, new neural network architectures</li> <li>Scale Sodatone’s storage infrastructure and applications to support our global userbase</li> <li>Be both a creative/product and technical contributor, taking on leadership roles as we grow</li> </ul> <u><strong>Required Competencies/Skills</strong></u> <ul> <li>2+ years of practical experience and proficiency with a high-level programming language and SQL</li> <li>Strong understanding of the infrastructure involved in deploying data-intensive web applications that scale</li> <li>Proven ability to prototype, ask for feedback, incorporate usage metrics, and iterate quickly</li> <li>Experience interacting with 3rd party APIs and efficiently handling large datasets</li> <li>Strong design, product and user experience intuition</li> <li>A love of music!</li> </ul> <u><strong>Bonus Points For</strong></u> <ul> <li>Experience with AWS or Azure</li> <li>Experience with an MVC application framework (we use Rails)</li> <li>A body of work (not necessarily open source) that you’d be proud to show us during an interview, preferably one that’s reached real users</li> <li>Ideally, you’ve built an exciting SaaS product and loved the satisfaction that comes with knowing that people around the world are using what you’ve created</li> </ul>
Title: Lead Software Engineer

Job_Description: At <strong>Broadsign</strong>, we believe in a world where bold creativity inspires bright ideas. <br/><br/> Where digital interactions inspire conversations and connect communities. Where screens drive growth, build excitement and prompt innovation. Where digital and real-life experiences collide. <br/><br/> As the leading SaaS company in digital signage, we’re a place for people who envision a better digital future and aren’t afraid to embark on ambitious challenges to change the status quo. <br/><br/> Lighting up airports, shopping malls, health clinics, street corners and more, our platform powers screens at the heart of people’s lives. <br/><br/> Want to join us on our mission to light up the world one screen at a time? <br/><br/> <strong>------------------------</strong> <br/><br/> Here we grow again… We’re currently looking to add a kick-ass <strong>front-end developer</strong> to our web development team. <br/><br/> <strong>Your day to day will vary but your mission is simple;</strong> <br/><br/> As a member of our Agile development team, your main focus will be to design and develop new features on the front-end of Broadsign’s software suite. And, because you’re a front-end enthusiast, you’ll probably want to tweak and maintain our existing feature set as well! You’ll get to participate in sprints where you’ll be encouraged to share your ideas and knowledge with your team. Basically, you’ll be working in a dynamic and peer-driven environment where you’ll play with all the latest and greatest hardware and software! <br/><br/> <strong>Of course, if this role to speaks to you, you’re someone who has;</strong>  <ul> <li>Professional experience with REACT and HMTL development</li>  <li>A good understanding of REST API’s</li>  <li>Experience with Windows but, given the choice, you’d would go with Linux</li>  <li>A curious nature – you’re always thinking outside the box</li>  <li>Interest in working with an awesome team</li>  <li>Great communication skills in English and French</li>  <li>**Additionally, if you have any experience working with; Python, Git and an image editing software, you’re definitely the Dev we’ve been searching for!</li>  </ul> <strong>But, more importantly, you’re the kind of person who:</strong>  <ul> <li>Loves to see a project through from beginning to end</li>  <li>Enjoys challenging themselves and constantly learning about new tech</li>  <li>Likes to have your ideas heard and contributions recognized</li>  <li>Wants to benefit from perks such as: competitive insurance package, RRSP plan, tons of fun company events (tubing, BBQs, go-karting, health & diversity week, etc.), paid time off during the holidays and a healthy work/life balance</li>  <li>Likes to dress casually</li>  <li>Loves coffee, beer, croissants, bagels and fruits – especially when they’re free!</li> </ul> Does this sound like you? If it does, <strong>we definitely want to hear from you!</strong>
Title: Frontend Developer

Job_Description: <strong>L'équipe en bref:</strong><br/><br/>AppHelp livre des solutions qui aident les entreprises et les consommateurs optimiser ladoption et lutilisation des dernières technologies et solutions infonuagiques. Forte de son approche unique combinant technologies et capital humain, AppHelp accompagne ses clients et sassure quils disposent du soutien dont ils ont besoin, et ce, tout au long de leur parcours. Comptant son actif des millions dincidents de soutien techniques résolus et plusieurs décennies dexpérience en soutien technologique, AppHelp est fière dassurer les programmes de soutien technique de nombreuses marques prestigieuses travers le monde, dont Comcast, CincinnatiBell, BellAlliant, Rogers, Telus, Windstream, Virgin Media, Panda Security et plusieurs autres.<br/><br/><strong>À propos de vous:</strong><br/><br/>Nous sommes la recherche dun développeur sénior, frontend, passionné des technologies Web pour se joindre notre équipe dingénieurs brillants, motivés et déterminés pour nous aider transformer et revamper notre système Web pour utilisateurs finaux. Au sein dune équipe multidisciplinaire, le développeur dinterface sénior prendra les rênes de notre système Web pour utilisateurs finaux et mettra en place une direction technique et artistique pour léquipe. AppHelp offre un environnement où les défis et linspiration sont quotidiens. Si vous recherchez la liberté pour mettre sur pied des solutions créatives et réfléchies qui reflètent votre expérience et votre personnalité, il ny aura pas de limite ce que vous pourrez accomplir ici.<br/><br/><strong>Ce que vous ferez et ce qui vous fera briller:</strong><br/><br/>- Créer des interfaces élégantes et fonctionnelles en utilisant React.js et Redux. sur notre application Web principale afin de réjouir et épater nos clients.   <ul> <li>Travailler avec une équipe multifonctionnelle pour réussir atteindre nos objectifs.</li> <li>Participer et contribuer activement au travail déquipe.</li> <li>Identifier et régler les problèmes de performance.</li> <li>Écrire des scripts JavaScript et CSS, du React.js, et du NodeJS qui sont faciles entretenir tout en prenant soin de bien documenter le tout.<br/><br/><strong>Votre profil:</strong><br/><br/><strong>Vous avez:</strong></li> <li>De l'expérience avec React.js et Redux; NodeJS, les préprocesseurs CSS (LESS ou Sass) nont pas de secret pour vous.</li> <li>Des compétences solides avec JavaScript, vous êtes au courant de ce que vous ne savez pas encore et vous avez hâte dapprendre.</li> <li>Une connaissance exceptionnelle des normes du Web, AngularJS 1.x, de HTML5, de la conception CSS3 et des enjeux de compatibilité des navigateurs Web.</li> <li>De bonnes notions de lexpérience utilisateurs et des interfaces et un intérêt marqué pour la conception dinterfaces.</li> <li>Développé et utilisé des API JSON RESTful.</li> <li>Une connaissance pratique du développement backend. <br/><br/> <strong>Vous êtes:</strong></li> <li>Un Leader technique : vous contribuez la passion de nos équipes de développement et vous êtes connu pour vos solutions créatives et réfléchies.</li> <li>Capable d'obtenir du respect et de la crédibilité et dinfluencer les autres.</li> <li>Curieux et innovateur : vous surveillez constamment les nouveautés sur le marché, vous aimez essayer de nouvelles solutions et des technologies que vous ne connaissez pas.</li> <li>Défenseur de la qualité : vous favorisez la création de logiciels de qualité supérieure laide de tests unitaires et de couverture de code.</li> <li>Pro de la méthode Agile : vous avez de lexpérience avec la méthode Agile de développement logiciel et les méthodes de développement piloté par les tests (TDD).</li> <li>Collaboratif : Vous valorisez le travail déquipe et souhaitez partager vos compétences et vos connaissances; vous demandez les perspectives de vos pairs, mais vous navez pas peur de prendre des décisions.</li> <li>Expert des outils de développement : Les gestionnaires de paquets, logiciels de contrôle des versions et outils dautomatisation vous sont familiers (git, npm, bower, grunt, etc.). <br/><br/> <em>AppDirect est la plateforme de référence pour la vente, la distribution et la gestion de produits et services infonuagiques. Sa technologie flexible et modulaire permet toutes les entreprises, quelle que soit leur taille, dentrer sur le marché rapidement selon une approche qui répond leurs besoins spécifiques, et ce, moindre coût. Les platformes de commerce en ligne AppMarket, de distribution et dassistance technique avancée alimentés par AppDirect permettent de nombreux fournisseurs dont Comcast, ADP, Zendesk, Deutsche Telekom et plusieurs autres de connecter plus de 30 millions dentreprises aux solutions offertes par Microsoft, Google, GoDaddy et plusieurs autres. AppDirect est basée San Francisco et compte 13 bureaux travers le monde.</em> <br/><br/> <em>Chez AppDirect, nous croyons que ce sont les contributions uniques de chaque «AppDirecteur» qui forgent notre réussite. Afin de nous assurer que nos produits et notre culture continuent de refléter les perspectives et les expériences de tous, nous ne faisons aucune discrimination en fonction de la race, la religion, la nationalité, lidentité ou lorientation sexuelle, lâge, létat matrimonial, statut dancien combattant ou du statut d'handicapé.</em> <br/><br/> -----<br/><br/><strong>About the Team:</strong><br/><br/>AppHelp delivers solutions that help businesses and consumers be more successful with their adoption and use of the latest in technology and cloud services. By leveraging a unique combination of technology and human capital, AppHelp ensures customers have the support they need as they traverse the customer journey. With millions of technical support incidents solved, and decades of experience assisting people with technology, AppHelp is proud to power the technical support programs for premier brands across the globe, including Comcast, CincinnatiBell, BellAlliant, Rogers, Telus, Windstream, Virgin Media, Panda Security and more.<br/><br/><strong>About You:</strong><br/><br/>We are looking for a Senior Front End Developer who is passionate about web technologies to join our team of bright, motivated and strong-willed engineers to help us transform and reimagine our existing end-user web system. As part of a multi-disciplinary team, the Senior Front-End developer will take the reins of our existing end-user web system and provide technical and design guidance to our team. AppHelp provides an environment where you will be challenged and inspired every day. If you relish the freedom to bring creative, thoughtful solutions to the table that reflect your experience and personality, there's no limit to what you can accomplish here.<br/><br/><strong>How Youll Make an Impact & What Youll Do:</strong><br/><br/>- Create beautiful and functional screens using React.js and Redux in our main web application meant to delight and amaze our customers.</li> <li>Work with a cross functional team to successfully deliver on our objectives.</li> <li>Actively take part in and contribute to the team work.</li> <li>Identify and address performance bottlenecks.</li> <li>Write scalable and maintainable AngularJS, React, NodeJS, JavaScript, and CSS code<br/><br/><strong>What You'll Need:</strong><br/><br/><strong>You have:</strong></li> <li>Experience with React.js + Redux, NodeJS and CSS preprocessors (LESS or Sass) have no secrets for you.</li> <li>A strong background in JavaScript, you are aware of what you do not know yet and are excited about what to learn next.</li> <li>Exceptional knowledge of web standards, AngularJS 1.x, HTML5, CSS3-based design and cross-browser compatibility.</li> <li>Good notions of UX / UI and a keen interest in interface design.</li> <li>Developed and consumed JSON RESTful API.</li>  <strong><li>Practical knowledge of backend development. <br/><br/> <strong>You are:</li>  </strong>  <li>A technical leader: contributing to the passion of our development teams, you are known to bring creative and thoughtful solutions to the table.</li> <li>Able to gain respect and credibility, and influence others.</li> <li>Curious and innovative: you are constantly monitoring what is new on the market and eager to try new things with technologies you are not familiar with.</li> <li>A quality promoter: you value and promote high quality software with unit testing and code coverage.</li> <li>An agilist: you have experience with Agile software development and Test Driven Development methodologies.</li> <li>Collaborative: you value teamwork, you desire to share your skills & knowledge, seek perspective from others, and ultimately you are not afraid to make decisions.</li> <li>Very familiar with development tools: package managers, version control software and automation tools are familiar to you (git, npm, bower, grunt, etc.). <br/><br/> <em>AppDirect is the leading platform for selling, distributing, and managing cloud-based products and services. Its flexible, modular technology enables organizations of all sizes to get to market quickly and cost effectively with an offering that meets their individual business needs. AppDirect-powered marketplaces, billing, distribution, reselling, and premium technical support services help providers including Comcast, ADP, Zendesk, Deutsche Telekom and others connect more than 30 million businesses to solutions from Microsoft, Google, GoDaddy, and more. AppDirect is headquartered in San Francisco with 13 global offices.</em> <br/><br/> <em>We believe that the unique contributions of all AppDirectors is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.</em> <br/><br/> #LI-JS1</li>  </ul>
Title: Développeur sénior, frontend / Senior Frontend Developer

Job_Description: <p>          @font-face {} @font-face {} p.MsoNormal, li.MsoNormal, div.MsoNormal {  margin: 0cm;  font-size: 12pt;  font-family: "Calibri", sans-serif } .MsoChpDefault {  font-family: "Calibri", sans-serif } div.WordSection1 {  page: WordSection1 }        </p><p>Reporting to the Team-Lead of the Telematics Software development, the Senior Frontend Software Developer will design, develop and evolve end-to-end telematics services used to assess end-users driving behaviour and more. The solutions are composed of in-car devices, smartphone apps and backend systems. Your web side developer background will help you taking an active part in the development process specifically in the frontend.</p>  <p> </p>  <p><b><u>Responsibilities:</u></b></p>  <p></p><ul><li>Participate in the business requirement definitions for web and UI solutions for telematics products</li><li>Provide functional analysis for the solutions</li><li>Ensure feature ease-of-use, ease-of-support, robustness, scalability and security, key ingredients to the recommended design solutions</li><li>Develop and code web and UI solutions</li><li>Collaborate with other teams (Mobile, Interface, Embedded, Test, IT Team and Marketing) and outsourced partners when required</li><li>Work in an Agile-Sprint environment</li><li>Participate in the Continuous Improvement philosophy</li></ul><p></p>              <p> </p>  <p><b><u>Qualifications:</u></b></p>  <p></p><ul><li>Bachelors degree in computer science or equivalent</li><li>10 years of professional experiences in web application development</li><li>1 year + of experience with Angular 2 application development</li><li>Experience with UI mapping technologies (Google, etc)</li><li>Experience in UI/UX design</li><li>Excellent communication verbal/written skills (English and French)</li></ul><p></p>            <p> </p>  <p><b><u>Assets:</u></b></p>  <p></p><ul><li>Experience in integration of 24X7 high-availability vehicle telematics or IoT services</li><li>Experience with Java based technologies</li><ul><li>Micro service architectures including Spring Boot, Spring REST & Spring JPA</li><li>Thick client web application development with Angular 4 and PrimeNG</li></ul><li>Experience with designing systems using web services (REST, SOAP, XML/JSON)</li><li>Experience with vehicle Title: SR. Frontend Software Developer

Job_Description: <div> Apply now</div> <br/><strong>Frontend Software Developer</strong> <br/><br/> Big data has the potential to fundamentally change the world, from the ways businesses operate to <br/><br/> the way people interact. The opportunities are limitless. And we think that’s incredibly cool and <br/><br/> phenomenally exciting. If you do too, join us to be a part of this journey. <br/><br/> Guavus is a young and fast growing company whose mission is to provide Communication Service <br/><br/> Providers (CSPs) with a competitive advantage in the ability to accurately understand their mobile <br/><br/> subscribers’ behaviors and extract value from this knowledge. We are at pivotal point in our history <br/><br/> where big data innovation can impact businesses and individuals in new and unforeseen ways, but we <br/><br/> need exceptionally smart people to join our team who are: <br/><br/> ●<strong> Passionate</strong> about getting the job done, <br/><br/> ● <strong>Relentless</strong> about flawless execution, <br/><br/> ● <strong>Committed</strong> to solving problems creatively, and <br/><br/> ● <strong>Believe</strong> in the collective intelligence to design, build and engineer extraordinary products and <br/><br/> solutions that are useful to all. <br/><br/> If this sounds like you, please reach out we’d love to hear from you. <br/><br/> <strong>Your Role</strong> <br/><br/> Guavus is looking for a highly motivated and talented Frontend Software Developer. The employee will <br/><br/> actively participate and collaborate with the team during the analysis, implementation and testing of <br/><br/> new development features. His main role will consist in developing new features and maintaining <br/><br/> current Product portfolio. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> ● Participate in software development analysis <br/><br/> ● Develop new features <br/><br/> ● Maintain existing rich & interactive data centric application <br/><br/> ● Produce quality code that is well-documented, and in accordance with system and technical <br/><br/> specifications <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications and Experience</strong> <br/><br/> ● Holder of a Degree in Computer Science, technical college or equivalent <br/><br/> ● 3 years of experience <br/><br/> ● Fluent in JavaScript (At least ES2015 flavor) <br/><br/> ● Enthusiast to work in Angular v5 with stack <br/><br/> ● Typescript <br/><br/> ● @ngrx/store (for redux style state management) <br/><br/> ● d3 for rich chart visualization <br/><br/> ● Redux or equivalent state management is a plus <br/><br/> ● Less or equivalent CSS preprocessor is a plus <br/><br/> ● Experience working a rich data centric application is a plus <br/><br/> ● Knowledge of business intelligence is a plus <br/><br/> This opportunity consists of full-time regular employment and is located in downtown Montreal. <br/><br/> For more information, please contact our Human Resources Department by e-mail at the following <br/><br/> address: hrmontreal@guavus.com
Title: Frontend Software Developer

Job_Description: Our customers have thousands of technicians that keep power, gas, and other essential services operating daily around the world. ABB’s development teams write the software to make this possible. Come join us in an environment that welcomes innovation and rewards your ability to get the job done while you build scalable and reliable features on a leading edge Azure cloud platform. <br/> The developer works on technical challenges and facilitates collaborative efforts within the scrum team and across product teams, in support of the frequent delivery of quality software to the customer. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>   <ul> <li>Deep involvement with your agile scrum team to understand customer needs, prototype, design, and deliver innovative end-to-end features with maintainable high-quality code.</li> <li>Integrate with back-end systems while maintaining reliability and performance</li> <li>Ensure high-quality deliverables following established design principles with appropriate level of test automation</li> <li>Design, develop, re-factor, review, and maintain software with quality and performance in mind.</li> <li>Identify risks that could impact schedule and quality of software and manage those risks with the team and ask for help when needed.</li> <li>Fail fast when needed and learn from mistakes; prototype new features.</li> <li>Be effective in reflection, retrospection, and constant incremental improvement.</li> <li>3+ years of mobile development experience with JavaScript, CSS and Sencha Ext JS, integrating with RESTful web services and third-party SDKs</li> <li>Firm understanding of software development principles</li> <li>Great verbal and written communication</li> <li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent with relevant work experience</li> <li>Written and spoken English is professional, clear and understood by others the first time. You are able to adjust your style according to the situation whether it’s a 15 minute stand up meeting or demo in front of senior management.</li> <li>Experience with Scrum development process</li> <li>Solid background in algorithms and data structures</li> </ul>  <strong>Additional Nice-to-have Skills or experience:</strong>   <ul> <li>Experience cloud development (Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google cloud, etc…)</li> <li>Familiar Micro Service design and development experience</li> <li>Experience with PowerShell</li> <li>Visual Studio Team System / Team Foundation Server</li> <li>Familiarity with TDD, Unit testing and mocking techniques, and automated testing.</li> </ul>  ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and values a diverse workforce. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities. In support of our Employment Equity Program, women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply and self-identify in the application process. We also offer a stimulating work environment, competitive salaries and a complete benefits package. ABB is prepared to act on requests for disability accommodations that might be required to allow any disabled person to access our facility. Please advise us if any attending person requires/requests some specific form of disability accommodation. The masculine form is used as neutral gender and includes men and women.
Title: Frontend Software Developer

Job_Description: We are looking for a strong Senior Full-Stack Software Developer, who will help us build a highly scalable and performant Walmart.ca eCommerce platform to match our exponential growth. You will have an opportunity to design and develop new innovative features on our current platform and help in transitioning our platform to micro-app architecture using next-gen technologies. You will be responsible to actively participate in the design and architectural discussions for Frontend and API gateway layer. You will also work closely with the Product Owners to develop innovative customer experiences and user interfaces  <ul> <li>BA/BS/MA/MS degree in Computer Science or closely related field or equivalent practical experience.</li><li>Strong knowledge of JavaScript, CSS3, HTML5, asynchronous request handling, and AJAX in highly scalable and available applications.</li><li>6-8 years of software development experience working in NodeJS, Scala, Ruby on Rails, Python or Java.</li><li>Experience building responsive UIs which are optimized for mobile devices.</li><li>Solid understanding of building RESTful APIs.</li><li>Have a strong passion for developing elegant and well-designed frameworks.</li><li>Experience in any of the JavaScript framework like React, EmberJS or Angular 1.x/2.x is a big plus.</li><li>A history of open-source contribution is an asset.</li> </ul>

Job_Description: TapClicks [www.tapclicks.com] - Montreal, Canada <br/> Hi! We’re one of the fastest growing companies in Silicon Valley and America. <br/> Inc. magazine ranked TapClicks as number 4 for marketing/advertising companies and number 87 overall on its 5000 list of companies in 2016. <br/><br/> <strong>Summary:</strong> <br/> We are seeking a senior-level Frontend Developer who can be part of the team that is designing the next generation TapClicks platform. <br/> You will be expected to be internally motivated and use the best practices to deliver this world-class scalable product. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Responsibilities:</strong> <br/> Designing and developing world class UI/UX for our web applications. <br/> Writing high quality code. <br/> Working closely with team members to make good trade-offs and deliver features that meet or exceed requirements. <br/> Tracking down and fixing bugs, performance issues, or display issues. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Requirements:</strong> <br/> BS/MS degree in computer science or a related field or commensurate experience <br/> 7+ years of front-end dev experience. <br/> 7+ years advanced JavaScript, jQuery <br/> 7+ years of HTML and CSS. <br/> 1+ years in AngularJS   <ul> <li>Strong HTML5 and CSS3.</li> <li>UI Design understanding/experience is bonus.</li> <li>Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX</li> <li>Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around such issues.</li> </ul>  Experience with web server such as Apache, Ngnix <br/> Knowledge of software implementation best practices <br/> Ability to adapt quickly to an existing, complex environment, learn new concepts and software <br/> Candidate should be a self-motivated, independent, detail oriented, responsible team-player <br/> Passionate about building high-quality systems with software implementation best practices <br/><br/> <strong>About TapClicks:</strong> <br/> TapClicks, Inc. is an MarTech company that delivers complete digital marketing reporting and analytics platforms to digital agencies, media companies, and enterprises, for improved marketing ROI. Its suite of products includes flagship TapAnalytics, which consolidates marketing campaign information and performance results into a unified digital dashboard, with automated reporting and analytics. TapClicks was founded in 2009, and operates out of offices in Silicon Valley, Boston, Canada, India and Mexico. For more information, please visit www.TapClicks.com. <br/> We're also well funded company. Get in touch and we'll be in touch! Best.
Title: JavaScript/Angular Frontend Developer

Job_Description: <div><strong>Léquipe en bref:</strong></div><div>Chez AppDirect, notre but est de changer la manière de trouver, acheter et utiliser des logiciels! Notre équipe d'ingénieurs crée la plateforme SAAS qui est utilisée par plusieurs des meilleures entreprise du monde. Il est difficile de changer le monde mais nous ne voudrions pas qu'il en soit autrement!</div> <br/> <div>La mission de l'équipe plateforme-frontend est de fournir aux développeurs des outils leur permettant d'augmenter leur productivité, la qualité de leurs livrables et de s'assurer de la bonne santé et de l'évolution des technologies frontend d'Appdirect.</div><br/>  <div><strong>À propos de vous:</strong></div><div>Nous sommes la recherche dun développeur qui aime travailler de manière autonome et développer des outils et bibliothèques internes. Vous êtes laise avec une combinaison de technologies dinterface et vous êtes idéalement un développeur «full-stack». Vous souhaitez travailler au sein dune équipe qui vous aidera relever de nouveaux défis, tout en étant motivé chercher et explorer de manière indépendante.</div><br/>  <div><strong>Ce que vous ferez et ce qui vous fera briller:</strong></div>  <li>Développer et améliorer une bibliothèque complète de composants pour React</li> <li>Participer lentretien de nos bibliothèques de type Sass</li> <li>Aider les développeurs contribuer notre bibliothèque de composants Marionette</li> <li>Guider les équipes dans leur transition vers le développement basé sur React</li> <li>Soutenir les équipes de produits pour répondre aux problèmes et spécifications dinterface les plus pointus</li>  <strong><div>Votre profil:</div> <br/> </strong>  <li>Vous avez de fortes compétences en "vanilla" JavaScript</li> <li>Vous avez quelques années d'expérience en création d'applications web</li> <li>Vous avez une compréhension approfondie d'au moins un framework d'application, idéalement plus d'un</li> <li>Vous connaissez NodeJS (backend, build systems, etc)</li>  <strong><div>Bonus:</div> <br/> </strong>  <li>Vous êtes familier avec Java stack</li>  <strong><div><em>AppDirect en bref:</em></div> <br/> </strong> <br/> <div><em>AppDirect est la plateforme de référence pour la vente, la distribution et la gestion de produits et services infonuagiques. Sa technologie flexible et modulaire permet toutes les entreprises, quelle que soit leur taille, dentrer sur le marché rapidement selon une approche qui répond leurs besoins spécifiques, et ce, moindre coût. Les platformes de commerce en ligne AppMarket, de distribution et dassistance technique avancée alimentés par AppDirect permettent de nombreux fournisseurs dont Comcast, ADP, Zendesk, Deutsche Telekom et plusieurs autres de connecter plus de 30 millions dentreprises aux solutions offertes par Microsoft, Google, GoDaddy et plusieurs autres. AppDirect est basée San Francisco et compte 13 bureaux travers le monde.</em></div> <br/> <div><em>Chez AppDirect, nous croyons que ce sont les contributions uniques de chaque «AppDirecteur» qui forgent notre réussite. Afin de nous assurer que nos produits et notre culture continuent de refléter les perspectives et les expériences de tous, nous ne faisons aucune discrimination en fonction de la race, la religion, la nationalité, lidentité ou lorientation sexuelle, lâge, létat matrimonial, statut dancien combattant ou du statut d'handicapé.</em></div><br/>  <div><strong>About the team:</strong></div><div>At AppDirect our goal is to change the way the world finds, buys and uses software! Our Engineering team creates the SAAS platform used by many of the world's top companies to meet this goal. It's hard to change the world, but we wouldn't want it any other way.</div> <br/> <div>The front-end platform team's mission is to provide developers with tools that increase their productivity, the quality of their deliverables and their happiness, and to ensure the health and evolution of AppDirect's front-end technologies.</div><br/>  <div><strong>About you:</strong></div><div>We are looking for a highly autonomous developer who loves to work on internal tooling and libraries. You are comfortable with a mix of front-end technologies and are ideally a "full-stack" developer. You want to work with a team that will challenge you, but you are driven to research and explore on your own.</div><br/>  <div><strong>How youll make an impact & what youll do:</strong></div>  <li>Developing and improving a fully featured component library for React</li> <li>Participate in the maintenance of our Sass styles library</li> <li>Help developers contribute to our Marionette component library</li> <li>Guide teams through their transition to React based development</li> <li>Provide support to the product teams with challenging front-end issues and requirements</li>  <strong><div>What youll need:</div> <br/> </strong>  <li>Strong "vanilla" JavaScript skills</li> <li>A few years of experience building web applications</li> <li>A solid grasp of at least one application framework, ideally more than one</li> <li>Some experience with NodeJS (backend, build systems, etc)</li> <li>Familiarity with Java stack an asset</li>  <strong><div><em>About AppDirect:</em></div> <br/> </strong> <br/> <div><em>AppDirect is the leading platform for selling, distributing, and managing cloud-based products and services. Its flexible, modular technology enables organizations of all sizes to get to market quickly and cost effectively with an offering that meets their individual business needs. AppDirect-powered marketplaces, billing, distribution, reselling, and premium technical support services help providersincluding Comcast, ADP, Zendesk, Deutsche Telekom and othersconnect more than 30 million businesses to solutions from Microsoft, Google, GoDaddy, and more. AppDirect is headquartered in San Francisco with 13 global offices.</em></div> <br/> <div><em>We believe that the unique contributions of all AppDirectors is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.</em></div> <br/> <strong>#LI-EG1</strong>
Title: Développeur sénior, frontend (Platforme) / Senior Frontend Developer (Platform)

Job_Description: <strong>Intermediate/Senior - Front-end Developer</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Questica Inc.</strong> Burlington, ON, Canada <br/><br/> <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/><br/> At Questica, we view coding as a craft; creating modular, maintainable, and innovative budgeting solutions for the public sector. Grow your skills, and your career, using the latest technologies. We’re looking for a .NET/C# developer whose focus has been frontend web development. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>Design and develop new core product UX features</li>  <li>Enhance, maintain and test existing functionality</li> </ul>  <strong>The Rewards</strong>   <ul> <li>A great salary with RRSP matching options</li>  <li>Intellectual and creative freedom</li>  <li>Work Life Balance</li>  <li>Casual work environment</li>  <li>Full and comprehensive benefit plan</li> </ul>  Skills & Requirements <br/><br/> <strong>Essential Knowledge Required</strong>   <ul> <li>Frontend Web Development</li>  <li>A SPA framework like Angular or Aurelia</li>  <li>Experience with JavaScript and JavaScript libraries such as jQuery</li>  <li>Experience simplifying UIs</li>  <li>TypeScript experience</li> </ul>  <strong>Nice to haves, but not necessary.</strong>   <ul> <li>Experience using ASP.NET, MVC, and C#</li>  <li>Strong Object Oriented development skills</li>  <li>Relational database experience</li>  <li>Microsoft Azure PaaS environments</li>  <li>CSS preprocessors like LESS or SASS</li>  <li>Charting libraries like KendoUI, D3, or Highcharts</li>  <li>Design Patterns/Microsoft Patterns and Practices</li>  <li>Team Foundation Server</li>  <li>WCF Web Services</li>  <li>Financial or public sector experience</li> </ul>  About Questica Inc. <br/><br/> Questica is the recognized leader in budget preparation software. Our goal is to make public sector finance better for everyone. Local governments, colleges, universities, K-12 schools, hospitals and not-for-profit organizations throughout North America have eliminated spreadsheets, opting for smarter planning, budgeting, management, and sharing with our solutions. <br/><br/> We integrate seamlessly with any Financial and/or Human Resources (HR) system. The Questica suite of products are part of a fully featured web-based budgeting preparation, performance and data visualization solution that enables public sector organizations to improve and shorten their budgeting cycles. <br/><br/> We’re a medium sized (but growing) company of 70+ employees working in modern, state-of-the-art facilities in Burlington, Ontario and Huntington Beach California.
Title: Intermediate/Senior .NET Frontend Developer

Job_Description: <div>Sitecore is the global leader in experience management software that combines content management, commerce, and customer insights. The Sitecore Experience Cloud™ empowers marketers to deliver personalized content in real time and at scale across every channel—before, during, and after a sale. More than 5,200 brands—including American Express, Carnival Cruise Lines, Dow Chemical, and L’Oréal—have trusted Sitecore to deliver the personalized interactions that delight audiences, build loyalty, and drive revenue.</div> <br/>Sitecore is experiencing spectacular growth all over the world. To build on Sitecore’s success and growth, we’re looking for a skilled Senior Software Developer. <br/><br/> Position Summary: <br/><br/> As a Senior Sitecore Developer, you will be building cutting-edge demo applications for the Sitecore platform. The demo applications will best help our Sellers and Solution Engineers showcase the value of Sitecore’s solutions that result in customer wins and competitive defeats. <br/><br/> The position requires building upon a foundational architecture as well as adding key consumption based services to the Sitecore Experience Platform and Sitecore Experience Commerce. <br/><br/> This is a highly critical role that provides excellent experience across a range of skills: you will work with all the latest Sitecore technologies and solutions, hone your problem-solving skills, learn the strategy of delivering features against schedules and interface with our Product Marketing teams and global Sales and SE teams to most effectively help understand and represent the “Best of Sitecore” in our demos. <br/><br/> In summary, the demo platform you help build is what Customers will see and experience in their purchasing decision – and we want first impressions to be winning ones! <br/><br/> Responsibilities: <br/><br/> - Understand and prioritize product marketing and SE requirements to help tell the best story in use cases within the demo <br/><br/> - Help develop, deliver and stage for deployment on VM’s as well as Azure Cloud – or other creative delivery platforms to make demonstrating our solutions as easy and fail-safe as possible <br/><br/> - Participate in requirements and backlog refinement <br/><br/> - Write clean, scalable .NET code following the Helix principles and SXA best practices <br/><br/> - Provide architectural, development and platform guidance to other team members <br/><br/> - Provide support for the application to internal and external stakeholders <br/><br/> - Troubleshoot problems and fix bugs <br/><br/> - Review and manage the quality of code <br/><br/> - Help assist field Solution Engineers <br/><br/> - Make the demo scalable and usable for Partners <br/><br/> Job Qualifications: <br/><br/> - Strong organizational skills <br/><br/> - Strong Sitecore 8.x + and/or 9.x Development or Architecture skills mandatory <br/><br/> - Knowledge of C#, HTML5, CSS3 – JSS a plus <br/><br/> - Strong understanding of virtual machine and Azure <br/><br/> - Understanding of Agile methodologies <br/><br/> - Ability to manage conflicting priorities <br/><br/> - Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills <br/><br/> - Creative problem solving <br/><br/> - College degree in Software Engineering, IT, DevOps or Computer Programming <br/><br/> Highly Desired: <br/><br/> - Experience with Frontend Technologies (Bootstrap, Angular, JQuery, etc) <br/><br/> - Experience with continuous integration environments like VSTS <br/><br/> - PowerShell experience <br/><br/> Sitecore is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity without unlawful regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other local legally protected characteristic.
Title: Senior Software Developer Demo Strategy & Delivery

Job_Description: <strong>ACL Impact</strong> <br/><br/> ACL exists to help make the world a safer and more ethical place. By enabling Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) professionals that use our software to be recognized for the value they bring to their organizations, we aim to be game-changers: to provide organizations with the software tools, support, and knowledge to dive deep into their data, identify anomalies, and manage GRC across the entire organization. From helping a national agency track down missing children to helping banks find suspicious patterns in their data and state agencies stamp out fraudulent activities, ACL has been at the heart of many investigations that have helped save people and millions talk about impact! <br/><br/> <strong>The ACL R&D Team</strong> <br/><br/> The R&D team extends beyond the walls of ACL and stands on the shoulders of giants. We use the innovation of technology partners like Amazon, select OEMs, and the Open Source Community to ensure were meeting our challenges with the most current and effective technologies. We give back by contributing time, code and support to our engineers and across the community. <br/><br/> To understand more about software development at ACL, read Landing your Software Engineering Dream Job. To look through the window into R&D, check out our blog or read these articles: Inside ACL R&D Part IBrigades, and R&D Baymax Team Spirit. <br/><br/> As a DevOps shop, we work quickly to release new stuff on a continuous basis. We own what we build and do not pass it off to others. We continually work to reduce the time required to build and safely deploy software. Security, integrity and performance are not an afterthought. They are built into our development process. If a serious vulnerability is discovered we pause everything else and immediately resolve it. <br/><br/> We have a product development group of 70+ and counting (the company has over 300 employees and counting). We work in small brigades comprised of 5 or so Software Engineers, 2 QA Engineers, a Manager, a UX Designer, UX Developer and a Product Manager. Its our version of a scrum team. <br/><br/> <strong>The Challenge Ahead</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for a Frontend Software Engineer who has extensive experience with modern Javascript and other frontend technologies. Youll be collaborating with a team of talented designers and engineers and be instrumental in building visually-stunning user interfaces for Projects module, the heart of our GRC platform. <br/><br/> <strong>What Will You Get Out of This?</strong>   <ul> <li>An amazing dynamic startup environment within a financially stable company (did we mention we just celebrated our 30thanniversary?)</li> <li>Some of the best benefits in the industry (asking for more information can be a great first question for us in the interview process).</li> <li>Working with an awesome team of professional software engineers with plenty of room to learn and grow.</ul>  Skills for Success at ACL</strong>   <ul> <li>You have a Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience.</li> <li>You have experience writing CSS and JavaScript in an agile team environment at scale. Bonus if you are familiar with React & Redux.</li> <li>You care deeply for code quality, are a TDD ninja, and detest having bugs slip through to production.</li> <li>You are passionate about learning and continuous improvement.</li> <li>You have creative ideas, a collaborative attitude and strong work ethic.</li> </ul>  <strong>Bonus</strong>   <ul> <li>You have an interest in learning or have experience with backend technologies such as Ruby on Rails, relational databases and AWS services.</li> <li>You are actively involved in local meetups and contribute to open source project we can look at on Github.</li>  </ul>
Title: Software Engineer (Frontend)

Job_Description: <div>Were looking for a Senior Frontend Web Developer to join our web team and help build software that serve our Enterprise clients in the event industry. This role will contribute in helping architect and develop our Enterprise tools used by clients and internal teams alike. This is a full-time position working in our Vancouver head office.</div><br/> <div>This role is a key position within our foundation team and as such this role presents an awesome opportunity to really develop and progress the foundational Eventbase software forward so we can keep delivering apps that power some of the worlds biggest events.</div><br/> <div><strong>ABOUT EVENTBASE</strong></div><div>Eventbase is the leading mobile event technology platform for premium brands. Our proven product powers intelligent mobile apps that shape personalized journeys and deliver exceptional attendee experiences. Large companies can better understand their customers by using an Enterprise Event App and Eventbase Data Stream for every event in their portfolio, including their largest conferences and smaller regional events. Eventbases current customers include technology companies like IBM, Cisco and Microsoft, leading brands like Disney, Mercedes-Benz and AT&T, as well as large consumer events like SXSW, CES, Sundance and three Olympic Games.</div><br/> <div>Our team pioneers the latest in *intelligent* event technology, from advanced chat bots and AI recommendation engines, to the use of proximity beacons for hyper-local networking and 3D mapping. Its no wonder weve been named Best Event App four years running.</div><br/> <div>Are you ready to join the best?</div> WHO YOU ARE  <ul> <li>You have a strong desire to continuously improve</li><li>You love to be challenged</li><li>You care about the code you leave behind</li><li>You have empathy for users</li> </ul>  <strong>WHAT YOU'LL DO</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop new features within our React web app and maintain features in Angular</li><li>Contribute to architectural direction and decision making</li><li>Code review and mentoring</li><li>Support QA team with automated testing development</li><li>Release management</li><li>Work as part of an agile team</li> </ul>  <strong>WHAT YOU BRING</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or equivalent experience</li><li>3+ years writing JavaScript with experience using React</li> <li>Extensive knowledge of modern frameworks and relevant design patterns</li><li>CSS expertise and complex layout execution; an eye for design</li><li>Expertise in frontend build systems (webpack, rollup)</li><li>Expertise in frontend state management (redux)</li><li>Strong communication skills</li><li>Strong understanding and experience with various testing paradigms (unit, snapshot, e2e, etc)</li> </ul>  <strong>BONUS</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience with Node.js</li><li>Experience with Angular would be great but not essential</li> <li>Open source contributions</li><li>Experience with legacy frontend frameworks such as angularjs (pre 2.x), backbone, etc.</li><li>Experience with CSS preprocessors and patterns</li><li>Experience with modern web tech (web sockets, web workers, browser-level storage)</li> </ul>  <div><strong>WHAT WE OFFER</strong></div><br/> <div>At Eventbase we work hard and smart, and take time to celebrate our wins. From casual team outings and Thirsty Thursdays to our themed holiday parties and annual summer talent show, we make sure we have fun.</div> <br/> <div>Our team enjoys a range of professional development opportunities including our unique Ticket to Ride program, letting you experience our apps in action at world class events. Our Yaletown office provides a relaxed work environment with spaces to meet, collaborate, work quietly and enjoy our in-house cafe. Its also dog-friendly, so bring your pal (and meet our current canine team online - #dogsofeventbase).</div> <br/> <div>Were proud of our diverse team: the Eventbasers hail from all over the world, with many different backgrounds, cultures and interests. We actively promote women working in technology both internally and by partnering with women in tech organizations externally. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national or ethnic origin, gender or gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital or family status, veteran status, or disability status.</div> <br/> <div><strong>To Apply</strong></div><div>Please complete our online form and attach your resume.</div>
Title: Frontend Software Developer (React) - Foundation Team
