We hire people who think in big, bold pictures and work hard to make a difference at the office and in the world. We know we have a team of all-stars, so we offer competitive salaries, purposeful perks, and a culture that gives back and has fun doing it! Plus, you won't find better lunchtime conversation anywhere else in town. <br/><br/> <strong>About You</strong> <br/><br/> You are a talented front-end web developer with a passion for building modern, fluid, responsive web applications using the latest client-side technologies. You love to bring great designs to life on both mobile and desktop devices. You are looking for a fun and collaborative team environment where you can apply and hone your skills, share your knowledge and experience, and learn from others. <br/><br/> <strong>Major Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Product Development (85%) <ul>  <li>Work closely with designers and other team members to create aesthetically pleasing, precision, responsive user interfaces, constructed from reusable UI components and styles</li> <li>Write, refactor, test and deploy front-end code that satisfies product requirements and improves the usability, quality and performance of our application</li> <li>Evaluate and evolve our front-end technologies and tools to ensure sustainable development</li> <li>Improve the design, performance and coverage of our automated UI test suite</li> <li>Constructively review team members’ code and address issues found in your own code</li> <li>Investigate product defects, identify and fix root causes, test and deploy fixes</li> <li>Contribute to ongoing improvement of team practices and procedures</li> <li>Participate in all Scrum practises: sprint planning, daily standups, estimation, backlog grooming, sprint demos and retrospectives</li> </ul> Other (15%) <ul>  <li>Contribute to monitoring and operation of production, staging and test servers</li> <li>Share responsibility for maintenance and improvement of our development and production environments and related tools</li> <li>Help our Customer Success team investigate and solve problems for customers</li> <li>Other duties as assigned</li> </ul> <strong> <br/> Measures of Success</strong> <ul>  <li>Consistently contributes to achievement of team goals and commitments</li> <li>Willingly participates in all aspects of software development, including refinement of user stories and acceptance criteria, estimation, design, development, testing, deployment, troubleshooting, maintenance/evolution of tools and runtime environments, and documentation of team processes and procedures</li> <li>Consistently adheres to team practises, guidelines and rules</li> <li>Shares knowledge, learns from others and demonstrates a commitment to continuous improvement</li> <li>Considered by team members and manager to be a consistent and collaborative contributor</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Skills and Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>3+ years professional experience as a front-end developer building web applications</li> <li>Proficient with HTML5, CSS3, Sass/SCSS, JavaScript, jQuery and HTML-based email</li> <li>Able to code in JavaScript without heavy reliance on frameworks (Angular, Backbone, etc.)</li> <li>Proficient at building responsive user interfaces and mobile web experiences</li> <li>Experience designing, building and using secure, RESTful web APIs</li> <li>Experience using Node.js and NPM</li> <li>Experience writing and maintaining automated UI tests using Nightwatch.js or a similar framework</li></ul>   <ul>  <li>Proficient with Git/GitHub or another distributed source control system</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to investigate, learn and apply new technologies and tools</li> <li>Strong collaboration and communication skills and an openness to giving and receiving constructive feedback</li> </ul> <strong>Nice to Haves</strong> <ul>  <li>Post-secondary education in computer science, interaction design or a similar discipline or successful completion of a recognized web development bootcamp</li> <li>Comfortable working in a continuous integration, continuous deployment environment</li> <li>Experience using Foundation or another responsive UI framework</li> <li>Experience building interfaces using React, Flux or Redux, and ES6</li> <li>Experience developing user experiences for iOS or Android</li> <li>Experience working with CoffeeScript, ERB templates, and/or Haml templates</li> <li>Experience working on a Scrum team</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> Competitive Salary & Benefits
Title: Frontend Developer - CHIMP

Job_Description: Drop is the first flexible, consumer-led, intelligent mobile rewards platform focusing on the user experience. With over 1 million members, Drop is one of the fastest growing apps and recently hit top 3 in the App Store under Lifestyle. Through the app, members link their debit and credit cards to automatically earn points, eliminating the need to scan receipts, enter promo codes or sign up for additional loyalty programs. Drop lets members earn points and instantly redeem rewards while shopping at all their favourite brands. <br/><br/> Headquartered in the heart of Downtown Toronto, Drop is building the next generation rewards platform. Drop is disrupting the $40+ billion loyalty market with a strong focus on design, user experience, and engineering. We are executing fast, with plans to grow our current team that consists of experienced talent from Airbnb, Amazon, Facebook, Microsoft, and Goldman Sachs. We are looking to grow our top-tier, diverse team that embodies a culture of passion, grit, humility and hustle. <br/><br/> <strong>Software Engineering at Drop:</strong> <br/><br/> Engineering is at the core of Drop’s ability to scale. We strive for automation, intelligence, and simplicity in all of our products and infrastructure. <br/><br/> We are responsible for continuously processing hundreds of millions of financial transactions while delivering a polished and engaging experience for users. Our product challenges span across both the consumer space (B2C) and the retailer space (B2B). <br/><br/> Our approach to development and collaboration welcomes engineers whom are full stack and/or specialize in a particular domain (frontend, backend, data, etc). We operate at all levels of the stack: building mobile-first apps with technologies like React Native to deliver elegant UIs, scaling highly parallelized APIs and banking integrations to get a 360-degree view of user spending habits and share of wallet, developing data infrastructure to deliver insights and enable the business to efficiently drive impact, and more. <br/><br/> As an Engineering team, we value code quality, testability, scalable engineering design, and continuous process improvement. We leverage modern technologies, such as React Native, Ruby/Rails, Postgres, Redshift, Docker, Kubernetes, and more. We maintain an efficient development environment to keep productive and rapidly innovate. Our key collaborators are product managers, designers, and other stakeholders (marketing, business development, customer support) who partner as entrepreneurial peers on a daily basis. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>What kinds of challenges are Frontend engineers working on at Drop?</strong> <ul>  <li>Produce highly interactive in-app experiences to educate and engage users.</li>  <li>Partner with Marketing to create dynamic, web-based experiences to bring new users to Drop from various sources, including Snapchat, Facebook and Instagram.</li> <li>Build with and contribute to our extensive Component library, which enables different teams to speak the same design language.</li>  <li>Develop with the bleeding edge of React Native to build games with gestural input and complex animations.</li> <li>Deliver customized experiences based on user personas to increase overall conversion.</li> <li>Create new features with an objective and scientific approach through A/B testing.</li>  <li>Utilize modern tooling, including Jest unit coverage, E2E screenshots and snapshots, and API Acceptance tests, all covered by continuous integration.</li> </ul> <strong>The following Frontend experience is relevant to us:</strong> <ul>  <li>You have at least 5 years of experience in software engineering.</li> <li>You are passionate about working with JavaScript and modern frontend frameworks to produce high fidelity user experiences.</li> <li>You have experience building in a production environment using modern web frameworks, service oriented architectures, and scalable datastores.</li> <li>You write testable and maintainable code to produce quality systems using engineering best practices.</li> <li>You thrive in a fast-paced environment; startup experience is not a strict requirement but a bonus. Drop welcomes people from all work backgrounds and recognizes the value of diversity.</li> <li>You’re passionate about building the next generation loyalty product to make life more rewarding.</li> <li>Bonus: You’ve worked with ES6, React Native, Redux, Promises, or Functional Programming.</li> <li>Bonus: You have experience scaling architecture and working on products with millions of users.</li> <li>Bonus: You’ve built financial, loyalty, or rewards systems.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> At Drop, we're committed to providing an enjoyable and meaningful environment for every member of our team. We operate under a flat structure with minimal hierarchy where everyone’s opinion is valued equally. We are looking for team members with an entrepreneurial mindset who will thrive in a fast-paced and rewarding environment. <br/><br/> <strong>Additional perks:</strong> <ul>  <li>Company stock</li> <li>Competitive salaries</li> <li>Flexible vacations</li> <li>Transportation perks</li> <li>Health and dental benefits</li> <li>Team retreats</li> <li>Catered lunches three times a week</li> <li>Unlimited snacks and coffee</li> <li>Company-sponsored happy hours</li> <li>And much more!</li> </ul> Drop Technologies, Inc. is proud to be a diverse and equal opportunity employer and as such does not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, national origins, age, sexual orientation, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Selection decisions are solely based on job-related factors.
Title: Software Engineer, Frontend

Job_Description: <strong>ACL Impact</strong> <br/><br/> ACL exists to help make the world a safer and more ethical place. By enabling Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) professionals that use our software to be recognized for the value they bring to their organizations, we aim to be game-changers: to provide organizations with the software tools, support, and knowledge to dive deep into their data, identify anomalies, and manage GRC across the entire organization. From helping a national agency track down missing children to helping banks find suspicious patterns in their data and state agencies stamp out fraudulent activities, ACL has been at the heart of many investigations that have helped save people and millions talk about impact! <br/><br/> <strong>The ACL R&D Team</strong> <br/><br/> The R&D team extends beyond the walls of ACL and stands on the shoulders of giants. We use the innovation of technology partners like Amazon, select OEMs, and the Open Source Community to ensure were meeting our challenges with the most current and effective technologies. We give back by contributing time, code and support to our engineers and across the community. <br/><br/> To understand more about software development at ACL, read Landing your Software Engineering Dream Job. To look through the window into R&D, check out our blog or read these articles: Inside ACL R&D Part IBrigades, and R&D Baymax Team Spirit. <br/><br/> As a DevOps shop, we work quickly to release new stuff on a continuous basis. We own what we build and do not pass it off to others. We continually work to reduce the time required to build and safely deploy software. Security, integrity and performance are not an afterthought. They are built into our development process. If a serious vulnerability is discovered we pause everything else and immediately resolve it. <br/><br/> We have a product development group of 70+ and counting (the company has over 300 employees and counting). We work in small brigades comprised of 5 or so Software Engineers, 2 QA Engineers, a Manager, a UX Designer, UX Developer and a Product Manager. Its our version of a scrum team. <br/><br/> <strong>The Challenge Ahead</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer (Frontend) who has extensive experience with modern Javascript and other frontend technologies. Youll provide technical leadershipo amongst a team of talented designers and engineers. You'll be instrumental in building visually-stunning user interfaces for Projects module, the heart of our GRC platform. <br/><br/> <strong>What Will You Get Out of This?</strong>   <ul> <li>An amazing dynamic startup environment within a financially stable company (did we mention we just celebrated our 30thanniversary?)</li> <li>Some of the best benefits in the industry (asking for more information can be a great first question for us in the interview process).</li> <li>Working with an awesome team of professional software engineers with plenty of room to learn and grow.</ul>  Skills For Success at ACL</strong>   <ul> <li>You have a Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience.</li> <li>You have a strong ability and desire to mentor fellow developers providing guidance on technical design and implementation.</li> <li>You have experience writing CSS and JavaScript in an agile team environment at scale. Bonus if you are familiar with React & Redux.</li> <li>You care deeply for code quality, are a TDD ninja, and detest having bugs slip through to production.</li> <li>You are passionate about learning and continuous improvement.</li> <li>You have creative ideas, a collaborative attitude and strong work ethic.</li> </ul>  <strong>Bonus</strong>   <ul> <li>You have an interest in learning or have experience with backend technologies such as Ruby on Rails, relational databases and AWS services.</li> <li>You are actively involved in local meetups and contribute to open source project we can look at on Github.</li>  </ul>

Job_Description: <strong>Role</strong> <br/><br/> It’s all up front. An intuitive, responsive and reliable frontend to our web and mobile web application makes or breaks our customers' experience and by extension our reputation. <br/><br/> You love building highly usable web and mobile applications that are used all day, every single day of the year, for mission critical work. You will play a leading role in the design, development, deployment of SEDNA’s successful frontend system. You will work closely with team product managers, designers, sales, and other developers to design, build, test, ship, and support new functionality and services. You will provide technical leadership and direction in the implementation of large new product features, site performance, and code maintainability. You will actively mentor junior team members and better your peers and work to make other people more productive. Your toolkit contains: React, Redux, BootStrap, SASS, and possibly TypeScript. <br/><br/> At heart, this role combines a love of technology, design, and leadership to help us build functional applications that our customers love to use and helps them work better together. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Conceptualize, design, estimate, document, develop, deploy, maintain, operate, support, and test existing and new applications/services.</li>  <li>Work closely with product managers, designers, sales, and other developers to deliver features, services, and bug fixes.</li>  <li>Take lead on making our current React application performant, maintainable, reliable and mobile-friendly.</li>  <li>Contribute to architectural direction and decision making.</li>  <li>Identify and adopt software engineering best practices and processes that make sense for our development team.</li>  <li>Improve our site performance - milliseconds matter, and better our craft by writing testable code, reusable components, and simplifying state management layers.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> You can demonstrate experience in building and maintaining high quality frontend sites on web and mobile and have an interest in constantly looking at how the company can build better, scalable, and sustainable solutions.  <ul> <li>4+ years of development experience, with at least 2 years experience developing single page applications.</li>  <li>Deep understanding of Web technologies especially as related to browser rendering and networking.</li>  <li>Practical experience with React.js component life cycles, rendering model, and integrating with foreign libraries.</li>  <li>Experience with popular frameworks of managing React.js state and effects (such as Flux or Redux)</li>  <li>Familiar with a few concurrency, and side-effect (state + IO) management patterns, possible examples: Elm Architecture, Reactive Streams, CSP, Actor Model, FRP, and more.</li>  <li>You reliably deliver without supervision and have experience mentoring junior employees.</li>  <li>You are skilled at explaining technical problems succinctly and clearly.</li>  <li>Your curiosity, empathy, and logic make you an excellent troubleshooter.</li>  <li>You are resourceful and make every effort to get through a challenge.</li>  <li>You know when something is over your head and you ask for help.</li>  <li>You stay positive and thrive under pressure.</li>  <li>You possess a mastery of English and are a confident and considerate writer and speaker.</li>  <li>You are able to make decisions and take action autonomously.</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus</strong>  <ul> <li>You have prior experience in a similar role in a startup environment.</li>  <li>Familiarity with one statically typed language.</li>  <li>Familiarity with build pipelines (webpack)</li>  <li>Deep knowledge of Dev Tools, especially profiling</li>  <li>Knowledge of modern front-end styling techniques (CSS Modules, Styled Components, etc)</li> </ul> <strong>SEDNA</strong> <br/><br/> At SEDNA, we help some of the biggest companies in the world manage their day-to-day transactions with a team inbox. We’re doing this by building an enterprise product that helps our customers work faster, better together, and more securely. SEDNA provides you with trust, support, guidance, and an opportunity to grow within the organization. We are a small company doing something disruptive. Our culture is one of trust, experimentation, helpfulness, working out loud, asking ‘what does the data say?’, and letting people self-serve. www.sedna.com

Title: Conversational Product Developer

Job_Description: <strong>*Multiple Openings*</strong> <br/><br/> Sitecore is the global leader in experience management software that enables context marketing. The Sitecore® Experience Platform™ manages content, supplies contextual intelligence, automates communications, and enables personalized commerce, at scale. It empowers marketers to deliver content in context of how customers have engaged with their brand, across every channel, in real time—before, during, and after a sale. More than 4,900 brands––including American Express, Carnival Cruise Lines, easyJet, and L’Oréal–– have trusted Sitecore for context marketing to deliver the personalized interactions that delight audiences, build loyalty, and drive revenue. <br/><br/> As a Software Engineer, you will be a member of the Product Support Services Team, responsible for assisting Sitecore’s implementation partners with best practices guidance, troubleshooting complex customizations, reverse engineering, and significantly contribute towards ramping up and developing the team in the first year. <br/><br/> Sitecore implementations are handled by their network of partners. Because of the complex nature of Sitecore’s products, their partners often need assistance in mapping customer requirements to implementation best practices. The Software Engineer will work with partners to understand customer requirements and determine the proper implementation approach. In addition, the Software Engineer may troubleshoot implementations that are experiencing complex performance or functional issues. Ultimately, the Software Engineer solves problems that developer cannot solve. <br/><br/> Sitecore will provide all necessary training on the Sitecore system. <br/><br/> You will work with a team of business people and technologists who are smart, experienced and great fun to be around. <br/><br/> <strong>Ideal candidates will have the following background:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong><ul><li>Experience in Microsoft technology platform, including:</strong>  <ul> <li>NET web applications</li><li>C#</li><li>Visual Studio</li><li>SQL Server</li><li>IIS</li></ul></li> <li>Outstanding problem solving and logical thinking skills</li><li>NET programming experience, including experience with 3rd-party APIs</li><li>Experience working with data structures and creating software algorithms</li><li>Experience defining solution architectures (software or physical)</li><li>Experience troubleshooting complex software development projects</li><li>Great communication skills in English</li>  </ul> <strong>Experience in the following would be a plus:</strong> <ul> <li>Experience in frontend technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS</li><li>Experience configuring load balancers and other network equipment</li><li>Experience configuring Windows-based servers</li> </ul>  No travel required. This position is located in Gatineau. <br/><br/> Sitecore is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity without unlawful regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other local legally protected characteristic.
Title: Product Support Software Engineer

Job_Description: <div>By 2020, 83% of enterprise workloads will be in the cloud. This transformation introduces an ever-increasing set of complex tradeoffs for IT staff, such as whether to place workloads on-premises or public cloud, when and how to scale up or scale out workloads, and what resources to allocate without overprovisioning. To de-risk this transformation, IT organizations are turning to self-managing and real-time workloads. With 10+ patents on our technology, Turbonomic is the only platform that enables enterprises to prepare their businesses for the cloud and answers the most complex IT challenges they face.</div><br/> <div>Were the leader in workload automation for hybrid cloud and transforming the way IT operates. We want the brightest and most driven individuals who are looking to steer the future of technology. If you thrive in a team-based environment where intellectual curiosity and willingness to go the extra mile without giving up are in your DNA, we want to hear from you!</div><br/> <div>As a full-stack software engineer, you will directly impact the next-generation of our product. You will play an active role in the design and development of new features and improvements to our existing UI (HTML5, Angular, D3 based stack), positively impacting our top customers.</div> <div>Turbonomic will present you with constant challenges where you can apply your ideas to real functionality and process. Youll have the ability to grow your experience and explore new technologies within a culture that is overflowing with mentorship and cross-team collaboration.</div> What you'll be doing:  <ul> <li>Work within one of our product engineering teams to develop new features and be the embedded full-stack expert.</li> <li>You will develop and design the user interface of our platform, while also contributing to back-end services.</li><li>Improve the quality, performance, and stability of frontend codebases.</li><li>Collaborate closely with designer, engineering and product teams to create the best experience for our customers.</li><li>Create breathtaking interfaces, focusing on driving customer engagement through coherent and elegant user experience.</li> </ul>  <strong>What you'll bring:</strong>  <ul> <li>3+ years of experience building customer-facing applications in a professional setting</li><li>Degree in a related field or equivalent practical experience.</li><li>Understand the intricacies of how JS and CSS impact rendering.</li> <li>Server-side experience (Java, C++ or similar) and proficiency with JavaScript.</li> <li>Experience with software engineering methodologies (e.g. unit testing, code reviews, design documentation)</li><li>Expert in all aspects of HTML5 and single-page web-apps and frameworks.</li><li>Passion for writing clean, effective code</li><li>Ability to thrive in dynamic, fast-paced environments where passion for customer engagement and great experience are at the forefront of all design & development.</li><li>Interest or Familiarity with Cloud technologies</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Benefits & Perks:</strong></div><div><strong>Health, dental and vision coverage</strong>  health is a #1 priority here also, eat your fruit!</div><div><strong>Career advancement</strong> jump in, make an impact and shape your career</div><div><strong>Unlimited Paid Time Off</strong> visit mom, see a Title: Full-Stack Software Engineer

Job_Description: Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets. <br/><br/> <strong>Software Engineer, Developer Experience - EA Digital Platform (EADP)</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>We are EA</strong> <br/><br/> Electronic Arts is more than you’ve ever realized. We’re more than a company, or a headline, or even a clever catchphrase – we’re a vibrant community of over 8,000 artists, storytellers, technologists and innovators working toward a shared vision: to inspire and unite through play. <br/><br/> While headquartered in Redwood City, EA's platform engineering, game development, and publishing operations take place in a network of locations, stretching from Shanghai to Stockholm, Melbourne to Vancouver. No matter which of our studio locations you join, you’ll feel the energy and support of EA’s global brand, while immersing yourself in a culture that inspires you to thrive, take risks and dream big. Our unique studios create amazingly creative and fun games - fast paced puzzles, adrenaline filled warfare, galaxy spanning adventures, high speed racing, and sports so realistic you can practically feel the grass under your feet. <br/><br/> This is an especially great time for the video game industry, as we’re currently going through an exciting digital transformation. The effects of this on EA’s business have been profound. In fiscal year 2014, 45% ($1.8 billion) of our non-GAAP net revenues came from digital offerings. The global gaming audience has also never been bigger, with industry revenue projected to reach $86 billion in 2016. <br/><br/> Since its founding in 1982, EA has helped shape the way over 300 million registered players consume and enjoy interactive media. No other company can deliver EA’s portfolio of amazing games and services, across multiple platforms, to players around the world. It is an exciting era in games, and an exciting time to join the team at EA! <br/><br/> <strong>The Challenge Ahead:</strong> <br/><br/> EA’s Digital Platform (EADP) organization is responsible for driving critical technology decisions and investments for EA on a global basis, across all divisions and studio teams. Technology and engineering leadership at EA is critical to making the industry’s best games and services and the EADP team is leading the way to providing cross-platform infrastructure that will keep our consumers connected with our games anytime, anywhere with anyone.. <br/><br/> <strong>What a Software Engineer, Developer Experience does at EA:</strong> <br/><br/> This unique role will be perfect for an individual who is passionate about engineering ease of use and reducing friction in tech integration. The team will focus on building a product that unifies integrator onboarding and support and provides apps to optimize the entire game development and live game management life cycle. The team will also build a framework that enables shared services to provide the right experiences, tools and documentation support to enable better integration. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> The Software Engineer will play a key role in developing tools and services to support the platform in providing a world class developer experience. Typical activities include: <ul> <li>Develop web apps, components, prototypes, or proofs of concept (POC’s)</li><li>Participate in all aspects of an iterative, agile software development process, including scoping, detailed design, effort estimation, coding, testing, debugging, maintenance and support</li><li>Define and tune frontend technology stack</li><li>Collaborate with the design and product management team to build applications that delight users.</li><li>Document and present designs for peer technical review and provide feedback on others’ designs</li><li>Work on the application framework that includes backend common services (e.g. authentication, authorization etc)</li><li>Develop Real-time data collection and analytics on client/server platforms</li><li>Work cross teams to identify key requirements, define key metrics and setup benchmarks for engineering ease of use</li><li>Analyze the complex technical architecture across EA’s shared services and platform to understand the underlying drivers of engineering friction and drive fixes</li><li>Partner closely with game studios to understand their key requirements and concerns for integration</li><li>Partner closely with platform teams to understand what common functionality they need in a framework to build the best possible integration experiences</li> </ul> <strong>The next great EA Software Engineer, Developer Experience also needs:</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science</li><li>Expertise in object oriented design/programming</li><li>Knowledgeable in the area of scalable platform architecture, end to end systems design and architecture</li><li>A passion for gaming and a good problem solver and creative thinker</li><li>Experience with web frontend technologies like React, Angular, Javascript, CSS and HTML is a plus</li><li>Familiarity with new web frameworks and tools (e.g. Grunt, Bower, Bootstrap, JSHint) is a plus</li><li>Able to work and problem solve independently, to organize workload and priorities, high-quality execution, technical innovation/adaptation, and initiative</li><li>Understanding of the realities of working with complex distributed client/server systems</li><li>Experience working in Agile/Scrum based development environments</li><li>Understanding of HTTP/HTTPS requests</li><li>Familiarity with Linux based systems</li> </ul> <strong>What’s in it for you? Glad you asked!</strong> <br/><br/> We love to brag about our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, 401k with company match and, of course, free video games. And since we realize it takes world-class people to make world-class games, we offer competitive compensation packages and a culture that thrives off of creativity and individuality. At EA, we live the “work hard/play hard” credo every day. <br/><br/> <strong>Don’t Just Play It – Create It!</strong>

Title: Intermediate or Senior Web Developer (Frontend)

Job_Description: Hey! We’re Radical I/O Technology, a software development lab & consultancy that loves to mix interesting tech with doing good in the world. We attract clients and employees who share many of our same values of integrity, honesty, approachability, quality, community, and collaboration. <br/><br/> We're currently looking for a couple of <strong>senior and/or intermediate</strong> <strong>frontend Javascript developers (React/Redux)</strong> for a 6-12 month full-time contract to start. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> To become a Javascript Developer with Radical I/O, we'd love to see your experience in: <ul>  <li>frontend web development, using popular frontend JavaScript frameworks like React, Angular, etc</li> <li>crafting great UI using HTML and CSS</li> <li>developing with mobile responsiveness in mind</li> <li>using Git repos as your version control of choice</li> </ul> Bonus/nice to have's (but not required): <ul>  <li>React Native</li> <li>fullstack web development on the MEAN/MERN stack</li> <li>restful API design & development</li> <li>SQL and NoSQL datastores</li> </ul> We also look for people who: <ul>  <li>write clean code, have written unit tests, and who adhere to effective software design principles</li> <li>have worked within agile processes like Scrum or Kanban, and used tools like JIRA or similar</li> <li>are comfortable working professionally with clients in varying industries</li> <li>are continuously learning</li> <li>communicate and collaborate well and often</li> <li>want to build community and/or make a difference in the world <em>(be sure to include more info about this in the summary section or your cover letter)</em></li>  </ul> THE OTHER STUFF <br/><br/> Local Vancouver, BC applicants are preferred, particularly those who can work in our office at least 50% of the time. <br/><br/> We are actively working towards changing the gender imbalance in the tech industry (see our work with App Camp For Girls), and we highly encourage devs whose identities are under-represented in this field to apply. If you don’t match 100% of the job requirements, but are passionate about what you do and eager to learn, we want to hear from you. <br/><br/> Please only apply if you are authorized to work full-time in Canada for any employer. We welcome applicants on working holiday visas and post-graduate work permits. <br/><br/> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> We offer a flexible and inclusive space to work where we welcome your unique self, including: <ul>  <li>Inviting office in downtown Vancouver at Beatty and Robson, close to all skytrain lines, shopping, restaurants, the seawall, and entertainment.</li> <li>Encouraging participation in professional events, meetups, conferences, and giving back to the community.</li> <li>Regular team social events and meals, including unlimited daily drinks and snacks.</li> <li>Excellent time off policy and flexibility.</li> </ul> Whether you're very experienced or new to the field, we look beyond cookie-cutter requirements and instead focus on your potential. We hire skilled teammates who are hungry to learn and grow, and who really care about the quality of work they produce. We want you to be proud of working on our team, and we want to feel privileged to know you.
Title: Frontend JavaScript Developers (React/Redux)

We balance this with a respectful, healthy environment and lifestyle. At Fusebill integrity and reliability are as important as talent and effort. At Fusebill the team always comes first. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop software in the context of a project, while ensuring alignment to current and developing architecture.</li>  <li>Delivering on development activities on time per project plan with the highest level of quality while producing code that is secure and reliable.</li>   <li>Understand and help refine un-stated requirements & work with the Development Manager and Project Manager to define software requirements.</li>  <li>Prepare Technical Design and Specification documents</li>  <li>Create implementation instructions and supports application deployments</li>  <li>Conduct design and peer reviews including individual & team unit testing</li>  <li>Work with the project team to review problems, define and test solutions</li>  <li>Exercise leadership through superior technical and domain knowledge</li>  <li>Aid in the development of architectural framework and design</li>  <li>Evaluate and introduce new tools and techniques to the development team</li>  <li>Proactive approach to finding solutions and managing problems.</li>  <li>Proactively identify areas for improvement, seek solutions and make recommendations</li>  <li>Remain up to date of development technologies, both current and future.</li> </ul> <strong>Required Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>Degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or other relevant discipline.</li>  <li>5+ years of experience developing web-based, SaaS or enterprise applications</li>  <li>5+ years of developing within the .NET environment, 3.5+, Web API, and MVC, and Web Services.</li>  <li>5+ years of experience working with SQL Server 2012 & above, ADO.NET, EF, ORM patterns</li>  <li>5+ years of experience in JavaScript, JQuery, and frontend frameworks such as BootStrap and Knockout JS.</li>  <li>Languages: C#, SQL/T-SQL, JavaScript, VBScript, HTML, XML</li>  <li>Experience leveraging popular design methodologies, patterns and practices</li>  <li>Strong background with the software development lifecycle, and common models (agile, iterative, waterfall, etc.) with familiarity in best software practices including source code control, requirements gathering and unit testing.</li>  <li>5+ years with ASP.NET deployment techniques</li> </ul> <strong>Desired Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>Some experience with front end UI design preferred</li>  <li>Previous ecommerce or fintech experience.</li>  <li>Exposure to PCI compliance</li>  <li>Experience with NServiceBus</li> </ul> <strong>Fusebill Offers:</strong>  <ul> <li>A fun, collaborative working environment</li>  <li>A place for continuous learning and growth</li>  <li>Flexible work hours</li>  <li>A competitive salary with a generous ESOP plan</li>  <li>Comprehensive benefits</li> </ul> <strong><em>Fusebill welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</em></strong>

Job_Description: Sr. Software Developer is responsible for creating new business applications for back-end systems and front-end, customer facing, web enabled systems. This person will be a well-versed programming expert that understands business processes and multiple programming languages. <br/><br/> <strong><u>RESPONSIBILITIES</u></strong> <ul> <li>Work with our agile development team to implement new features in JavaScript (NodeJS and React)</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Implement continuous development pipeline</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Implement click stream analysis using AWS Lambda, DynamoDB, Athena and Elasticsearch</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Participate in daily scrum meetings to help prioritize tasks</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Work with product owner to help define user stories and estimates</li></ul>  <ul>   <ul> <li>A willingness and drive to acquire new skills, provide input, and grow with the company and IT Team.</li><li>Ability to work individually on a task or project, and as a team member on larger system projects.</li></ul></ul>  <ul> <li>Excellent oral and written skills, and an ability to communicate well with technical and non-technical personnel daily, while working in a results-oriented organization under strict guidelines and a devotion to exceptional end-user experiences.</li> </ul> <strong><u>INVUE’s TECHNOLOGY STACK</u></strong> <ul> <li>Infrastructure is hosted on AWS using ECS, Docker with CloudFront</li><li>Frontend development is done using ReactJS</li><li>Server-side development is implemented with NodeJS</li><li>Click stream handling uses AWS Kinesis, Lambda and Elastic Search</li><li>Github, AWS Code Pipeline and Code Build are used for development process</li> </ul> <strong><u>QUALIFICATIONS</u></strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s Degree required; preferred in Computer Science or Engineering</li><li>6+ years of Development experience</li><li>3+ years of software development experience on a team with at least 5 developers</li><li>1+ year of experience with NodeJS</li><li>Strong programming skills and working knowledge in <strong>one or more</strong> of the following programming languages: Java, Scala, Python, or JavaScript</li><li>Work experience with Git and other CI tools</li><li>Eye for design is desirable with internal and external customers</li><li>Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, operate gracefully under stress and handle multiple assignments in parallel</li><li>Good communication skills in one of the following languages: English or French</li> </ul> <strong><u>BENEFITS</u></strong> <ul> <li>Office is a 5-minute walk from the Metro Line</li><li>Offers flexible work schedule with the ability to work from home</li><li>Competitive package</li><li>Performance bonus</li><li>Supplemental healthcare plan</li> </ul>  <strong>Développeur logiciel - senior</strong><br/><br/><strong>Lieu:</strong> Montréal Canada <br/><br/> <strong>Supérieur hiérarchique:</strong> Directeur du développement <br/><br/> Le développeur logiciel sera responsable de créer de nouvelles fonctionnalités aussi bien back-end que front-end pour nos App actuelles. Cette personne devra aussi bien comprendre les processus d’Affaires et devra maîtriser plusieurs langages de programmation <br/><br/> <strong><u>RESPONSABILITÉS:</u></strong> <ul> <li>Travailler au sein d’une équipe de développement AGILE pour l’implémentation de nouvelles fonctionnalités en JavaScript (NodeJS et React)</li><li>Implémenter un pipeline de développement en continu</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Implémenter une analyse de séquence des clics enregistrés en utilisant AWS Lambda, DynamoDB, Athena et Elasticsearch.</li><li>Participer aux rituels Agile afin de d’aider à la priorisation des tâches</li><li>Travailler étroitement avec le Product Owner pour aider à déterminer les « User Stories » et estimés</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Être volontaire pour accroître ses connaissances et compétences, ne pas avoir peur d’apporter son point de vue constructif à l’équipe, grandir avec cette dernière et avec la compagnie elle-même</li><li>Savoir être indépendant sur des tâches et des projets autant que savoir être un joueur d’équipe sur des projets de plus grande envergure.</li><li>Excellente communication orale et écrite aussi bien avec des personnes techniques que non-techniques (savoir vulgariser les concepts)</li><li>Apprécier travailler dans une compagnie orientée résultat, dans de cours délais, pour servir les objectifs des utilisateurs finaux (Utilisation des Personas)</li> </ul> <strong></strong> <br/><br/> <strong><u>PORTFOLIO DE TECHNOLOGIES D’INVUE :</u></strong> <ul> <li>Infrastructure hébergée sur AWS utilisant ECS, Docker avec Cloudfront</li><li>Le Front-end est développé avec ReactJS</li><li>Les développements côté serveur sont implémentés avec NodeJS</li><li>Suivi et enrichissements des clics avec AWS Kinesis, Lambda et Elastic Search</li><li>Github, AWS Code Pipeline et Code Build sont utilisés dans le processus de développement</li> </ul> <strong><u>QUALIFICATIONS ATTENDUES:</u></strong> <ul> <li>Détenir au minimum un baccalauréat, préférablement en Informatique ou Ingénierie</li><li>Minimum de 6 ans d'expérience</li><li>Totaliser 3 ans d’expérience en développement au sein d’une équipe de minimum 5 développeurs</li><li>Minimum de 1 an d'expérience avec NodeJS</li><li>Avoir de solides compétences en programmation dans <strong>un ou plus</strong> des langages suivants : Java, Scala, Python, or JavaScript</li><li>Avoir une expérience de travail pertinente avec Git et d’autres outils d’intégration continue</li><li>Avoir l’oeil pour le Design est un atout</li><li>Savoir travailler dans un environnement au rythme rapide et gérer plusieurs projets en parallèle</li><li>Savoir s’exprimer correctement en Français ou en Anglais</li> </ul> <strong><u>AVANTAGES</u></strong> <ul> <li>Station de métro à 5 minutes du bureau</li><li>Horaires flexibles avec la possibilité de travailler parfois de la maison</li><li>Salaire compétitif</li><li>Bonus de performance</li> </ul>
Title: Senior Software Developer

Job_Description: <DIV><B>Excellence Leaves a Lasting Impression: Bring Your Vision to shape a better world. </B></DIV> <DIV><B> </B></DIV> <DIV><B>At Arup, our innovative spirit compels us to express our ingenuity in unique ways — engineering, planning, designing, and consulting on many of the most renowned projects in the built environment. We aim to deliver technical excellence, innovation, and value to clients, while maintaining our core mission of shaping a better world. The firm opened its first office over 70 years ago and now employs 13,000 people globally. Since its founding in 1946, members of Arup have developed transformative ways of working. Adapting to the ever changing environment, our work is focused on ambitiously reimagining a sustainable and resilient future for cities. Arup is rising to these new challenges: by bringing together broad-minded individuals from a wide range of disciplines, investing in research, innovating and creating better solutions for clients and the wider world.<BR><BR></B></DIV> <DIV>We are currently seeking a Full Stack Developer in our Toronto office to work as part of a multidisciplinary team engaged in translating business requirements into bespoke software and cloud solutions for clients around the world.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B> Responsibilities:</B></DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Being aligned with the responsibilities of the DevOps process, which includes designing, building, testing and deploying products, software solutions and services. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Developing frontend interfaces, backend APIs, web maps and data visualizations. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Interfacing with a broad user base to understand requirements and solicit feedback.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Supporting continuous-integration and continuous-deployment pipelines on private on premise IT infrastructure and public cloud providers like Amazon AWS and Microsoft Azure. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Identifying and architecting solutions that meet the stakeholder’s needs, preform requirements gathering workshops with stakeholders, extract user stories, and identify a minimum viable product that meets the client’s expectations.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Product Management.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Supervision of junior resources such as developers and interns.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Maintaining the integrity of the code base through:</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Code reviews</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Version control</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Issue tracking</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Testing regimes</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Documentation</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B>Qualifications:</B></DIV> <DIV><B> </B></DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical discipline. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>5 years of professional experience developing software.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong, object-oriented design and coding skills.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong knowledge of object oriented design and programming, </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Knowledge around GIS platforms will be advantageous. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ability to work independently and solve technical problems with little supervision;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong communication & collaboration skills.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Preferred experience with:</DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Cloud (AWS/AZURE):</DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Solution architecting</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>DevOps</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Messaging and Queues</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Serverless functions and infrastructure</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Authentication and Job_Description: Zymeworks is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company dedicated to the discovery, development and commercialization of next-generation bispecific and multifunctional biotherapeutics. Zymeworks’ suite of complementary therapeutic platforms and its fully-integrated drug development engine provide the flexibility and compatibility to precisely engineer and develop highly-differentiated product candidates. <br/><br/> We are looking for a Full Stack Software Developer to join this team to expand and improve our scientific computing stack. You will collaborate with scientists and developers to molecular modelling frameworks, applications, and libraries, as well as helping to develop data management, visualization, and analysis tools. This position will report to the Group Lead of the Software Development Team and will be based in Vancouver, Canada <br/><br/> <strong>We expect you to have…</strong> <br/><br/> • A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related discipline <br/><br/> • Minimum 2 years industry experience in web application development <br/><br/> • Demonstrated ability to design, implement, and maintain medium-to-large scale web applications, their supporting back-end services, and associated infrastructure through entire life cycle from initial idea to final deployment <br/><br/> • Ability to deliver rapid, iterative prototypes from initial ideas, and a drive for software development excellence through peer code reviews, automated testing, and systematic deployments <br/><br/> • Proficiency in English, spoken and written <br/><br/> <strong>It would be great if you had…</strong> <br/><br/> • Experience with Python based web frameworks like Django or Pyramid <br/><br/> • Experience developing servers and other infrastructure using Python, Go, and/or Elixir <br/><br/> • Experience building UX front ends and interactive data visualizations <br/><br/> • Experience with git and GitHub/GitLab, CI/CD systems <br/><br/> <strong>Our Platform</strong> <br/><br/> Our software platform includes the following technologies: <br/><br/> • Elm and JavaScript, including D3, AngularJS for webapp frontends and visualizations <br/><br/> • Python for scientific applications and modelling software <br/><br/> • Go for server development <br/><br/> • Elixir for server development <br/><br/> • PostgreSQL <br/><br/> <strong>Duties</strong> <br/><br/> • Developing our data acquisition, processing, analysis, and visualization capabilities <br/><br/> • Creating and evolving front-end web applications, their supporting back-end APIs, and operational infrastructure <br/><br/> • Actively coordinating with our R&D teams to find areas of inefficiencies in data processes, and designing and implementing solutions in conjunction with the software development team <br/><br/> • Integrating and maintaining the developed software as part of the entire computational platform <br/><br/> • Experimenting with new technologies and practices that can be integrated within our organization <br/><br/> <strong>Why Work for Us?</strong> <br/><br/> Zymeworks’ employees are passionate, engaged and extremely motivated to succeed. We are excited by cutting-edge science and technology, the endless possibilities this union holds and the sheer opportunity to be a part of something big. To learn more about Zymeworks Inc. and our current openings, please visit our website at www.zymeworks.com. <br/><br/> We offer challenging career opportunities, competitive benefits and an environment that recognizes and rewards performance.

Job_Description: Embrace and Lead<br/><br/>You have spent countless hours over the years learning the academic and practical skills to be great at what you do. Working professionally and as a hobbyist you have gathered experience in your field so you know what to do and what not to do. You embrace the perpetual cycle of learning and mastering new technologies. At ZetaTango we encourage everyone to trust themselves, stop holding back and use your acquired knowledge. <br/><br/> Everyone in the team is an integral contributor to our products, working with our customers to collaborate and design the best solutions. Our open work culture provides the opportunity for you to contribute to all aspects of our business: customer engagement, product ownership, software, QA, devops and 24/7 cloud service deployment. <br/><br/> As a key member of our development team you will lead through collaboration to design, develop and deploy our integrated cloud services that help small businesses succeed:  <ul>  <li>Drive the full product lifecycle as a product owner and developer</li>    <li>Design complete solutions</li>    <li>Develop secure code for APIs, frontend, backend, web, mobile, partner integration</li>    <li>Learn and adapt technologies to real problems</li>   </ul>    <ul>  <li>Leverage big data, predictive analytics and machine learning when and where its needed</li>    </ul> <strong>What You Bring:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Ruby on Rails or other web application frameworks</li>    <li>ELT and processing large data sets</li>    <li>Experience with the Apache big data ecosystem</li>    <li>Experience with API driven solutions</li>    <li>Proficiency with Linux</li>    <li>Working autonomously and being highly resourceful</li>    <li>Experience with agile, test driven design methodology</li>    <li>BSC or MSC in computer science or engineering</li>    </ul> <strong>Other Valued Skills & Knowledge:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Statistics, analytics and machine learning</li>    <li>Node.js, JavaScript and front-end development frameworks</li>    <li>Heroku, AWS, Kubernetes, Docker</li>    <li>Security & Cryptography</li>    <li>Accounting, payment, billing or other finance solutions</li>    </ul> <strong>What You Can Expect From Us</strong> <br/><br/> At ZetaTango we hire for fit. Fit with our values of openness, agility and respect. Fit with the knowledge and skills needed to excel both individually and as part of a larger team so that we can continue to serve our customers. Fit with an insatiable need to improve, learn and discover. What you’ll get in return is the opportunity to work with others who are top in the industry and who possess an incredible amount of knowledge and enthusiasm for building a world class company. <br/><br/> If you are looking for a challenging career and the opportunity to be part of a successful and high growth company, ZetaTango is the ideal place for you. <br/><br/> We want our candidates and our employees to be set up for success. During every part of the recruiting process you will have the opportunity to get in touch with our People & Culture team with any questions, concerns or requests for accommodations.
Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: Job DescriptionAmazon Simple Storage Service (S3) is storage for the Internet. Through the use of pioneering techniques in distributed computing, developers are able to durably store their data on Amazon’s proven computing infrastructure to achieve virtually limitless storage capacity at minimal cost. Amazon S3 provides a simple web services interface that can be used to store and retrieve any amount of data, at any time, from anywhere on the web. It gives any developer access to the same highly scalable, reliable, secure, fast, inexpensive infrastructure that Amazon uses to run its own global network of web sites. The service aims to maximize benefits of scale and to pass those benefits on to developers.We’re looking for an experienced Software Development Engineer to focus on technology for a growing area of the S3 Frontend Services group of Amazon S3. As a builder in this area, you will focus on the challenges of writing software and designing service endpoint systems to handle the vast array of use cases that customers use on S3 today. You will dig into the details of high-scale API request processing one week, and will drive design for networking enhancements the next. You will code deliverables that break ground in enabling new high-performance workloads on S3. You will work with your peers on innovations in securing workloads that come into S3's front door. You will focus on high standards in coding, testing, and delivery.Responsibilities Include:   <ul>   <li>Design, implementation, deployment and maintenance of innovative software solutions to transform service security, durability, availability, performance and cost.</li> <li>Using software engineering best practices to ensure the standard of quality of all team deliverables</li> <li>Writing high quality distributed system software</li> <li>Effectively estimating time to implement design</li> <li>Work in an agile, startup-like development environment, where you are always working on the most important stuff</li> <li>Solving big problems with a lot of ambiguity</li> </ul>  Basic Qualifications   <ul>   <li>4+ years of industry experience</li> <li>Proficiency in, at least, one modern programming language such as Java, C++, or C#</li> <li>Familiarity with distributed systems and service oriented architectures</li> <li>Candidates must have a strong Computer Science background (a bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science is a must)</li> <li>Familiarity with networking protocols and performance optimizations</li> </ul>  Preferred Qualifications   <ul>   <li>Graduate Degree in Computer Science</li> <li>Experience with big data and massively-scaled distributed computing</li> <li>Strong foundation in algorithms, data structures, OO and core Computer Science concepts</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast paced environment</li> <li>Passion for understanding ambiguous, complex problems and driving innovative technical solutions</li> <li>Experience with software development in a Linux environment</li> <li>Deep understanding of networking protocols</li></ul>
Title: Software Development Engineer - AWS S3 Frontend Services

Why just have a job when you can be a part of something bigger? <br/><br/> <strong>TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN THIS ROLE, YOU'LL NEED:</strong>  <ul> <li>2+ years of experience in front end development and integration projects</li> <li>Proficiency with React.js & SASS required</li>   <li>Experience working with REST APIs asynchronously from the frontend</li>   <li>Experience with HTML, CSS and JavaScript (jQuery) required</li> <li>Experience working in an Agile software development environment</li> <li>Experience with website conversion analysis and optimization</li>   <li>A solid understanding of modern PHP and OOP principles are considered an asset</li>  </ul> <strong>BENEFITS:</strong>  <ul> <li>Access to group insurance benefits, including health and dental</li> <li>Advanced, platform agnostic workstations (we are happy to provide you with your preferred hardware and operating system to help you do your best work)</li> <li>Generous subsidies for your monthly public transit passes and for a variety of electric/hybrid cars</li> <li>Free Starbucks or Café Depot coffee/tea and numerous company lunches and events</li> <li>Exceptional contribution towards fitness classes/ your personal gym OR a fully paid annual gym membership to GOLDS GYM located right next to our office (you can workout at lunch)</li> <li>A fully stocked kitchen with healthy yummy snacks</li> <li>Convenient location with free parking and easily accessible via public transit, also close to various restaurants and stores</li> <li>Positive and diverse work environment, with an outgoing and collaborative team</li> </ul> <strong>If you feel like this opportunity could be a great fit for you, click here for your one-way ticket!</strong> <br/><br/> <strong> IF YOU KNOW SOMEONE WHO COULD FIT THIS JOB DESCRIPTION, CHECK OUT OUR</strong> REFERRAL PROGRAM:) <br/><br/> <strong><em>(please note that additional responsibilities may apply)</em></strong>
