Title: Full Stack Software Developer

Job_Description: Company Description<br/><br/>Thinking Capital is the leader in the Canadian Alternative Lending space, leveraging technology to be at the forefront of the FinTech industry. Since 2006, they have helped more than 10,000 small-to-medium sized Canadian businesses reach their full potential. By combining their people and technology, Thinking Capital is transforming the way business owners get the capital they need to grow. For more information, visit thinkingcapital.ca<br/><br/>Job Description<br/><br/><strong>Your role:</strong> <br/><br/> As an active member of the technology department, you will work within the Software Quality Assurance team to conduct testing, writing, and execution of test cases. The SQA Analyst will be responsible for ensuring that standards, processes, and procedures are properly implemented. This role is pivotal in developing and implementing a standard testing procedures. <br/><br/> <strong>Your tasks:</strong> <ul> <li>Participate and create testing project test plans;</li><li>Develop and create automated test cases using Zephyr in JIRA;</li><li>Implement Testing Automation using advance selenium skills;</li><li>Responsible for testing financial applications and actively carry out UAT with financial stakeholders;</li><li>Ability to work independently with minimal management oversight;</li><li>Creates Test Strategy and Test Approach document for releases gets it reviewed by required stakeholders and keeps updating these documents as and when the changes are required;</li><li>Design, develop and execute automation scripts using open source tools;</li><li>Work with development team, product owners to ensure requirements are complete and testable;</li><li>Ensure test environment is set up and working prior to QC cycle;</li><li>Provide estimates of testing effort during the sprint planning meeting;</li><li>Develop test plans for web services using tools like SOAP UI, JMeter;</li><li>Develop and execute regression and functional tests;</li><li>Defect Bug tracking;</li><li>Create SQL queries to perform back-end testing;</li><li>Contribute to company strategy for ensuring quality across systems;</li><li>Actively participate in daily SCRUM.</li> </ul>  Qualifications<br/><br/><strong>Apply if you have the following skillset:</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum of two years of experience in a similar role;</li><li><em>Good knowledge of Financial models an asset;</em></li><li>Experience with Salesforce or any other CRM;</li><li>Background in Computer Science/Quality Systems Engineering;</li><li>Detail oriented with strong troubleshooting skills;</li><li>SQA Testing and Methodologies;</li><li>Deep knowledge of Software Quality Assurance and Quality Control processes and practices;</li><li>Working experience with any of the following automation tools (SOAP UI, JMeter);</li><li>Hands-on experience testing web services;</li><li>Hands-on experience in all testing methodologies (mobile, system, functional, black vs. white box);</li><li>Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process;</li><li>Strong hands on scripting experience;</li><li>Strong understanding of the Software Development/Testing Life Cycle (SDLC/STLC);</li><li>JIRA and Confluence experience is an asset;</li><li>Knowledge of database concepts and client server technology;</li><li>Ability to work in a fast paced and rapidly changing environment;</li><li>Previous experience working in a Software Development environment;</li><li>Good written and verbal communication skills.</li> </ul>  <strong>Additional Information<br/><br/><strong>Why work for Thinking Capital:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>• Great Team:</strong>  <br/> Surround yourself with high-performing, energetic and passionate group of people dedicated to the Thinking Capital Mission; <br/> <strong>• FinTech Revolution:</strong>  <br/> Be part of a team that is revolutionizing the financial system and redefining how Canadian small businesses access capital; <br/> <strong>• Our Stack:</strong> <br/> Our backend is a sophisticated service oriented architecture developed mostly in Java with a Spring framework. On the frontend side, our application is developed on an AngularJS framework. We use Git in coordination with the best DevOps practices for Continuous Integration and Deployment to our AWS cloud infrastructure; <br/> <strong>• Fast-Paced Environment:</strong>  <br/> Take on complex projects in a start-up like collaborative environment; <br/> <strong>• Amazing Culture:</strong>  <br/> Amazing work spaces, advanced technology tools, subsidized lunches, Foosball table, super fun work events (Amazing Race, Murder mystery wine and cheeses, Wacky Olympics, Casino nights and legendary holiday parties and more). <br/> <strong>• Thinking Capital Academy:</strong>  <br/> Get the opportunity to grow and advance in the company through continuous professional training; <br/> <strong>• Diverse Team:</strong>  <br/> Join an at-will equal opportunity team that prides itself on its diversity and harmony.
Title: Analyst - Software Quality Assurance

Job_Description: About AdParlor <br/> AdParlor’s advertising solutions and strategies use deep expertise and unique data-driven approaches to get the best performance from social and video advertising for over half of the Fortune 1000. We work with some of the largest brands and agencies in the world to drive business results from the most valuable digital platforms in the world. <br/><br/> Our Software Engineering team uses a wide range of languages and cutting-edge technologies to build advanced and complex feature sets accessed by media buyers and planners throughout the world. Striving for excellence is in our DNA and you will have the opportunity to work alongside a team of engineers, quality assurance analysts, designers, and product managers that has the reputation of delivering solutions that meet and exceed customer expectations. <br/><br/> Why work with us?  <ul> <li>Working in the social and video advertising space means working with the latest trends and features for the networks that are relevant to people’s lives today - our team is at the forefront, focused on unifying major social networks into a single platform.</li>  <li>Innovation on our platform is key - you will work alongside talented engineers that have a passion for solving problems in big data, performance, and machine learning.</li>  <li>Our projects are far ranging and leverage modern technology for the challenge at hand - we use Java, Ruby, JavaScript (Backbone, React/Redux), Ansible, and other emergent technologies.</li> </ul> What will you do?  <ul> <li>Participate in implementation of new platform features as part of small rotating teams of developers.</li>  <li>Work closely with product managers, QA, and designers to ensure features are technically feasible and ultimately implemented to spec.</li>  <li>Participate in platform firefighter duties to ensure priority issues are fixed quickly and efficiently.</li>  <li>Document and present technical implementation plans for new features.</li>  <li>Learn new technologies as necessary to support existing features.</li>  <li>Participate in product roundtables and architecture discussions to help ideate and shape the future features and functionality we will add to the platform.</li>  </ul> What are we looking for?  <ul> <li>3+ years of backend software engineering experience with Java and/or Ruby</li>  <li>A background in building efficient, scalable, reusable components and APIs</li>  <li>Demonstrated history of structuring and documenting code in a manner that is easily understood</li>  <li>A love for building custom middleware and microservices with reusability and extensibility in mind</li>  <li>You get excited by the guiding principles and contracts that the best libraries and frameworks offer, not just the high-level features they have available</li>  <li>In-depth knowledge of code quality tools and best practices in testing and architecture in enterprise scale applications</li> </ul> Preferred Candidates  <ul> <li>Have prior experience with digital advertising</li>  <li>Understand the Facebook, Google, and/or Twitter ads ecosystems</li>  <li>Experience working in a production Java environment (Spring or Vert.x), or Ruby</li>  <li>Comprehensive knowledge of JavaScript, JS frameworks</li>  <li>Have experience with frontend MV* architectures</li> </ul>
Title: Software Engineer

Job_Description: Company Profile <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the people of Morgan Stanley are dedicated to providing our clients the finest thinking, products and services to help them achieve even the most challenging goals. <br/><br/> As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. We embrace integrity, excellence, team work and giving back. <br/><br/> Technology <br/><br/> The Technology division partners with our business units and leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global and dynamic financial markets. <br/><br/> Our sizeable investment in technology results in leading-edge tools, software, and systems. Our insights, applications, and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients’ businesses—and to our own. <br/><br/> Institutional Securities Technology (IST) develops and oversees the overall technology strategy and bespoke technology solutions to drive and enable the Institutional businesses and enterprise-wide functions. Our clients include Fixed Income, Equities, Commodities, Investment Banking, Research and Global Capital Markets as well as Operations, HR and Corporate Services. <br/><br/> Position Description: <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is looking for a developer in Montreal who will be able to help improve its real time risk analysis systems used by derivatives traders. Our systems are meant to consistently provide large amounts of important data, at high scale, while markets are moving quickly. <br/><br/> You would be part of a development team for a system that is responsible for all of the distributed components and the associated user interfaces for said risk delivery. There are several languages and development frameworks involved so we're interested in talking to strong generalists who have broad technical interests or who would like to explore various technical paths. <br/><br/> We encourage developers to contribute to the whole system rather than just individual components, so over time you'll have more freedom to develop in areas you are interested in. This also means individual developers have more ownership of project work across several components and programming languages. <br/><br/> Desired skills: <br/><br/> - At least 3 years of relevant experience   <ul> <li>Strong Computer Science fundamentals</li> <li>Proficient with at least one object oriented language (e.g. Java, C# or C ) <br/><br/> Nice to have: <br/><br/> - Experience with a scripting language (e.g. Python)</li> <li>Experience with web technology (either servers or frontends)</li> <li>Interest and knowledge of capital markets and finance concepts <br/><br/> Knowledge of French and English are required. <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential. <br/><br/> </li> </ul>
Title: Software developer (various languages welcome!)

Job_Description: <DIV><strong>WHO WE´RE LOOKING FOR?</strong> </DIV> <br/> <DIV>You are a beginner or intermediate developer with a true passion for coding. You genuinely enjoy the journey of learning, yearning for the next technology advancement and the promise that it will bring with it. You are not shying away from challenges, looking at failure as a natural step to reach the great satisfaction of eventually making things work. You also know that the strength of the wolf is the pack you value the team around you and invest in building your professional network.</DIV> <br/> <DIV></DIV> <br/> <strong><DIV>Basic Qualifications:</DIV>  <br/></strong>   <ul> <li>A desire and ability to learn new technologies</li> <li>Innovative and independent thinking</li> <li>Experience with JavaScript especially ES6, for frontend SPA (e.g. React.js, Angular) and Node.js</li> <li>Bonus - experience with HTML and CSS</li> <li>Bonus - experience with JVM languages such as Java, Kotlin, or Scala</li> <li>Bonus - Bachelor Degree or higher (preferably in Computer Science)</LI> </ul>  <DIV><strong>WHAT´S IN IT FOR YOU?</strong> </DIV>   <ul> <li>Competitive benefits, including a fair and balanced parental leave policy.</li> <li>Fantastic opportunities to develop your career across industries, local and global clients</li> <li>Performance Achievement and Career Mentorship our performance management process that focuses on your strengths, progress and career possibilities.</li> <li>Opportunities to get involved in corporate citizenship initiatives, from volunteering to doing charity work.</LI> </ul>  <DIV>To learn more about Accenture, and how you will be challenged and inspired from Day 1, please visit our website at accenture.ca/careers.</DIV> <br/> <DIV>It is currently our objective to assign our people to work near where they live. However, given the nature of our business and our need to serve our clients our employees must be available to travel when needed (up to 20%).</DIV> <br/> <DIV>Accenture does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other basis covered by local law. Accenture is committed to providing employment opportunities to current or former members of the armed forces. <br/><br/> We are committed to employment equity. We encourage all people, including women, visible minorities, persons with disabilities and persons of aboriginal descent to apply.</DIV> <br/> <DIV>Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functionsunderpinned by the worlds largest delivery networkAccenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With approximately 442,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.</DIV>
Title: Accenture Innovation Center - Software Developer

Job_Description: About Us:<br/><br/>Global Relay is the leading provider of cloud-based archiving, supervision, eDiscovery, and analytics for the global financial sector. We deliver services to 23,000 customers in 90 countries, including 22 of the top 25 global banks. Our market-leading archiving service supports email, instant messaging, Bloomberg®, Thomson Reuters, social media, mobile messaging, and more – with mobile, Outlook, and web access. <br/><br/> Our Global Operations & Development Center is located in Vancouver, BC, Canada. In addition, we have offices in six other cities across the world, including major financial centers like New York, Chicago, and London. <br/><br/> Over the years, we have won several major awards, including:  <ul>   <li>Company of the Year from the BC Tech Association (2016)</li> <li>Canada’s 50 Best Small and Medium Employers (2014, 2015)</li> <li>Canada’s Top Employers for Young People (2014)</li> <li>Canada’s Top 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures (2013, 2016)</li> <li>Canada’s Best Managed Companies (2013 - present)</li> </ul> We provide fantastic opportunities to individuals passionate about business and technology. For those with international business aspirations, we offer invaluable opportunities for doing business with some of the world’s largest, most influential firms. Our company is also perfect for those who want to create cool technology using massively scalable, big-data architecture, with a strong focus on mobile. <br/><br/> To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.<br/><br/>The Role:<br/><br/>The Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) is a developer who specializes in writing code to test the product. They are responsible for the overall test coverage, test code, and automation frameworks within their Agile team. <br/><br/> As a Senior SDET, you will drive growth in your team’s automation coverage while mentoring other SDETs in the team on automation and test practices. You will work directly with the code in a Selenium-based framework to automate testing of a front-end web application. You will support the team’s testing efforts while proposing and implementing improvements in the automation coverage and frameworks. <br/><br/> <strong>Role Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Design, develop and maintain automation frameworks, infrastructure and tools</li> <li>Define and automate test cases that verify product requirements</li> <li>Participate in team planning and story grooming</li> <li>Participate in test execution, issue identification and resolution in support of the release</li> <li>Provide suggestions to improve automation and test processes, infrastructure</li> <li>Develop and maintain shared testing libraries</li> <li>Provide training, mentorship and support to other members on the team</li> <li>Conduct code reviews, improve and maintain quality of the automation code</li> <li>Document the automation framework, tools and infrastructure</li> </ul> <strong>Technical Skills Requirements:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Minimum 8 years of experience in software testing</li> <li>Minimum 5 years of experience in test development</li> <li>Strong understanding of Java or C# languages</li> <li>Strong understanding of testing practices in an agile environment</li> <li>Experience with Selenium WebDriver and JMeter</li> <li>Experience with web services technology such as REST, JSON or Thrift</li> <li>Experience with multi-threaded programming</li> <li>Experience with design patterns</li> </ul> <strong>Desirable:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Experience with CSS3, HTML5 or Extend.JS (Sencha)</li> <li>Experience with network protocols such as HTTP, TLS and TCP</li> <li>Experience with continuous integration systems such as Bamboo or Jenkins</li> <li>Experience with continuous delivery concepts</li> <li>Experience with automated testing tools for Mobile applications</li> </ul> <strong>To Apply:</strong> <br/><br/> Think you’re a great fit for this job? Apply today with your cover letter and resume in <strong>one PDF document</strong>. No phone calls please. Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada.
Title: Senior Software Development Engineer in Test (Frontend)

Job_Description: <div>If you're looking for a technical leadership role to allow you to drive the web forward by utilizing the latest web technologies, you've come to the right place! Whether you want to build Progressive Web Apps , work with service & web workers, architectures to manage micro-services on the frontend, or manage memory usage & latency of large scale Javascript applications, this is a role that requires you to think holistically about building the next generation of cross-platform mobile & web apps.</div> <br/> <div>EventMobi is an engineer run company that is focused on building software "the right way" and we wholly believe in the power of the web as the ubiquitous platform to power applications across devices & platforms. Engineers at EventMobi focus on building powerful front-ends that work cross-platform, are offline capable and are just-as if not more powerful than their native counter parts. We use the best tools for the job, whether it's Angular + Cordova, React+Redux, or React Native to develop a platform that generates & deploys thousands of apps annually and we're constantly looking to push the bar with your help.</div><br/> <div>We're looking for passionate developers looking to work on challenging engineering problems in a fast paced environment. You ideally care about good architecture & design, quality, processes and scalability as part of your work. You enjoy leading and coaching individuals on your team and you're looking for a place where you can approach your problems creatively instead of being given a task list to work on. You enjoy collaboration with an incredibly smart & talented team and to bring your expertise to an autonomous role where you can help shape the vision and determine how we will execute on it.</div>Your Work Will Focus On:  <ul> <li><strong>Architecture & Scale</strong> - You will lead the architecture on your team, gathering insights, employing design principles to determine the best tech to address our customers needs.</li><li><strong>Ownership</strong> - You own the products / features you ship. From initial design, to deployment, test automation to performance monitoring, you own what you build end-to-end.</li><li><strong>Development</strong> - Best practices, craftsmanship, well thought out code and mentorship to your team is your ideal and you preach this in your work and with your team.</li><li><strong>Quality</strong> - You will be involved with coaching and mentorship, lunch & learns and will teach and help grow the team around you in not only pushing new features but also keeping the utmost quality in everything we build.</li><li><strong>Research</strong> - You will help guide the tech stack across our multitude of products, how they fit in to our architecture, and their growth & maintenance plans amongst our growing product set.</li> </ul>  What Will You Bring to the Team?  <ul> <li>5+ years experience as a software engineering working on large or fast scaling products</li><li>Experience and passion about Javascript and JS based frameworks (React, Angular, Vue, Ember)</li> <li>Experience with Python or other server side languages is a nice to have</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication abilities</li><li>Ability to mentor and grow team members, provide technical guidance and oversight on technical direction</li> </ul>  What Will You Get From EventMobi?  <ul> <li>We offer an experience of a lifetime working with a dynamic, open-minded and diverse team, who are excited to come to work every day and passionate about what they do and the clients they help.</li><li>Quarterly team events, Mix & Mingles, SkiMobi (Winter), CampMobi (Summer)</li><li>A beautiful new office space in Queens Quay terminal where you will see some of the most incredible sunsets imaginable as your day closes.</li><li>Competitive salary, subsidized health care plans with dental, vision, drug coverage.</li><li>Team building events and trips</li><li>A wellness account providing reimbursement on transit passes, fitness equipment, house cleaning and dry cleaning</li><li>Full kitchen stocked with coffee and snacks to keep you nourished</li><li>Quarterly team events</li><li>EventMobi sports teams - right now dodgeball, soccer and softball are our thing</li><li>Foosball, ping pong, massage chair for your down time</li><li>Discounted Goodlife membership</li><li>A great culture with much more along the way!</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Want to Learn More About EventMobi?</strong></div><div>Also here is an awesome video that shows you what brought a smile to EventMobi's team in 2016: https://youtu.be/jm8j15wpEu4</div><br/> <div>We're focused on building the most robust & well designed event management platform to help planners run better & more successful events. We believe that live events bring people together to enable change, and we can have a huge impact on enabling success for events & and their attendees. We've already changed how 10,000+ events in 70+ countries use technology at their events, and we're looking forward to influencing hundreds of thousands of future events.</div><br/> <div>If you are interested in checking out EventMobi's Platform please click the link attached: https://eventmobi.wistia.com/medias/919mqb87j9</div><br/> <div>EventMobi welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities and from minorities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</div>
Title: Senior Software Engineer

Job_Description: **What You'll be Doing **We are looking for a strong Software Engineer with a background in Machine<br/>Learning, who is passionate about leveraging data and algorithms for achieving<br/>a delightful and frictionless user experience when interacting with,<br/>visualizing and analyzing data. Our team advances the state-of-the-art in the<br/>Analytics space and helps deliver on our companys mission to help people see<br/>and understand their data. You will be working on a team of highly skilled and<br/>motivated engineers, building the next generation of delightful user<br/>experiences that leverage the power of machine learning.<br/><br/>You will work on Tableaus next-generation Visual Analytics and Collaboration<br/>suite. As a full stack developer you will be working on a Python and Java<br/>based backend platform with modern web technologies frontend. You will do this<br/>and more in a highly collaborative environment full of talented professionals<br/>who are dedicated to helping people "see and understand their data".<br/><br/>Some of the things youll be doing include...<br/><br/> * Build modern front-end consumer-friendly interfaces and their Java and Python backend services allowing people to answer complex questions about their data.<br/> * Craft novel experiences for interactions with automated Machine Learning services to make a delightful experience when answering questions and telling stories with data.<br/><br/>**Who you are ** <br/><br/> * **Experienced. **Solid development skills with Python and Java. Experience developing in web languages such as JavaScript,TypeScript, CoffeeScript, HTML, and CSS. Fast learner who will help us establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model development, validation and implementation. Recent college grads welcome!<br/> * **Learning is Breathing. **You believe that you and the company are on a rapid growth path, and that your career and your customers demand that you keep adding new skills.<br/> * **Highly Technical. **You love writing things that just work things that are robust, scalable, and that perform well. You have a strong understanding of software architectures relevant to multi-tier client applications.<br/> * **A True Team Player. **You enjoy collaborating, learning from or teaching others so we can all become better developers. You assume good intent in others, and actively do your part to make a positive work environment.<br/> * **Self-Motivated. **You do good work, and lots of it, and not because your boss is watching the drive to deliver is just a part of you.<br/> * **You are a Recruiter! **Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world!<br/><br/>Tableau Software is a company on a mission. We help people see and understand their data. After a highly successful IPO in 2013, Tableau has become a market-defining company in the business intelligence industry. Our culture is casual and high-energy. We are passionate about our product and our mission and we are loyal to each other and our company. We value work/life balance, efficiency, simplicity, freakishly friendly customer service, and making a difference in the world!<br/><br/>Tableau Software is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Title: Software Engineer, Automated Insights

Job_Description: <strong>It’s your experience that counts</strong><br/><br/>Rise is Canada’s complete HR-Payroll-Benefits solution that gives businesses everything they need to build loyal and productive teams — all in one place. <br/><br/> When you step through our doors, you’ll discover a workplace that brings people together to innovate and succeed. We’re a forward thinking group of individuals that believes in building strong relationships, challenging one another, and fostering an open environment of dialogue and creativity. <br/><br/> Headquartered in Vancouver, we serve hundreds of businesses and thousands of employees across Canada and have big plans to grow. We care deeply about our employee experiences and support each individual with our own HR + Benefits solution that we all trust. <br/><br/> At Rise, it goes without saying that we have a lot of fun, and we’d really love you to join us. We aim to provide you with the most positive, challenging, and transformative experience of your career.<br/><br/><strong>This could be you</strong><br/><br/>Managing people is core to every business. That’s why Rise is on a mission to dominate the people-management software market with powerful software that is a cut above the rest. Rise provides an experience that is unique in our market by focusing on modern, intuitive software and an outstanding client experience. <br/><br/> We are seeking a full stack software developer with at least three years of experience to work on the RESTful API services that power our front-end applications. The developer should be strongly familiar with Angular and Rails or a similar framework. <br/><br/> As an engineering organization, we always choose to get things done right over getting them done fast. We strongly believe that research and experimentation is fundamental to producing high-quality software and are not afraid to challenge conventional wisdom. We are looking for people who share these values and are strongly consistent with their own.<br/><br/><strong>Here’s what you’ll be doing</strong><br/><br/><strong>#1) <strong>Build a Winning Platform</strong></strong> <br/><br/> You’ll work directly with the Senior Backend Software Developer and the development team to execute on the product plan for the Rise platform. Using your extensive knowledge of software architecture, you’ll build product enhancements to the platform, improve the architecture, and develop, debug and design software applications and databases. <br/><br/> <strong>#2) <strong>Collaborate with the Development Team</strong></strong> <br/><br/> You’ll collaborate with the development team in the design, development, test, deployment and operation of the Rise platform. As a full stack software developer, you’ll deliver fast and predictable results, adjusting in an agile fashion to provide what our customers need. <br/><br/> <strong>#3) <strong>Ensure Operational Excellence</strong></strong> <br/><br/> You have a proven track record of operational success with a high attention to detail. You’ll ensure sanity of architecture, operational excellence, and quality while delivering results on time.<br/><br/><strong>Your qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Minimum 3 years of experience building software</li><li>Deep full-stack knowledge of client, server, tools, and internet technologies</li><li>Intermediate to advanced level experience with JS/HTML/CSS and RoR/PHP</li><li>Strong working knowledge of frontend frameworks and libraries (Angular, Bootstrap, Foundation, WebPack, Grunt)</li><li>Experience in agile methodologies with scrum</li><li>Bachelors in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience</li><li>Exceptional verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills</li><li>Deeply collaborative and enjoy working in a cross-departmental fashion</li><li>Driven and entrepreneurial, yet open and approachable</li><li>Willing to roll up sleeves and do whatever needs to be done to make this a great place to work</li><li>Technical knowledge and mobile app development expertise is a bonus</li> </ul>
Title: Full Stack Software Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Job Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> We’ve been named a Glassdoor Employee Choice winner, a San Francisco Business Times/Silicon Valley Business Journal Top 25 best place to work and one of the SBI 10 Best Companies to Sell for in 2016. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>We need a talented developer to join our frontend development team in Markham.</li><li>You will participate in the development of Genesys Workforce Management product, which is deployed in the Cloud and on-premise with JavaScript front end and Java, C++ backend.</li> <li>You Will work with other team members to investigate design approaches, prototype new technology, and evaluate feasibility.</li><li>You will participate in full development cycle including code review, unit testing - we are very serious about the code and product quality.</li><li>You will be doing test automation as needed.</li><li>You will assist with issue resolution in the existing and newly developed parts of the product.</li><li>You will demonstrate creativity, foresight, and good engineering judgment in anticipating and solving various engineering problems</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong> <ul> <li>A background and 4 years or more in Computer Science / Engineering.</li><li>4 or more years’ experience working with JavaScript.</li><li>Advanced understanding of modern web development (e.g. HTML5, CSS3, LESS, etc.)</li><li>Experience with modern JavaScript Frameworks (React, Vue, Flux, Angular, Backbone, jQuery, etc.)</li><li>Ability to manually craft HTML and CSS.</li><li>Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and communication skills.</li><li>Highly organized and self-motivated.</li><li>Strong team player who enjoys collaborating with multicultural teams.</li><li>Passion to win.</li> </ul> About Us: <br/><br/> Genesys® powers more than 25 billion of the world’s best customer experiences each year. We put the customer at the center of everything we do and passionately believe that great customer engagement drives great business outcomes. More than 10,000 companies in more than 100 countries trust the industry’s #1 customer experience platform to orchestrate omnichannel customer journeys that eliminate silos and build lasting relationships. With a strong track record of innovation and a never-ending desire to be first, Genesys is the only company recognized by top industry analysts as a leader in both cloud and on-premise customer engagement solutions. Connect with Genesys via www.genesys.com, Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, LinkedIn, and the Genesys blog. <br/><br/> <strong>Genesys is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics. #LI-BJ1</strong>
Title: Sr. Software Developer, Front End

Job_Description: Embrace and Lead<br/><br/>You have spent countless hours over the years learning to solve hard problems in mathematics, data structures, statistics with a variety of software languages. Your passion for problem solving led you to a career in computer science and engineering. As a self-taught hobbyist you have gathered experience in your field and you are anxious to follow your passion as a profession. At ZetaTango we encourage everyone to trust themselves, stop holding back and use your acquired knowledge to influence your future. <br/><br/> Everyone in the team is an integral contributor to our products, working with our customers to collaborate and design the best solutions. Our open work culture provides the opportunity for you to contribute to all aspects of our business: customer engagement, product ownership, software, QA, devops and 24/7 cloud service deployment. <br/><br/> As a key member of our development team your passion to learn will help us design, develop and deploy our integrated cloud services that help small businesses succeed:  <ul>  <li>Participate in the full product lifecycle</li>    <li>Develop secure code for APIs, frontend, backend, web, mobile, partner integration</li>    <li>Learn and adapt new technologies to real problems</li>    <li>Application of machine learning and analytics to online financial services</li>    </ul> <br/><br/>What You Bring   <ul>  <li>Passion for solving hard problems</li>    <li>Algorithms, data structures, statistics, computational mathematics</li>    <li>Ruby on Rails or other web application frameworks</li>    <li>Relational databases such as PostgresQL, MySQL</li>    <li>Proficiency with Linux command-line</li>    <li>Working autonomously and being highly resourceful</li>    <li>BSC, MSC or PHD in computer science or engineering</li>    </ul> <br/><br/>Other Valued Skills & Knowledge   <ul>  <li>Git or other version control systems</li>    <li>Security & Cryptography</li>    <li>Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence</li>    </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>What You Can Expect From Us</strong> <br/><br/> At ZetaTango we hire for fit. Fit with our values of openness, agility and respect. Fit with the knowledge and skills needed to excel both individually and as part of a larger team so that we can continue to serve our customers. Fit with an insatiable need to improve, learn and discover. What you’ll get in return is the opportunity to work with others who are top in the industry and who possess an incredible amount of knowledge and enthusiasm for building a world class company. <br/><br/> If you are looking for a challenging career and the opportunity to be part of a successful and high growth company, ZetaTango is the ideal place for you. <br/><br/> <em><strong>We want our candidates and our employees to be set up for success. During every part of the recruiting process you will have the opportunity to get in touch with our People & Culture team with any questions, concerns or requests for accommodations.</strong></em>

Title: Intermediate Software Development Engineer in Test (Frontend)

Job_Description: At Invoice Simple, we're building incredible software for 1 person businesses. If you're running your own small business, invoicing and accounting is the last thing on your mind, you want to spend your time running and growing your business. Invoice Simple's mission is to make that possible, by making invoicing and accounting effortless, and keeping you organized and on top of things, by default. <br/><br/> We've experienced incredible success in mobile, and now we're expanding to the web. That’s where you come in! If you can build incredible web experiences then we need to talk. <br/><br/> <strong>If you’re interested, here is what year one is all about:</strong> <br/><br/> ● Launch the initial version of our web app, using React, and blaze a path forwards <br/><br/> ● Work with Product Management to evolve our apps from something that gets the job done to something businesses can't do without <br/><br/> ● Achieve incredible reliability by establishing automated testing practices <br/><br/> ● Delight users by leveraging analytics, working with customer support to developing empathy and a deep understanding of small businesses <br/><br/> <strong>The role</strong> <br/><br/> ● Own and execute features at all layers - UI, client-server communication, database, test automation and SDK. <br/><br/> ● Contribute to all phases of product development - roadmap, requirements, design, release, QA & customer support. <br/><br/> ● Release frequently <br/><br/> ● Data driven. Use metrics and analytics to understand users and identify opportunities. <br/><br/> ● Customer satisfaction. Respond to customer support requests, understand users’ needs, build a product people love. <br/><br/> ● Not just code. Take on any task that comes your way so we can hit our goals. <br/><br/> <strong>Our current tech stack includes:</strong> <br/><br/> ● NodeJS, React, native mobile apps (Objective-C, Java) <br/><br/> ● Postgres, Mongo, and Google BigQuery <br/><br/> ● Heroku and AWS <br/><br/> ● Github, BuddyBuild <br/><br/> ● Intercom, Stripe, Mailgun, and Mixpanel <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong> Requirements for Success</strong> <br/><br/> ● 3+ experience building complex front-end applications in Javascript, HTML, CSS, ideally with React <br/><br/> ● Great product sense and be able to think through user experience issues before diving into the code <br/><br/> ● Ability to write maintainable, testable, and performant JavaScript <br/><br/> ● A love for implementing great UI <br/><br/> ● Enjoyment for debugging all aspects of the front-end app including memory leaks and quirky CSS across browsers <br/><br/> ● Significant experience with REST APIs and thoroughly understand HTTP requests <br/><br/> ● Willing to challenge your own ideas and preconceptions with experiments and data <br/><br/> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>About Invoice Simple</strong> <br/><br/> More and more people are starting their own businesses, self employment is on the rise. Invoice Simple’s mission is to make it effortless for people manage their business from their phone or laptop. We’ve started with invoicing, because getting paid is key. Our service is used by thousands of small businesses around the world, with over $1B invoiced in the last year. <br/><br/> Launched just over two years ago, our mobile app has been downloaded over 1 million times, and is the highest rated (or tied for highest rated) invoicing app, with an average rating of 4.8/5 on iTunes (over 2,000 reviews), and 4.7/5 on Google Play (over 14,000 reviews). We're growing quickly, and looking to expand to the web next! <br/><br/> <strong>What we offer</strong> <br/><br/> If you act like an owner, you’ll be treated (and compensated) like an owner. <br/><br/> ● Competitive salary and benefits <br/><br/> ● Stock options <br/><br/> ● Work with a small team who are building something great <br/><br/> ● Few meetings, but lots of discussions! <br/><br/> ● Office perks, bike rack, great location in Gastown <br/><br/> ● Quarterly company workcations (Whistler, Tofino, …)

Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: Zymeworks is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company dedicated to the discovery, development and commercialization of next-generation bispecific and multifunctional biotherapeutics. Zymeworks’ suite of complementary therapeutic platforms and its fully-integrated drug development engine provide the flexibility and compatibility to precisely engineer and develop highly-differentiated product candidates. <br/><br/> We are looking for a web application developer with expertise in data visualization, user interface design, and browser based tools to join our software team. This is an ideal opportunity for an individual who enjoys working with diverse teams of scientists and software developers to contribute towards our research platform. This position will report to the Group Lead of the Software Development Team and will be based in Vancouver, Canada. <br/><br/> <strong>We expect you to have…</strong>  <ul> <li>Proven experience with interactive web application development</li>  <li>A good grasp of web standards and browser technology</li>  <li>A working knowledge of HTTP, REST and the nuances of API design</li>  <li>Experience with our software stack or equivalent technologies</li>  <li>Proficiency in English, spoken and written</li>  </ul> <strong>It would be great if you had…</strong>  <ul> <li>Two years or more industry experience in web development</li>  <li>Proven ability to assume ownership of a medium-to-large scale web application including design, implementation and maintenance</li>  <li>A track record of mentorship and knowledge sharing</li>  <li>Expertise or interest in backend web technologies such as Python or Go</li> </ul> <strong>Duties</strong>  <ul> <li>Create browser-based visualizations, user interfaces for web applications and data analysis tools tailored to our scientists' R&D needs</li>  <li>Collaborate with scientists and developers to condense complex requirements, design prototypes and deploy production grade software for internal users.</li>  <li>Participate in peer code reviews, regression testing and systematic deployments.</li>  <li>Experiment with new technologies and ideas to enhance the maintainability, simplicity and robustness of our platform.</li> </ul> <strong>Our Platform</strong> <br/><br/> Our software platform includes the following technologies:  <ul> <li>Elm and JavaScript, including D3, AngularJS for webapp frontends and visualizations</li>  <li>Python for scientific applications and modelling software</li>  <li>Go for server development</li>  <li>Elixir for server development</li>  <li>PostgreSQL</li> </ul> <strong>Why Work for Us?</strong> <br/><br/> Zymeworks’ employees are passionate, engaged and extremely motivated to succeed. We are excited by cutting-edge science and technology, the endless possibilities this union holds and the sheer opportunity to be a part of something big. To learn more about Zymeworks Inc. and our current openings, please visit our website at www.zymeworks.com. <br/><br/> We offer challenging career opportunities, competitive benefits and an environment that recognizes and rewards performance.

fixes</li><li>Continuously engage with other development teams to identify and resolve cross-team dependencies/issues, always looking for ways to improve</li><li>Interface with other technology teams designs by having a voice and communicating your thoughts clearly, ensuring adoption</li><li>Remain up-to-date in emerging trends in software development, advocating for their adoption where and when appropriate</li><li>Evaluate new, cutting-edge technologies and methodologies through further education and proof of concepts</li><li>Ensure appropriate coverage of automated tests, including unit tests, integration tests, and UI tests, is introduced for all new code</li><li>Lead by example, continuously evolving yourself and those around you to meet the needs of the business through successful implementation and deployment of software</li><li>Act as a mentor for existing developers, coaching and encouraging them regularly and actively participating in new employee onboarding</li><li>Clearly articulate ideas both verbally and written, with a positive attitude</li><li>Listen to others, encouraging and accepting input from all team members</li><li>Appreciate and acknowledge individual and team contributions</li><li>Set and showcase high standards</li> </ul>  <strong><div>QUALIFICATIONS:</div> <br/> </strong> <br/> <div><strong>All applicants must possess the following:</strong></div><ul><li>B.S, M.S or Ph.D. in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Science, or an equivalent field</li><li>6+ years of professional development experience</li><li>Experience in Agile/DevOps methodologies</li><li>Solid experience developing with C#/VB.NET/ASP.NET/HTML/JavaScript and Relational Databases (Microsoft SQL Server)</li> <li>Experience developing secure and scalable Windows and Web applications</li><li>Experience developing scalable Web APIs (REST) and Windows Services</li><li>Experience consuming 3rd party APIs and manipulate XML or JSON response as needed</li><li>Experience developing with MVC, WCF, Entity Framework and LINQ</li><li>Good understanding of design patterns and data modelling</li><li>Strong SQL development skills</li><li>Knowledge of at least one of the frontend frameworks like Knockout, Angular, jQuery etc.</li><li>Good understanding of Client/Server and multi-tier application architecture and development</li><li>Experience in the data migration/synchronization in the multi-database environments</li><li>Good coding standards and willingness to learn and apply best coding practices</li><li>Passionate about learning and implementing new technologies</li> </ul>  <div>Fleet Complete will provide support in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, including accommodation that takes into account an applicant's accessibility needs. Title: Backend / Web Developer Java

Job_Description: <strong>Software Engineer, Developer Experience - EA Digital Platform (EADP)</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>We are EA</strong> <br/><br/> Electronic Arts is more than youve ever realized. Were more than a company, or a headline, or even a clever catchphrase were a vibrant community of over 8,000 artists, storytellers, technologists and innovators working toward a shared vision: to inspire and unite through play. <br/><br/> While headquartered in Redwood City, EA's platform engineering, game development, and publishing operations take place in a network of locations, stretching from Shanghai to Stockholm, Melbourne to Vancouver. No matter which of our studio locations you join, youll feel the energy and support of EAs global brand, while immersing yourself in a culture that inspires you to thrive, take risks and dream big. Our unique studios create amazingly creative and fun games - fast paced puzzles, adrenaline filled warfare, galaxy spanning adventures, high speed racing, and sports so realistic you can practically feel the grass under your feet. <br/><br/> This is an especially great time for the video game industry, as were currently going through an exciting digital transformation. The effects of this on EAs business have been profound. In fiscal year 2014, 45% ($1.8 billion) of our non-GAAP net revenues came from digital offerings. The global gaming audience has also never been bigger, with industry revenue projected to reach $86 billion in 2016. <br/><br/> Since its founding in 1982, EA has helped shape the way over 300 million registered players consume and enjoy interactive media. No other company can deliver EAs portfolio of amazing games and services, across multiple platforms, to players around the world. It is an exciting era in games, and an exciting time to join the team at EA! <br/><br/> <strong>The Challenge Ahead:</strong> <br/><br/> EAs Digital Platform (EADP) organization is responsible for driving critical technology decisions and investments for EA on a global basis, across all divisions and studio teams. Technology and engineering leadership at EA is critical to making the industrys best games and services and the EADP team is leading the way to providing cross-platform infrastructure that will keep our consumers connected with our games anytime, anywhere with anyone.. <br/><br/> <strong>What a Software Engineer, Developer Experience does at EA:</strong> <br/><br/> This unique role will be perfect for an individual who is passionate about engineering ease of use and reducing friction in tech integration. The team will focus on building a product that unifies integrator onboarding and support and provides apps to optimize the entire game development and live game management life cycle. The team will also build a framework that enables shared services to provide the right experiences, tools and documentation support to enable better integration. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> The Software Engineer will play a key role in developing tools and services to support the platform in providing a world class developer experience. Typical activities include: <ul> <li>Develop web apps, components, prototypes, or proofs of concept (POCs)</li><li>Participate in all aspects of an iterative, agile software development process, including scoping, detailed design, effort estimation, coding, testing, debugging, maintenance and support</li><li>Define and tune frontend technology stack</li><li>Collaborate with the design and product management team to build applications that delight users.</li><li>Document and present designs for peer technical review and provide feedback on others designs</li><li>Work on the application framework that includes backend common services (e.g. authentication, authorization etc)</li><li>Develop Real-time data collection and analytics on client/server platforms</li><li>Work cross teams to identify key requirements, define key metrics and setup benchmarks for engineering ease of use</li><li>Analyze the complex technical architecture across EAs shared services and platform to understand the underlying drivers of engineering friction and drive fixes</li><li>Partner closely with game studios to understand their key requirements and concerns for integration</li><li>Partner closely with platform teams to understand what common functionality they need in a framework to build the best possible integration experiences</li> </ul> <strong>The next great EA Software Engineer, Developer Experience also needs:</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelors degree in Computer Science</li><li>Expertise in object oriented design/programming</li><li>Knowledgeable in the area of scalable platform architecture, end to end systems design and architecture</li><li>A passion for gaming and a good problem solver and creative thinker</li><li>Experience with web frontend technologies like React, Angular, Javascript, CSS and HTML is a plus</li><li>Familiarity with new web frameworks and tools (e.g. Grunt, Bower, Bootstrap, JSHint) is a plus</li><li>Able to work and problem solve independently, to organize workload and priorities, high-quality execution, technical innovation/adaptation, and initiative</li><li>Understanding of the realities of working with complex distributed client/server systems</li><li>Experience working in Agile/Scrum based development environments</li><li>Understanding of HTTP/HTTPS requests</li><li>Familiarity with Linux based systems</li> </ul> <strong>Whats in it for you? Glad you asked!</strong> <br/><br/> We love to brag about our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, 401k with company match and, of course, free video games. And since we realize it takes world-class people to make world-class games, we offer competitive compensation packages and a culture that thrives off of creativity and individuality. At EA, we live the work hard/play hard credo every day. <br/><br/> <strong>Dont Just Play It Create It!</strong>
Title: Sr. Software Engineer - Developer Experience

Job_Description: We are looking for a strong Staff Software Developer, will have an opportunity to be a technical lead and mentor for the team in developing and designing system design and architecture. You will also help us build a highly scalable and performant Walmart.ca eCommerce platform to match our exponential growth. As a Staff Software Developer, you will be responsible for building technical roadmaps for the team and help in transitioning our platform to micro-app architecture using next-gen technologies. You will also be leading design and architectural discussions for Frontend and API gateway layer, and building prototypes for the team to validate ideas. Additionally, you will work closely with the Product Owners to develop innovative customer experiences and user interfaces  <ul> <li>BA/BS/MA/MS degree in Computer Science or closely related field or equivalent practical experience.</li><li>Strong knowledge of JavaScript, CSS3, HTML5, asynchronous request handling, and AJAX in highly scalable and available applications.</li><li>Experience building responsive UIs which are optimized for mobile devices.</li><li>8-10 years of software development experience working in NodeJS, Scala, Java, Ruby on Rails or Python.</li><li>Experience in any of the JavaScript framework like React, EmberJS or Angular 1.x/2.x.</li><li>Solid understanding of building RESTful APIs.</li><li>Have a strong passion for developing elegant and well-designed frameworks.</li><li>Experience in building and designing scalable FE systems is a big plus.</li> </ul>
Title: Staff Software Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Senior MakeSpace Engineer</strong> <br/><br/> MakeSpace is the technology solution for physical storage. We are taking on the $34B storage industry with a combined product and engineering team of 20 people. By changing the way people think about their belongings and saving them from ever having to visit a storage unit again, we are delivering a modern solution to an archaic industry. <br/><br/> <strong>The Projects:</strong>  <ul> <li>Join a small infrastructure team focused on writing clean, reusable code for multipurpose services like logins, monitoring, or logging.</li> <li>Gain rewarding experience in breaking up a monolith into a Service-Oriented Architecture with an opportunity to use the latest and greatest tools from the start.</li> </ul> <strong>The Gig:</strong>  <ul> <li>You have 5+ years of professional software engineering experience.</li> <li>Youre motivated by a desire for deep involvement in product definition.</li> <li>You write, test, document and deploy clean code in an asynchronous architecture that ensures the integrity of our operations and unique user experience</li> <li>You have built platform applications with Python/Ruby/Java.</li> <li>You maintain a willingness to learn, teach and step outside of your comfort zone.</li> <li>You design and update RESTful APIs and their documentations.</li> <li>You collaborate with our exceptional design & engineering teams for the best UX</li> </ul> <strong>The Stack:</strong>  <ul> <li>Backend: Python, Django/DRF, Celery</li> <li>Infrastructure: EC2, MySQL, RabbitMQ, Redis, Consul</li> <li>Devops Tools: Ansible, Terraform, Jenkins</li> <li>Frontend: ES6, React, Redux</li> </ul> <strong>The Team:</strong>  <ul> <li>Join a group of agile, bright, hard-working, and thoughtful individuals</li> <li>Gain insight from executive leadership (with advice on getting a job with a startup)</li> <li>Work with cutting edge technology</li> <li>Help us drink ~three gallons of coffee each day (collectively)</li> </ul> If you want to join a startup that makes a concrete impact on the physical world every day then please apply. <br/><br/> MakeSpace is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Pearl, VBScript</li><li>Understanding of Relational Databases</li><li>Experience with Microsoft Technologies (.NET, MSSQL, Classic ASP) an asset</li> </ul> The successful candidate of this position development</li><li>Containerized Cluster management systems (Kubernetes, Docker)</li><li>Classic ASP, C#.Net</li><li>Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, MongoDB</li><li>Hadoop, HIVE, NIFI and other cluster based data technologies</li><li>Continuous integration deployment methodologies using GIT & Jenkins</li> </ul> Accountabilities (and to whom): <ul> <li>Accountable to Manager of IT</li> </ul> SCM Title: Junior Software Developer

Job_Description: <div>At <strong>Makespace,</strong> we are changing the way people think about their belongings and saving them from ever having to visit a storage unit again by offering a technology solution for physical storage. Listed among the top 10 most innovative consumer electronics companies in the world in 2015 (Fast Company), we provide a convenient, simple, and full-service storage solution that takes the "self" out of "self-storage."</div><br/> <div>As a <strong>Senior Software Developer</strong>:</div>What Youll Do - Function  <ul> <li>Join a small infrastructure team focused on writing clean, reusable code for multipurpose services like logins, monitoring, or logging.</li><li>Gain rewarding experience in breaking up a monolith into a Service-Oriented Architecture with an opportunity to use the latest and greatest tools from the start.</li> </ul>  What You Bring - Experience  <ul> <li>You have 5+ years of professional software engineering experience.</li><li>Youre motivated by a desire for deep involvement in product definition.</li><li>You write, test, document and deploy clean code in an asynchronous architecture that ensures the integrity of our operations and unique user experience.</li><li>You have built platform applications with Python/Ruby/Java.</li><li>You maintain a willingness to learn, teach and step outside of your comfort zone.</li><li>You design and update RESTful APIs and their documentations.</li><li>You collaborate with our exceptional design & engineering teams for the best UX.</li> </ul>  What You Have - Skill  <ul> <li>Backend: Python, Django/DRF, Celery</li><li>Infrastructure: EC2, MySQL, RabbitMQ, Redis, Consul</li><li>Devops Tools: Ansible, Terraform, Jenkins</li><li>Frontend: ES6, React, Redux</li> </ul>  <div>Makespace is partnering with Terminal to grow and scale in the Canadian market.</div><br/> <div>At Terminal, we identify emerging tech hubs around the globe, and connect the top engineers with the most compelling companies. We provide complete operations and services to give companies all the benefits of a new office without any of the hassle.</div> <br/> <div>We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. Terminal is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, provincial, or local law.</div><br/> <div>We thank all applicants for their interest.</div>

Job_Description: Come be part of a team that will influence the future of the sharing economy. Keycafe (www.keycafe.com) is a Vancouver, Canada based company that has expanded its service to 7 major cities in Canada, the US and EU and integrated with a number of major companies including Airbnb. We are looking for someone with strong technical skills and the desire to build something challenging and new. If you'd like to work with a group of talented engineers who are shipping secure, scalable code, we'd like to meet you. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>2 years experience in building web applications</li></ul>   <ul>  <li>B.Sc. in Computer Science or Software Engineering or equivalent experience</li> </ul> The following are assets: <ul>  <li>Backend Java/Grails experience</li> <li>Android/IOS experience</li> <li>Frontend HTML5/Javascript/CSS3 experience, including:  <ul>  <li>Responsive CSS</li> <li>jQuery/jQuery UI</li> <li>Multi-browser and multi-platform support</li></ul> </li> <li>Familiarity with REST web services</li> <li>Heroku</li> <li>Atlassian tools (JIRA/Confluence/BitBucket)</li> <li>IntelliJ IDEA and/or Eclipse</li> <li>Git</li> <li>Spring and Hibernate</li> <li>Continuous Integration</li> <li>Test Driven Design</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <ul>  <li>Awesome Gastown office!</li> <li>Small team where everybody is an entrepreneur and builder</li> <li>Lots of great benefits and perks you won't find at other companies</li> <li>The chance to grow your role with a rising company</li> </ul>
Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Who we are</strong> <br/><br/> Creating a planet fueled by reliable, clean energy isnt what keeps us up at night; its what gets us out of bed. At Opus One Solutions, we pursue solutions that will change how countries access and distribute electrical energy. From microgrids that keep things running in the event of an outage to how Tesla's latest batteries can help accelerate the integration of renewable energy. From how electric utilities can optimize their operations and reduce their carbon footprint to how every homeowner will feed energy into a power grid fueling the electrical sharing economy. <br/><br/> At Opus One Solutions, we believe some of the best talent in the tech industry share our passion for delivering technology that matters and that will make a difference, in our lifetime and beyond. We want to work with people who love the complexities of software; who believe in its power to transform the world to a better place. <br/><br/> Good people know that great ideas are everywhere and what matters most is practical execution. Turning vision into reality is the hard part. But, when its creating technical solutions that support access to renewable energy, its an engineering feat worth contributing to. <br/><br/> <strong>Our tech stack</strong> <br/><br/> Our tech stack is deep because we interact with real things in the real world where the outcome matters. Our systems collect, analyze and interact with other systems in real-time. Internally, the tools we use include Python3, C+11, Javascript/React/Leaflet, PostgreSQL, Redmine, GitLab, Jenkins, and Docker, all hosted on AWS. <br/><br/> <strong>The opportunity</strong> <br/><br/> Opus One Solutions is looking for a Python Developer who wants to be a key player on our GridOS team. The GridOS team at Opus One builds our flagship product, GridOS. Its a cross-functional team with expertise in frontend, backend and power system analysis. Our new Python Developer will be an active contributor to our products cutting edge Python backend. <br/><br/> <strong>Who are you?</strong> <br/><br/> You are a strong Python developer and you enjoy working autonomously to solve complex problems. You have developed database-backed web services. Youre familiar with software security and deployment workflows. You have experience with software that gets deployed on the cloud and maybe even on-premises within a customers datacenter. <br/><br/> This is an exciting opportunity for someone who wants to think creatively and be innovative. Someone ready to step out of their comfort zone. Someone eager to build a robust, resilient and high-availability product. This is a chance to be on the forefront of new technology. <br/><br/> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Challenges.</strong> The electrical power grid is a lifeline to millions of people. Quite literally, this is a system that cannot go down when it comes to hospitals, traffic controls and more. Your challenge is to build a product that reaches that level of quality and reliability. <br/><br/> <strong>Personal and professional satisfaction.</strong> You want to do meaningful work. You dont just want to build and analyze things. You want to directly contribute to technology solutions that matter. <br/><br/> <strong>Knowledge.</strong> This is a great team, passionate about technology. You will have an opportunity to broaden your technical knowledge using new back and front end technologies: JavaScript, C++, React and Docker to name a few. <br/><br/> <strong>What will our new Python Developer work on? You will:</strong>  <ul> <li>Design and implement high quality, robust, and reusable software using multiple languages and technologies conforming to industry best practices.</li> <li>Evaluate emerging technologies and open source libraries to provide recommendations.</li> <li>Support testing processes, troubleshoot and resolve issues.</li> <li>Participate in architectural design sessions and product discussions.</li> <li>Work closely with other developers with a diverse skill set and technology expertise to provide scalable solutions.</li> <li>Work in an Agile/SCRUM team setting including cross-functional structures and varying levels of management.</li> </ul> <strong>Heres what you bring:</strong>  <ul> <li>The education. You have a degree in Computer Science or equivalent.</li> <li>The experience. You have 2+ years developing Python webapps. Youre familiar with version control systems and Python testing frameworks.</li> <li>The technical expertise. You have expertise in Python. Your programming skills are strong and you can quickly learn new technologies.</li> <li>The passion. You are equally passionate about clean tech as you are about quality coding.</li> <li>The vision. You can focus on the big picture and the details. Robust, reliable and scalable is your motto.</li> <li>The communication. You have exceptional written and oral communication skills. You are a strong presenter.</li> <li>The energy. You thrive in a high volume, fast paced environment.</li> <li>The innovation. You have the ability to anticipate problems and provide creative, quick - and reliable - solutions.</li> </ul> <strong>Why join Opus One Solutions?</strong> <br/><br/> Opus One is growing! After spending the last four years under the radar focused on research and pilot projects were ready to shine as one of Canadas top 10 game-changers named by CIX Cleantech! We are deploying exciting microgrid projects in North America and have partnerships with leading energy players such as Tesla and Advanced Microgrid Solutions. <br/><br/> Collectively, we are fanatical about the work we do. Our leadership has assembled carefully selected teams with some of the best strategic visionaries - and executors - in technology and the clean energy space. From the newest team member to the company founders, we are all driven by one common goal: to accelerate the integration of clean and sustainable energy in North America and the world. <br/><br/> As a team and a company, we are committed to working with like-minded people, with opinions and thoughts of their own that will contribute to our innovation and evolution. We equally want to work with people who like to get outside and spend time together on team outings, special events, to grab lunch or take part in off-site brainstorming retreats. Theres a lot of humility at Opus One Solutions. No one person is going to know it all its too complicated. We must work and innovate together to get the job done. <br/><br/> At Opus One Solutions we understand that not everyone develops their talent and hones their skills in a traditional way. Different paths and experiences are part of the diversity we know we need to succeed. If you feel you meet all or most of the qualifications we are seeking; and you are excited by the possibility of growing our company, take a chance and express your interest here. <br/><br/> Opus One Solutions welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Title: Python Developer

Job_Description: Software Engineer <br/><br/> 17-May-2018 <br/><br/> <strong>Role/Responsibilities</strong> <br/> <strong>The Role / Responsibilities:</strong> <br/> <strong><u>Accountabilities</u></strong>  <ul> <li>Design and develop technical solutions in the areas of e-learning, m-learning, content management, learner data tracking, Web Services, etc.</li> <li>Provide technical expertise in backend design, development and maintenance.</li><li>Take innovative approach to fulfilling the vision of learning technology.</li>  </ul>  The Software Engineer will report to Senior Software Engineer and will be accountable for designing, coding, implementing and supporting applications for CSI’s on-line and back office systems. Employment is contingent upon compliance with the Policy, including remediation of positions in those holdings as necessary. <br/><br/> <strong>Entity</strong> <br/> Moody's Analytics (MA) <br/><br/> <strong>Posting Title</strong> <br/> Software Engineer - Application Developer <br/><br/> <strong>EEO Policy</strong> <br/> Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law. Moody’s is committed to maintaining an inclusive, diverse and accessible workplace.
