Information provided during the accommodation process will be treated as confidential, and will be shared only to the extent required to properly administer accommodation requests. <br/><br/> <strong>City</strong> <br/> Toronto <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <br/> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>University degree and/or college diploma in a related discipline.</li><li>5+ years’ related work experience in Web application design and development.</li> <li>Hands on experience and knowledge in designing and developing applications using:  <ul> <li>Experience with e-learning, m-learning, SCORM/AICC/TinCan.</li><li>Experience with LMS (Blackboard, Net Dimension).</li><li>Object Oriented analysis and design using common design patterns.</li><li>Java EE platforms, Spring Framework, Struts and MVC.</li><li>XML, XSLT and JSON.</li><li>Frontend technologies, like HTML, JavaScript, JSP, Bootstrap, JQuery, and AJAX.</li><li>SVN, Git, ANT, Maven</li><li>Good knowledge of Relational Databases (Oracle/MS SQL Server).</li><li>Thorough knowledge of SQL and ORM technologies (Hibernate).</li><li>Working experience with SQL, Stored Procedure programming and database schemas.</li></ul></li> </ul>  <strong><u>Required Abilities</u></strong>  <ul> <li>Professional, friendly and courteous in all interactions with team members and business users.</li> <li>Ability to remain calm even under pressure and to perform well in a busy environment.</li> <li>An overall business approach that is both customer and results-oriented.</li> </ul>  <ul> <li>Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills.</li><li>Strong analytical, communication and consultative skills.</li><li>Strong team player; demonstrated ability to foster positive constructive working relationships.</li><li>Ability to manage competing priorities and meet deadlines in time sensitive situations.</li><li>Strong work ethic; detail-oriented, creative and resourceful.</li> </ul>  <strong>Regular/Temporary</strong> <br/> Regular <br/><br/> <strong>Working at Moody's</strong> <br/> Moody's is an essential component of the global capital markets, providing credit ratings, research, tools and analysis that contribute to transparent and integrated financial markets. Moody's Corporation (NYSE: MCO) is the parent company of Moody's Investors Service, which provides credit ratings and research covering debt instruments and securities, and Moody's Analytics, which offers leading-edge software, advisory services and research for credit and economic analysis and financial risk management. The Corporation, which reported revenue of $4.2 billion in 2017, employs approximately 11,900 people worldwide and maintains a presence in 41 countries. Further information is available at www.moodys.com. <br/><br/> <strong>Department/Team</strong> <br/> <strong>The Department / Team:</strong> <br/> Moody’s Analytics, a division of Moody’s Corporation (NYSE: MCO), is the world’s leading provider of credit analysis and related tools, including quantitative credit risk models, credit analysis software, portfolio management analytics, economic research, financial data, pricing and valuation services, and specialized consulting services. Moody’s Analytics also distributes investor-oriented research and data developed by Moody’s Investors Service as part of its rating process, including in-depth research on major debt issuers, industry studies, and commentary on topical events.The Moody’s Analytics Financial Services Training and Certification business in Canada operates as the Canadian Securities Institute, the leading provider in Canada of financial learning, credentials and certification. <br/><br/> <strong>Graduate Position</strong> <br/> Experienced Hire <br/><br/> <strong>Job Category</strong> <br/> Engineering & Technology <br/><br/> <strong>Job Sub Category</strong> <br/> Software Engineering <br/>
Title: Software Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>JO: 2057</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Role: QA / Developer</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> <strong>Toronto, Ontario</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Contract Term: 1 year</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Duration of Potential Extension:</strong> <strong>1 year</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Description of Assignment</strong> <br/><br/> Our valued client requires a Software Test Automation Developer specialist to join the project team to implement automated testing strategy and solution for various digital transformation initiatives. <br/><br/> Software test automation has long been considered critical for application development In an Agile environment, the ability to quickly react to ever-changing business needs is critical. With test automation, regression testing can be performed continuously while test cases are generated in each Sprint and added to existing automation. <br/><br/> The Specialist will be part of a group of developers who love technical innovation and are strong at solving real business problems. This is an award-winning group that has an excellent record of delivering high-quality IT solutions, and close teamwork with its clients and partners. It is known for its collaborative and Agile team culture, and for continuously leading innovation and transformation. <br/><br/> The Specialist will be instrumental in implementing the test automation strategy. The person will work on a variety of software products and services, and will have the opportunity to work with the latest technologies like Selenium, Cucumber, Protractor, Jasmine, front end development with TypeScript and Angular, as well as various CI/CD tools. In particular, the Specialist will  <ul> <li>Define test automation procedure and build related infrastructure and tooling</li> <li>Develop effective, reusable and maintainable automated testing framework</li> <li>Build innovative solutions to ease developer and QA testing experience</li> <li>Employ new DevOps tools to simplify build process to further improve Continuous Delivery</li> </ul> Key credentials of the Specialist include:  <ul> <li>Experience with test automation strategy, methodology, test tools, BDD, and test data management</li> <li>Experience in Java software development and/or JavaScript or TypeScript frontend development</li> <li>Thorough understanding and experience in Agile software development</li> </ul> The estimated duration of the required services is for a period of twelve (12) months, with a possible extension of an additional twelve (12) months, working 35-40 hours per week depending on project needs. <br/><br/> The Software Test Automation Developer will be responsible for carrying out the duties described below. <br/><br/> <strong>Assignment Duties</strong> <br/><br/> The Specialist will be responsible for the following:  <ul> <li>Work with Development Lead or Product Delivery Manager to analyze the existing software development practice and identify opportunities of excellent in software quality assurance</li> <li>Develop software automated testing strategy to better satisfy Agile business needs</li> <li>Develop effective, reusable and maintainable automated testing framework and test cases to achieve maximum code coverage</li> <li>Identify software tools and processes to implement the automated testing strategy and framework</li> <li>Define the criteria to optimize manual vs automation test needs</li> <li>Collaborate and communicate effectively with project stakeholders such as solutions architect, project delivery managers, business SMEs, or BAs, application developers, QA testers, and database specialists</li> <li>Integrate tests into the Jenkins build process for continuous integration and efficiency gains</li> <li>Maintain test data needed by the automated test suite</li> <li>Document acceptance test scenarios for User Stories and implement related automated testing logic</li> <li>Document business rules using Cucumber / Gherkin style</li> <li>Contribute to the ongoing team development by sharing knowledge, information and lessons learned on a regular basis</li> <li>Contribute to the team’ Agile maturity by prompting Agile software development best practices and pitfall avoidance</li> <li>Document technical requirements to comply with corporate I&T directions and industry best practices</li> <li>Advise and provide expert knowledge on the technical feasibility of the proposed deliverables</li> <li>Participate in business requirements / User Story review and analysis, and UX prototype review</li> <li>Participate in technical design documentation and peer code reviews</li> <li>Provide technical support during the various phases of testing, preparation for production implementation, and post-implementation support</li> <li>Communicate effectively and efficiently in an Agile environment</li> <li>Coach and mentor team members</li> <li>Perform other duties as required by the project</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> It is important that the Services be undertaken by the Specialist who can demonstrate specific knowledge of, and experience in, performing similar work for projects of comparable nature, size and scope as detailed below. <br/><br/> Qualifications and Experience:  <ul> <li>Minimum 3 years of professional experience with software automated testing in an Agile environment</li> <li>Minimum 5 years of experience in Java web application development</li> <li>Thorough understanding and experience in Agile software development</li> <li>Experienced in Behavior-Driven Development (BDD), Cucumber, and Gherkin rule authoring</li> <li>Experienced in automated UI and RESTful API testing</li> <li>Experienced in test data management</li> <li>Good understanding of QA methodology, including test plans, test cycles, and software release</li> <li>Experienced in CI/CD, Jenkins, and collaboration tools such as JIRA</li> <li>Effective communication and collaboration skills for interaction with peers and customers</li> <li>BS in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline or equivalent experience</li> </ul> Technical Capabilities:  <ul> <li>BDD, Cucumber, Gherkin</li> <li>Selenium, Protractor, Jasmine</li> <li>HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, JavaScript, TypeScript, Angular</li> <li>Java, RESTful, JAX-RS, JPA, SQL</li> </ul> <strong>Deliverables</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop divisional level software automated testing strategy</li> <li>Develop automated testing framework to achieve maximum code coverage</li> <li>Identify software tools and processes to implement the automated testing strategy and framework</li> <li>Define criteria to optimize manual vs automation test needs</li> <li>Integrate tests into the Jenkins build process</li> <li>Prepare Acceptance Test Scenarios based on User Stories</li> <li>Write the automated testing logic</li> <li>Document business rules using Cucumber / Gherkin style based on User Stories and Acceptance Criteria</li> <li>Maintain test data needed by the automated test suite</li> <li>Support various phases of testing, prepare for production implementation</li> <li>Contribute to the team’ Agile maturity by prompting Agile software development best practices and pitfall avoidance</li> <li>Coach and mentor application developers and other QA personnel</li> </ul> Job URL: https://01millennium.com/jobs/qa-developer/ <br/><br/> Note: “Our client is an equal opportunity employer and we invite all potential candidates to apply”
Title: QA / Developer

Job_Description: Embrace and Lead<br/><br/>You have spent countless hours over the years learning the academic and practical skills to be great at what you do. Working professionally and as a hobbyist you have gathered experience in the security field so you know what to do and what not to do. At ZetaTango we encourage everyone to trust themselves, stop holding back and use their acquired knowledge. <br/><br/> Everyone in the team is an integral contributor to our products, working with our customers to collaborate and design the best solutions. Our open work culture provides the opportunity for you to contribute to all aspects of our business: customer engagement, product ownership, software, security, QA, devops and 24/7 cloud service deployment. <br/><br/> As a key member of our security team you will lead through collaboration to design, develop and deploy advanced security solutions to keep our integrated cloud services trusted, safe and secure. As a financial technology company we deploy cutting edge security solutions to deter highly sophisticated attackers from theft and fraud. <br/><br/> As a Security Developer you will be expected to:  <ul>  <li>Drive ZetaTango’s security platform forward as a security developer</li>    <li>Design complete security and cryptographic solutions</li>    <li>Develop secure code to protect our APIs, frontend, backend, web, mobile and partner integration platforms</li>    <li>Fully automate large scale solutions to detect advanced threats to our online financial services</li>    <li>Develop and deploy security policies, standards, guidelines, tools and frameworks</li>    <li>Perform threat modelling to prioritize the design and development of appropriate mitigations</li>    </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>What Experience You Bring:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Computer, network and communications security</li>    <li>Security analysis of web applications</li>    <li>Secure software development using web application frameworks</li>    <li>Relational databases such as PostgresQL, MySQL</li>    <li>Proficiency with Linux/UNIX command-line</li>    <li>Working autonomously and being highly resourceful</li>    <li>Experience with agile, test driven design methodology</li>    <li>BSC, MSC or PHD in computer science or engineering</li>    </ul> <br/><br/>Other Valued Skills & Knowledge:   <ul>  <li>Ruby on Rails</li>    <li>Node.js, JavaScript and front-end development frameworks</li>    <li>Git or other version control systems</li>    <li>Building a RESTful API</li>    <li>Heroku, Kubernetes, Docker for production deployment</li>    <li>Accounting, payment, billing or other finance solutions</li>    </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>What You Can Expect From Us</strong> <br/><br/> At ZetaTango we hire for fit. Fit with our values of openness, agility and respect. Fit with the knowledge and skills needed to excel both individually and as part of a larger team so that we can continue to serve our customers. Fit with an insatiable need to improve, learn and discover. What you’ll get in return is the opportunity to work with others who are top in the industry and who possess an incredible amount of knowledge and enthusiasm for building a world class company. <br/><br/> If you are looking for a challenging career and the opportunity to be part of a successful and high growth company, ZetaTango is the ideal place for you. We want our candidates and our employees to be set up for success. During every part of the recruiting process you will have the opportunity to get in touch with our People & Culture team with any questions, concerns or requests for accommodations.
Title: Security Developer

Job_Description: As a Lead Full Stack Developer at STAT, you will be the on the Web Application team. We are a profitable and high growth Data Analytics company. We collect about 100 GB of data every data and have about 50 TB of historical data. <br/><br/> The STAT Application is a data visualization tool for SEO experts built on Ruby on Rails, MySQL and Ext.JS. It is powered by a search engine data collection and aggregation system that uses Ruby, Resque, DynamoDB and MongoDB to collect and store data, and Spark EMR, Scala and Ruby to aggregate data. <br/><br/> This role will be a combination of hands-on coding, and team management. You will be mentoring developers on technical implementation, best practices, code reviews, performance analysis, and testing. Jointly, you will be designing and implementing new projects, new components, and maintaining existing components. One of the main projects you will be focusing on will be an upgrade of our Web-app UI using a more modern JS framework. Therefore, the job will require you to have experience with Rails, JavaScript framework(s) preferably ReactJS or Vue.js, HTML, CSS, and various databases. Additionally, prior experience on a re-design project will be a bonus. <br/><br/> From the process side, you will be working closely with Product Managers to plan sprints, prioritize tasks, and solve technical implementation challenges to ensure that the team meets projects deadlines. <br/><br/> Working in a small company like STAT will require flexibility and an interest in, and a willingness to work on, all aspects of the product. <br/><br/> <strong>Duties and Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Design and write new features for our web application by using Ruby on Rails, Ruby, databases such as MySQL, MongoDB etc., JavaScript frameworks such as ReactJS, Vue.js, D3.js etc., job queues such as Resque/Sidekiq, and occasionally HTML and CSS.</li> <li>Participate in the evaluation and implementation of new technologies via design sprints, technological spikes etc. while making sure that project timelines are met</li> <li>Maintain and refactor the existing web application, and various reporting, client data import and API services.</li> <li>Implement new data visualizations and UI for our web application using Ruby on Rails, D3.js and JS Frontend frameworks such as ReactJS or Vue.js</li> <li>Assist with project design, technical specification, and estimation for projects</li> <li>Complete internal technical documentation of our software, development environments, production environments and procedures.</li> <li>Work with their respective project team and Product Managers on story points/task estimation to ensure that sprints are productive and project goals are being met</li> <li>Follow and teach development best practices such coding styles and patterns, performance testing, unit testing etc. through discussions and code reviews</li> <li>Eliminate development blockers using pragmatic approaches that achieves business outcomes while keeping technical debt in check</li> <li>Implement and maintain large-scale data reporting systems, import processes and API services</li> <li>Conduct and speak at meetings both internally and externally on new tools and technologies that are relevant to the STAT and our products</li> <li>Assist with the monitoring and maintenance of our production servers and software systems. This may require occasional work responsibilities on weekends and outside normal office hours. We schedule this work ahead of time and endeavor to give as much notice as possible.</li> <li>Participate in higher-level meetings and discussion for software design, software development, resolving customer issues and code review.</li> <li>Discuss and participate in the ongoing refinement of our software development process.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>5+ years of web application development using a modern framework such as Rails, Django, Play framework etc.</li> <li>3+ years of JavaScript development in ReactJS, Vue.js or another similar framework</li> <li>4+ years of RDBMS experience in MySQL, PostgreSQL, MS SQL etc.</li> <li>At least 1 year of experience in acting as a technical leading on a team</li> <li>Experienced in Agile methodologies such as sprint planning, story pointing, code reviews etc.</li> <li>Experienced in unit, functional and performance testing</li> <li>Knowledge of continuous deployment processes and practices such as Chef, Capistrano, Travis CI etc.</li> </ul>

Good. Love an innovative work environment? Even better. <br/><br/> Apply today. <br/><br/> <strong><strong>Employment Type:</strong></strong><br/><br/>Full time<br/><br/><strong><strong>Type of Role:</strong></strong><br/><br/>Regular<br/><br/>Loblaw Digital recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. From venues, to organizers, to street teams, to event attendees, we are focused on bringing people together through the magic of live events. These pillars support the Showpass culture which is built on a love for events, and all things food. That’s what makes us the fastest growing Canadian ticketing company. <br/><br/> <strong>THE ROLE:</strong> Full Stack Developer (full-time permanent role) <br/><br/> T<strong>HE LOCATION:</strong> Calgary, Alberta <br/><br/> <strong>THE PERKS:</strong>   <ul>   <li>A unique and fun place to work – flexible hours and vacation policy, in-house chef, fully stocked snack and fresh pressed juice bar, gym membership, dog-friendly office and parking</li> <li>Competitive compensation and benefits package</li>  </ul>  <strong>THE RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>   <ul>   <li>Work with developers and designers to make exciting new features and elegant pages</li> <li>Learn new technologies, frameworks and concepts in a short period of time</li> <li>Assist production deployment and provide post-production support and troubleshooting</li> <li>Participate in routine standups, code reviews and testing parties</li> <li>Write clean code in a testable, reliable and sustainable way</li> </ul>  <strong>THE QUALIFICATIONS:</strong>   <ul>   <li>Post secondary education in engineering or computer science would be an asset</li> <li>Minimum 1 year experience working in a technology or software company</li> <li>Must have experience working with the following technologies: Python, Django or similar (Flask, Rails, Node.js, Go), Git, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Docker, Kubernetes, Fabric, Chef or other infrastructure automation tools, AngularJS or similar frontend frameworks (Backbone, Ember, Polymer)</li> <li>Strong testing and debugging skills</li> <li>Must work great in a team and also as an individual contributor</li> <li>Ability to champion new ideas and develop creative approaches</li> <li>Analytical thinker with the ability to problem solve in a fast-paced work environment</li> <li>Must have the hustle and drive to take initiative and make things happen!</li> </ul>  <strong>NOTE: We will only contact qualified candidates of interest.</strong>

Job_Description: Description<br/><br/>Kronos is currently recruiting a UI Developer to join its engineering center of excellence in Montreal using a highly mature SCRUM based SDLC.   <ul> <li>Implement JavaScript, CSS3 and HTML5.</li> <li>Identify and build a set of reusable, configurable UI components.</li> <li>Adhere to and promote standards and web development best practices.</li> <li>Ensure high performance of frontend experiences.</li> <li>Work with UX team to assess technical feasibility and identify risks.</li> <li>Work closely with scrum master and other team members to prioritize deliverables and adapt to change.<br/><br/>Qualifications<br/><br/>• Excellent understanding of current web technologies, expert JavaScript knowledge, expert knowledge in HTML5 and cross browser compatibility.</li> <li>Experience with different Javascript frameworks such as AngularJS and JQuery.</li> <li>Knowledge of UI development patterns such as MVC and MVVM.</li> <li>Enjoy working in a collaborative, fast-paced agile environment.</li> <li>Experience with TDD and Jasmine.</li> <li>Experience working in high complex and large single page applications<br/><br/>Corporate overview <br/><br/> <strong>You’re empowered when you’re a Kronite</strong> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Want to be part of an elite group of highly skilled professionals?</em></strong> We think our employees are a special group of talented, energetic, and innovative people. And for that reason, we refer to ourselves as Kronites. Kronites care about more than just work. We recognize the need to maintain a healthy work-life balance — to live inspired. In fact, it’s expected! Whether you’re playing foosball in one of our game rooms, working up a healthy sweat in group fitness classes, or videoconferencing with Kronites thousands of miles away, you’ll soon learn that we take work and fun seriously. No matter what position you hold at Kronos, you’re a Kronite. And we want you to feel like you have the power to make a difference in your life and the lives of others, at work and beyond. <br/><br/> Kronos is the global leader in workforce management solutions that enable organizations to control labor costs, minimize compliance risk, and improve workforce productivity. Tens of thousands of organizations in 100 countries – including more than half the Fortune 1000® - use Kronos time and attendance, scheduling, absence management, HR and payroll, hiring, and labor analytics applications. Kronos customers include enterprises large and small across diverse industries worldwide including retail, hospitality, healthcare, manufacturing, public sector, services, and distribution. <br/><br/> Kronos is a privately held company and was founded in 1977. Headquartered in Chelmsford, Massachusetts, Kronos employs more than 5,000 people worldwide. <br/><br/> Kronos is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <br/><br/> EEO Statement<br/><br/>Kronos is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.</li> </ul>

Job_Description: We are looking for a strong Principal Software Developer, who will have an opportunity to lead, develop and design highly scalable and performant architectures across multiple teams and set the technical direction for the entire walmart.ca FE teams. You will be responsible for driving and building prototypes for complex and large initiatives while providing guidance and insight into deep technical and performance issues. As a Principal Software Developer, you will also lead the transition of our platform to micro-app architecture and help us in evaluating best technical choices for this transition and evangelize those technical choices to other teams. You will also work closely with Product Owners, UI/UX, and other senior engineering team members to define the future architecture and system design to support new business needs.  <ul> <li>BA/BS/MA/MS degree in Computer Science or closely related field or equivalent practical experience.</li><li>12+ years of software development experience working in NodeJS, Scala, Java, Ruby on Rails or Python.</li><li>Strong knowledge of JavaScript, JavaScript Frameworks (React, Ember or Angular), CSS3, HTML5, asynchronous request handling, and AJAX in highly scalable and available applications.</li><li>Strong understanding of all the different components (Frontend, Backend, Storage, Caching layer etc) of the web application and their interactions.</li><li>Expert in building responsive UIs which are optimized for mobile devices.</li><li>Experience with persistence and caching technologies (eg. MySql, Postgres, Memcache, Redis)</li><li>Experience working with micro-services architecture and distributed systems.</li><li>Solid understanding of building RESTful APIs.</li><li>Ability to clearly and effectively communicate at all levels from development to executive levels.</li><li>A history of open-source contribution is an asset.</li> </ul>
Title: Principal Software Developer

Job_Description: Company Description<div> <strong>Join the INgrooves team!</strong> <br/><br/> At INgrooves Music Group, we are committed to powering creativity in today’s dynamic music marketplace by providing the best distribution, marketing, and rights management tools and services to content creators and owners. <br/><br/> We develop cost-effective and scalable technology platforms. Our partners benefit from our experienced, knowledgeable people, unparalleled commitment to customer service, and thoughtful marketing solutions that drive results. We aspire to be the most transparent and solution-driven partner for all of the labels and artists we work with. Our team is solutions-oriented, predisposed to delivering fun and results! </div>  <br/>Job Description<div><strong>The Role</strong> <br/><br/> You are passionate about User Interface and how it relates to the user's experience with a product. As a developer, you deliver simple, clean code that is tested and testable. You are intimately familiar with established UI/UX best practices. You carefully evaluate and communicate the merits and costs of design choices, not only on how it impacts the user but also how it impacts implementation and architecture. You are comfortable working in multiple programming languages. You are always looking for better ways to design and develop user interfaces. <br/><br/> As a member of the software development team, you will be designing, prototyping, and delivering scalable solutions in an agile environment. You will be responsible for contributing to individual products, the core software platform and for meeting the commitments that your team agrees on. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Work as part of a team to deliver quality software from inception to production</li><li>Create and refine user interface mockups and wireframes with prototypes</li> <li>Write, test, document, and review code in multiple programming languages and frameworks</li><li>Investigate, troubleshoot and solve issues discovered throughout the software release cycle from development to production</li> </ul>  </div>Qualifications<div> <strong>Core Skills and Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>Positive attitude, reliable, self-motivated, team player with excellent communication skills. Seriously, this is important – lone-wolf types need not apply!</li><li>Knowledge of software development lifecycle, TDD, and Agile development practices. Experience with source control (git or svn) is required, and having worked with Continuous Integration environments as part of your workflow is a plus.</li><li>A strong and demonstrable portfolio of user interface or UI component concepts. Knowledge of best practices for composing user interfaces, and creativity to find solutions for unique presentation problems</li><li>3 or more years of experience with javascript frameworks such as React.js, react-native, Bootstrap, Angular, etc. TypeScript experience is great too, as is broader experience with JS ecosystem staples like Node.js, Express, Socket.io, JSON-RPC, Babel, SASS, Swagger, etc.</li><li>Experience developing against REST API’s, as well as with common database connectors such as Postgres or SQL Server</li> </ul>  <strong>Supporting Skills and Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience programming with cloud infrastructure providers such as AWS or Google Cloud.</li> <li>Python and Go are great to have, and experience in .Net frontends (ASP.Net MVC in particular) is a bonus. Experience working with Docker is a bonus.</li><li>Experience in IOS and Android UI development a plus.</li> <li>Comfortable working in both Linux and Windows environments</li> </ul>  </div>Additional Information<div> <strong>Success at INgrooves</strong> <br/><br/> <u>Business Acumen</u> <br/><br/> The successful candidate aligns with the INgrooves culture by being solution-oriented, collaborative, leveraging best practices, and possessing a passion for both technology and music. <br/>  <br/> <strong>What this means:</strong> You care about success and moving your team forward. <br/><br/> <u>Interpersonal/Communication Skills</u> <br/><br/> The successful candidate will be open minded, with a natural curiosity of their internal and external customers, delivery oriented with an understanding of the product development process. Builds and fosters strong relationships and effective partnerships with cross-functional teams. <br/>  <br/> <strong>What this means:</strong>  You care about your teammates and clients. <br/><br/> <u>Executing for Results</u> <br/><br/> The successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to generate and translate strategic plans into actions with timely execution and accountability. <br/>  <br/> <strong>What this means:</strong> You have a strong work ethic. <br/><br/> <u>Leadership/Collaboration</u> <br/><br/> Establishes and maintains positive working relationships, operates with integrity, influences and supports others, and remains open to ideas. <br/>  <br/> <strong>What this means:</strong> Your teammates care about you. <br/><br/> <u>Problem Solving</u> <br/><br/> The successful candidate will be tenacious and self-motivated and have a demonstrable record of resolving issues and providing effective solutions. Demonstrates an eagerness and ability to learn quickly and leverages a flexible mindset in response to shifting dynamics, adversity and/or change. <br/>  <br/> <strong>What this means:</strong> You're efficient and intelligent. <br/><br/> <u><strong>Why work with us?</strong></u> <br/><br/> We are passionate about developing dynamic solutions in a relaxed and engaged environment. Our people matter! And we have a fun, relaxed working environment (with great views, among other perks)!</div>  <br/>Videos To Watch  <ul> </ul>  I'm interested
Title: Front End Developer

Job_Description: <div> <div> Job Description<br/><br/>Are you looking for a new and challenging career with a growing and fast-paced company? Then we have the perfect fit for you! <br/><br/> Wurth Canada is a division of the Wurth Group, the largest fastener company in the world with companies in 80 countries and employing over 74,000 people worldwide. In Canada, we have 445 sales representatives servicing various customers coast to coast.Our goal at Wurth Canada - To be the leader in our industry by setting standards, which always exceed the expectations of our customers and employees. Our Vision - Becoming the number 1 in the eyes of our customers as the best and most qualified sales team. We love selling. We inspire our customers. <br/><br/> At Wurth Canada we continue to expand and grow. $200 million in sales, 1,000 employees by the year 2020! These figures are not just a dream but are in fact an objective that we are driven to obtain! MOVE2020 is the name of this strategy and it is well underway at Wurth Canada! <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> About the role</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for a Mid-to-Senior level full-stack developer to join and play an important role on our digital team. In November 2017, Wurth Canada launched its first ever e-shop. We have aggressive goals for this new sales channel, and are now growing this new team. In this unique role, you will be doing a combination of back-end and supportive frontend development. <br/><br/> This in-house Web Developer will continue to develop our very own exclusive e-commerce platform at Wurth Canada. <br/><br/> <strong>You will be responsible for:</strong> <ul>  <li>Utilizing the .Net web stack including C#, ASP.Net, JavaScript to develop and implement functionality and enhancements to shop.wurth.ca</li> <li>Researching, recommending, and planning for upgrades and new implementations in web technology;</li> <li>Developing / enhancing the backend technical components of our e-commerce applications;</li> <li>You will work with the digital team to design and create functionality for the best user shopping experience.</li> <li>Strong knowledge and hands on experience in analysis, design and development of web services and web applications under the .NET framework.</li> <li>Working with designers on creating functionality considering UX and conversion.</li> <li>Working with the Front End Developer to take designs (in HTML format) and develop with functionality</li> <li>Providing web expertise and actively participating with fellow Web Developers, Designers.</li> <li>Developing responsive web pages for multiple platforms, mobile devices and browsers</li></ul></div> </div><br/>  <div> <div> Job Requirements<br/><br/><strong>Our ideal candidate:</strong> <ul>  <li>Post-secondary degree BSC in Computer Science or relevant education in software development</li></ul>  <ul>  <li>At Least 3 Years of experience and knowledge of: C# / .Net Development ASP.Net web development experience Windows Server Javascript / Jquery CSS MySQL Server Databases MVC Framework Systems architecture and application</li> <li>Experience in working development collaboration software (Team Foundation Server, SourceSafe)</li> <li>Understanding of current web standards, cross platform compatibility</li> <li>Visual Studio</li> <li>Javascript (jQuery, Angular)</li> <li>Version Control</li> <li>Browser Compatibility Testing</li> <li>Bilingualism in French and English is an asset</li> <li>Creative and technical with the ability to prioritize</li> <li>Intermediate working experience in front-end development languages and tools, including: HTML 5 & CSS3</li> </ul>  <strong> <br/> What We Can Offer You</strong>  <ul>  <li>Competitive compensation plan plus bonus</li> <li>A comprehensive benefits package</li>  <li>Contribution to a Pension Plan</li> <li>Opportunities for ongoing training and professional development</li>  <li>A commitment to openness, diversity and work-life balance.</li> </ul> <strong> <br/> If you are the person we are looking for please send your resume to</strong> <strong>hr-internal@wurth.ca</strong><strong> with reference EWD</strong>**No agencies please** <br/><br/> Wurth Canada is an equal employer and we are committed to fostering an inclusive and barrier-free environment to all employees and candidates. Please contact a member of the HR team if accommodation is required during any point of the recruitment process. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.</div> </div>  <br/>
Title: Web Developer - E

Job_Description: Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!<br/><br/>Role:<br/><br/>The Engineering team at Splunk in Vancouver is responsible for developing the data collection solution for the flagship Splunk Enterprise platform! So what? Getting a vast variety of massive data in and ready for analysis is never easy. If you want to make a lasting impact on our Development team, this is the internship for you. Over the course of 4 to 8 months, you will receive hands-on experience, be exposed to different facets of the business, learn new technologies, and have fun while doing so. You will also contribute directly to the production codebase by doing development work in new features and writing automation scripts to test the product. If this gets you excited in your bones, apply today.<br/><br/>Responsibilities:<br/><br/>Splunk is looking for highly motivated college students to join our team this summer. As an intern (Splunktern), you will work on real projects that go to market. You will also have an opportunity to enjoy our dynamic, startup-like environment. You will get invaluable work experience at a leader in “Big Data”, the hottest software market now, and you will have the opportunity to focus on full-stack, backend or front-end technologies.<br/><br/>Requirements:  <ul> <li>You are a college student with at least 2 years of university-level Computer Science education</li><li>You have experience building web applications: in a class, as a personal hobby, as a job, as part of an open source project</li><li>You enjoy working well with others in a fast-paced environment</li><li>You enjoy working within an agile environment</li> </ul>  <strong>Good to have:</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience working in a commercial or open source software development team</li><li>Experience working with any of the following frontend JavaScript technologies: jQuery, Backbone, React/Redux, etc.</li><li>Experience with Python, Java or Go</li><li>Experience using docker, kubernates, or public cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, GCP, Azure)</li><li>Experience working with Big Data technology such as Hadoop, Spark</li><li>Experience writing Python or JavaScript based automated tests</li><li>Experience with Splunk products is a plus!</li> </ul>  <strong>What We Offer You:</strong>  <ul> <li>The opportunity to work with a set of extraordinarily talented and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering and QA to product management and customer support. Splunk flourishes with disruption and diversity.</li><li>A constant stream of new things for you to learn and an opportunity for growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe mentors help both sides of the equation.</li><li>A stable, collaborative and supportive work environment.</li> </ul> We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. <br/><br/> For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Title: FULL STACK APP DEVELOPER

Job_Description: We are looking for a strong Senior Full-Stack Software Developer, who will help us build a highly scalable and performant Walmart.ca eCommerce platform to match our exponential growth. You will have an opportunity to design and develop new innovative features on our current platform and help in transitioning our platform to micro-app architecture using next-gen technologies. You will be responsible to actively participate in the design and architectural discussions for Frontend and API gateway layer. You will also work closely with the Product Owners to develop innovative customer experiences and user interfaces  <ul> <li>BS/MS degree in Computer Science or closely related field or equivalent practical experience.</li><li>6-8 years of software development experience working in Scala, Java or Python.</li><li>Strong knowledge working with Big data technologies like Spark ETLs, Hadoop, Hive and Kafka.</li><li>Experience in building and designing scalable Data pipeline.</li><li>Familiarity with containerization with Docker</li><li>Building CI/CD pipeline for deploying spark jobs.</li><li>Have a strong passion for developing elegant and well-designed frameworks.</li><li>A history of open-source contribution is an asset.</li> </ul>
Title: Senior Software Developer (Backend)

Job_Description: Busbud is the bus travel booking app and website with the largest sellable coverage. Users can search, compare and buy tickets from hundreds of bus companies in over 16,000 cities and more than 1M different bus routes. <br/><br/> We're working hard to make the bus, one of the most environmentally friendly and sustainable modes of transportation, a great travel option for customers in dozens of languages in over 60 different countries. Our platform unites travelers, partners and bus companies throughout the world to move an increasingly large share of the entire industry online to increase access and improve the travel experience. <br/><br/> Our people, technology and approach have been instrumental in getting us this far, but we have so much more to do, and that's where you come in. <br/><br/> <strong>What do we expect from you?</strong> <br/><br/> Busbud is looking for a <strong>senior Developer</strong> with a diversified experience to join our team of talented developers. Our challenges evolve, and as a generalist, you'll have the greatest impact on the team and our customers. <br/><br/> Your initial focus will be to build fast, rich Javascript applications and style beautiful pages to bring the right users to Busbud and have them successfully purchase their bus travel. You'll balance iteration and A/B testing with risk-taking and greenfielding. You'll routinely work with modern tools like React, Node and SASS on the frontend, and Node, Redis and Postgres on the backend. You'll share your wisdom with a team that values learning and experimenting. <br/><br/> Depending on the task, you may own the feature end to end, or work with other team members to bring it to life together. We expect you to feel at home on the frontend in user experience land as much as on the backend modeling data and everywhere in between. <br/><br/> As a full stack developer, and depending on your interests, you'll also have the opportunity to work on preventing fraud, improving how we communicate with customers, how we interface with supplier systems, upgrading our global architecture, monitoring, and much more. We've got lots of challenges from which to choose! <br/><br/> <strong>How can you impress us?</strong> <br/><br/> You might recognize a few of these from Camille Fournier's RTR post, which we've used to build our own career path ladder. <br/><br/> As a Senior developer, you  <ul> <li>Have shaped broad architecture, having shipped multiple large services, complex libraries or major pieces of infrastructure (5+ years)</li> <li>Are sought out for technical guidance</li> <li>Are recognized as a prolific contributor to core and side projects</li> <li>Love what you do, and sweat the details</li> <li>You're comfortable with (or can quickly ramp up) with some key ingredients in our tech stack: Javascript, NodeJS, React, Redis, Postgres, CDNs and caches, REST APIs and Heroku</li> </ul> At Busbud, you will  <ul> <li>Be an owner and expert on large sections of our codebase, initially the website and related services</li> <li>Anticipate technical issues at the product level and make architectural and design decisions to avoid them</li> <li>Exemplify software development excellence balancing scope and deadlines to deliver on quality and speed with appropriate test coverage, monitoring and rollout plans</li> <li>Multiply the effectiveness of peers by facilitating cross-team work</li> <li>Make our pages and site fast, beautiful, accessible and great for our users</li> <li>Delight Google and other search engines with your thoughtful use of sitemaps, interlinking, annotated content and other tactics to help travelers find buses.</li> </ul> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong>  <ul> <li>Compensation based on experience</li> <li>4 weeks of vacation (3 weeks + holiday season)</li> <li>Health Benefits * Stock options</li> <li>Apple equipment</li> <li>Breakfast snacks, team lunch on Wednesdays, happy hour on Fridays</li> <li>Team events</li> <li>A beautiful office in Montreals burgeoning tech neighbourhood, Mile End</li> </ul> <strong>What's it like working as a Developer at Busbud?</strong>  <ul> <li>You get the tools you need to be successful: laptop, big screen, comfy chair and desk and whatever else you might need to do your best work</li> <li>We invest in outool chain so you can focus on building: we've got instrumentation, monitoring, logging, continuous integration, continuous deployments, crowd testing, managed translations and much more. And since we use Javascript in almost all our projects, it's easy for anyone to jump across projects, provide a code review or contribute.</li> <li>We love our office and having most of the team there for high-bandwidth face-to-face communication, and we also have flexible work schedules and support for remote work in our DNA - Mike, our CTO, had spent most of his time in Busbud's early days working remotely out of New York using chat, Github and other async tools to great success in addition to Google Hangouts for 1-on-1s, and also larger team meetings. Our A/V setup isn't perfect (yet!), but it's gotten pretty good :)</li> <li>Many of us have kids, others hobbies, and sometimes both, so we encourage a sane work/life balance. If you want to work like crazy, we'll take that too - you'll be in good company with the team's night owls</li>   <li>We use science (A/B tests) and customer feedback (interviews, support, live chat) to determine the impact of our work</li> <li>We serve over 10M bus departures daily through our API, website and apps, and we're constantly looking for ways to improve our performance and availability without overwhelming the bus companies that supply us with the data - there are lots of challenges in this area around failure mitigation, latency compensation, cache optimization and much more</li> <li>We help travelers in over 60 countries, so we have all kinds of competitors keeping us on our toes, and we need to find ways of providing value to our users to keep them coming back to Busbud to find and buy what is essentially a commodity product. This is a constant challenge which we meet with creativity and taking risks. As much as we can, we deploy explicit and intentional effort to improve diversity in tech and also help upskill the next generation of developers through internship programs, mentoring and hosting, organizing or sponsoring relevant events.</li> <li>There's a lot more, and if you're still reading, then you should hop over to the blog and our tech blog.</li> </ul> <em>Busbud is committed to equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing its team members with a work environment free from discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Busbud are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, regardless of race, colour, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex, age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, pregnancy, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Learn more about why we care about diversity.</em>
Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: Drop is the first flexible, consumer-led, intelligent mobile rewards platform focusing on the user experience. With over 1 million members, Drop is one of the fastest growing apps and recently hit top 3 in the App Store under Lifestyle. Through the app, members link their debit and credit cards to automatically earn points, eliminating the need to scan receipts, enter promo codes or sign up for additional loyalty programs. Drop lets members earn points and instantly redeem rewards while shopping at all their favourite brands. <br/><br/> Headquartered in the heart of Downtown Toronto, Drop is building the next generation rewards platform. Drop is disrupting the $40+ billion loyalty market with a strong focus on design, user experience, and engineering. We are executing fast, with plans to grow our current team that consists of experienced talent from Airbnb, Amazon, Facebook, Microsoft, and Goldman Sachs. We are looking to grow our top-tier, diverse team that embodies a culture of passion, grit, humility and hustle. <br/><br/> <strong>Software Engineering at Drop:</strong> <br/><br/> Engineering is at the core of Drop’s ability to scale. We strive for automation, intelligence, and simplicity in all of our products and infrastructure. <br/><br/> We are responsible for continuously processing hundreds of millions of financial transactions while delivering a polished and engaging experience for users. Our product challenges span across both the consumer space (B2C) and the retailer space (B2B). <br/><br/> Our approach to development and collaboration welcomes engineers whom are full stack and/or specialize in a particular domain (frontend, backend, data, etc). We operate at all levels of the stack: building mobile-first apps with technologies like React Native to deliver elegant UIs, scaling highly parallelized APIs and banking integrations to get a 360-degree view of user spending habits and share of wallet, developing data infrastructure to deliver insights and enable the business to efficiently drive impact, and more. <br/><br/> As an Engineering team, we value code quality, testability, scalable engineering design, and continuous process improvement. We leverage modern technologies, such as React Native, Ruby/Rails, Postgres, Redshift, Docker, Kubernetes, and more. We maintain an efficient development environment to keep productive and rapidly innovate. Our key collaborators are product managers, designers, and other stakeholders (marketing, business development, customer support) who partner as entrepreneurial peers on a daily basis. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>What kinds of challenges are Full Stack engineers working on at Drop?</strong> <ul>  <li>Design applications that allow partners to visualize the performance of their offers and optimize their campaigns to increase offer completions.</li> <li>Create an SDK and API for partners to easily integrate with the Drop platform and generate points for customers.</li> <li>Automate end-to-end solutions to increase the time to resolution for common issues to increase user adoption and overall user happiness.</li> <li>Integrate with multiple rewards platforms to provide more relevant products and experiences for users to redeem.</li> <li>Build the platform that allows partners to discover their customers and build offers that cater to defined cohorts of users.</li> </ul> <strong><em>The following Full Stack experience is relevant to us:</em></strong> <ul>  <li>You have at least 5 years of experience in software engineering.</li> <li>You are comfortable working in different parts of the stack.</li> <li>You have experience building in a production environment using modern web frameworks, service oriented architectures, and scalable datastores.</li> <li>You write testable and maintainable code to produce quality systems using engineering best practices.</li> <li>You thrive in a fast-paced environment; startup experience is not a strict requirement but a bonus. Drop welcomes people from all work backgrounds and recognizes the value of diversity.</li> <li>You’re passionate about building the next generation loyalty product to make life more rewarding.</li> <li>Bonus: You’ve worked with Ruby, React Native, Redux, Ruby/Rails, Postgres, Redshift, Docker, or Kubernetes.</li> <li>Bonus: You have experience scaling architecture and working on products with millions of users.</li> <li>Bonus: You’ve built financial, loyalty, or rewards systems.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> At Drop, we're committed to providing an enjoyable and meaningful environment for every member of our team. We operate under a flat structure with minimal hierarchy where everyone’s opinion is valued equally. We are looking for team members with an entrepreneurial mindset who will thrive in a fast-paced and rewarding environment. <br/><br/> <strong>Additional perks:</strong> <ul>  <li>Company stock</li> <li>Competitive salaries</li> <li>Flexible vacations</li> <li>Transportation perks</li> <li>Health and dental benefits</li> <li>Team retreats</li> <li>Catered lunches three times a week</li> <li>Unlimited snacks and coffee</li> <li>Company-sponsored happy hours</li> <li>And much more</li> </ul> Drop Technologies, Inc. is proud to be a diverse and equal opportunity employer and as such does not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, national origins, age, sexual orientation, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Selection decisions are solely based on job-related factors.
Title: Software Engineer, Full Stack

Job_Description: Company Profile <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the people of Morgan Stanley are dedicated to providing our clients the finest thinking, products and services to help them achieve even the most challenging goals. <br/><br/> As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. We embrace integrity, excellence, team work and giving back. <br/><br/> Technology <br/><br/> The Technology division partners with our business units and leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global and dynamic financial markets. <br/><br/> Our sizeable investment in technology results in leading-edge tools, software, and systems. Our insights, applications, and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients’ businesses—and to our own. <br/><br/> Institutional Securities Technology (IST) develops and oversees the overall technology strategy and bespoke technology solutions to drive and enable the Institutional businesses and enterprise-wide functions. Our clients include Fixed Income, Equities, Commodities, Investment Banking, Research and Global Capital Markets as well as Operations, HR and Corporate Services. <br/><br/> Position Description: <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is looking for a strong experienced developer in Montreal who will be able to help improve its real time risk analysis systems used by derivatives traders. Our systems are meant to consistently provide large amounts of important data, at high scale, while markets are moving quickly. <br/><br/> You would be part of a development team for a system that is responsible for all of the distributed components and the associated user interfaces for said risk delivery. There are several languages and development frameworks involved (Java, C , C#, Javascript, etc) so we're interested in talking to any who have broad technical interests or who would like to explore various technical paths. We prefer to see people with some interest in finance or analytic concepts regardless of industry experience. <br/><br/> We encourage developers to contribute to the whole system rather than just individual components, so over time you'll have more freedom to develop in areas you are interested in. This also means individual developers have more ownership of project work across several components and programming languages. <br/><br/> Skill required: <br/><br/> - At least 5 years of relevant experience   <ul> <li>Strong Computer Science fundamentals</li> <li>Expert with at least one object oriented language (e.g. Java, C# or C )</li> <li>Proficient with a scripting language (e.g. Python)</li> <li>Organized and comfortable taking on projects with ambiguous requirements</li> <li>Experienced with web server architectures or front end web development</li> <li>Comfortable working in a linux environment <br/><br/> Nice to have: <br/><br/> - An ideal candidate has at least some experience working on both backend or frontend systems, even if expertise is more in one area than the other</li> <li>Interest and knowledge of capital markets and finance concepts</li> <li>Mastery of C is not required or expected but would be very valuable</li> <li>Expertise in Angular or other Javascript frameworks <br/><br/> Knowledge of French and English are required. <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential.<br/><br/></li> </ul>
Title: Senior software developer (various languages welcome!)

Job_Description: Software Developer -Toronto <br/> Fulltime role <br/><br/> The Software Developer III will be a driving force in developing new product offerings as part of a scrum team. The position requires knowledge and experience in application design, development, debugging, and system administration in a variety of technologies. <br/><br/> Software Developer III codes software applications to adhere to designs supporting internal business requirements and external customer needs. Helps standardize the quality assurance procedures for software development. Has knowledge of standard concepts, practices, and procedures within the SDLC. Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. May lead and direct the work of others. A wide degree of creativity and latitude required. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> Minimum requirements: Java 8, API, Rest, Continous Testing, development, and deployment. <br/><br/> Research, design, and develop new software programs using mostly Java. <br/><br/> Maintain and enhance existing software applications (backend and frontend). <br/><br/> Integrate existing software products and new technologies. <br/><br/> Create technical specifications and documentation. <br/><br/> Perform support for internal customers. <br/><br/> Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are a must. <br/><br/> Comfortable working in a team environment. <br/><br/> Excellent attention to detail and ability to solve problems. <br/><br/> Use of Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment technologies <br/><br/> <strong>Position Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> Comfortable working with both Linux and Windows operating systems. <br/><br/> Solid understanding of the software development life cycle. <br/><br/> Java, Python, PHP, SQL, JavaScript, and shell scripting experience <br/><br/> Familiar with SOA, web services and REST architecture. <br/><br/> Automated testing, particularly TDD/BDD. <br/><br/> Unit, Functional, and Integration testing <br/><br/> Continuous Integration experience with Jenkins <br/><br/> Continuous Delivery and deployment automation experience <br/><br/> Agile/Scrum processes and methodologies <br/><br/> Deploy anywhere technologies (Docker, Dropwizard)
Title: Software Developer

We are looking for team members with an entrepreneurial mindset who will thrive in a fast-paced and rewarding environment. <br/><br/> <strong>Benefits:</strong> <ul>  <li>Company stock</li> <li>Competitive salaries</li> <li>Flexible vacations</li> <li>Transportation perks</li> <li>Health and dental benefits</li> <li>Team retreats</li> <li>Catered lunches three times a week</li> <li>Unlimited snacks and coffee</li> <li>Company-sponsored happy hours</li> <li>And much more!</li> </ul> Drop Technologies, Inc. is proud to be a diverse and equal opportunity employer and as such does not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, national origins, age, sexual orientation, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Selection decisions are solely based on job-related factors.

As a senior software developer, they will also take a lead mentorship role within the team and assist in driving projects and supporting managers. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Activities/Tasks</strong>  <ul> <li>Use a variety of programming languages and development tools to build, test, implement, and support the development of web software applications</li>  <li>Drive collaboration and interaction with interdisciplinary teams (interactive designers and software developers) to identify and resolve issues, review and complete projects</li>  <li>Oversee agile software development framework; proactively find and address areas of concern and identify potential roadblocks</li>  <li>Lead in estimating of resource needs and timelines to complete short and long term projects as well as daily operational tasks</li>  <li>Lead in clarifying stakeholder requirements; communicate questions and address concerns; provide relevant and detailed updates and feedback in a timely manner</li>  <li>Mentor other team members and deliver effective code reviews to improve overall quality of the code base across the team</li>  <li>Research and prototype solutions for enterprise architecture; focus on constant learning, keep up to date with emerging technologies and demonstrate potential ways to utilize them to the companys advantage</li>  <li>Drive team focus towards project completion by proactively identifying and mitigating any project risks and roadblocks while providing any solutions when possible.</li>  <li>Design appropriate technical solutions based on requirements provided while taking into account timelines and future re-use ability</li>  <li>Develop and understanding of the business and its processes in order to design appropriate solutions.</li>  <li>Promote the use of development patterns and best practices.</li> </ul> <strong>Education and Experience</strong>  <ul> <li>Minimum 7 years of experience in a professional software development role</li>  <li>Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Application Development, or Information Technology (nice to have but not required)</li>  <li>Any IT related certification is an asset</li> </ul> <strong>Skills</strong>  <ul> <li>Solution Design Ability to define and describe an architecture of a system and understand the cause and effect of their coding</li>  <li>Collaborative communication skills (written and oral) - Ability to convert technical concepts into non-technical</li>  <li>Backend Development Some experience and applicable knowledge in backend development in any language (Ruby, PHP, .NET, etc.), relational databases, writing and optimizing queries (Postgres, My SQL, etc.)</li>  <li>Development from specs - Ability to find requirements and break them down into an actionable execution plan for the team and proactively identify problems.</li>  <li>Frontend Development some experience and applicable knowledge with HTML 5, CSS3 or Java Script</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <em>ITRG is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other legally protected factors. To that end, upon request, ITRG will ensure, to the extent possible, that accommodation be made available to applicants throughout the recruitment and hiring process.</em>
