You will be responsible for designing and implementing complex, cutting-edge, integrated mobile solution. You will be directly involved in defining solution architecture, technologies and tools evaluation, in addition to hands on development. <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>   <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or in a related field</li> <li>Minimum of 4 years of software development experience</li> <li>Minimum of 3 years of Web and Mobile development experience</li> <li>Demonstrated track record of working in a collaborative and time-pressured environment</li> <li>Experience in software development methods, especially in a large scale distributed, secure systems</li> <li>Understanding of mobile enabling components such as security, infrastructure, EMM, MDM, application development platforms, user experience, data governance</li> </ul>  <strong>Desired Skills and Experience:</strong>   <ul> <li>Strong knowledge of the mobile market including</li> <li>Experience, technical knowledge of techniques, standards and state-of-the art capabilities for authentication and authorization</li> <li>Experience with Mobile or Web application development</li> <li>Cross-browser development</li> <li>HTTP, SOAP, AJAX and REST web services</li> <li>Mobile Web (HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, RWD, mobile-first frontend frameworks)</li> <li>Strong user interface design, layout and implementation skills</li> <li>Strong analytical and conceptual design skills; strong problem-solving skills</li> <li>Experience working in a multi-disciplinary team</li> <li>A self-starting problem solver</li> <li>A security mindset</li></ul>
Title: Mobile Developer

Job_Description: Company Description<div><p><b>About the company:</b></p><p><b></b></p><p>Thinking Capital is the leader in the Canadian Alternative Lending space, using technology to be at the forefront of the FinTech industry. Since 2006, they have helped more than 10,000 small-to-medium sized Canadian businesses reach their full potential. By combining their people and technology, We are transforming the way business owners get the capital they need to grow. For more information, visit www.thinkingcapital.ca </p></div>Job Description<div><p><b>Your role: </b></p><p>As an active member of the technology department, you will work within the agile team and be responsible for the growth and development of our systems and software that directly impact the success in the daily functions of the business. As an ideal candidate, you will have a proven track record, have the ability and desire to make a difference in a fast-paced talented team and are capable of demonstrating excellent coding ability within an award winning development team. <br><br></p><p><b>Your tasks:</b></p><ul><li>Proven ability to independently perform development, testing, implementation, documentation and updating as it relates to the SalesForce.com software and system administration; </li><li>Implement new enhancements including creation of custom objects, workflows;</li><li> Develop and maintain visualforce, Apex, AppExchanges apps and integration to other third party solutions; </li><li>Maintain multiple user roles, security, profiles, workflow rules, etc; <br></li><li>Participate in cross-functional teams that address strategic business issues involving CRM and sales operations;</li><li>Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate technical issues and resolve problems at all levels of the organization both internally and externally; </li><li>Identify SFDC usage problems and craft technical / communication plans to IT/business teams;</li><li>Must be comfortable in rapidly changing and sometimes ambiguous work situations. Ability to work independently and engage supervisor as needed.<br></li></ul></div>Qualifications<div><p><b>Apply if you have the following skillset: </b></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree (preferred Computer Science); </li><li>3 - 5 years of experience functioning as a developer; </li><li>Good Experience in Java Technologies;</li><li>JEE, Spring Framework; </li><li>XML and JSON;</li><li>Amazon Cloud (asset);</li><li>UI development in JQUERY, AngularJS (asset) ;</li><li>Web Services SOAP/REST;</li><li>Good understanding of data structures, data modelling, No SQL; </li><li>Good Experience in Design Patterns; </li><li>Experience with UML design and methodology an asset; </li><li>Experience in Agile development methodology/Scrum is preferred;</li><li>Experience with technologies that work with Salesforce.com including: Apex, Visual Force, Workflows, etc (asset);<br></li></ul><p></p></div>Additional Information<div><p><b>Why work for Thinking Capital:</b></p><ul><li><b>Our Mission: </b><br>To own the rails on which small businesses access credit in Canada.</li><li><b>Great Team:</b> <br>Surround yourself with high-performing, energetic and passionate group of people dedicated to the Thinking Capital Mission;<br></li><li><b>FinTech Revolution: </b><br>Be part of a team that is revolutionizing the financial system and redefining how Canadian small businesses access capital;<br></li><li><b>Our Stack:</b><br>Our backend is a sophisticated service oriented architecture developed mostly in Java with a Spring framework. On the frontend side, our application is developed on an AngularJS framework. We use Git in coordination with the best DevOps practices for Continuous Integration and Deployment to our AWS cloud infrastructure.<br></li><li><b>Fast-Paced Environment: </b><br>Take on complex projects in a start-up like collaborative environment;<br></li><li><b>Amazing Culture: </b><br>Amazing work spaces, advanced technology tools, subsidized lunches, Foosball table, super fun work events (Amazing Race, Murder mystery wine and cheeses, Wacky Olympics, Casino nights and legendary holiday parties and more). Take a look at our career page for more information!<br></li><li><b>Thinking Capital Academy: </b><br>Get the opportunity to grow and advance in the company through continuous professional training;<br></li><li><b>Diverse Team: </b><br>Join an “at-will” equal opportunity team that prides itself on its diversity and harmony;</li></ul></div>I'm interested
Title: Java Developer

Job_Description: Company Profile <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the people of Morgan Stanley are dedicated to providing our clients the finest thinking, products and services to help them achieve even the most challenging goals. <br/><br/> As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. We embrace integrity, excellence, team work and giving back. <br/><br/> Technology <br/><br/> The Technology division partners with our business units and leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global and dynamic financial markets. <br/><br/> Our sizeable investment in technology results in leading-edge tools, software, and systems. Our insights, applications, and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients’ businesses—and to our own. <br/><br/> Institutional Securities Technology (IST) develops and oversees the overall technology strategy and bespoke technology solutions to drive and enable the institutional businesses and enterprise-wide functions. Our clients include Fixed Income, Equities, Commodities, Investment Banking, Research and Global Capital Markets. <br/><br/> We are also responsible for Pioneer and Application Infrastructure groups that look to develop foundational strategies, tools and technologies that are leveraged across Technology, as well as standardized data and enterprise-wide services to provide leverage to the Firm's businesses. <br/><br/> Position Description: <br/><br/> The candidate will work for the Client Reference Data team which is responsible for maintaining client data across the firm. The candidate will be involved in the design and development of new system features and components, ranging from designing and implementing software solutions to enrich and move data across systems in the firm. The candidate will also be involved in developing and optimizing existing distributed cache infrastructure. <br/><br/> The role requires someone who is self-motivated, quick-learning and comfortable working across numerous technologies, and who can take ownership of critical problems and work throughout the full project lifecycle from problem analysis to successful timely delivery of the solution. <br/><br/> A strong interest in learning about the business will also contribute to the candidate's success in the team. <br/><br/> Responsibilities: <br/><br/> - Writing, testing and troubleshooting software code according to design specifications;   <ul> <li>Deploying and integrating new software into existing database systems;</li> <li>Writing and maintaining technical documentations, including software design specifications, implementation details and user instructions;</li> <li>Improve efficiency and quality of Development workflows <br/><br/> Skills Required: <br/><br/> - Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or related field</li> <li>5 years of experience in a similar role</li> <li>Analytical and problem solving skills</li> <li>Experience in medium to large scale Java or Scala multi-threaded applications</li> <li>Strong OO design skills</li> <li>Familiarity with GIT/Jenkins</li> <li>Experience with relational database (preferably Sybase, DB2) and SQL</li> <li>Spring</li> <li>UNIX</li> <li>Experience with Unit Testing</li> <li>SOA, SOAP, REST, XML, JSON</li> <li>Outstanding attitude and energy</li> <li>Excellent communication skills <br/><br/> Skills Desired: <br/><br/> - Angular or any frontend development experience is a bonus</li> <li>Scala development experience is a bonus</li> <li>Experience with Kafka is a bonus</li> <li>Experience with noSQL database is a bonus <br/><br/> Knowledge of French and English are required. <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential.<br/><br/></li> </ul>
Title: Java Application Developer

Job_Description: CAE is a global leader in training for the civil aviation, defence and security, and healthcare markets. Backed by a 70-year record of industry firsts, we continue to help define global training standards with our innovative virtual-to-live training solutions to make flying safer, maintain defence force readiness and enhance patient safety. We have the broadest global presence in the industry, with 8,000 employees, 160 sites and training locations in over 35 countries. Each year, we train more than 120,000 civil and defence crewmembers and thousands of healthcare professionals worldwide. www.cae.com<br/><br/>Développeur d'applications digitales (Full Stack) / Digital Applications Developer (Full Stack)<br/><br/><strong>Position Type:</strong> <br/><br/> Regular<br/><br/><strong>Role and Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> (English will follow) <br/><br/> Les développeurs d’infrastructures complètes auront un éventail de responsabilités allant de l’élaboration et la mise en œuvre de produits numériques à veiller à ce que l’entreprise demeure à l’avant-garde de la technologie. <br/><br/> Nos développeurs participent à l’ensemble de l’infrastructure, de la base de données et l’infrastructure DevOps qui supportent le déploiement continu, aux applications natives, jusqu’aux premières phases du cycle de développement. <br/><br/> À titre de développeur, vous travaillerez au sein d’une équipe interfonctionnelle avec le chargé de produit, les concepteurs et le développeur principal en vue de développer conjointement les produits numériques. <br/><br/> <u>Responsabilités:</u> <ul> <li>Utiliser les pratiques d’ingénierie Agile et divers logiciels et technologies de développement Web pour développer rapidement des solutions créatives et efficaces qui améliorent l’expérience des clients et des employés.</li><li>Collaborer avec les autres membres de l’équipe pour créer des scénarios d’utilisateurs et des tests de conception clairs pour les prototypes et les produits, et afin d’offrir continuellement des améliorations de produits.</li><li>Communiquer avec les équipes de TI au sujet des innovations numériques associées au fondement des systèmes de TI.</li><li>Communiquer avec les partenaires commerciaux à propos des processus Agile pour établir et gérer les attentes relatives aux méthodes de livraison et aux échéanciers.</li> </ul> <u>Compétences types et expérience</u>: <ul> <li>Un minimum de 5 ans d’expérience en développement de logiciels en plus d’une expérience de travail au sein d’équipes Agile.</li><li>Excellentes compétences de programmation dans au moins un langage de programmation/infrastructure, comme Node.JS, Ruby on Rails, C#, ASP .Net, Python.</li><li>Expérience et connaissance pratique de HTML/CSS et d’une infrastructure frontale Javascript moderne, comme ReactJS, AngularJS, EmberJS, Vue.js.</li><li>Connaissance pratique de SQL et d’une technologie de base de données courante, comme SQL Server, MySQL, MongoDB.</li><li>Une réelle passion pour le développement et un goût démontré pour l’apprentissage continu.</li><li>Connaissance de la programmation jumelée, de l’intégration continue et du développement axé sur les essais.</li><li>Expérience avec au moins une infrastructure d’essai unitaire, comme Mocha, RSpec.</li><li>La connaissance des concepts de programmation fonctionnelle et de microservices est un atout.</li><li>Les contributions à la communauté (p.ex. travail à code source ouvert, publications ou discussions sur des idées techniques) sont un atout.</li> </ul> *********************************************************************************** <br/><br/> Full stack developers will have a range of responsibilities from shaping and implementing digital products to ensuring that we stay on the leading edge of technology. <br/><br/> Our developers contribute across the full technology stack, from database and DevOps infrastructure that supports continuous deployment, over native apps, to front end development. <br/><br/> As a Developer you will work in a cross-functional team with the Product Owner, Designers and Lead Developer to co-develop the digital products. <br/><br/> <u>Responsibilities</u>: <ul> <li>Use Agile engineering practices and various software and web development technologies to rapidly develop creative and efficient solutions that enhance the client customer and employee experience.</li><li>Collaborate with other team members to craft clear user stories, design tests <br/> for prototypes and products, and continuously deliver product enhancements.</li><li>Communicate with IT teams about any Digital innovations that are tying into bedrock IT systems.</li><li>Communicate with business stakeholders about Agile processes to set and manage expectations about delivery methods and timelines.</li> </ul> <u>Typical skills & background:</u> <ul> <li>At least 5 years of software development experience with experience working in Agile teams.</li><li>Excellent programming skills in at least one modern programming language/ framework, such as Node.JS, Ruby on Rails, C#, ASP .Net, Python.</li><li>Experience and working knowledge of HTML/ CSS, and a modern frontend Javascript framework, such as ReactJS, AngularJS, EmberJS, Vue.js.</li><li>Working knowledge of SQL and one common database technology, such as SQL Server, MySQL, MongoDB.</li><li>Real passion for development and a demonstrated appetite for continual learning.</li><li>Knowledge of pair programming, continuous integration and test-driven development.</li><li>Experience with at least one unit testing framework, such as Mocha, RSpec.</li><li>Familiarity with the concepts of Functional Programming and Microservices is a plus.</li><li>Community contributions (e.g., open source work, publishing / speaking on technical ideas) is a plus.</li> </ul> CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted. <br/><br/> <strong>Equal Employment Opportunity</strong> <br/><br/> CAE is firmly committed to ensuring a positive and professional working environment in which all people are treated with dignity and respect. We aim to provide a fair and consistent method for filling job openings in support of equality of opportunity and cultural diversity within the company. <br/><br/> The masculine gender is used throughout this job description solely to make the text easier to read and therefore applies to both men and women.
Title: Développeur d'applications digitales (Full Stack) / Digital Applications Developer (Full Stack)

Job_Description: <div><div>Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey! <br/><br/> Splunk's Machine Learning Incubation group is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to design and build innovative solutions that enable rapid analysis of massive amounts of behavioral data in real time. We're working on the cutting edge of data analysis and correlation, letting our customers have a single pane of glass for their data from sensors to web servers. <ul> <li>You will work with a tight-knit super smart bunch of engineers who are doing state of the art development work (both frontend and backend) in areas of Machine Learning and Data Analytics across silos of data to build best in class business analytics software.</li> <li>You will be interacting with product management and customers on the bleeding edge of technology to understand detailed requirements and create new products for the market.</li>  </ul> Requirements: <ul> <li>You have 7+years related experience in designing and building scalable high quality high performance software that processes massive amounts of data in real-time</li><li>You have worked in a collaborative multi-functional team (PM, QA, UX)</li><li>You have expert skills in Python or Scala or Java and Object Oriented Programming</li> <li>You have a proven foundation in RESTful APIs, data structures, algorithms, software design and security</li><li>You have good understanding of Systems Programming (network stack, file system, OS services)</li><li>You are comfortable developing cross platform software in a CI/CD environment and practicing test-driven development.</li><li>You have the ability to learn new technologies quickly and mentor junior team members</li><li>You have strong communication skills, verbal, written and whiteboard</li><li>You have a BS CS/EE or equivalent</li> </ul> Additional Skills would be a plus: <ul> <li>Working knowledge of Javascript, HTML and CSS</li><li>Development experience with Go, or C++</li><li>Knowledge of machine learning (how to use and integrate to)</li><li>Experience with Big Data technologies such as Spark, Hadoop, Flink or Splunk</li><li>Experience with at least one Cloud platform</li> </ul> What we offer you: <ul> <li>A constant stream of new things to learn. We're always expanding into new areas, bringing in open source projects and contributing back, and exploring new technologies.</li><li>A set of exceptionally talented and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering and QA to product management and customer support.</li><li>Breadth and depth. You want to work on an area that spans backend and frontend and SDKs? We have that.</li><li>Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe mentors help both sides of the equation.</li><li>A stable, collaborative and supportive work environment. We work in an open environment, have a shared kitchen and sit down for a quick sync every morning.</li><li>We don't expect people to work 12 hour days. We want you to have a successful time outside of work too. Want to work from home sometimes? No problem. We trust our colleagues to be responsible with their time and dedication, and believe that balance helps cultivate a great environment.</li> </ul> We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status</div></div>
Title: Senior Software Engineer - Backend

Flexible hours supported by outstanding benefits   <ul> <li>Six levels of engineers within R&D department with unlimited opportunities to grow</li> <li>Opportunity to rock the world of digital publishing and distribution while doing your job <br/><br/> What You Will Be Doing: <br/><br/> In this position you will join the team that builds the platform for PressReader.com web-site and app-services using cutting-edge technologies. JavaScript ES5/6 for frontend development</li> <li>Microsoft Azure as a cloud platform</li> <li>Mix of SQL and NoSQL for database (MS SQL Server, Cassandra, Redis, Azure Table/Blob storage, DocumentDB)</li> <li>ElasticSearch for full-text search and analytics</li> <li>Agile development process</li> <li>Continuous integration and deployment (TeamCity, Octopus Deploy)</li> <li>Selenium for constraints</li> <li>Consult with internal clients to develop and document web requirements</li> </ul> What You Need To Succeed in This Role: <ul>  <li>Bachelors degree in Computer Science/Engineering</li> <li>Minimum 3 years of experience in C# programming</li> <li>Minimum 3 years development experience with ASP.NET MVC, Web API, HTML5, JavaScript, T-SQL</li> <li>Minimum 3 years of recent experience as a Software Engineer in test-driven, continuous integration development environment (back-end unit-testing, front-end unit-testing, behavior and integration testing)</li> <li>Solid understanding and experience using both relational (MS SQL) and non-relational (Cassandra, Redis) data stores, cloud platform (Microsoft Azure)</li> <li>Ability to learn quickly and effectively apply new knowledge</li> </ul> This role is a full-time position based in our Richmond, BC, office. <br/><br/> Send your resume at https://pressreader.workable.com/j/7FF4DCCB15 to add it straight to the job pipeline. <br/><br/> We thank you for your interest in joining us. Only eligible candidates will be contacted for interviews. For more information about our company and other roles open, please visit our website http://about.pressreader.com.  </ul>
Title: Full Stack Software Engineer

Job_Description: Showpass is a ticketing and event management software company. We empower venue and event organizers to create a rich, connected experience for their customers through next-generation technology. We combine cutting-edge software and hardware for seamless on- and offline sales, while delivering event management tools on the same integrated platform. <br/><br/> <em><strong>But what makes us different?</strong></em> <br/><br/> Showpass offers a unique platform for collaboration between the key groups that power events. From venues, to organizers, to street teams, to event attendees, we are focused on bringing people together through the magic of live events. We also happen to be powered by a very talented team fostering innovation, creativity and disruption. These pillars support the Showpass culture which is built on a love for events, and all things food. Thats what makes us the fastest growing Canadian ticketing company. <br/><br/> <strong>THE ROLE:</strong> Senior Software Engineer (full-time permanent role) <br/><br/> <strong>THE PERKS:</strong> <ul> <li>A unique and fun place to work flexible hours and vacation policy, in-house chef, fully stocked snack and fresh pressed juice bar, gym membership, dog-friendly office and parking</li><li>Competitive compensation and benefits package</li>  </ul> <strong>THE RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong> <ul> <li>Facilitate best practices for quality assurance such as code reviews and technical recommendations</li><li>Work with developers and designers to design new features and optimize the stability and scalability of our servers</li><li>Stay up to date and knowledgeable on the latest programming tools and practices</li><li>Write effective tests to find bugs quickly, and teach other developers to do the same</li><li>Participate in routine standups, code reviews and testing parties</li> </ul> <strong>THE QUALIFICATIONS:</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum 3 years work experience in Python/Django or similar</li><li>Post secondary education in engineering or computer science would be an asset</li><li>Natural ability to find and exploit weaknesses in a system</li><li>Relentless pursuit of perfection in code and design</li><li>Highly skilled with latest DevOps tools and practices including: Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS</li><li>Experience with AngularJS or similar frontend frameworks (Backbone, React, Polymer)</li><li>Experience with testing tools such as CircleCI, mocha, unittest</li><li>Strong knowledge of database concepts</li><li>Must work great in a team and also as an individual contributor</li><li>Analytical thinker with the ability to problem solve in a fast-paced work environment</li><li>Must have the hustle and drive to take initiative and make things happen!</li> </ul> <strong>NOTE: We will only contact qualified candidates of interest</strong>
Title: Senior Software Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>Why join Irdeto?</strong> <br/><br/> We are on a mission! A mission to secure the world’s digital platforms. Why? Because a secure platform allows our clients to produce and deliver great content. In return, you can enjoy the latest blockbuster movies and your favorite live events at all times. It doesn’t stop at the media industry. Our security technology is also securing connected transport and IoT applications. We are innovative, international and part of Naspers, one of the largest technology investors in the world. <br/><br/> <strong>Cloakware™</strong> <strong>Market Unit</strong> <br/><br/> Our mission is to become the number 1 software security provider on the planet in terms of usability, security and brand. That is why the Cloakware<strong>™</strong> team is responsible for leveraging the world’s best software security to protect digital platforms. The team focuses on building, delivering and supporting Cloakware<strong>™</strong> for automotive, payments and banking, games and future IoT markets. <br/><br/> We are currently seeking candidates with expertise in the broad area of programming languages technologies, including one or more of the following: compilers, interpreters, intermediate representations (IRs), source-to-source language transformations and compiler optimizations, type systems, the semantics of programming languages and static analysis such as data-flow analysis. <br/><br/> The ideal candidate will contribute to our High Assurance Software Protection Tools and Technologies including to our state of the art Obfuscation and Tamper proofing technology areas. While strong emphasis is put on correctness and reliability of the tools we will be developing, we also strive to build on top of our many years of industry-leading obfuscation, anti-tamper and white-box cryptography techniques. <br/><br/> <strong>Primary Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Design, develop, verify and test, deploy, maintain and improve software.</li> <li>Perform various analysis and testing tasks to improve the correctness, performance and general quality of the tools products.</li> <li>Manage project deadlines and priorities in a self-directed fashion.</li> <li>Thoroughly document the research, architecture/design and implementations of solutions.</li> <li>Create and share ideas and knowledge by both speaking and writing through presentations and papers to internal technical staff and to external working groups and conferences.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Bachelor’s or Graduate degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, or related field.</li> </ul> <strong>Required Skills & Experience:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Hands-on compiler and/or interpreter development experience.</li> <li>Knowledge of compiler backend technologies such as code generation, register allocation and loop transformations, etc.</li> <li>Knowledge of compiler frontend technologies such as parsers and parser generators and type checking</li> <li>Experience and programming skills in one or more of: C, C++, Java and knowledge of one or more of Haskell, OCaml, Scheme.</li> <li>Hands-on experience with low-level debugging</li> <li>Ability to read, understand and interpret language standards such as ISO/IEC 9899:2011</li> <li>Knowledge of language semantics and formalisms is an important asset</li> <li>Knowledge of open source development including tooling such as Git, makefiles/make and CMake</li> <li>Extensive experience with design, development and debugging especially in a Linux environment</li> <li>Knowledge of intermediate representations especially with the LLVM framework and LLVM IR</li> <li>Clear, concise verbal, and written communication</li> <li>Have a strong sense of customer focus and teamwork</li> <li>Enjoy <em>getting the job done</em>; on time and to a high degree of quality</li> </ul> <strong>What do we offer you?</strong> <br/><br/> At Irdeto, we know that it is the people who make our company a success. We encourage personal and professional growth and success among our globally diverse workforce by offering:  <ul>  	<li>Competitive remuneration and benefits</li> <li>Career and personal development opportunities</li> <li>Flexible working spaces in state of the art offices</li> <li>A focus on collaboration, creativity, health and happiness</li> <li>Working for a truly global company with offices in 15+ countries</li> </ul> With nearly 50 successful years of business innovation behind us, Irdeto is a solid company to join. We are looking for people who are energetic, dynamic and driven to be part of our community. <br/><br/> <strong>Welcome to Irdeto!</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Click here to learn more about Irdeto.</em>
Title: Compiler Developer - High Assurance Software Protection

Job_Description: <div>League is the digital alternative to traditional health insurance. Led by serial entrepreneur and Kobo founder Michael Serbinis, we are bringing much-needed innovation to the stagnant health care industry. League enables employers to give employees access to health and wellness spending accounts, flexible and cost-effective group insurance plans and workplace health services, all through our website and mobile apps. Our mission is to help people live healthier, happier lives every day.</div> <br/> <div>Were looking for a platform developer to help build the tools and systems that enable our development team to regularly and reliably ship products to our customers. In this role, you will work as part of a small team of developers to deliver and manage the infrastructure underlying our platform, as well as the tooling and automation needed to enable a DevOps culture across our organization. This means working closely with our product delivery teams to understand their bottlenecks, and to mentor them on operational ownership.</div><br/> <div>Our platform and applications run on Google Cloud. We build backend services with Go and MongoDB, a web frontend with React and Redux, and native Android and iOS applications. We ship code to production multiple times per week, and were always looking to improve both the quality and speed of our releases.</div><br/> <div>You may not have expertise in our particular programming languages or technologies, but thats okay. Whats important to League is your ability to take ownership and solve problems, as well as your collaborative spirit and drive for professional growth.</div>You Will  <ul> <li>Build and maintain Leagues server infrastructure, following infrastructure-as-code principles</li><li>Develop tools to support continuous delivery and developer empowerment</li><li>Diagnose and resolve production issues with software development teams</li><li>Participate in an on-call rotation, including incident management</li><li>Live our team values of ownership, pragmatism, cooperation, and empathy for our customers</li> </ul>  About You  <ul> <li>Youre knowledgeable about cloud-based infrastructure</li><li>You have experience with configuration management and deployment automation</li><li>Youre comfortable working in at least one programming language</li><li>You have a focus on security in the delivery of all levels of a system</li><li>When things break, youre eager and able to help fix things</li> </ul>  Nice to Have  <ul> <li>Experience with Google Cloud and/or Docker</li><li>Experience in a startup environment</li> </ul>  <div>Does this sound like you? Wed love to hear from you. Submit your application and someone from our recruitment team will be in touch.</div><br/> <div>We believe that diverse teams perform better, and that fostering an inclusive work environment is a key part of growing a successful team. We welcome people of diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to working with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.</div>

Job_Description: Are you a result-oriented, self-motivated PHP software developer looking for flexibility? <br/><br/> TapClicks, a fast-growing software company with a team of engineers working from Montreal, Boston and San Jose (California), is looking for a new engineer to work on its reporting and order management platform for digital marketing agencies. <br/><br/> Our core product currently integrates with over 60 third-party data sources to fetch data and report it in a unified dashboard for agencies and their clients, saving them time and allowing them to make better decisions. Based on client needs, we also built a new order management and workflow system to let them enter their clients' orders and process them based on custom product definitions and workflows. That way, they can use our platform from start to finish (enter their orders, have campaigns created in third-party platforms via APIs, and then use our existing reporting capabilities). <br/><br/> As part of our growth, we're now looking for a full-stack developer who will be able to add new features to the application, working both on the PHP backend and the Angular frontend. <br/><br/> Ideally, we'd like a software developer with at least 3 years of experience who:   <ul> <li>Is smart and self-motivated;</li> <li>Is familiar with the LAMP development stack;</li> <li>Is experienced with the Angular framework;</li> <li>Is detail-oriented;</li> <li>Is a fast learner;</li> <li>Can innovate/make improvements without always needing a precise spec;</li> <li>Is a great communicator (we're a distributed team);</li> <li>Has a bachelor degree or higher (nice to have - not required);</li> <li>Has experience with third-party APIs (nice to have - not required);</li> <li>Has previous experience with digital marketing and/or order entry system (nice to have - not required).</li> </ul>  Is this something that could interest you? If so, please contact plsoucy@tapclicks.com with questions or with your CV/LinkedIn profile for more details. <br/><br/> We offer a competitive salary and a possibility of stock options. <br/><br/> We're looking for people in the Montreal, Boston and San Jose (California) areas. <br/><br/> <strong>======</strong> <br/><br/> P.S. Here's a list of some of the technologies we use: <br/> Backend code: PHP 5.6 <br/> Frontend code: AngularJS <br/> Database: MySQL (InnoDB with foreign keys) <br/> Web server: Apache <br/> Servers: Dedicated servers at OVH + AWS (S3 and Route 53, mostly) <br/> Version control: SVN <br/> Bug tracking: Trac <br/> Some of the APIs we currently have integrations with: Google Adwords, Google Analytics, Facebook Ads, Facebook Insights, Bing Ads, MailChimp, Constant Contact, Twitter, Foursquare, Marchex, Moz, StepRep.
Title: Full-stack LAMP (PHP)/Angular Intermediate/Senior Developer

Job_Description: Company Description<div>Thinking Capital is the leader in the Canadian Alternative Lending space, leveraging technology to be at the forefront of the FinTech industry. Since 2006, they have helped more than 10,000 small-to-medium sized Canadian businesses reach their full potential. By combining their people and technology, Thinking Capital is transforming the way business owners get the capital they need to grow. For more information, visit thinkingcapital.ca</div>Job Description<div><strong>Your role:</strong> <br/><br/> As an active member of the technology department, you will work within the Software Quality Assurance team to conduct testing, writing, and execution of test cases. The SQA Analyst will be responsible for ensuring that standards, processes, and procedures are properly implemented. This role is pivotal in developing and implementing a standard testing procedures. <br/><br/> <strong>Your tasks:</strong> <ul> <li>Participate and create testing project test plans;</li><li>Develop and create automated test cases using Zephyr in JIRA;</li><li>Implement Testing Automation using advance selenium skills;</li><li>Responsible for testing financial applications and actively carry out UAT with financial stakeholders;</li><li>Ability to work independently with minimal management oversight;</li><li>Creates Test Strategy and Test Approach document for releases gets it reviewed by required stakeholders and keeps updating these documents as and when the changes are required;</li><li>Design, develop and execute automation scripts using open source tools;</li><li>Work with development team, product owners to ensure requirements are complete and testable;</li><li>Ensure test environment is set up and working prior to QC cycle;</li><li>Provide estimates of testing effort during the sprint planning meeting;</li><li>Develop test plans for web services using tools like SOAP UI, JMeter;</li><li>Develop and execute regression and functional tests;</li><li>Defect Bug tracking;</li><li>Create SQL queries to perform back-end testing;</li><li>Contribute to company strategy for ensuring quality across systems;</li><li>Actively participate in daily SCRUM.</li></ul></div> <br/> Qualifications<div><strong>Apply if you have the following skillset:</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum of two years of experience in a similar role;</li><li><em>Good knowledge of Financial models an asset;</em></li><li>Experience with Salesforce or any other CRM;</li><li>Background in Computer Science/Quality Systems Engineering;</li><li>Detail oriented with strong troubleshooting skills;</li><li>SQA Testing and Methodologies;</li><li>Deep knowledge of Software Quality Assurance and Quality Control processes and practices;</li><li>Working experience with any of the following automation tools (SOAP UI, JMeter);</li><li>Hands-on experience testing web services;</li><li>Hands-on experience in all testing methodologies (mobile, system, functional, black vs. white box);</li><li>Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process;</li><li>Strong hands on scripting experience;</li><li>Strong understanding of the Software Development/Testing Life Cycle (SDLC/STLC);</li><li>JIRA and Confluence experience is an asset;</li><li>Knowledge of database concepts and client server technology;</li><li>Ability to work in a fast paced and rapidly changing environment;</li><li>Previous experience working in a Software Development environment;</li><li>Good written and verbal communication skills.</li></ul></div> <br/> <strong>Additional Information<div><strong>Why work for Thinking Capital:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>• Great Team:</strong>  <br/> Surround yourself with high-performing, energetic and passionate group of people dedicated to the Thinking Capital Mission; <br/> <strong>• FinTech Revolution:</strong>  <br/> Be part of a team that is revolutionizing the financial system and redefining how Canadian small businesses access capital; <br/> <strong>• Our Stack:</strong> <br/> Our backend is a sophisticated service oriented architecture developed mostly in Java with a Spring framework. On the frontend side, our application is developed on an AngularJS framework. We use Git in coordination with the best DevOps practices for Continuous Integration and Deployment to our AWS cloud infrastructure. <br/> <strong>• Fast-Paced Environment:</strong>  <br/> Take on complex projects in a start-up like collaborative environment; <br/> <strong>• Amazing Culture:</strong>  <br/> Amazing work spaces, advanced technology tools, subsidized lunches, Foosball table, super fun work events (Amazing Race, Murder mystery wine and cheeses, Wacky Olympics, Casino nights and legendary holiday parties and more). Take a look! <br/> <strong>• Thinking Capital Academy:</strong>  <br/> Get the opportunity to grow and advance in the company through continuous professional training; <br/> <strong>• Diverse Team:</strong>  <br/> Join an “at-will” equal opportunity team that prides itself on its diversity and harmony;</div>I'm interested
