Job_Description: <strong>Location:</strong><br/><br/>40 Hanna Ave, Toronto, Ontario, M6K 0C3<br/><br/>The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you. <br/><br/> <strong>Why is this role important?</strong> <br/><br/> Looking for a challenge? Good. Love an innovative work environment? Even better. <br/><br/> At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experience, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. From our office in Downtown Toronto, we’ve created leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started. <br/><br/> We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. If you have big ideas, undeniable enthusiasm, and thrive in a collaborative, creative, and diverse group, we’ll get along just fine. <br/><br/> Working from our downtown office, you will report to the E-Commerce Technology Lead and will assist in building, improving and maintaining a world-class, multi-channel e-commerce platform. This is a hands-on role in the E-Commerce Development Team where you will develop software across the full-stack of a multi-channel platform from HTML, CSS & Javascript to server-side Java. <br/> What You'll Do: <ul> <li>Java Development on the hybris e-commerce platform</li><li>Write server-side code for web-based applications, create robust high-volume production applications, and develop prototypes quickly.</li><li>Participate in code and architecture reviews.</li><li>Responsive front-end Development using Javascript, CSS, HTML in a Spring framework</li><li>Translate wireframes, creative design, and functional requirements into functional xHTML/ CSS / Javascript</li><li>Develop JavaScript using standard frameworks (jQuery, Backbone.js, node.js etc.)</li><li>Construct design documents and documentation to aid in maintenance and code reuse.</li><li>Confirms program operation with testing; modifying program logic and performance tuning while guaranteeing quality assurance.</li><li>Closely work with the Quality Control and Technical Communication team members to ensure high quality deliverables</li><li>Provides input to status reports on the “health” of the application.</li><li>Provides support by ensuring stability of the application and addressing and resolving business issues in a timely manner.</li> </ul> What You'll Need: <ul> <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar</li><li>3+ years of experience in software engineering.</li><li>1+ years’ experience in object oriented design and development in Java.</li><li>Some experience developing with the Spring Framework would be preferred.</li><li>Some experience with an e-commerce platform (hybris, ATG, Websphere etc.) would be preferred.</li><li>Advanced skills using J2EE Frameworks and Libraries specifically such as Hibernate, JPA and JDO</li><li>Database development skills including SQL programming, solid understanding of relational database technologies, logical and physical data modeling. Preferably on an Oracle database.</li><li>Backend and Frontend/Web development experience with JSP, JavaScript, JSON, jQuery, HTML, CSS</li><li>Experience with web app servers, such as Tomcat, JBoss, Websphere, and Weblogic</li><li>Experience using standard development tools, such as Eclipse, Ant, Git</li><li>Experience developing REST based web services</li> </ul> #LI-ST1 <br/><br/> <strong>How You’ll Succeed:</strong> <br/><br/> At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. <br/><br/> If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today. <br/><br/> <strong>Employment Type:</strong><br/><br/>Full time<br/><br/><strong><strong>Type of Role:</strong></strong><br/><br/>Regular<br/><br/>Loblaw recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired.<br/><br/>Please Note: If you have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.
Title: Developer II

Job_Description: Company Profile <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the people of Morgan Stanley are dedicated to providing our clients the finest thinking, products and services to help them achieve even the most challenging goals. <br/><br/> As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. We embrace integrity, excellence, team work and giving back. <br/><br/> Technology <br/><br/> The Technology division partners with our business units and leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global and dynamic financial markets. <br/><br/> Our sizeable investment in technology results in leading-edge tools, software, and systems. Our insights, applications, and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients’ businesses—and to our own. <br/><br/> Institutional Securities Technology (IST) develops and oversees the overall technology strategy and bespoke technology solutions to drive and enable the Institutional businesses and enterprise-wide functions. Our clients include Fixed Income, Equities, Commodities, Investment Banking, Research and Global Capital Markets as well as Operations, HR and Corporate Services. <br/><br/> Position Description: <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is looking for a java developer in Montreal who will be able to help improve its real time risk analysis systems used by derivatives traders. Our systems are meant to consistently provide large amounts of important data, at high scale, while markets are moving quickly. <br/><br/> You would be part of a development team for a system that is responsible for all of the distributed components and the associated user interfaces for said risk delivery. There are several languages and development frameworks involved so we're interested in talking to strong generalists who have broad technical interests or who would like to explore various technical paths. <br/><br/> We encourage developers to contribute to the whole system rather than just individual components, so over time you'll have more freedom to develop in areas you are interested in. This also means individual developers have more ownership of project work across several components and programming languages. <br/><br/> Desired skills: <br/><br/> - 3 years of relevant experience   <ul> <li>Strong Computer Science fundamentals</li> <li>Proficient with at least one object oriented language (e.g. Java, C# or C ) <br/><br/> Nice to have: <br/><br/> - Experience with a scripting language (e.g. Python)</li> <li>Experience with web technology (either servers or frontends)</li> <li>Interest and knowledge of capital markets and finance concepts <br/><br/> Knowledge of French and English are required. <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential. <br/><br/> </li> </ul>
Title: Java developer

Job_Description: Location: Markham, ON <br/><br/> Level: II <br/><br/> A Canadian success story! Orbit Group Partners is a leading contact centre consulting firm who is quickly emerging as a formidable enterprise software solutions provider to the Global contact centre industry. We give our clients better results than typical contact centre systems through a total work out that strengthens every part of their organization. Providing our clients a superior product which includes follow through that will sustain their newfound vigour. At the heart of our method are proprietary products and systems that have been consistently effective in reducing costs and increasing revenue for our clients. <br/><br/> Job Description: <br/><br/> We offer compelling and rewarding career opportunities for a highly talented, motivated front end developer who can work with our product and project teams to develop our custom software solutions for a variety of unique business applications. If you have demonstrated experience developing frontend web interfaces in Angular and JavaScript, have great interpersonal skills, superior command of the english language, and an ability to learn new products and environments quickly, you might be just the person we are looking for. <br/><br/> Job Responsibilities:  <ul>   <li>Develop and test custom web-based software in the JavaScript framework Angular 2 and associated frontend languages</li> <li>Maintain development, QA, and UAT environments</li> <li>Maintain code in version control system supporting multiple branches/deployment paths</li> <li>Ensure quality and timeliness of artifacts, including development of effort and cost estimates, and joint development of statements of work</li> <li>Keep abreast of new technologies and how they can be used to advance Orbit’s technology</li> <li>Continuous improvement of the development process</li> </ul> Job Qualifications:  <ul>   <li>Strong background in web-based application design and development in enterprise environments.</li> <li>3+ years of current and solid experience in frontend JavaScript development</li> <li>Experience with Typescript a major asset</li> <li>Experience with HTML5, Bootstrap, AJAX and JSON</li> <li>Experience with LESS or SASS or similar CSS technologies</li> <li>Development experience with Angular 2, React, or other JavaScript frameworks a major asset</li> <li>Experience with multi-instance SaaS, including client customization, user permissions and version control.</li> <li>Experience with Git or other source control systems.</li> <li>Experience with responsive design / mobile web development</li> <li>User experience design experience an asset</li> <li>Knowledge of WCAG 2.0 and accessibility standards and practices is an asset</li> <li>Experience with ASP.NET MVC & Web API is an asset</li> <li>Knowledge of and experience with MS SQL 2016 is nice to have</li> </ul> Additional Info: <strong>Education Requirements:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology, Diploma in Computer Programming, or relevant experience</li> </ul>
Title: Front End Developer

Job_Description: <br/><br/><b>About Us: </b><br/>GE is the world's Digital Industrial Company, transforming industry with software-defined machines and solutions that are connected, responsive and predictive. Through our people, leadership development, services, technology and scale, GE delivers better outcomes for global customers by speaking the language of industry. <div><br/></div><div>At GE Lighting Solutions, we are dedicated to advancing the industrial internet vision through superior engineering, intelligent devices design and bold innovation. We've combined embedded systems industry knowledge, brand recognition and the global reach of GE with our electronics and software design expertise to change the world of the industrial internet.<br> </div><div><br/></div><div>GE (NYSE: GE) est le groupe industriel numérique mondial, qui transforme lindustrie grâce des machines contrôlées par logiciel et des solutions connectées, adaptées et prédictives. GE sorganise autour dun échange mondial de connaissance, le « GE Store » (offre de produits GE), au sein duquel chaque activité partage et a accès aux mêmes technologies, marchés, structures et intelligences. Chaque invention nourrit les innovations et les applications dans tous nos secteurs industriels. Fort de ses collaborateurs, ses services, sa technologie et sa taille, GE produit de meilleurs résultats pour ses clients en parlant le langage de lindustrie. www.ge.com<br><br></div> <br/><br/><b>Role Summary: </b><br/>GE Digital is looking for an experienced Software Engineer to work on a number of exciting projects that will have a very positive impact on GEs business.<br> <div><br/></div><br><br>GE Digital est la recherche dun ingénieur en logiciel pour travailler sur un nombre de projets intéressants qui auront un impact positif sur les activités commerciales de GE. <br/><br/><b>Essential Responsibilities: </b><br/>• Act as a member of the Software Center of Excellence, representing the face of high quality design and development practices <div>• Develop high performing, scaling and innovative end-to-end web applications </div><div>• Collaborate with system engineers, frontend developers and software developers to implement solutions that are aligned with and extend shared platforms and solutions </div><div>• Apply principles of SDLC and methodologies like Lean/Agile/XP, CI, Software and Product Security, Scalability, Documentation Practices, refactoring and Testing Techniques </div><div>• Writes codes that meets standards and delivers desired functionality using the technology selected for the project </div><div>• Build features such as web services and Queries on existing tables </div><div>• Understand performance parameters and assess application performance<br></div><div><br/></div><br><br>• agir en tant que membre du Centre dexcellence en logiciel, représentant limage dune conception de haute qualité et des pratiques de développement; <div>• développer de bout en bout des applications Web extrêmement performantes, évolutives et novatrices; </div><div>• collaborer avec les ingénieurs systèmes, les développeurs Front-End et les développeurs logiciels pour mettre en œuvre des solutions qui sharmonisent aux plateformes et solutions partagées tout en les élargissant; </div><div>• mettre en application les principes des cycles de développement des logiciels et des méthodologies comme Lean/Agile/XP, lintégration continue, la sécurité des logiciels et produits, lévolutivité, les pratiques en matière de documentation, le remaniement de code et les techniques en matière dessais; </div><div>• écrire du code qui répond aux normes et fournit la fonctionnalité désirée l'aide de la technologie sélectionnée pour le projet; </div><div>• intégrer des fonctionnalités comme des services Web et des requêtes dans les tableaux existants; </div><div>• comprendre les paramètres de performance et évaluer la performance des applications; </div><div>• développer des structures de données de base et des algorithmes et les mettre en œuvre laide du langage de choix;<br><br></div> <br/><br/><b>Qualifications/Requirements: </b><br/>• Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or in STEM Majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math) <div>• A minimum of 2 years of professional experience in Software Development </div><div>• GE Leadership Program Graduates will get credit towards relevant work experience, commensurate to the program they have completed </div><div>• Legal authorization to work in the Canada is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job </div><div>• Must be willing to work out of an office located in Lachine, QC, Canada</div><div><br/></div><br><br>• détenir un baccalauréat en informatique ou un baccalauréat dont la matière principale est les sciences, la technologie, lingénierie ou les mathématiques (« STEM »); <div>• posséder un minimum de 2 ans dexpérience professionnelle en développement de logiciel; </div><div>• les diplômés du programme de leadership de GE seront reconnus pour lexpérience professionnelle pertinente acquise, en fonction du programme quils ont terminé. </div><div>• autorisation légale travailler au Canada requise; aucun parrainage ne sera offert pour loctroi dun visa emploi pour ce poste, ni maintenant ni lavenir; </div><div> • volonté de travailler dans un bureau situé Lachine, Québec, Canada.<br></div> <br/><br/><b>Desired Characteristics: </b><br/>• Hands-on experience in web services (REST, SOAP, WSDL etc.), using Apache Commons Suite & Maven, SQL Database such as Oracle MySQL, PostgreSQL etc. <div>• Hands-on experience in utilizing Spring Framework (Core, MVC, Integration and Data)<br>Experience with Big Data (DataStax) / Hadoop and NoSQL Database is a big plus<br>• Experience with rules engines (Camel, Drools, JRules) & modern tooling (Gradle, Maven, Git, SVN) </div><div>• Has the ability to break down problems and estimate time for development tasks </div><div>• Has the ability to make basic technology choices based on experience </div><div>• Has the ability to take ownership of small tasks and deliver without supervision while using their discretion to seek help when necessary </div><div>• Voices opinions and presents clear rationale. Uses data or factual evidence to influence </div><div>• Recognizes collaborative behavior and participates in collaborative activities </div><div>• Learns organization vision statement and decision making framework. Able to understand how team and personal goals/objectives contribute to the organization vision<br>• Demonstrate the ability to help team members </div><div>• Seeks to understand problems thoroughly before implementing solutions. Asks questions to clarify requirements when ambiguities are present </div><div>• Identifies opportunities for innovation and offers new ideas. Takes the initiative to experiment with new <br>software frameworks </div><div>• Adapts to new environments and changing requirements. Pivots quickly as needed. When coached, responds to need & seeks info from other sources<br></div><br><br>• posséder une expérience pratique avec les services Web (REST, SOAP, WSDL etc.), en utilisant la suite Apache Commons & Mavin et les bases de données SQL, comme Oracle MySQL, PostgreSQL,etc.; <div><br/></div><div>• posséder une expérience pratique avec le cadre dapplications Spring (base, modèle MVC, intégration et données);<br>posséder une expérience avec les bases de données massives (DataStax)/Hadoop et NoSQL est considéré un atout; </div><div>• posséder une expérience avec les moteurs de règles (Camel, Drools, JRules) et les outils modernes (Gradle, Maven, Git, SVN); </div><div>• avoir lhabileté de décortiquer les problèmes et destimer le temps requis pour les tâches de développement; </div><div>• avoir la capacité de faire des choix technologiques de base selon lexpérience; </div><div>• avoir la capacité dassumer la responsabilité de petites tâches et de fournir des résultats sans supervision, tout en se servant de leur discrétion pour solliciter de laide en cas de besoin; </div><div>• exprimer des opinions et présenter un raisonnement clair; utiliser des données ou des éléments de preuve pour influencer; </div><div>• reconnaître les comportements collaboratifs et participer aux activités collaboratives; </div><div>• se familiariser avec lénoncé de la vision de lorganisation et le cadre décisionnel; avoir la capacité de comprendre comment les buts et les objectifs personnels et de léquipe contribuent la vision de lorganisation; </div><div>• démontrer la capacité daider les membres de léquipe; </div><div>• chercher comprendre les problèmes fond avant de mettre en œuvre des solutions; poser des questions pour clarifier les exigences lorsque des ambiguïtés se présentent; </div><div>• cerner des possibilités dinnovation et offrir de nouvelles idées; faire preuve dinitiative en expérimentant avec de nouveaux <br>cadres dapplications logiciels; </div><div>• sadapter aux nouveaux environnements et aux exigences en évolution; réagir rapidement au besoin; répondre au besoin lors dun encadrement et solliciter des informations auprès dautres sources.<br></div> <br/><br/><b>Locations: </b> Canada; Quebec; Lachine
Title: Ingénieur en logiciel/Software Engineer

Job_Description: Description <br/>  <div> <em>Position at Coveo Solutions</em></div>  <br/><strong>Step Up to the Plate!</strong><br/>  <div>You’ve been practising for months? It is now time to join a completely awesome development team and put your talent to work. In collaboration with your personal mentor and your assigned team you will be able to perfect the art of created structured and clean code that scales through trial and error, research and a lot of practice. If you love diversity and you are excited about working in a state-of-art environment, you’re in the right place. Here at Coveo, an intern works on many aspects of a project: Analysis, Development, Deliverables estimation, Architecture, Automation (Tests and Infrastructure), Optimization, Etc.</div>  <br/><strong>Ready for the Major Leagues?!</strong><br/>  <div><strong>“Pros” are forged with practice, passion, collaboration and perseverance. Whether you are a “carry-and-support” player or a “tank”, it’s all about teamwork! An intern at Coveo can take on a variety of different projects. Here are a few quests you just might take on:</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Windows is your thing?! Help us improve our connectivity with Louis-Daniel</li> <li>You’re into Frontend?! Improve the user experience and available functionalities on our admin console with our React experts</li><li>You love the Cloud?! Optimize our Cloud Infrastructure in our all-around “Oddish” team led by Vincent</li><li>Pretty down-to-earth? Work on the core of Coveo, the Index, where all the data is stored using C++</li><li>More the creative type?! Add modules to our Open Source Search UI Framework in Typescript with Olivier</li><li>Impressed by big players in the industry? Contribute to one of our product teams (Salesforce, Sitecore, Dynamics) who work with technologies specific to our partners’ environments</li><li>You enjoy playing detective!? Develop key features for monitoring all of our users’ interactions: our Usage Analytics team codes in Java</li><li>You want to explore avant-garde languages?! Participate in projects surrounding our Query Engine, you’ll have to get familiar with Scala!</li></ul></div> <br/> <div>Obviously, all of our teams are agile, and don’t worry, no matter what, you will be writing tons of code.</div>  <br/><strong>Do You Have What It Takes?</strong><br/>  <div>You are complete tech addict and you love solving complex puzzles and problems. Even if there was a zombie invasion, you would be unable to turn your eyes off your problem before it’s solved. You participated in programming activities in the past years and you have a head full of ideas. You can’t write a code line that is not impeccable. You can quickly reload your Nerf Gun, especially in critical moments. If you just recognized yourself, you’re probably the player we’re looking for.</div><br/>  <div>Hurry up! Send us your <strong>résumé</strong> and most recent <strong>transcript</strong> to apply!</div><br/>  <div>What is <strong>Coveo</strong>? The Best information. Everywhere. Every Time. Recognized as THE Leader in intelligent search and insights, Coveo enables users to benefit from the latest, most relevant information for their needs. Via a traditional search box or contextualized content recommendations, major companies such as Adobe, Logitech and GoPro use Coveo to better answer their customer inquiries, facilitate self-service, accelerate innovation and sell more (and better).</div><br/>  <div><strong>Why Intern at Coveo?</strong></div> <br/> <div>It is with the conviction that “if it were easy, someone else would have done it” that all our colleagues at Coveo find the drive to continuously seek new challenges and test roads no one else has ever explored before. It is what has allowed us to become world leaders in an innovative industry and to be a collaborative, diverse and trusting place to work filled with amazingly talented and passionate humans.</div> <br/>
Title: Software Development Intern

Job_Description: <strong>Service:</strong> Financial Advisory <br/> <strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Toronto, Ontario, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary; Montreal; Toronto; Vancouver<br/> <div> External Posting Description <br/><br/> Deloitte’s <strong>Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning practice (AI and ML)</strong> practice is comprised of specialized experts with hands-on experience, and cutting-edge information assets that facilitate successful Artificial Intelligence (AI) transformations. We develop AI-enabled solutions to address all aspects of a client’s transformative journey with disciplined focus on business outcomes. <br/><br/> <strong>Your role at Deloitte</strong> <ul> <li>Create various custom applications that tailor towards different clients by working with multiple teams and understanding the business</li><li>Bridge information and requirements across multiple teams such as product management, creative, advisory and analytic teams to define application requirements (epics & user stories) and influence the design of the solutions</li><li>Accurately define effort requirements and manage personal workflow to ensure the deliverables are created on time and in budget</li><li>Growing developers to become senior contributors and establishing new mandates that enable developers to grow and take on leadership roles</li><li>Experience leading and mentoring a team of software developers</li><li>Being multi-disciplinary and being able to roll up your sleeves and get into code whether that is frontend or backend code and also managing servers</li><li>Understand, recommend and apply architecture principles and technologies in the context of specific solutions.</li> </ul> External Posting Qualifications <ul> <li>B.S. or M.S. degree in Computer Science or a related technical field</li><li>A strong background in data structures, algorithms, and design patterns</li><li>6+ years’ experience building software solutions in a corporate or start up engineering environment using JavaScript, Ruby, Python and/or Java / C#, etc</li><li>6+ years’ experience developing web applications leveraging frameworks such Django, Ruby on Rails, etc</li><li>6+ years of front end technologies ranging from HTML, CSS, React, Javascript, jQuery, Redux</li><li>Linux system knowledge and scripting in a linux environment</li><li>Working knowledge of relational and non-relational databases along with design</li><li>Experience in defining, analyzing and documenting business requirements</li><li>Passion for UI / UX (is a plus)</li><li>Comfortable in delivering oral presentations would be considered an asset.</li> </ul> </div> <br/><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: <ul> <li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li> </ul> Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted <br/><br/> 35455
Title: Software Development Manager, AI and ML Joint Venture

Job_Description: <strong>About us:</strong> <br/><br/> At Myant, we are creating the worlds first textile computing platform, integrating technology directly into the only thing weve been wearing our entire life our clothing. The sensors and actuators embedded within our apparel create your Digital Identity, which will be consumed by those who matter to you - your doctors, coaches, other IoT devices, your family members - without you consciously having to think about it. Imagine a world where you walk into your house and the temperature automatically adjusts to your optimal body temperature, the lights adjust to your mood, or your doctor is aware of the onset of a disease before you even visit. The line between the digital and physical world is becoming increasingly blurry, and we believe textile is the next medium to further bridge that gap. <br/><br/> Were looking for people who believe in our mission to make wearable technology truly ubiquitous and convenient, so that everyone can benefit from it. We are a cross-functional team solving big challenges at the intersection of fashion, electronics, software, and data science. <br/><br/> <strong>The Position:</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for an experienced mobile developer to join our rapidly growing, multidisciplinary team. Youll be helping us build the next generation of user experience, which extends beyond a mobile phone and into the clothing we wear. Youll work closely with our UX, hardware, and data science teams to transform innovative technology into groundbreaking products. <br/><br/> You will contribute to the entire engineering process for this product - design, implementation, and operations. You will take pride and ownership over your work, be a critical voice during product development, and challenge assumptions about our technology, products and ecosystem. <br/><br/> <strong>You:</strong> <br/><br/> You are an energetic, passionate mobile developer, who is fuelled by big challenges and disruptive technology. You are a quick study, with a strong drive for personal and professional development. You are an excellent communicator, capable of conversing with both technical and non-technical colleagues, and are comfortable contributing to a highly multidisciplinary team. You are a techie at heart, and feel empowered working on technology that makes a difference; being at a startup is the right place for you. <br/><br/> <strong>Role:</strong>  <ul> <li>Work alongside the product/UX team to define app features</li> <li>Implement UX designs with pixel perfect precision</li> <li>Build frameworks for routing data between our Bluetooth Low Energy enabled smart clothing, web APIs, and the frontend user experience</li> </ul> <strong>Required Skills/Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>A bachelors degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or similar</li> <li>Minimum 2 years industry experience</li> <li>Experience with Objective-C/Swift/Java/Kotlin</li> <li>Experience writing native iOS and/or Android Applications</li> <li>Well versed in software design patterns, and their applications</li> <li>Able to implement pixel perfect designs</li> <li>A strong drive to learn and improve yourself</li> <li>Energetic, resourceful and a highly independent worker</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus:</strong>  <ul> <li>Have a published iOS or Android app</li> <li>Experience interfacing with Bluetooth Low Energy sensors</li> <li>Experience communicating with web APIs (REST/GraphQL)</li> <li>Familiar with reactive programming techniques</li> <li>Familiar with asynchronous design patterns (Promises, etc.)</li> </ul>
Title: Mobile Developer

Job_Description: At Dealflo, we are revolutionizing how businesses and consumers execute financial transactions. Whether you’re buying a car, opening a bank account, getting a mortgage, or insuring your home, we’re here in real-time to make the entire online transaction secure, reliable, and enjoyable. <br/><br/> Our Financial Agreements Automation Platform enables our customers to securely verify electronic identities, seamlessly apply electronic signatures, and reliably ensure regulatory compliance. Our customers are among the world’s largest financial institutions and global enterprises, and Deloitte Technology Fast 50 recognized us as one of the fastest growing technology companies in the UK and Europe. <br/><br/> We are now looking for a <strong>Web Application Developer</strong> to join our Professional Services team in Montreal. <br/><br/> If you thrive on challenges and seek growth, then we want YOU on our Product Team! Our environment is built on trust, openness, and growth. We offer great benefits, excellent health insurance, flexible hours and work-from-home, a wonderful RRSP program, and a fantastic vacation package. <br/><br/> Day to day, you will… <ul>  <li>Evolve and enhance the UI/UX of our current production SaaS application running on the AWS cloud</li> <li>Participate in the analysis, elaboration, and estimation of customer requirements and specifications</li> <li>Design, develop, and deploy new production-quality frontend features and functionality that meet customer requirements</li> <li>Collaborate with application support to analyze, troubleshoot, reproduce, and resolve production issues reported by customers</li> <li>Work with other team members on release planning and deployment activities</li> <li>Participate in all software development lifecycle activities: estimation, planning, designing, coding, documenting, and testing</li> <li>Be proactive, facilitate knowledge sharing, and continually improve our activities</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> To succeed, you have… <ul>  <li>Extensive experience in UI/UX technologies including HTML, JavaScript, CSS, XSLT, REST, JSON, jQuery</li>  <li>Experience in handling differences and limitations of various Web browsers</li></ul>   <ul>  <li>Deep understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX</li> <li>Experience using software best practices like Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Continuous Integration (CI)</li> <li>Strong debugging and analytical skills</li> <li>Knowledge of front-end tools such as Grunt, Gulp.js, AngularJS, and Bootstrap; relational databases and SQL; and cryptography and security</li> <li>Worked as part of Scrum teams or similar iterative Agile development methodologies</li> <li>Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in software engineering or computer science</li></ul>   <ul>  <li>Practiced continuous improvement and promoted knowledge sharing</li> <li>Strong organizational skills, capable of managing assigned tasks and meeting deadlines</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal, communication, collaboration, and writing skills</li> </ul> Come be part of a rapidly growing and exciting SaaS business on a mission to own the global Financial Transaction Management market. We have built the team with the passion, ambition, and experience to make it happen. <br/><br/> So, what are you waiting for? Apply now!
Title: Web Application Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/><br/> An established startup in the gaming industry is urgently looking for a Lead Unity Engineer to lead their Game Client engineering team at their downtown Toronto office. Their current game client sits on a high performance, large scale game service and utilizes a virtual world/3D navigation user interface. You will be responsible for managing the current team (5), own the integratino process between frontend and backend, and design and implement game features. <br/><br/> The ideal candidate will have strong leadership experience managing a team of developers, hands on experience developing game features using Unity and must have experience shipping mobile games. <br/><br/> <strong>Skills/Requirements</strong> <ul> <li>1-3 years leading a software development team</li><li>3-5 years of experience in unity mobile app development</li><li>3-5 years of experience using C#/.NET</li><li>Knowledge and understanding of OOP principles and design patterns</li><li>MUST have shipped at least 1 mobile game title</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <ul> <li>Competitive base salary + bonus</li><li>3 weeks of vacation</li><li>Stock option plan</li><li>Full benefits package</li></ul>  <ul> <li>RELOCATION ASSISTANCE</li> </ul> <strong>Salary: 150,000</strong>
Title: Lead Unity Developer for VC Funded Gaming Company

Job_Description: Busbud is the bus travel booking app and website with the largest sellable coverage. Users can search, compare and buy tickets from hundreds of bus companies in over 16,000 cities and more than 1M different bus routes. <br/><br/> We're working hard to make the bus, one of the most environmentally friendly and sustainable modes of transportation, a great travel option for customers in dozens of languages in over 60 different countries. Our platform unites travelers, partners and bus companies throughout the world to move an increasingly large share of the entire industry online to increase access and improve the travel experience. <br/><br/> Our people, technology and approach have been instrumental in getting us this far, but we have so much more to do, and that's where you come in. <br/><br/> <strong>What do we expect from you?</strong> <br/><br/> Busbud is looking for a **Senior and Intermediate Frontend Developer** with a diversified experience to join our team of talented developers. Our challenges evolve, and as a UX/UI specialist, you'll have the greatest impact on the products that touch our customers. <br/><br/> Your initial focus will be to build fast, rich Javascript applications and style beautiful pages to bring the right users to Busbud and have them successfully purchase their bus travel. You'll balance iteration and A/B testing with risk-taking and greenfielding. You'll routinely work with modern tools like React, Node and SASS on the frontend, and our CDN. You'll share your wisdom with a team that values learning and experimenting. <br/><br/> Depending on the task, you may own the feature end to end, or work with other team members to bring it to life together. We expect you to feel at home on the frontend in user experience land as much as on the server modeling data and improving performance, in the build optimizing asset delivery and everywhere in between. <br/><br/> Given Busbud's all javascript stack (with some Typescript making an appearance), and depending on your interests, you'll also have the opportunity to work on preventing fraud, improving how we communicate with customers, how we interface with supplier systems, upgrading our global architecture, monitoring, and much more. We've got lots of challenges from which to choose! <br/><br/> <strong>How can you impress us?</strong> <br/><br/> You might recognize a few of these from Camille Fournier's RTR post, which we've used to build our own career path ladder. <br/><br/> As an Intermediate or Senior developer, you  <ul> <li>Have shaped broad architecture, having shipped multiple large services, complex libraries or major pieces of infrastructure (5+ years)</li> <li>Are sought out for technical guidance</li> <li>Are recognized as a prolific contributor to core and side projects</li> <li>Love what you do, and sweat the details</li> <li>You're comfortable with (or can quickly ramp up) with some key ingredients in our tech stack: Javascript, NodeJS, React, Redis, Postgres, CDNs and caches, REST APIs and Heroku</li> </ul> At Busbud, you will  <ul> <li>Be an owner and expert on large sections of our codebase, initially the website and related services</li> <li>Anticipate technical issues at the product level and make architectural and design decisions to avoid them</li> <li>Exemplify software development excellence balancing scope and deadlines to deliver on quality and speed with appropriate test coverage, monitoring and rollout plans</li> <li>Multiply the effectiveness of peers by facilitating cross-team work</li> <li>Make our pages and site fast, beautiful, accessible and great for our users</li> <li>Delight Google and other search engines with your thoughtful use of sitemaps, interlinking, annotated content and other tactics to help travelers find buses.</li> </ul> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong>  <ul> <li>Compensation based on experience</li> <li>4 weeks of vacation (3 weeks + holiday season)</li> <li>Health Benefits</li> <li>Stock options</li> <li>Apple equipment</li> <li>Breakfast snacks, team lunch on Wednesdays, happy hour on Fridays</li> <li>Team events</li> <li>A beautiful office in Montreals burgeoning tech neighbourhood, Mile End</li> </ul> <strong>What's it like working as a Developer at Busbud?</strong>  <ul> <li>You get the tools you need to be successful: laptop, big screen, comfy chair and desk and whatever else you might need to do your best work</li> <li>We invest in our tool chain so you can focus on building: we've got instrumentation, monitoring, logging, continuous integration, continuous deployments, crowd testing, managed translations and much more. And since we use Javascript in almost all our projects, it's easy for anyone to jump across projects, provide a code review or contribute.</li> <li>We love our office and having most of the team there for high-bandwidth face-to-face communication, and we also have flexible work schedules and support for remote work in our DNA - Mike, our CTO, had spent most of his time in Busbud's early days working remotely out of New York using chat, Github and other async tools to great success in addition to Google Hangouts for 1-on-1s, and also larger team meetings. Our A/V setup isn't perfect (yet!), but it's gotten pretty good :)</li> <li>Many of us have kids, others hobbies, and sometimes both, so we encourage a sane work/life balance. If you want to work like crazy, we'll take that too - you'll be in good company with the team's night owls</li> <li>We use science (A/B tests) and customer feedback (interviews, support, live chat) to determine the impact of our work</li> <li>We serve over 10M bus departures daily through our API, website and apps, and we're constantly looking for ways to improve our performance and availability without overwhelming the bus companies that supply us with the data - there are lots of challenges in this area around failure mitigation, latency compensation, cache optimization and much more</li> <li>We help travelers in over 60 countries, so we have all kinds of competitors keeping us on our toes, and we need to find ways of providing value to our users to keep them coming back to Busbud to find and buy what is essentially a commodity product. This is a constant challenge which we meet with creativity and taking risks.</li> <li>As much as we can, we deploy explicit and intentional effort to improve diversity in tech and also help upskill the next generation of developers through internship programs, mentoring and hosting, organizing or sponsoring relevant events.</li> <li>There's a lot more, and if you're still reading, then you should hop over to the blog and our tech blog.</li> </ul> <em>Busbud is committed to equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing its team members with a work environment free from discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Busbud are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, regardless of race, colour, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex, age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, pregnancy, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Learn more about why we care about diversity.</em>
Title: Developer - front-end

Job_Description: On behalf of our client, Affinity Staffing is looking for a highly motivated Software Engineer with a proven knowledge of design patterns and Software Engineering techniques. <br/><br/> If you like working in a small and fun start-up environment, take full ownership and responsibility to deliver tangible results, this is the right place for you! We are looking for a Senior (5 to 7+ years) .NET/C# Developer, to join the engineering team. You will design, develop, and maintain the APIs and Hosted Application. Our current development stack is:   <ul> <li>.NET/C#, ASP.NET MVC and WebAPI for backend services and web development</li>  <li>HTML5, CSS3, AngularJS, ReactJS and Gulp automation for frontend development</li>  <li>Microsoft Azure as a cloud platform</li>  <li>Mix of SQL and NoSQL for database (MS SQL Server, Redis, Azure Table/Blob storage, MongoDB)</li> </ul>  This is a young, fast moving company so it is essential that you have a can-do, entrepreneurial spirit - ideas are good but execution is better (especially when its executing on good ideas)! We are a small team, we are good at what we do and we like working together. You will have autonomy and respect from day one. Learning and keeping abreast of new technology and sharing with the rest of the team are activities we all enjoy and encourage. <br/><br/> <u>Skills & Requirements</u>   <ul> <li>University Degree in Computer Science/Engineering</li>  <li>Minimum 5 years of experience in C# programming</li>  <li>Minimum 4 years of development experience with ASP.NET Web API, JavaScript, jQuery, Ajax, CSS, DHTML, T-SQL</li>  <li>Solid understanding and experience using both relational (MS SQL) and NoSQL data stores (Mongo, Redis), cloud platforms (Microsoft Azure, Amazon AWS)</li>  <li>Proven mentorship and knowledge transfer ability</li>  <li>Ability to multitask and prioritize multiple concurrent assignments</li>  <li>Ability to learn quickly and effectively apply new knowledge</li> </ul>
Title: .NET Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: At Dealflo, we are revolutionizing how businesses and consumers execute financial transactions. Whether you’re buying a car, opening a bank account, getting a mortgage, or insuring your home, we’re here in real-time to make the entire online transaction secure, reliable, and enjoyable. <br/><br/> Our Financial Agreements Automation Platform enables our customers to securely verify electronic identities, seamlessly apply electronic signatures, and reliably ensure regulatory compliance. Our customers are among the world’s largest financial institutions and global enterprises, and Deloitte Technology Fast 50 recognized us as one of the fastest growing technology companies in the UK and Europe. <br/><br/> We are now looking for a <strong>Senior Full Stack Developer</strong> to join our Professional Services team in Montreal. <br/><br/> If you thrive on challenges and seek growth, then we want YOU on our Product Team! Our environment is built on trust, openness, and growth. We offer great benefits, excellent health insurance, flexible hours and work-from-home, a wonderful RRSP program, and a fantastic vacation package. <br/><br/> Day to day, you will… <ul>  <li>Evolve and enhance our current production SaaS application running on the AWS cloud</li> <li>Participate in the analysis, elaboration, and estimation of customer requirements and specifications</li> <li>Design, develop, and deploy new production-quality frontend and backend features and functionality that meet customer requirements</li> <li>Educate, guide, and interact with our customers’ technical staff throughout their development and integration efforts</li> <li>Perform design and code reviews, assist with refactoring, and provide guidance and mentoring to other developers</li> <li>Collaborate with application support to analyze, troubleshoot, reproduce, and resolve production issues reported by customers</li> <li>Work with other team members on release planning and deployment activities</li> <li>Innovate and improve development and implementation processes and tools by advocating technologies and designs that promote efficiency, reliability, and reusability</li> <li>Be proactive, facilitate knowledge sharing, and continually improve our activities</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> To succeed, you have… <ul>  <li>Extensive experience in Core Java, J2EE, and Java frameworks such as Spring, Maven, and Hibernate</li> <li>Deep expertise in Web technologies including HTML, JavaScript, CSS, XSLT, REST, JSON, jQuery</li> <li>Experience in handling differences and limitations of various Web browsers</li></ul>   <ul>  <li>Deep understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX</li> <li>Experience using software best practices like Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Continuous Integration (CI)</li> <li>Strong debugging and analytical skills</li> <li>Knowledge of front-end tools such as Grunt, Gulp.js, AngularJS, and Bootstrap; relational databases and SQL; and cryptography and security</li> <li>Worked as part of Scrum teams or similar iterative Agile development methodologies</li> <li>Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in software engineering or computer science</li></ul>   <ul>  <li>Practiced continuous improvement and promoted knowledge sharing</li> <li>Strong organizational skills, capable of managing assigned tasks and meeting deadlines</li> <li>Excellent leadership, interpersonal, communication, collaboration, and writing skills</li> </ul> Come be part of a rapidly growing and exciting SaaS business on a mission to own the global Financial Transaction Management market. We have built the team with the passion, ambition, and experience to make it happen. <br/><br/> So, what are you waiting for? Apply now!
Title: Senior Full Stack Developer (Contract)

Job_Description: Software Engineer - Machine Learning<br/><br/>Join a smart, tight-knit development team and use your creativity and expertise to implement robust, high-performance services. You will participate constructively in requirements analysis and design discussions and collaborate closely with product management, architects, front-end developers and QA. -<br/><br/>Requirements:  <ul> <li>2+ years of meaningful industry experience</li><li>Ability to learn new technologies quickly and understand a wide variety of technical challenges to be solved</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills, both verbal and written.</li><li>Basic familiarity with JVM ecosystem</li><li>BS CS/EE or equivalent</li> </ul>  <strong>Additional Skills:</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience in one or more functional and/or statically typed programming languages (Scala, Java, Haskell, Erlang, OCaml, Lisp, etc.) is a HUGE plus.</li><li>Experience using Actor frameworks (Akka, Erlang) is also a HUGE plus.</li><li>Experience with Cloud technologies and Application monitoring tools is a plus.</li><li>Experience with working in a Hadoop/Cassandra like cluster environment is a plus</li> </ul>  <strong>What</strong> <strong>We</strong> <strong>Offer</strong> <strong>You:</strong>  <ul> <li>A constant stream of new things for you to learn. We're always expanding into new areas, bringing in open source projects and contributing back, and exploring new technologies.</li><li>A set of exceptionally talented and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering and QA to product management and customer support.</li><li>Breadth and depth. You want to work on an area that spans backend and frontend and SDKs? We have that. You want to go deep into optimizing how we compress data for fast random-access retrieval? We have that too, and more.</li><li>Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe mentors help both sides of the equation.</li><li>A stable, collaborative and supportive work environment.</li><li>We don't expect people to work 12 hour days. We want you to have a successful time outside of work too. Want to work from home sometimes? No problem. We trust our colleagues to be responsible with their time and dedication, and believe that balance helps cultivate a phenomenal environment.</li> </ul> We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status
Title: Software Engineer - Machine Learning

Job_Description: <strong>Everyday is a trip, your adventure starts here.</strong> <br/> <strong>Come fly with us!!!</strong><br/><br/><em>We are looking for a <strong>Front End Developer.</strong> Lets keep it simple: work closely with our team to develop features and maintain our FlightHub.com & JustFly.com websites in React.js.</em><em> <strong>We work fast and need our code to do the same.</strong></em> <br/><br/> We are a group of passionate people who work hard and move quickly in the goal of redefining the flight shopping experience for the entire world. We get high off seeing progress and we strive to be the best at what we do. Why just have a job when you can be a part of something bigger? <br/><br/> <strong>TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN THIS ROLE, YOU'LL NEED:</strong>  <ul> <li>2+ years of experience in front end development and integration projects</li> <li>Proficiency with React.js & SASS required</li>   <li>Experience working with REST APIs asynchronously from the frontend</li>   <li>Experience with HTML, CSS and JavaScript (jQuery) required</li> <li>Experience working in an Agile software development environment</li> <li>Experience with website conversion analysis and optimization</li>   <li>A solid understanding of modern PHP and OOP principles are considered an asset</li>  </ul> <strong>BENEFITS:</strong>  <ul> <li>Access to group insurance benefits, including health and dental</li> <li>Advanced, platform agnostic workstations (we are happy to provide you with your preferred hardware and operating system to help you do your best work)</li> <li>Generous subsidies for your monthly public transit passes and for a variety of electric/hybrid cars</li> <li>Free Starbucks or Café Depot coffee/tea and numerous company lunches and events</li> <li>Exceptional contribution towards fitness classes/ your personal gym OR a fully paid annual gym membership to GOLDS GYM located right next to our office (you can workout at lunch)</li> <li>A fully stocked kitchen with healthy yummy snacks</li> <li>Convenient location with free parking and easily accessible via public transit, also close to various restaurants and stores</li> <li>Positive and diverse work environment, with an outgoing and collaborative team</li> </ul> <strong>If you feel like this opportunity could be a great fit for you, click here for your one-way ticket!</strong> <br/><br/> <strong> IF YOU KNOW SOMEONE WHO COULD FIT THIS JOB DESCRIPTION, CHECK OUT OUR</strong> REFERRAL PROGRAM:) <br/><br/> <strong><em>(please note that additional responsibilities may apply)</em></strong>
Title: Front end Developer (React.js)

Job_Description: <strong>Who are we?</strong> <br/><br/> We are Canada's 11th, and North America's 52nd Fastest Growing Tech Company (PROFIT 500), and Canada's (#2) Best Place to Work (SMB, 2017). <br/><br/> At Unata, were shaping the future of the retail experience. We power digital experiences for some of North Americas most well-respected grocery chains. Our white-label platform powers award-winning e-commerce experiences, digital flyers and digital loyalty programs, allowing the retailer to automatically tailor each shoppers experience at an individual level so that they can deliver 1-to-1 personalized content and offers. <br/><br/> In other words, we enable customer experiences that make shopping easier and more personal, such as allowing shoppers to order their groceries online and pick up in-store / have them delivered, and allowing shoppers to receive a completely personalized version of the Flyer based on their purchase history. <br/><br/> We are one of Canada's 50 fastest growing companies, and were listed as one of Canada's top 20 most innovative companies. And we have no plans on slowing down! We are absolutely committed to continuous innovation, bringing together a team of Canadas brightest developers, designers, project managers and marketers. <br/><br/> Acquired by Instacart in 2018, Unata operates as a independent subsidiary headquartered in Toronto, Canada. With over 75 employees and plans to keep growing, our team includes some of the best, brightest and most driven minds from across the world in systems integrations, software development, data science, product management, design, and customer success. Weve joined forces to provide the most comprehensive, innovative digital grocery solution in the industry. Want to join a talented team of people changing the way the world grocery shops? Visit www.unata.com/careers/. To learn more about our parent, please visit www.instacart.com. <br/><br/> Want to be part of the future of retail? Wed love to hear from you! <br/><br/> <strong>Why This Opportunity is Cool</strong> <br/><br/> The Frontend Team is responsible for building our platform's core platform features. Our product roadmap is full of challenging projects that require innovative engineering solutions. Alongside a team of designers, engineers and data scientists, youll be building scalable and robust distributed systems that power the best digital grocery experience in the market. <br/><br/> <strong>Our Best Frontend Engineers</strong>  <ul> <li>Have a degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, etc.</li> <li>Have a strong knowledge of JavaScript, CSS and HTML, and interacting with REST­ful APIs. You have used or can easily learn Angular.</li> <li>Bring deep hands-on experience building large, modular client­-side apps using MVC style frameworks like AngularJs/Angular, React, Vue.js and Ember.js. You take a fast moving, iterative approach to development.</li> <li>Desire to constantly evolve their tools and methods; and pursue best practices and work towards incorporating new advances.</li> <li>Are enthusiastic and energetic, striving daily for new heights and making an impact.</li> <li>Continually create side projects and open source code you are proud of.</li> <li>Are comfortable writing performant client side code & crafting a fast UI.</li> <li>Have an eye for design and usability and experience building mobile web applications</li> <li>Have some experience building mobile applications either native, or using web frameworks</li> <li>Have excellent written and verbal communication skills; are open to feedback and able to provide constructive criticism fairly and are comfortable speaking to internal and external clients at any level.</li> </ul> <strong>What This Opportunity Gives You</strong>  <ul> <li>The chance to help shape the technical future of our product as we scale to scores of retail partners and millions of users</li> <li>Learn and work with technologies like JavaScript, Angular, React, HTML, CSS, and more!</li> <li>Participation in daily stand-up (providing a status of work completed and in-progress), team sprint planning and solution design meetings; as well as in all aspects of software development including design, implementation, and deployment</li> <li>Present work performed to other team members for constructive review. Communicating design decisions and solutions to other teams in the form of tech circles in effort of improving awareness, and soliciting feedback and buy in on approach.</li> <li>Provide retrospective feedback for failures and errors in development and/or processes.</li> <li>Ensure development practices and process is followed along with compliance to company standards.</li> <li>The opportunity to mentor junior engineers via pairing, design review, participation in code reviews to help maintain best practices.</li> <li>Take initiative to identify and solve important problems, coordinating with others on cross-cutting technical issues</li> <li>Time to attend various developer conferences, like PyCon, where our Team is regularly selected to present</li> <li>A dedicated team filled with people that want to make an impact - this aint no another-day-another-dollar gig!</li> <li>A working environment where your opinions are valued</li> <li>A place within a company that appreciates learning new technologies and implementing them when they make sense</li> <li> and more!</li> </ul> <strong>What Are You Waiting For?</strong> <br/><br/> Apply today with a copy of your resume, and let us know why you're a great fit for the position!
Title: Software Engineer (Front End)

Job_Description: <strong>Global Financial Client in Montreal, QC <br/> 12+ Months Contract <br/> Web Application Developer with Angular 2+ (2/3/4/5)</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Technology Team Profile</strong> <br/> Technology works as a strategic partner with Brokerage business units and the world's leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global, complex, and dynamic financial markets. Brokerage's sizeable investment in technology results in quantitative trading systems, cutting-edge modelling and simulation software, comprehensive risk and security systems, and robust client-relationship capabilities, plus the worldwide infrastructure that forms the backbone of these systems and tools. Our insights, our applications and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients' businesses—and to our own. <br/><br/> Enterprise Infrastructure (EI) is responsible for delivering essential technology infrastructure solutions to Brokerage's businesses. EI manages the production, operations, and engineering of our data centers, voice and data networking solutions, mainframe servers and databases, distributed computing, wireless technologies, and associated end user capabilities. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Description:</strong> <br/> Enterprise Reporting Framework (ERF) is a critical reporting system which provides both highly concurrent adhoc / ondemand reporting and batch reporting capability as well as reporting workflow monitoring tools. It generates 20k custom reports for 16900 Wealth Management FAs very day, and it generates 2 million quarterly reports in 4 days. <br/><br/> The candidate will part of Montreal based development team and will be involved in development and maintenance of various distributed frontend/backend systems including middleware components, web, and infrastructure components.   <ul> <li>Design & implement distributed applications, enhance and support existing systems.</li> <li>Utilize strong object oriented design (OOD), algorithms & programming skills to implement distributed systems of multi-tier architecture.</li> <li>Work closely with internal, external clients and users to deliver solutions.</li> <li>Will have the opportunity to participate in system integration efforts and requirements gathering for projects involving multiple teams and systems.</li> </ul>  In addition to this, candidate will also work on various integration/special projects that involves working with different business units like Wealth Management, and Investment Management etc. The team also works on technical R&D and cutting-edge solutions to improve performance & scale and for integrating new products and technologies in our system. <br/><br/> <strong>Skills Required:</strong>   <ul> <li>Strong programming skills in HTML, Angular 2+, JavaScript with 4+ years of experience.</li> <li>Experience developing distributed, performance-critical, highly available, or large-scale systems</li> <li>Experience building Web applications in Multithreading, Web Services for a Unix/Linux platform</li> <li>Experience working with Source Code Management solutions like (ex. Perforce, Git, CVS)</li> <li>Experience testing software (e.g. Unit testing, performance testing/tuning)</li> <li>Good troubleshooting and problem solving skills</li> <li>Good verbal and written communication skills</li> <li>A Team Player</li> </ul>  <strong>Skills Desired:</strong>   <ul> <li>Experience working with the Spring framework</li> <li>Experience in either Eclipse IDE or IntelliJ</li> </ul>
Title: Web Application Developer

Job_Description: Job Summary & Responsibilities<div> <div>You will design, develop <br/> and evolve end-to-end cloud services <br/> used to monitor and control some motorized vehicle behaviors. The end-to-end system is composed <br/> of in-car devices, <br/> smartphone & web apps, and backend <br/> systems. Your server-side developer background will help you guide the overall <br/> system architecture as well as actively <br/> develop the backend, and interact with <br/> the frontend team. <br/><br/> Your main responsibilities will be:<br/><br/>1.  <br/> Project and Process Management<br/><br/>-  <br/> Collaborate with other team members, with <br/> Product Owners, work closely with <br/> other functional groups (Mobile, <br/> Interface, Embedded, Test, <br/> IT Team and <br/> Marketing) and outsourced <br/> partners when required <br/><br/> -  <br/> Participate in project management by helping others <br/> understand the possibilities of server-side, assisting with <br/> backend system architecture, and defining your <br/> tasks as driven by user stories, <br/> and progress tracking. <br/><br/> -  <br/> Participate in the consolidation, the follow-up, the prioritization and the scheduling of product requirements and bug fixing <br/> implementation. <br/><br/> -  <br/> Work in an Agile-Scrum environment <br/><br/> -  <br/> Communicate technical issues and project <br/> details to peers <br/> and management team<br/><br/>2.  <br/> Technical - Development of software solutions<br/><br/>-  <br/> Map detailed business requirements into software solutions <br/><br/> -  <br/> Guide the system architecture <br/> roadmap, the specifications and the key technical decision <br/><br/> -  <br/> Ensure that feature ease-of-use, ease-of-support, robustness, scalability and security are always key ingredients in the recommended design solutions <br/><br/> -  <br/> Actively participate in <br/> development and coding, namely at the server-side level (backend) <br/><br/> -  <br/> Promote the software best <br/> practice, i.e. test-driven development, continuous integration, and continuous deployment culture</div>  <br/>Qualifications:<br/><br/>-  <br/> Bachelors degree <br/> in computer science <br/> or equivalent <br/><br/> -  <br/> 10 years + of professional experience in server-side software <br/> development <br/><br/> -  <br/> Experience in Client-server architecture development <br/><br/> -  <br/> Experience with Java based technologies <br/><br/> -  <br/> Micro service architectures including <br/> Spring Boot, Spring <br/> REST & JPA <br/><br/> -  <br/> Experience in design of systems using web services (REST, SOAP, XML/JSON) <br/><br/> -  <br/> Experience with service oriented <br/> architecture (SOA) <br/><br/> -  <br/> Excellent communication verbal/written skills (English <br/> and French)<br/><br/>Pluses:<br/><br/>-  <br/> Integration of 24/7 high-availability telematics service (backend <br/> and presentation) <br/><br/> -  <br/> Vehicle <br/> telematics messaging platform experience (GPS message processing, alert processing, OTA device configuration) <br/><br/> - At least one of the following : <br/><br/> o  <br/> MVNO or telecom carrier <br/> network integration <br/><br/> o  <br/> high volume message processing - Kafka, JMS, ActiveMQ, Camel <br/><br/> o  <br/> NoSQL based message storage   <ul> <li>NoSQL, MongoDB,</li> </ul>  DynamoDB, Cassandra <br/><br/> o  <br/> message processing, search and analytics - Elasticsearch, Hadoop <br/> Ecosystem <br/><br/> -  <br/> Experience with Amazon Web Services technologies including EC2, ECS, RDS, <br/> DynamoDB, CloudWatch <br/><br/> -  <br/> Experience with Docker application deployment and container <br/> management <br/><br/> -  <br/> Experience with Linux <br/><br/> -  <br/> Knowledge of Target Process <br/> or Jira, Confluence, SVN/Git, Jenkins <br/><br/> -  <br/> Experience with <br/> Microsoft technologies (ASP.NET, IIS, C#, Visual <br/> Studio, MSSQL, etc.)</div> <br/>
Title: Senior Back End Developer

Job_Description: @font-face {} @font-face {} p.MsoNormal, li.MsoNormal, div.MsoNormal {  margin: 0cm;  font-size: 12pt;  font-family: "Calibri", sans-serif } .MsoChpDefault {  font-family: "Calibri", sans-serif } div.WordSection1 {  page: WordSection1 }        <p>Do you want to work on state of the art vehicle and IoT solutions? Join our client and be part of the adventure as a server-side (backend) development team! They are developing cloud services for both web and mobile front ends, as well as generating hardware interactions from the backend to a fleet of cloud-connected cars. They are aficionados of Agile, test-driven development and CI with an eye to CD. The software group is big on continuous improvement.</p>  <p> </p>  <p>Reporting to the Director of Engineering Software Development, you will design, develop and evolve end-to-end cloud services used to monitor and control some motorized vehicle behaviors. The end-to-end system is composed of in-car devices, smartphone & web apps, and backend systems. Your server-side developer background will help you guide the overall system architecture as well as actively develop the backend and interact with the frontend team.</p>  <p> </p>  <p><b><u>Qualifications:</u></b></p>  <p></p><ul><li>Bachelors degree in computer science or equivalent</li><li>10 years + of professional experience in server-side software development</li><li>Experience in Client-server architecture development</li><li>Experience with Java based technologies</li><li>Micro service architectures including Spring Boot, Spring REST & JPA</li><li>Experience in design of systems using web services (REST, SOAP, XML/JSON)</li><li>Experience with service-oriented architecture (SOA)</li><li>Excellent communication verbal/written skills (English and French)</li></ul><p></p>                <p> </p>  <p><b><u>Pluses:</u></b></p>  <p></p><ul><li>Integration of 24/7 high-availability telematics service (backend and presentation)</li><li>Vehicle telematics messaging platform experience (GPS message processing, alert processing, OTA device configuration)</li><li>At least one of the following:</li><ul><li>MVNO or telecom carrier network integration</li><li>High volume message processing - Kafka, JMS, ActiveMQ, Camel</li><li>NoSQL based message storage - NoSQL, MongoDB, DynamoDB, Cassandra o message processing, search and analytics - Elasticsearch, Hadoop Ecosystem</li></ul><li>Experience with Amazon Web Services technologies including EC2, ECS, RDS, DynamoDB, CloudWatch</li><li>Experience with Docker application deployment and container management</li><li>Experience with Linux</li><li>Knowledge of Target Process or Jira, Confluence, SVN/Git, Jenkins</li><li>Experience with Microsoft technologies (ASP.NET, IIS, C#, Visual Studio, MSSQL, etc.)</li></ul><p></p>  <p><b><u>Strengths and skills:</u></b></p>  <p></p><ul><li>Proactive</li><li>Result-oriented</li><li>Organized, methodical</li><li>Works well under pressure</li><li>Strong analytical skills, system approach;</li><li>Ability to focus on established priorities;</li><li>Ability to troubleshoot, test-driven approaches/methodologies;</li><li>Enjoy working as part of a dynamic team</li><li>Ability to suggest/present solution approaches and reach consensus when needed;</li><li>Attention to detail</li><li>Able to interface with 3rd party development partners and directly with the customer technical contacts for specifications, testing, integration challenges</li></ul><p></p>
Title: Sr. Backend Developer

Job_Description: *Multiple Openings*  Sitecore is the global leader in experience management software that enables context marketing. The Sitecore® Experience Platform™ manages content, supplies contextual intelligence, automates communications, and enables personalized commerce, at scale. It empowers marketers to deliver content in context of how customers have engaged with their brand, across every channel, in real time—before, during, and after a sale. More than 4,900 brands––including American Express, Carnival Cruise Lines, easyJet, and L’Oréal–– have trusted Sitecore for context marketing to deliver the personalized interactions that delight audiences, build loyalty, and drive revenue.  As a Software Engineer, you will be a member of the Product Support Services Team, responsible for assisting Sitecore’s implementation partners with best practices guidance, troubleshooting complex customizations, reverse engineering, and significantly contribute towards ramping up and developing the team in the first year. Sitecore implementations are handled by their network of partners. Because of the complex nature of Sitecore’s products, their partners often need assistance in mapping customer requirements to implementation best practices. The Software Engineer will work with partners to understand customer requirements and determine the proper implementation approach. In addition, the Software Engineer may troubleshoot implementations that are experiencing complex performance or functional issues. Ultimately, the Software Engineer solves problems that developer cannot solve. Sitecore will provide all necessary training on the Sitecore system. You will work with a team of business people and technologists who are smart, experienced and great fun to be around. Ideal candidates will have the following background: Experience in Microsoft technology platform, including: NET web applications C# Visual Studio SQL Server IIS Outstanding problem solving and logical thinking skills NET programming experience, including experience with 3rd-party APIs Experience working with data structures and creating software algorithms Experience defining solution architectures (software or physical) Experience troubleshooting complex software development projects Great communication skills in English Experience in the following would be a plus: Experience in frontend technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS Experience configuring load balancers and other network equipment Experience configuring Windows-based servers No travel required. This position is located in Gatineau.  Sitecore is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity without unlawful regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other local legally protected characteristic.
Title: Software Engineer, Product Support

Job_Description: Job Description: We are seeking a self-motivated Junior Software Developer to aid in the scale up of our technology platform.
