Job_Description: Contobox (a Crucial Interactive company) is looking for a junior-to-intermediate front-end developer to work on our proprietary user engagement advertising platform. About the job We developed an audience engagement platform entirely from scratch to dynamically generate and deliver billions of award-winning interactive ad units to users in milliseconds. Each ad unit is like a unique web app full of interactive tools, games, widgets, and functionalities, so the code we develop needs to be fast, lightweight, efficient, and result in a great experience to users. To make that happen, we built our platform using vanilla JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 on the front-end and we powered it with GoLang, MySQL, and Redshift on the back-end. We are also developing a new self-serve platform allowing our clients to launch new campaigns, analyze their performance and manage audience data. This platform is powered by React on the frontend and GoLang on the backend, and it is integrated with Data Management Platforms. If you are passionate about new technologies and building web apps, we'd be more than happy to invite you to be part of our team. We look forward to working together to bring our platform to the next level. Here are some of the things we'll be doing together: Working with plain JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, and Canvas to build beautiful UX interfaces and interactive ad units (that's right, no third party libraries and frameworks), Improving mechanisms for tracking end user's actions across all components in cross-platform environments, Working with the back-end team to use internal APIs and REST services for enhancing the functionality of front-end interfaces, Developing a web application platform with a diverse set of components and functionalities. About us Put simply, we make HTML5-enriched ads—no pop-ups, pop-unders, or spam—that inform people about product without disrupting their online flow. More specifically, Contobox is a premium digital media and technology company, specializing in digital advertising innovation and audience engagement. Our platform dynamically delivers high impact ads with unlimited content across multiple platforms (desktop, tablet, mobile) creating effective advertising that increases relevancy and engagement for the consumer, while improving campaign performance for the advertiser. We are a team of young and dynamic professionals, but you don't have to be. If you enjoy fast-paced, creative, and exciting work in an environment where effort is recognized and rewarded, this is the company for you. We are committed to assisting all of our team members in their professional growth.  Requirements Qualifications At least 2 years experience working in an information technology or online advertising company, Thorough knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, and JS (ES6 a plus but not required), Familiarity with CSS3 animations and JS animations (no libraries), Can integrate / build front-end client applications with REST APIs, Can identify and solve tough problems quickly since this is a fast paced environment. Assets Has worked on web apps, online tools and services, html5 games, etc. (a big plus), Can code without libraries (no jQuery, no React, no Angular, just plain JS / ES6), Can work directly with HTML5 canvas, Familiarity with React is a plus but not at all required, Has worked using a cloud environment (AWS, NGINX, Linux), Has a passion for software engineering best practices (e.g. unit testing, code reviews, simplicity, etc.), Access to past work is always a plus (public websites, github profile, portfolio site, etc.). Benefits Highly competitive medical & dental coverage, Annual personal spending budget which can be applied towards a gym membership, classes, or other personal development initiatives, Bright open office space that faces Saint-Laurent Boulevard and gets tons of sunlight year-round, Regular health and wellness activities (in-office massages, yoga classes, soccer games, etc.), In-office ping-pong table, xbox, TVs, movie screenings, Coffee, tea, drinks & snacks provided by the company, Monthly team lunches provided by the company, Group outings (go-karting, bowling, movies, etc.).

Title: Front-end Developer

Job_Description: Sitecore is the global leader in experience management software that combines content management, commerce, and customer insights. The Sitecore Experience Cloud™ empowers marketers to deliver personalized content in real time and at scale across every channel—before, during, and after a sale. More than 5,200 brands—including American Express, Carnival Cruise Lines, Dow Chemical, and L’Oréal—have trusted Sitecore to deliver the personalized interactions that delight audiences, build loyalty, and drive revenue.  Sitecore is experiencing spectacular growth all over the world. To build on Sitecore’s success and growth, we’re looking for a skilled Senior Software Developer.  Position Summary: As a Senior Sitecore Developer, you will be building cutting-edge demo applications for the Sitecore platform. The demo applications will best help our Sellers and Solution Engineers showcase the value of Sitecore’s solutions that result in customer wins and competitive defeats.  The position requires building upon a foundational architecture as well as adding key consumption based services to the Sitecore Experience Platform and Sitecore Experience Commerce.  This is a highly critical role that provides excellent experience across a range of skills: you will work with all the latest Sitecore technologies and solutions, hone your problem-solving skills, learn the strategy of delivering features against schedules and interface with our Product Marketing teams and global Sales and SE teams to most effectively help understand and represent the “Best of Sitecore” in our demos.  In summary, the demo platform you help build is what Customers will see and experience in their purchasing decision – and we want first impressions to be winning ones!  Responsibilities:  Understand and prioritize product marketing and SE requirements to help tell the best story in use cases within the demo Help develop, deliver and stage for deployment on VM’s as well as Azure Cloud – or other creative delivery platforms to make demonstrating our solutions as easy and fail-safe as possible Participate in requirements and backlog refinement Write clean, scalable .NET code following the Helix principles and SXA best practices Provide architectural, development and platform guidance to other team members Provide support for the application to internal and external stakeholders Troubleshoot problems and fix bugs Review and manage the quality of code Help assist field Solution Engineers Make the demo scalable and usable for Partners  Job Qualifications:  Strong organizational skills Strong Sitecore 8.x + and/or 9.x Development or Architecture skills mandatory Knowledge of C#, HTML5, CSS3 – JSS a plus Strong understanding of virtual machine and Azure Understanding of Agile methodologies Ability to manage conflicting priorities Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills Creative problem solving College degree in Software Engineering, IT, DevOps or Computer Programming  Highly Desired: Experience with Frontend Technologies (Bootstrap, Angular, JQuery, etc)  Experience with continuous integration environments like VSTS PowerShell experience  Sitecore is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity without unlawful regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other local legally protected characteristic.
Title: Senior Software Developer – Demo Strategy & Delivery

Job_Description: We are currently looking for a .NET Developer based in Montreal for one of our clients.  The main responsibilities of this role are: Use Agile engineering practices and various software and web development technologies to rapidly develop creative and efficient solutions that enhance the client customer and employee experience; Collaborate with other team members to craft clear user stories, design tests for prototypes and products, and continuously deliver product enhancements; Communicate with IT teams about any Digital innovations that are tying into bedrock IT systems; Communicate with business stakeholders about Agile processes to set and manage expectations about delivery methods and timelines; Contribute across the full technology stack, from database and DevOps infrastructure that supports continuous deployment, over native apps, to front end development; Work in a cross-functional team with the Product Owner, Designers and Lead Developer to co-develop the digital products.  The ideal applicant has the following skills: At least 5 years of software development experience working in Agile teams; Excellent programming skills in at least one modern programming language/framework, such as Node.JS, Ruby on Rails, C#, ASP .NET, Python; Experience and working knowledge of HTML/CSS, and a modern frontend JavaScript framework, such as ReactJS, AngularJS, EmberJS, Vue.js; Working knowledge of SQL and one common database technology, such as SQL Server, MySQL, MongoDB; Real passion for development and a demonstrated appetite for continual learning; Knowledge of pair programming, continuous integration and test-driven development; Experience with at least one unit testing framework, such as Mocha, RSpec; Familiarity with the concepts of Functional Programming and Microservices (asset); Community contributions (e.g., open source work, publishing /speaking on technical ideas) (asset). Job_Description: Développeur Junior de logiciels Backend Vous désirez travailler sur des solutions automobiles et IoT (Internet des objets) ? Joignez-vous à nous pour faire partie de l'aventure en tant que Développeur Junior Backend ! Nous développons des services-nuages pour le frontend web et mobile, en plus de générer des interactions hardware du backend à une flotte de voitures connectés au Cloud. Dans un environnement en mode Agile, axé sur les tests et le développement, l’équipe logiciel est forte sur l’évolution continuelle. Relevant au Directeur de l’ingénierie – Développement logiciel, vous serez responsable de concevoir, développer et faire évoluer les services-nuages complets utilisés pour surveiller et contrôler les comportements des véhicules. Le système complet est composé d’équipements spécialisés dans les automobiles, d’applications mobiles et web et de systèmes backend. Votre expérience coté-serveur comme développeur vous aidera à guider l'architecture globale du système, en plus d’être un membre actif dans le développement du back-end et pour interagir avec l’équipe front-end. Vos principales responsabilités seront : Gestion de Projets et de Processus Collaborer avec les autres membres de l’équipe, les clients, les autres équipes travail (Mobile, Interface, Embedded, Test, TI, et Marketing) et des partenaires externes lorsque requis Participer à la gestion de projet en aidant les autres à comprendre les différentes possibilités coté-serveur, en assistant au niveau de l’architecture du système back-end, et en définissant les tâches selon l’historique des utilisateurs et le suivi du progrès. Participer à la consolidation, le suivi, la priorisation, la planification des exigences du produit et à la correction des bugs. Maintenir la philosophie de l’amélioration continuelle Travailler dans un environnement Agile Communiquer les problèmes techniques et les détails du projet à ses pairs et à l’équipe de la direction Technique – Développement des solutions logicielles Cartographier les exigences détaillées en solutions logicielles Guider la feuille de route de l'architecture du système, les spécifications et la décision technique clé Assurer la facilité d'utilisation, la facilité de support, la robustesse, l'évolution et la sécurité des fonctionnalités : des éléments clés pour les solutions de conception recommandées Participer activement au développement et au codage de la solution logicielle, notamment au niveau du serveur backend Promouvoir les meilleures pratiques logicielles (ex : développement des tests, intégration continuelle et déploiement continuel de la culture Qualifications : Baccalauréat en génie informatique ou l'équivalent Trois (3) ans d'expérience dans le développement de logiciels côté serveur Expérience dans le développement d'architecture client-serveur Expérience avec les technologies basées sur Java Expérience avec les microarchitectures, y compris Spring Boot, Spring REST et JPA Expérience en développement d'applications Web avec Angular 2+ Expérience en conception de systèmes utilisant des services web (REST, SOAP, XML / JSON) Expérience en SOA Excellentes aptitudes en communication orale et écrite (anglais et français) Atouts : Intégration des services télématiques 24X7 haute disponibilité (backend et présentation) Expérience de la plate-forme de messagerie télématique de véhicules (traitement des messages GPS, traitement des alertes, configuration de l'appareil OTA) Expérience avec au moins un des éléments suivants: Intégration de réseaux MVNO ou télécoms Traitement de messages à volume élevé - Kafka, JMS, ActiveMQ, Camel Stockage de messages basé sur NoSQL - NoSQL, MongoDB, DynamoDB, Cassandr Expérience en traitement des messages, recherche et analyse - Elasticsearch, Hadoop Ecosystem Expérience avec les Technologies Amazon Web Services incluant EC2, ECS, RDS, DynamoDB, CloudWatch Expérience en déploiement de l'application Docker et gestion du contenu Connaissance de ces outils: Target Process ou Jira, Confluence, SVN / Git, Jenkins Expérience avec les technologies Microsoft (ASP.NET, IIS, C #, Visual Studio, MSSQL, etc.) Expérience avec Linux Compétences : Proactif Axé sur les résultats Organisé, méthodique Capacité à travailler sous pression Solides compétences analytiques, approche systémique Capacité à garder le focus et prioriser Capacité à troubleshooting, tester les approches / méthodologies Aimer travailler au sein d'une équipe dynamique Capacité de proposer / présenter des solutions et d'atteindre un consensus en cas de besoin Attentif aux détails Capacité à interagir avec des partenaires de développement et directement avec les contacts techniques du client pour les spécifications, les tests, les défis d'intégration Junior Backend Software Developer Do you want to work on state of the art vehicle and IoT solutions? Join us and be part of the adventure as a server-side (backend) development team! We are developing cloud services for both web and mobile front ends, as well as generating hardware interactions from the backend to a fleet of cloud-connected cars. We are aficionados of Agile, test-driven development and CI with an eye to CD. The software group is big on continuous improvement. Reporting to the Director of Engineering Software Development, you will design, develop and evolve end-to-end cloud services used to monitor and control some motorized vehicle behaviors. The end-to-end system is composed of in-car devices, smartphone & web apps, and backend systems. Your server-side developer background will help you guide the overall system architecture as well as actively develop the backend, and interact with the frontend team. Your main responsibilities will be: Project and Process Management Collaborate with other team members, with Product Owners, work closely with other functional groups (Mobile, Interface, Embedded, Test, IT Team and Marketing) and outsourced partners when required Participate in project management by helping others understand the possibilities of server-side, assisting with backend system architecture, and defining your tasks as driven by user stories, and progress tracking. Participate in the consolidation, the follow-up, the prioritization and the scheduling of product requirements and bug fixing implementation. Live the Continuous Improvement philosophy. Work in an Agile-Scrum environment Communicate technical issues and project details to peers and management team Technical - Development of software solutions Map detailed business requirements into software solutions Guide the system architecture roadmap, the specifications and the key technical decision Ensure that feature ease-of-use, ease-of-support, robustness, scalability and security are always key ingredients in the recommended design solutions Actively participate in development and coding, namely at the server-side level (backend) Promote the software best practice, i.e. test-driven development, continuous integration, and continuous deployment culture Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent 3 years + of professional experience in server-side software development Experience in Client-server architecture development Experience with Java based technologies Micro service architectures including Spring Boot, Spring REST & JPA Experience in design of systems using web services (REST, SOAP, XML/JSON) Experience with service oriented architecture (SOA) Excellent communication verbal/written skills (English and French) Pluses: Integration of 24/7 high-availability telematics service (backend and presentation) Vehicle telematics messaging platform experience (GPS message processing, alert processing, OTA device configuration) At least one of the following : MVNO or telecom carrier network integration high volume message processing - Kafka, JMS, ActiveMQ, Camel NoSQL based message storage - NoSQL, MongoDB, DynamoDB, Cassandra message processing, search and analytics - Elasticsearch, Hadoop Ecosystem Experience with Amazon Web Services technologies including EC2, ECS, RDS, DynamoDB, CloudWatch Experience with Docker application deployment and container management Experience with Linux Knowledge of Target Process or Jira, Confluence, SVN/Git, Jenkins Experience with Microsoft technologies (ASP.NET, IIS, C#, Visual Studio, MSSQL, etc.) Strengths and skills: Proactive Result-oriented Organized, methodical Works well under pressure Strong analytical skills, system approach; Ability to focus on established priorities; Ability to troubleshoot, test-driven approaches/methodologies; Enjoy working as part of a dynamic team Ability to suggest/present solution approaches and reach consensus when needed; Attention to detail Able to interface with 3rd party development partners and directly with the customer technical contacts for specifications, testing, integration challenges
Title: Développeur Jr Backend Developer

Job_Description: Unhaggle is currently the #1 web portal in Canada for new car buying. The data we provide powers our own tools and products, including our flagship consumer car buying service at Unhaggle.com and leading automotive portals including Yahoo Autos, MSN Autos, Autofocus, AutoGuide, Globe Drive, and others. We have also recently partnered with auto makers to launch a large eCommerce platform allowing the complete purchase of new cars online.  We are looking for Senior Front-end Developers with experience in web application development. This is a full-time remote position, we accept applications from anywhere in the world.  We use GitHub to manage tasks and code reviews as well as tools/services like Travis-CI, Docker, New Relic, Sentry, Browserstack, Stripe, Twilio, Solr and Redis. Our dev team is regularly connected in Slack for communication. We are constantly seeking the best tools available for our development team.  You will be primarily involved in the following projects/areas: Our new eCommerce platform for new car buying, serving major car brandsOur web portal unhaggle.comSeveral web products we built for Enterprise clients.Widgets we built for third-party integration, they run in some of the most popular auto websites in Canada.We take quality seriously and you should expect to be involved in well written code bases following industry standards and good software development practices.  Requirements: At least 3 years of Javascript professional experience.Strong web development experience: we expect that you know XHTML, CSS and Javascript well. Hands on experience with Javascript frameworks is a big plusProficient and hands on experience with responsive web sites, including the Bootstrap library.You care about writing semantic well formed code and paying attention to standards and good practices.Experience using version control software, Git is a plus.Track record of delivering completed projects, preferably web-based.Easy-going personality. You will actively participate in design discussions and code review.Any previous experience with Django or Django templates is a big plus.  Bonus: Some experience with Linux is a big plus. You will be asked to deploy changes to our dev machines that are based in Linux (Ubuntu server).Some experience with Python and/or experience with Django would be a big plus.  We are helping consumers to get the best price on new cars in Canada and changing the industry along the way. Working at Unhaggle brings unique challenges, you will have the opportunity to leave a large footprint and have real impact in the product we ship every day to our customers.  No relocation available, we are a distributed team.

Job_Description: Why join Irdeto?  We are on a mission! A mission to secure the world’s digital platforms. Why? Because a secure platform allows our clients to produce and deliver great content. In return, you can enjoy the latest blockbuster movies and your favorite live events at all times. It doesn’t stop at the media industry. Our security technology is also securing connected transport and IoT applications. We are innovative, international and part of Naspers, one of the largest technology investors in the world.  Cloakware™ Market Unit  Our mission is to become the number 1 software security provider on the planet in terms of usability, security and brand. That is why the Cloakware™ team is responsible for leveraging the world’s best software security to protect digital platforms. The team focuses on building, delivering and supporting Cloakware™ for automotive, payments and banking, games and future IoT markets.  We are currently seeking candidates with expertise in the broad area of programming languages technologies, including one or more of the following: compilers, interpreters, intermediate representations (IRs), source-to-source language transformations and compiler optimizations, type systems, the semantics of programming languages and static analysis such as data-flow analysis.  The ideal candidate will contribute to our High Assurance Software Protection Tools and Technologies including to our state of the art Obfuscation and Tamper proofing technology areas. While strong emphasis is put on correctness and reliability of the tools we will be developing, we also strive to build on top of our many years of industry-leading obfuscation, anti-tamper and white-box cryptography techniques.  Primary Responsibilities: Design, develop, verify and test, deploy, maintain and improve software. Perform various analysis and testing tasks to improve the correctness, performance and general quality of the tools products. Manage project deadlines and priorities in a self-directed fashion. Thoroughly document the research, architecture/design and implementations of solutions. Create and share ideas and knowledge by both speaking and writing through presentations and papers to internal technical staff and to external working groups and conferences.  Qualifications: Bachelor’s or Graduate degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, or related field.  Required Skills & Experience: Hands-on compiler and/or interpreter development experience. Knowledge of compiler backend technologies such as code generation, register allocation and loop transformations, etc. Knowledge of compiler frontend technologies such as parsers and parser generators and type checking Experience and programming skills in one or more of: C, C++, Java and knowledge of one or more of Haskell, OCaml, Scheme. Hands-on experience with low-level debugging Ability to read, understand and interpret language standards such as ISO/IEC 9899:2011 Knowledge of language semantics and formalisms is an important asset Knowledge of open source development including tooling such as Git, makefiles/make and CMake Extensive experience with design, development and debugging especially in a Linux environment Knowledge of intermediate representations especially with the LLVM framework and LLVM IR Clear, concise verbal, and written communication Have a strong sense of customer focus and teamwork Enjoy getting the job done; on time and to a high degree of quality  What do we offer you?  At Irdeto, we know that it is the people who make our company a success. We encourage personal and professional growth and success among our globally diverse workforce by offering:  Competitive remuneration and benefits Career and personal development opportunities Flexible working spaces in state of the art offices A focus on collaboration, creativity, health and happiness Working for a truly global company with offices in 15+ countries With nearly 50 successful years of business innovation behind us, Irdeto is a solid company to join. We are looking for people who are energetic, dynamic and driven to be part of our community.  Welcome to Irdeto!
Title: Compiler Developer - High Assurance Software Protection

Job_Description: Play a part in the next revolution in human-computer interaction, contributing to a product portfolio that is rethinking how people use Intelligent Interfaces to work @ work, and working with other designers and developers who want to build great products using the latest technology.  Responsibilities ----------------   Implementing features for the conversational user experience, across modalities (messaging, voice) and platforms (SMS, Google Assistant, Siri, Alexa, and more) Work on primarily frontend feature development as part of a small team, and able to participate in backend and platform activities where it make sense Prototyping ways to iteratively learn, optimize for growth, and improve the user experience Working on exciting Proof of Concept projects related to Conversational Agents (Alexa, Google Assistant, Cortana, etc.), Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, Augmented/Mixed/Virtual Reality, and more. Collaborating within a cross-functional team, helping to create elegant systems that maximize reuse across technologies Dogged focus on software quality, performance analysis, and system tuning where possible Applying lessons learned to other exciting client projects, and vice versa  Desired Skills & Experience   5+ years experience developing commercial shipping products BS or MS in Computer Science, equivalent degree and/or equivalent experience Experience with any of the following: distributed compute environments, application development, mobile development, big data analytics, cloud computing including virtualization, hosted services, multi tenant cloud infrastructures, storage systems and content delivery networks. Experience in writing software in one or more languages such as Javascript (React, Angular.js, Node.js), Python, Go, C++, Objective-C, Swift, Java, etc. Experience working in customer-facing technical roles. Development pipeline experience (Versioning, Automation, Testing, Continuous Integration, etc.) is an asset A well-trained eye for design, and the ability to collaborate with designers, are definite assets Familiarity with Unix, Speech Interfaces, AI/Machine Learning, and conversational UIs are assets Referenceable track record of positively impacting a team, and caring about your fellow human  Benefits & Perks   Explore ongoing opportunities for professional development: training, conferences, certifications, and in-house peer mentorship Experiment with new techniques, wear multiple hats, and learn about new disciplines. Our environment is not your average, hierarchical development shop: we emphasize accountability for outcomes, but autonomy in activities Pursue independent projects, explore new ideas, and challenge yourself to become a thought leader in your field with 5 days of dedicated “Awesome time” (self-directed professional development) annually and quarterly training budgets Enjoy a flexible schedule of full-time hours, health/dental benefits and private US coverage Work from a modern, ergonomic space complete with standing/sitting desks and an open-concept social atmosphere Additional perks based on employee feedback and interest, including in-house mindfulness training, yoga, group get-togethers and more!  About Myplanet  We’re a software studio with an integrated team of designers and developers. We make smarter interfaces for the world’s most influential companies by implementing leading software platforms from Acquia, IBM, and Salesforce to empower your employees and engage your customers. Headquartered in Toronto, with studio presence in Vancouver, Ukraine, and Chicago, we're a team of 90 designers, product managers & engineers hell-bent on making the workplace better.  A Commitment to an Inclusive Workplace  We are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment as we work to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live, including those with disabilities. We are dedicated to providing accommodations in all parts of the hiring process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.
Title: Full Stack Software Developer

Job_Description: Full Stack Software Developer (TOR0000CF) Primary Location : Canada-Ontario-Toronto Discipline : Information Technology Job Posting : 19-Mar-18  Excellence Leaves a Lasting Impression: Bring Your Vision to shape a better world. At Arup, our innovative spirit compels us to express our ingenuity in unique ways — engineering, planning, designing, and consulting on many of the most renowned projects in the built environment. We aim to deliver technical excellence, innovation, and value to clients, while maintaining our core mission of shaping a better world. The firm opened its first office over 70 years ago and now employs 13,000 people globally. Since its founding in 1946, members of Arup have developed transformative ways of working. Adapting to the ever changing environment, our work is focused on ambitiously reimagining a sustainable and resilient future for cities. Arup is rising to these new challenges: by bringing together broad-minded individuals from a wide range of disciplines, investing in research, innovating and creating better solutions for clients and the wider world.  We are currently seeking a Full Stack Developer in our Toronto office to work as part of a multidisciplinary team engaged in translating business requirements into bespoke software and cloud solutions for clients around the world.  Responsibilities: Being aligned with the responsibilities of the DevOps process, which includes designing, building, testing and deploying products, software solutions and services. Developing frontend interfaces, backend APIs, web maps and data visualizations. Interfacing with a broad user base to understand requirements and solicit feedback. Supporting continuous-integration and continuous-deployment pipelines on private on premise IT infrastructure and public cloud providers like Amazon AWS and Microsoft Azure. Identifying and architecting solutions that meet the stakeholder’s needs, preform requirements gathering workshops with stakeholders, extract user stories, and identify a minimum viable product that meets the client’s expectations. Product Management. Supervision of junior resources such as developers and interns. Maintaining the integrity of the code base through: Code reviews Version control Issue tracking Testing regimes Documentation Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical discipline. 5+ years of professional experience developing software. Strong, object-oriented design and coding skills. Strong knowledge of object oriented design and programming, Knowledge around GIS platforms will be advantageous. Ability to work independently and solve technical problems with little supervision; Strong communication & collaboration skills. Preferred experience with: Cloud (AWS/AZURE): Solution architecting DevOps Messaging and Queues Serverless functions and infrastructure Authentication and Authorization Role based permissions, IAM, service roles Frontend: Angular (v2+) and AngularJS (v1) React and Redux Typescript D3 Leaflet Backend: Django and Django REST Framework Numpy, SciPy, spaCy and Pandas NodeJS v8 and ES6 ExpressJS Databases: PostgreSQL and PostGIS MongoDB MySQL Cassandra Hadoop via Cloudera  Others will be advantageous: AGILE Jenkins Travis Visio/Lucidchart Bash Powershell Git Arduino, other microcontrollers and sensors  Share your passion and experience in a global culture that believes your potential to achieve is endless. This is your opportunity to shine.  Arup offers an outstanding benefits package including healthcare, GRRSP match, time off and profit share. Arup is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Job_Description: mnubo is a creative, fun and fast-growing big data and analytics company focused in the revolutionary space of the Internet of Things (IoT). mnubo’s IoT cloud SaaS platform transforms the way object manufacturers, enterprises and consumers interact with, and benefit from, connected smart objects. mnubo is building tremendous momentum in the IoT market and has received multiple awards and acquired a growing number of customers and partners. This is a great opportunity to join the booming market of the Internet of Things “IoT” and be part of a fast growing company that is on the leading edge of the industry.  We are located in the entrepreneurial and technology hub of Montreal in an open, loft-style office space; our highly talented team tackles difficult problems with innovative solutions and a great team-building attitude.  mnubo is looking for a talented Front End Developer to join the Data Visualization Team. The team constantly pushes the edge to deliver state to the art dashboards and analytics tools in a fast, agile environment deploying in production multiple times per day by trusting automated testing. Job Role and Responsibilities  Write web applications in TypeScript, HTML, CSS that are heavily dependent on AngularJS and Angular  Accountable for delivering assigned development tasks and take ownership in order to deliver on time  Translate provided designs and style guides into functional user interfaces, ensuring cross browser compatibility and performance  Scope and estimate the development and testing effort for user stories  Perform automated testing (Unit, Integration and End to End) within an iterative agile environment  Share knowledge with the team by participating in Code Reviews and Pair Programming.  Participate in all agile ceremonies (standups, planning, backlog refinement, reviews, retrospectives)  Perform installation, maintenance and debugging of operational infrastructure  Traits and Skills  Truly passionate about Front End development  A team player who is able to collaborate across teams (FrontEnd, BackEnd, DevOps)  Result oriented and positive attitude  Good analytical capabilities to debug existing code and write tests  Understand the user stories and their acceptance criteria  Great attention to detail  Basic Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in CS, related software engineering discipline or equivalent experience  2+ years of professional experience in Front End development with a modern framework (React, Angular, Vue, …).  Both French and English speaker.  Our Stack  Front End Framework: TypeScript, Webpack, AngularJS with ongoing migration to Angular  Backend: Scala with Play Framework v2 (some scripts in Node.JS) - Akka HTTP for internal services  CSS Layout: bootstrap v3  Testing: Karma, Protractor (looking into Pupeteer)  Data visualization: Highcharts, D3.js  Infrascture: Docker, Kubernetes, Ansible  Source Control: Git  Bug Tracking: JIRA

Job_Description: Our Web Developers work magic – building websites tailored to a wide variety of clients and markets. You will need to bring a creative edge as well as attention to detail and process to work while also delivering a highly functional finished online presence which reflects the brand identity of the client and meets the functional requirements of the website build. TrueCourse developers deliver fantastic looking, user friendly platforms which also work to drive the marketing strategy to targeted audiences. Don’t worry, we will share our marketing strategy with you!  The important stuff…  Education – We would love to see you have a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Web design/Digital Media or an equivalent experience although there are several different platforms, being fluent in WordPress is an asset, so we hope you have that down pat. If you are a whiz at all the others – bonus!  You must have a strong understanding of common CMS platforms and extensive experience in static and database-driven websites. You must be familiar setting up databases and writing backend code such as MySQL and PHP, and developing in frontend languages such as HTML, CSS and Javascript. You should also note we value someone who is able to think creatively as well as who is process-oriented – and if you’re a pro in the kitchen, we love homemade goodies too!

With clients in over 20 countries, Optix enables commercial real estate players, from coworking spaces to large enterprise organizations, to transform their workplace. Our vision is to change the way the world works and we're looking for talented people to join our team. In joining our team at this stage, you would play a critical role in taking our existing Web product to the next stage in its evolution. There is also an opportunity to grow into a leadership position as our team continues to grow. We have an ambitious roadmap that requires some serious problem-solving to reach our vision. Alongside our Designers and Android and iOS developers, you would be a key player in our team. Please note that we are also hiring for a experienced full-stack developer part-time or flexible hours. If this is of interest and you have 5+ years of experience, please visit this job posting. Who you are You have 3+ years of experience You're empathetic and can work both independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment You're able to clearly articulate your knowledge and reasoning to technical and non-technical team members You question the status quo, take ownership of your work, and proactively identify and address issues and opportunities You're comfortable jumping between the frontend and backend You insist on using great tools — you’re excited to work in an open environment where you and your colleagues embrace change and new resources in order to achieve the ultimate goal You test your code What you'll do Drive and help shape the technical direction of our core product features and functionality Work closely with our team of designers and developers to build exceptional features and experiences Document APIs and software you help build Perform scalability and performance enhancements Work with our support team to resolve customer issues and make product improvements What we are looking for in a successful candidate Excellent back-end or systems programming knowledge, we use PHP7 and MySQL but we’d love to also hear about your skills in other languages too You’ve worked with many of 3rd party libraries, open source projects, and API’s in the past and you understand the benefits and consequences of what they provide HTML, CSS and vanilla Javascript skills, preferably with some experience on large SPA’s especially AngularJS and scaling complex responsive layouts Front-end build tools such as Gulp, Grunt, SASS Back-end tools like Git, unit testing, continuous integration and Linux command line skills Bonus points for An academic background in computer science Devops experience - particularly AWS and deployments through Docker Experience with Atlassian tools (BitBucket, Jira, Confluence) Experience developing APIs for Android and/or iOS Experience dealing with backwards compatibility for mobile app APIs Understanding of the Agile process We take care of our teammates This is a unique opportunity to join a rapidly growing technology startup. Taking care of our team on this journey is a priority. We offer: Competitive salary compensation Employee stock options Teammates that really care about what they do Personal and professional growth Health and fitness program A beautiful Gastown workspace with ocean and mountain views

Job_Description: Job Summary: We’ve been named a Glassdoor Employee Choice winner, a San Francisco Business Times/Silicon Valley Business Journal Top 25 best place to work and one of the SBI 10 Best Companies to Sell for in 2016. Responsibilities:  We need a talented developer to join our frontend development team in Markham. You will participate in the development of Genesys Workforce Management product, which is deployed in the Cloud and on-premise with JavaScript front end and Java, C++ backend. You Will work with other team members to investigate design approaches, prototype new technology, and evaluate feasibility. You will participate in full development cycle including code review, unit testing - we are very serious about the code and product quality. You will be doing test automation as needed. You will assist with issue resolution in the existing and newly developed parts of the product. You will demonstrate creativity, foresight, and good engineering judgment in anticipating and solving various engineering problems   Requirements:  A background and 4 years or more in Computer Science / Engineering. 4 or more years’ experience working with JavaScript. Advanced understanding of modern web development (e.g. HTML5, CSS3, LESS, etc.) Experience with modern JavaScript Frameworks (React, Vue, Flux, Angular, Backbone, jQuery, etc.) Ability to manually craft HTML and CSS. Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and communication skills. Highly organized and self-motivated. Strong team player who enjoys collaborating with multicultural teams. Passion to win.  About Us: Genesys® powers more than 25 billion of the world’s best customer experiences each year. We put the customer at the center of everything we do and passionately believe that great customer engagement drives great business outcomes. More than 10,000 companies in more than 100 countries trust the industry’s #1 customer experience platform to orchestrate omnichannel customer journeys that eliminate silos and build lasting relationships. With a strong track record of innovation and a never-ending desire to be first, Genesys is the only company recognized by top industry analysts as a leader in both cloud and on-premise customer engagement solutions. Connect with Genesys via www.genesys.com, Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, LinkedIn, and the Genesys blog. Genesys is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics. #LI-BJ1

At a minimum, code reviews, unit testing, and system testing should ensure all requirements have been addressed, all basic functionality works, and errors are handled properly.If you answer ‘yes’ to the following, you’d be a great fit for Front End Devloper positionBasic knowledge ASP .NET and page life cycleProficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3Proficient understanding of adaptive and responsive designs and tools such as BootstrapProficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQueryGood understanding of advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks, such as AngularJS, React, or Ember etc., or JS-based build tools like Grunt, Gulp, and BowerBasic understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASSGood understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAXProficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them.Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as GITTools and Languages: Version Control (e.g., GIT), Visual Studio 2015+, ASP.NET / MVC, Data formats (e.g., JSON, XML), Data APIs (e.g. Restful API), Web Font Embedding, Scalable Vector Graphics (aka SVG), Responsive Web Design, Object-Oriented Programming, JavaScript Animation, CSS Animation, Charts / Graphs, UI Widgets, Code Quality Testing, Integration Testing, Templating Strategies, Templating Engines, Single Page Applications, XHR Requests (AJAX), Web/Browser Security, HTML Semantics, Browser Developer ToolsExperience working with graphic designers and UI/UX requirementsKnowledge of SOAP and REST APIJob Type: Full-timeLocation:Montréal, QC
Title: Front End Developer

Job_Description: If you're looking for a technical leadership role to allow you to drive the web forward by utilizing the latest web technologies, you've come to the right place! Whether you want to build Progressive Web Apps , work with service & web workers, architectures to manage micro-services on the frontend, or manage memory usage & latency of large scale Javascript applications, this is a role that requires you to think holistically about building the next generation of cross-platform mobile & web apps. EventMobi is an engineer run company that is focused on building software "the right way" and we wholly believe in the power of the web as the ubiquitous platform to power applications across devices & platforms. Engineers at EventMobi focus on building powerful front-ends that work cross-platform, are offline capable and are just-as if not more powerful than their native counter parts. We use the best tools for the job, whether it's Angular + Cordova, React+Redux, or React Native to develop a platform that generates & deploys thousands of apps annually and we're constantly looking to push the bar with your help.  We're looking for passionate developers looking to work on challenging engineering problems in a fast paced environment. You ideally care about good architecture & design, quality, processes and scalability as part of your work. You enjoy leading and coaching individuals on your team and you're looking for a place where you can approach your problems creatively instead of being given a task list to work on. You enjoy collaboration with an incredibly smart & talented team and to bring your expertise to an autonomous role where you can help shape the vision and determine how we will execute on it. Your Work Will Focus On: Architecture & Scale - You will lead the architecture on your team, gathering insights, employing design principles to determine the best tech to address our customers needs. Ownership - You own the products / features you ship. From initial design, to deployment, test automation to performance monitoring, you own what you build end-to-end. Development - Best practices, craftsmanship, well thought out code and mentorship to your team is your ideal and you preach this in your work and with your team. Quality - You will be involved with coaching and mentorship, lunch & learns and will teach and help grow the team around you in not only pushing new features but also keeping the utmost quality in everything we build. Research - You will help guide the tech stack across our multitude of products, how they fit in to our architecture, and their growth & maintenance plans amongst our growing product set. What Will You Bring to the Team? 5+ years experience as a software engineering working on large or fast scaling products Experience and passion about Javascript and JS based frameworks (React, Angular, Vue, Ember) Experience with Python or other server side languages is a nice to have Excellent written and verbal communication abilities Ability to mentor and grow team members, provide technical guidance and oversight on technical direction What Will You Get From EventMobi? We offer an experience of a lifetime working with a dynamic, open-minded and diverse team, who are excited to come to work every day and passionate about what they do and the clients they help. Quarterly team events, Mix & Mingles, SkiMobi (Winter), CampMobi (Summer) A beautiful new office space in Queens Quay terminal where you will see some of the most incredible sunsets imaginable as your day closes. Competitive salary, subsidized health care plans with dental, vision, drug coverage. Team building events and trips A wellness account providing reimbursement on transit passes, fitness equipment, house cleaning and dry cleaning Full kitchen stocked with coffee and snacks to keep you nourished Quarterly team events EventMobi sports teams - right now dodgeball, soccer and softball are our thing Foosball, ping pong, massage chair for your down time Discounted Goodlife membership A great culture with much more along the way! Want to Learn More About EventMobi? Also here is an awesome video that shows you what brought a smile to EventMobi's team in 2016: https://youtu.be/jm8j15wpEu4  We're focused on building the most robust & well designed event management platform to help planners run better & more successful events. We believe that live events bring people together to enable change, and we can have a huge impact on enabling success for events & and their attendees. We've already changed how 10,000+ events in 70+ countries use technology at their events, and we're looking forward to influencing hundreds of thousands of future events.  If you are interested in checking out EventMobi's Platform please click the link attached: https://eventmobi.wistia.com/medias/919mqb87j9  EventMobi welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities and from minorities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Title: Senior Software Engineer

Job_Description: What you’ll do: As a Platform developer with TELUS Digital, you will be responsible for designing, building and running the Delivery Platform, which enables our development teams to quickly, safely and easily catalyze digital experiences for TELUS customers. As a custodian of customer trust, you will employ best practices in development, security and accessibility to ensure a first-rate quality of service.  You will be working as part of a friendly, cross-discipline agile team, which directly solves wide-ranging cloud-native problems. The Delivery team leads by example, with continuous integration tooling, delivery pipelines and application templates that are used by hundreds of TELUS websites and services.  We focus on significantly reducing the time to deliver software, with tailored experiences, onboarding, training and documentation that allows outcome teams to build, maintain and measure their own projects and teams safely and effectively. A wide variety of technologies allows us to get the job done: JavaScript , Webpack, React, Redux, OpenShift, Kubernetes, Docker, AWS, EC2, Ansible, Terraform and Jenkins.  You are an experienced, hands-on developer who has shipped large-scale applications and dabbled in DevOps. You will be a forward thinker who can balance day-to-day pragmatism with an eye for future growth of our platform.  This position is a full-time 1 year contract position that is renewable.  What you’ll be responsible for: Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve the Delivery Platform Identify problem areas in code and suggest solutions on how to tackle Identify implementation problems in infrastructure and suggest solutions Assist in evaluating technology choices and rapidly test solutions Develop scalable systems with performance and security in mind Develop creative solutions that are maintainable, scalable and super-fast Help identify and solve frontend web development issues experienced by customers Ensure a cohesive experience across different browsers and devices Adhere to accessibility best practices (We believe in an accessible web for everyone) Collaborate closely with team members in an agile environment (we like Scrum, Kanban)  What you need to be successful: Minimum qualifications: 2 years of experience with frontend development (ES2015-2016 JavaScript, CSS) 2 years of experience in backend development (we use Node.js, PostgreSQL, Redis) Strong Experience of React and Redux Strong Experience with client-side testing (we use Jest, Mocha) Experience designing and documenting APIs (we use Node.js, Express, OpenAPI Spec) Experience with FRP (functional, reactive programming) Experience in the Operations perspective  Preferred qualifications: Experience monitoring production web services (we use NewRelic and Kibana) Experience with clustering technologies (we use Kubernetes and OpenShift) Familiarity with the Docker ecosystem About TELUS Digital  We’re a customer-driven and product-minded team within TELUS, responsible for our company’s digital evolution. We simplify the path to production so teams can focus on what matters most.  TELUS Digital’s mission is to make life easier for millions of customers – and for our team. We build smart, customer-centric and data-driven experiences for telus.com, business.telus.com and the My Account app.  Our team includes a passionate group of strategists, UX and visual designers, full stack developers, content managers, scrum masters, testers, product owners, people experience specialists, and other digital experts.  We’re looking for team members who: Share our passion for all things digital  Thrive in an agile, lean and fast-paced environment Clearly see things from the perspective of our customers Are curious, experiment and never stop learning Embrace diversity and new ideas  What you can expect from us: An environment where you’re encouraged to share and act on your ideas  Flexible work hours in a central downtown location A welcoming, relaxed office with a casual dress code A culture committed to giving; every year we donate time and resources in our communities Team lunches with a generous supply of healthy snacks A fun, dynamic team that works and plays every day; great ideas can come as easily during an impromptu hallway soccer match or social team outing  We aspire to build the best products. We’re always a work in progress and looking for people to join us and help digitize the telco. Learn about our team at telus.com/digital .  Accessibility  At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.  Bonus points  Check out labs.telus.com/blog to see how we solve challenging problems for millions of customers with innovative tools.
Title: Platform Developer

Job_Description: Software Engineer - Machine Learning Join a smart, tight-knit development team and use your creativity and expertise to implement robust, high-performance services. You will participate constructively in requirements analysis and design discussions and collaborate closely with product management, architects, front-end developers and QA. - Requirements: 2+ years of meaningful industry experience Ability to learn new technologies quickly and understand a wide variety of technical challenges to be solved Strong interpersonal skills, both verbal and written. Basic familiarity with JVM ecosystem BS CS/EE or equivalent Additional Skills: Experience in one or more functional and/or statically typed programming languages (Scala, Java, Haskell, Erlang, OCaml, Lisp, etc.) is a HUGE plus. Experience using Actor frameworks (Akka, Erlang) is also a HUGE plus. Experience with Cloud technologies and Application monitoring tools is a plus. Experience with working in a Hadoop/Cassandra like cluster environment is a plus What We Offer You: A constant stream of new things for you to learn. We're always expanding into new areas, bringing in open source projects and contributing back, and exploring new technologies. A set of exceptionally talented and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering and QA to product management and customer support. Breadth and depth. You want to work on an area that spans backend and frontend and SDKs? We have that. You want to go deep into optimizing how we compress data for fast random-access retrieval? We have that too, and more. Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe mentors help both sides of the equation. A stable, collaborative and supportive work environment. We don't expect people to work 12 hour days. We want you to have a successful time outside of work too. Want to work from home sometimes? No problem. We trust our colleagues to be responsible with their time and dedication, and believe that balance helps cultivate a phenomenal environment. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status
Title: Software Engineer - Machine Learning

Job_Description: Frontend DeveloperMajik Systems - www.majik.ioHiring Full-Time, On-Site Position, Downtown KitchenerA little about us.Majik Systems builds the most intuitive and best looking Manufacturing Execution Systems for manufacturers.Our team is driven, proactive, and we maintain a relaxed and fun atmosphere. The team values personal growth, having fun and building disruptive technologies.Look around! Nearly everything you see is manufactured. What you build here will directly change manufacturing and aid its transition into the fourth industrial revolution known as industry 4.0! At MAJiK, you will help introduce new technologies into factories. Through interoperability, we bring IoT principles to factories by connecting disparate systems and data sources to collect and share production information in real-time. Our software harnesses this information to provide decision makers with transparency into their factory’s operations, allowing them to react swiftly to urgent problems, make more informed decisions, and pinpoint areas for actions or improvements.You can expect to learn and contribute a lot at MAJiK and help shape the direction of one of the largest industries on the planet!Industrial Operations & Continuous Improvement: We provide value by making systems and processes more efficient and reliable for our clients. We are constantly developing tools to help solve industrial challenges such as factory transparency, continuous improvement, production forecasting, work order attainment, and reduction in waste such as downtime and scrap.Networking and IoT: We are active in the IoT community! Specifically with manufacturing, to build the best virtual representation of a factory it is important that all types of systems, sensors, equipment, SCADA systems, and data sources can communicate.Business Development and Entrepreneurship: You will be working alongside the founders of the company. We welcome any questions you have, and if you are interested in other areas of the company, we welcome you to join us in our sales discussions, planning sessions, and product-review meetings.JavaScript: Our entire platform is built on JavaScript, utilizing React on the front-end, node.js for our main servers, and mongoDB as our data store.Scaling Large Software Systems: You will practice writing modular and reusable code. When servicing many customers with different system configurations, it is important to maintain a single configurable code-base.Performance and Configurability: You can expect to be a part of developing and implementing techniques for collecting, analyzing, and serving large amounts of information with the added complexity of performance and configurability.Frontend DeveloperSummary:Majik is looking for a driven and detail oriented Front-End Developer to help with architecture, design, and development of our real-time interface. We continuously improve the performance, usability, look, and design of our manufacturing analysis tools. Help us shape the best user experience available for discovering manufacturing insights.Example ProjectsCreate real-time environments and graphs using React, SVG, and Canvas to help users to truly explore what’s going on in their factoryDesign reusable, reactive, and performant UI componentsConduct user interviews and studies for usability and design requirementsDesign the workflow and develop powerful analysis and optimization tools such as dynamic scheduling tools, and interactive graphsTools UsedReact.js, Redux, Lodash, Jest, Websockets, GraphQLDesired Skills:MVC/Flux Architecture Patterns, JavaScript, Testing, DebuggingNice-to- Have:Manufacturing Experience (Just In Time, Quality Control, Process Flow, etc.), Telecommunications Networking, C/C++, PLC experience, SCADA, ERP Integration, Embedded SystemsJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $52,000.00 to $68,000.00 /yearExperience:React: 1 yearRealtime Applications: 1 yearUI/UX Design: 1 yearJavascript: 1 yearFront-end Development: 1 yearEducation:Bachelor'sLocation:Kitchener-Waterloo, ON
Title: Frontend Developer

Job_Description: We are looking for a strong Senior Full-Stack Software Developer, who will help us build a highly scalable and performant Walmart.ca eCommerce platform to match our exponential growth. You will have an opportunity to design and develop new innovative features on our current platform and help in transitioning our platform to micro-app architecture using next-gen technologies. You will be responsible to actively participate in the design and architectural discussions for Frontend and API gateway layer. You will also work closely with the Product Owners to develop innovative customer experiences and user interfaces Position Responsibilities Design and develop scalable, performant and responsive FE architecture. Participate in Code Reviews, providing technical mentorship to other junior team members. Implement new features by collaboratively working with Product Owners, UX designers, and other fellow Engineers. Help in design and development of API gateway layer which can interact with many other micro-services. Leads the design sessions for medium to large initiatives to come up with high level design. Able to independently handle high impact critical issues. Actively participate in agile ceremonies Canada Walmart DivisioneCommerce Qualifications BA/BS/MA/MS degree in Computer Science or closely related field or equivalent practical experience. Strong knowledge of JavaScript, CSS3, HTML5, asynchronous request handling, and AJAX in highly scalable and available applications. 6-8 years of software development experience working in NodeJS, Scala, Ruby on Rails, Python or Java. Experience building responsive UIs which are optimized for mobile devices. Solid understanding of building RESTful APIs. Have a strong passion for developing elegant and well-designed frameworks. Experience in any of the JavaScript framework like React, EmberJS or Angular 1.x/2.x is a big plus. A history of open-source contribution is an asset. AccessibilityWalmart will accommodate the disability-related needs of applicants and associates as required by law.
Title: Senior Software Developer (Frontend)

Job_Description: Company Profile  Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the people of Morgan Stanley are dedicated to providing our clients the finest thinking, products and services to help them achieve even the most challenging goals. As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. We embrace integrity, excellence, team work and giving back.  Technology  The Technology division partners with our business units and leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global and dynamic financial markets.  Our sizeable investment in technology results in leading-edge tools, software, and systems. Our insights, applications, and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients’ businesses—and to our own.  Institutional Securities Technology (IST) develops and oversees the overall technology strategy and bespoke technology solutions to drive and enable the Institutional businesses and enterprise-wide functions. Our clients include Fixed Income, Equities, Commodities, Investment Banking, Research and Global Capital Markets as well as Operations, HR and Corporate Services.  Position Description: Morgan Stanley is looking for a developer in Montreal who will be able to help improve its real time risk analysis systems used by derivatives traders. Our systems are meant to consistently provide large amounts of important data, at high scale, while markets are moving quickly.  You would be part of a development team for a system that is responsible for all of the distributed components and the associated user interfaces for said risk delivery. There are several languages and development frameworks involved so we're interested in talking to strong generalists who have broad technical interests or who would like to explore various technical paths.  We encourage developers to contribute to the whole system rather than just individual components, so over time you'll have more freedom to develop in areas you are interested in. This also means individual developers have more ownership of project work across several components and programming languages.  Desired skills:  At least 3 years of relevant experience- Strong Computer Science fundamentals- Proficient with at least one object oriented language (e.g. Java, C# or C++)  Nice to have:  Experience with a scripting language (e.g. Python)- Experience with web technology (either servers or frontends)- Interest and knowledge of capital markets and finance concepts  Knowledge of French and English are required.  Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential.
Title: Software Developer (various languages welcome!) 3105397

Job_Description: Hey! We’re Radical I/O Technology, a software development lab & consultancy that loves to mix interesting tech with doing good in the world. We attract clients and employees who share many of our same values of integrity, honesty, approachability, quality, community, and collaboration. We're on the lookout for 1-2 senior and/or intermediate backend, API & integration developers for a 4-6 month full time contract, potentially starting some time in May 2018. This is a great opportunity to use this time to see if we all work well together. Even if we are don't call you in for an interview right away, we often have projects start fairly quickly with new clients, so we will always look through our applicant database first. We'd also love to keep a small roster of people we trust and who we can easily reach out to during these times. Requirements To become a backend developer with Radical I/O, we'd love to see your experience in:  backend and middleware app development using NodeJS or Java (depending on our clients' needs, you might switch between projects that require JavaScript vs Java skills) RESTful API design & development data integrations between various legacy on-premise systems, SAAS apps, and APIs NodeJS frameworks such as Hapi, Express Java: J2EE/J2SE and Spring frameworks; messaging and JMS; JDBC, JPA/Hibernate, ORM; knowledge of design patterns, and Dependency Injection vs. Inversion of Control concepts. NoSQL databases, like MongoDB relational databases, like MySQL/MariaDB, Oracle, MS SQL Server Docker containerization and deployment AWS cloud services having Git repos as your version control of choice using build tools such as Ant, Maven, or Gradle, and working with continuous integration tools and processes Bonus/nice to have's (but not required): ESB integration platform experience, like TIBCO and others Identity management platform experience, like ForgeRock and others using popular frontend JavaScript frameworks like React, Angular, etc We also look for people who:  write clean code, have written unit tests, and who adhere to effective software design principles have worked within agile processes like Scrum or Kanban, and used tools like JIRA or similar are comfortable working professionally with clients in varying industries are continuously learning communicate and collaborate well and often want to build community and/or make a difference in the world (be sure to include more info about this in the summary section or your cover letter) THE OTHER STUFF  Local Vancouver, BC applicants are preferred, particularly those who can work in our office at least 50% of the time.  We are actively working towards changing the gender imbalance in the tech industry (see our work with App Camp For Girls), and we highly encourage devs whose identities are under-represented in this field to apply. If you don’t match 100% of the job requirements, but are passionate about what you do and eager to learn, we want to hear from you.  Please only apply if you are authorized to work full-time in Canada for any employer. We welcome applicants on working holiday visas and post-graduate work permits. Benefits We offer a flexible and inclusive space to work where we welcome your unique self, including: Inviting office in downtown Vancouver at Beatty and Robson, close to all skytrain lines, shopping, restaurants, the seawall, and entertainment. Encouraging participation in professional events, meetups, conferences, and giving back to the community. Regular team social events and meals, including unlimited daily drinks and snacks. Excellent time off policy and flexibility. Whether you're very experienced or new to the field, we look beyond cookie-cutter requirements and instead focus on your potential. We hire skilled teammates who are hungry to learn and grow, and who really care about the quality of work they produce. We want you to be proud of working on our team, and we want to feel privileged to know you.
Title: Backend, API & integration developers (JavaScript & Java)

Job_Description: Multiple Openings*  Sitecore is the global leader in experience management software that enables context marketing. The Sitecore® Experience Platform™ manages content, supplies contextual intelligence, automates communications, and enables personalized commerce, at scale. It empowers marketers to deliver content in context of how customers have engaged with their brand, across every channel, in real time—before, during, and after a sale. More than 4,900 brands––including American Express, Carnival Cruise Lines, easyJet, and L’Oréal–– have trusted Sitecore for context marketing to deliver the personalized interactions that delight audiences, build loyalty, and drive revenue.  As a Software Engineer, you will be a member of the Product Support Services Team, responsible for assisting Sitecore’s implementation partners with best practices guidance, troubleshooting complex customizations, reverse engineering, and significantly contribute towards ramping up and developing the team in the first year.  Sitecore implementations are handled by their network of partners. Because of the complex nature of Sitecore’s products, their partners often need assistance in mapping customer requirements to implementation best practices. The Software Engineer will work with partners to understand customer requirements and determine the proper implementation approach. In addition, the Software Engineer may troubleshoot implementations that are experiencing complex performance or functional issues. Ultimately, the Software Engineer solves problems that developer cannot solve.  Sitecore will provide all necessary training on the Sitecore system.  You will work with a team of business people and technologists who are smart, experienced and great fun to be around.  Ideal candidates will have the following background: Experience in Microsoft technology platform, including: NET web applications C# Visual Studio SQL Server IIS Outstanding problem solving and logical thinking skills NET programming experience, including experience with 3rd-party APIs Experience working with data structures and creating software algorithms Experience defining solution architectures (software or physical) Experience troubleshooting complex software development projects Great communication skills in English  Experience in the following would be a plus: Experience in frontend technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS Experience configuring load balancers and other network equipment Experience configuring Windows-based servers No travel required. This position is located in Gatineau.  Sitecore is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity without unlawful regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other local legally protected characteristic.
Title: Software Engineer, Product Support

Job_Description: At Broadsign , we believe in a world where bold creativity inspires bright ideas.  Where digital interactions inspire conversations and connect communities. Where screens drive growth, build excitement and prompt innovation. Where digital and real-life experiences collide .  As the leading SaaS company in digital signage, we’re a place for people who envision a better digital future and aren’t afraid to embark on ambitious challenges to change the status quo.  Lighting up airports, shopping malls, health clinics, street corners and more, our platform powers screens at the heart of people’s lives.  Want to join us on our mission to light up the world one screen at a time?  ------------------------  Here we grow again… We’re currently looking to add a kick-ass front-end developer to our web development team.  Your day to day will vary but your mission is simple;  As a member of our Agile development team, your main focus will be to design and develop new features on the front-end of Broadsign’s software suite. And, because you’re a front-end enthusiast, you’ll probably want to tweak and maintain our existing feature set as well! You’ll get to participate in sprints where you’ll be encouraged to share your ideas and knowledge with your team. Basically, you’ll be working in a dynamic and peer-driven environment where you’ll play with all the latest and greatest hardware and software!  Of course, if this role to speaks to you, you’re someone who has;  Professional experience with REACT and HMTL development  A good understanding of REST API’s  Experience with Windows but, given the choice, you’d would go with Linux  A curious nature – you’re always thinking outside the box  Interest in working with an awesome team  Great communication skills in English and French  **Additionally, if you have any experience working with; Python, Git and an image editing software, you’re definitely the Dev we’ve been searching for!  But, more importantly, you’re the kind of person who: Loves to see a project through from beginning to end  Enjoys challenging themselves and constantly learning about new tech  Likes to have your ideas heard and contributions recognized  Wants to benefit from perks such as: competitive insurance package, RRSP plan, tons of fun company events (tubing, BBQs, go-karting, health & diversity week, etc.), paid time off during the holidays and a healthy work/life balance  Likes to dress casually  Loves coffee, beer, croissants, bagels and fruits – especially when they’re free!  Does this sound like you? If it does, we definitely want to hear from you!

Job_Description: About Us: GE is the world's Digital Industrial Company, transforming industry with software-defined machines and solutions that are connected, responsive and predictive. Through our people, leadership development, services, technology and scale, GE delivers better outcomes for global customers by speaking the language of industry.  At GE Lighting Solutions, we are dedicated to advancing the industrial internet vision through superior engineering, intelligent devices design and bold innovation. We've combined embedded systems industry knowledge, brand recognition and the global reach of GE with our electronics and software design expertise to change the world of the industrial internet.   GE (NYSE: GE) est le groupe industriel numérique mondial, qui transforme l’industrie grâce à des machines contrôlées par logiciel et des solutions connectées, adaptées et prédictives. GE s’organise autour d’un échange mondial de connaissance, le « GE Store » (offre de produits GE), au sein duquel chaque activité partage et a accès aux mêmes technologies, marchés, structures et intelligences. Chaque invention nourrit les innovations et les applications dans tous nos secteurs industriels. Fort de ses collaborateurs, ses services, sa technologie et sa taille, GE produit de meilleurs résultats pour ses clients en parlant le langage de l’industrie. www.ge.com    Role Summary: GE Digital is looking for an experienced Software Engineer to work on a number of exciting projects that will have a very positive impact on GE’s business. GE Digital est à la recherche d’un ingénieur en logiciel pour travailler sur un nombre de projets intéressants qui auront un impact positif sur les activités commerciales de GE.  Essential Responsibilities: Act as a member of the Software Center of Excellence, representing the face of high quality design and development practicesDevelop high performing, scaling and innovative end-to-end web applicationsCollaborate with system engineers, frontend developers and software developers to implement solutions that are aligned with and extend shared platforms and solutionsApply principles of SDLC and methodologies like Lean/Agile/XP, CI, Software and Product Security, Scalability, Documentation Practices, refactoring and Testing TechniquesWrites codes that meets standards
