Title: Junior Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: *Multiple Openings*  Sitecore is the global leader in experience management software that enables context marketing. The Sitecore® Experience Platform™ manages content, supplies contextual intelligence, automates communications, and enables personalized commerce, at scale. It empowers marketers to deliver content in context of how customers have engaged with their brand, across every channel, in real time—before, during, and after a sale. More than 4,900 brands––including American Express, Carnival Cruise Lines, easyJet, and L’Oréal–– have trusted Sitecore for context marketing to deliver the personalized interactions that delight audiences, build loyalty, and drive revenue.  As a Software Engineer, you will be a member of the Product Support Services Team, responsible for assisting Sitecore’s implementation partners with best practices guidance, troubleshooting complex customizations, reverse engineering, and significantly contribute towards ramping up and developing the team in the first year. Sitecore implementations are handled by their network of partners. Because of the complex nature of Sitecore’s products, their partners often need assistance in mapping customer requirements to implementation best practices. The Software Engineer will work with partners to understand customer requirements and determine the proper implementation approach. In addition, the Software Engineer may troubleshoot implementations that are experiencing complex performance or functional issues. Ultimately, the Software Engineer solves problems that developer cannot solve. Sitecore will provide all necessary training on the Sitecore system. You will work with a team of business people and technologists who are smart, experienced and great fun to be around. Ideal candidates will have the following background: Experience in Microsoft technology platform, including: NET web applications C# Visual Studio SQL Server IIS Outstanding problem solving and logical thinking skills NET programming experience, including experience with 3rd-party APIs Experience working with data structures and creating software algorithms Experience defining solution architectures (software or physical) Experience troubleshooting complex software development projects Great communication skills in English Experience in the following would be a plus: Experience in frontend technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS Experience configuring load balancers and other network equipment Experience configuring Windows-based servers No travel required. This position is located in Gatineau.  Sitecore is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity without unlawful regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other local legally protected characteristic.

Job_Description: Visier is the gathering place for the smartest thinkers, wisest sages, brightest innovators, and creative masterminds. Visier is looking to hire a Senior Test Developer to join our rapidly growing software development team. We are looking for a motivated, technical, Senior Test Developer who is passionate about testing software and cares about the quality of our products. Candidates should have proven knowledge and experience in testing enterprise software with cutting-edge technologies. And they should have hands-on experience with multiple testing activities including but not limited to functional, regression, black/white box and automated testing.  We are relentlessly passionate about empowering companies with the insights they need to confidently answer critical business questions and be more successful. PayPal, Yahoo, LinkedIn, Micron, Time Inc, Electronic Arts, and BMO are just some of the brands we’ve transformed with our award-winning solutions. Our vision is ambitious: to redefine the field of business intelligence by creating domain-specific and end-user-centric analytic applications.  With over 350 employees across our Vancouver and San Jose offices, we’re looking for new talent to join our dynamic, passion-driven organization. Grow with us to become an expert developer with a proven record of delivery of high quality solutions. What you'll be doing...  Design, implement and maintain test automation framework and scripts for backend, frontend and mobile apps Drive to reduce manual/repetitive tasks and assist with writing test automation scripts Coordinate and participate in feature requirements review for testability, including writing and reviewing of automation and manual test plans Participate and provide guidance in code reviews Responsible for end-to-end product quality, including defect management, status reporting, and escalation for critical issues discovered during the testing phase Participate in bug triage, helping assess defect prioritization relative to business and customer requirements Work closely with developers, program managers and data management engineers to assist in debugging, testing, and development of tools to help identify defects Available to help troubleshoot critical customer issues, including reproducing issues, analyzing application logs, or clarifying intended feature functionality Perform automated and manual testing, including regression testing for each release cycle to ensure software meets business and security requirements Drive and help to establish best practices and testing processes Help coach and mentor Junior QA Developers to gain better understanding in domain knowledge, test development best practices and test efficiencies Perform SQL queries to validate data correctness What you'll bring to the table...  Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or similar technical field 6+ years of experience as a Automation QA Developer Background in testing data driven applications Experience in testing SAAS deployments Proficiency in Black, Grey, and White Box testing Experience in building tools and test automation frameworks that drive testing efficiencies Experience with performance and security testing Strong Java, JavaScript or Scala development skills in testing and debugging Strong knowledge of using Selenium, Appium, and REST API test framework, particularly ScalaTest Experience with designing and testing APIs/SDKs is a plus Experience working with iOS SDK or Android SDK is a plus Experience working with DB technologies such as Postgres or Apache Cassandra is a plus Deep commitment and passionate about maintaining quality Excellent communication, collaboration, reporting, analytical and problem solving skill Proficient with Agile testing methodologies and know what great looks like

As a software developer, you will be responsible for designing, building and running the software applications which enable innovative, data-driven, customer centric digital experiences for customers.  What You’ll Be Responsible For: ? Lead team members in an agile environment (we like Scrum, Kanban) ? Evaluate technology choices and rapidly test solutions ? Setting the technical vision for your team, and working with Architects to define the roadmap for the applications that your team supports ? Work closely with the team to solve architectural challenges ? Work with product owners to support translating business deliverables into technical outcomes ? Design scalable systems with performance and security in mind ? Identify and solve frontend web development issues experienced by customers ? Ensure a cohesive experience across different browsers and devices ? Advocate the use of unit testing and test driven development to drive design and development  Challenge, mentor and guide the team to implement best practices ? Implement & Advocate accessibility best practices ? Diagnose and evolve container-based build pipelines for your team ? Adapt and influence the team to create the best outcome for not only the project but also for customers  What You Need to Be Successful: ? Prior experience in mentoring developers and team leadership ? 5+ years of experience with frontend development in JavaScript with the following frameworks: React, Redux, Mocha, Node.js, Express.js ? 5+ years of experience in backend development (PostgreSQL, Redis) ? Expert level knowledge of client-side testing best practices and tooling (Jest) ? Experience mentoring juniors, overseeing code quality and evangelizing best practices ? Experience in translating technical concepts and requirements for non-technical stakeholders ? Experience designing and documenting APIs ? Experience with FRP (functional, reactive programming) ? Experience monitoring production web services (Kibana) ? Experience with clustering technologies (Kubernetes) ? Experience designing and load-testing highly available systems ? Experience with the Docker ecosystem ? Experience with securing web applications to common security threats  Preferred qualifications ? Familiar with accessibility (WCAG 2) best practices ? Experience with Web/HTTP security controls (CORS, CSP, TLS, etc ...) ? Experience designing, building, and maintaining High Availability systems ? Experience in creating and socializing technology roadmaps  Specialization and Skills:  Software Development JavaScript 5 - 7 years   Priority Requirements: Please describe your experience as a Lead Developer on full-stack JavaScript (Node.js, React, Redux) on large-Scale Applications. (Must-have)   Work Environment: Downtown Toronto; 37.5 hour/week 6 month initial contract; high possibility of extension

Job_Description: Global Financial Client in Montreal, QC  12+ Months Contract  Web Application Developer with Angular 2+ (2/3/4/5)  Technology Team Profile  Technology works as a strategic partner with Brokerage business units and the world's leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global, complex, and dynamic financial markets. Brokerage's sizeable investment in technology results in quantitative trading systems, cutting-edge modelling and simulation software, comprehensive risk and security systems, and robust client-relationship capabilities, plus the worldwide infrastructure that forms the backbone of these systems and tools. Our insights, our applications and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients' businesses and to our own.  Enterprise Infrastructure (EI) is responsible for delivering essential technology infrastructure solutions to Brokerage's businesses. EI manages the production, operations, and engineering of our data centers, voice and data networking solutions, mainframe servers and databases, distributed computing, wireless technologies, and associated end user capabilities.  Position Description: Enterprise Reporting Framework (ERF) is a critical reporting system which provides both highly concurrent adhoc / ondemand reporting and batch reporting capability as well as reporting workflow monitoring tools. It generates 20k custom reports for 16900 Wealth Management FAs very day, and it generates 2 million quarterly reports in 4 days.  The candidate will part of Montreal based development team and will be involved in development and maintenance of various distributed frontend/backend systems including middleware components, web, and infrastructure components.  1. Design & implement distributed applications, enhance and support existing systems.  2. Utilize strong object oriented design (OOD), algorithms & programming skills to implement distributed systems of multi-tier architecture.  3. Work closely with internal, external clients and users to deliver solutions.  4. Will have the opportunity to participate in system integration efforts and requirements gathering for projects involving multiple teams and systems.  In addition to this, candidate will also work on various integration/special projects that involves working with different business units like Wealth Management, and Investment Management etc. The team also works on technical R&D; and cutting-edge solutions to improve performance & scale and for integrating new products and technologies in our system.  Skills Required:  Strong programming skills in HTML, Angular 2+, JavaScript with 4+ years of experience. Experience developing distributed, performance-critical, highly available, or large-scale systems Experience building Web applications in Multithreading, Web Services for a Unix/Linux platform Experience working with Source Code Management solutions like (ex. Perforce, Git, CVS) Experience testing software (e.g. Unit testing, performance testing/tuning) Good troubleshooting and problem solving skills Good verbal and written communication skills A Team Player  Skills Desired:  Experience working with the Spring framework Experience in either Eclipse IDE or IntelliJ
Title: Web Application Developer

Job_Description: Arobas Personnel is looking for a web application developer for a permanent position in Montreal. Our client is revolutionizing how businesses and consumers execute financial transactions. Whether you’re buying a car, opening a bank account, getting a mortgage, or insuring your home, they are here in real-time to make the entire online transaction secure, reliable, and enjoyable. Their Financial Agreements Automation Platform enables their customers to securely verify electronic identities, seamlessly apply electronic signatures, and reliably ensure regulatory compliance. Their customers are among the world’s largest financial institutions and global enterprises, and Deloitte Technology Fast 50 recognized them as one of the fastest growing technology companies in the UK and Europe. If you thrive on challenges and seek growth, then they want YOU on our Product Team! The environment is built on trust, openness, and growth. They offer great benefits, excellent health insurance, flexible hours and work-from-home, a wonderful RRSP program, and a fantastic vacation package. Day to day, you will… Evolve and enhance the UI/UX of our current production SaaS application running on the AWS cloud Participate in the analysis, elaboration, and estimation of customer requirements and specifications Design, develop, and deploy new production-quality frontend features and functionality that meet customer requirements Collaborate with application support to analyze, troubleshoot, reproduce, and resolve production issues reported by customers Work with other team members on release planning and deployment activities Participate in all software development lifecycle activities: estimation, planning, designing, coding, documenting, and testing Be proactive, facilitate knowledge sharing, and continually improve our activities REQUIREMENTS To succeed, you have… Extensive experience in UI/UX technologies including HTML, JavaScript, CSS, XSLT, REST, JSON, jQuery Experience in handling differences and limitations of various Web browsers Deep understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX Experience using software best practices like Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Continuous Integration (CI) Strong debugging and analytical skills Knowledge of front-end tools such as Grunt, Gulp.js, AngularJS, and Bootstrap; relational databases and SQL; and cryptography and security Worked as part of Scrum teams or similar iterative Agile development methodologies Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in software engineering or computer science Practiced continuous improvement and promoted knowledge sharing Strong organizational skills, capable of managing assigned tasks and meeting deadlines Excellent interpersonal, communication, collaboration, and writing skills
Title: Web Application Developer

Job_Description: Our client is the leading global eCommerce merchant looking to build out their development centre of excellence here in the Greater Toronto Area. This is a full-time consulting/contract role starting on a 12 month term and expected to renew there after. In this role you'll have an opportunity to contribute to one of the most innovative and exciting eCommerce/Technology revolutions taking place globally!  Position Summary  We are looking for a strong Senior Software Developer with Frontend expertise, who will help us build a highly scalable and performant eCommerce platform to match our client's exponential growth. You will have an opportunity to design and develop new innovative features on our current platform and help in transitioning our platform to micro-app architecture using next-gen technologies. You will be responsible to actively participate in the design and architectural discussions for Frontend and API gateway layer. You will also work closely with the Product Owners to develop innovative customer experiences and user interfaces.  Duties and Responsibilities  Design and develop scalable, performant and responsive FE architecture. Participate in Code Reviews, providing technical mentorship to other junior team members. Implement new features by collaboratively working with Product Owners, UX designers, and other fellow Engineers. Help in design and development of API gateway layer which can interact with many other micro-services. Leads the design sessions for medium to large initiatives to come up with high level design. Able to independently handle high impact critical issues. Actively participate in agile ceremonies.  Qualifications  BA/BS/MA/MS degree in Computer Science or closely related field or equivalent practical experience. Strong knowledge of JavaScript, CSS3, HTML5, asynchronous request handling, and AJAX in highly scalable and available applications. 5+ years of software development experience working in NodeJS, Scala, Ruby on Rails, Python or Java. Experience building responsive UIs which are optimized for mobile devices. Solid understanding of building RESTful APIs. Have a strong passion for developing elegant and well-designed frameworks. Experience in any of the JavaScript framework like React, EmberJS or Angular 1.x/2.x is a big plus. A history of open-source contribution is an asset.
Title: Sr. Front End Software Developer (eCommerce)

Job_Description: WE ARE A TRANSFORMATIONAL PARTNER We create impactful and custom digital experiences that connect brands with consumers in relevant and memorable interactions. We partner in the digital strategy, design and execution transforming the world’s leading global businesses.  Our digital studios are worldwide, yet we are one collaborative global team who recognize the demand for all software and technology products to engage users through compelling design.  Our people are 'full stack’ hustler’s - digital citizens connected to the world of design and technology with stand out skills and business savvy - but most importantly, who like to get their hands dirty experimenting and learning.  We operate across many sectors but specialize in retail and financial services, healthcare.  Our Team: Our Vancouver office is staffed with a mix of User Interface/User Experience Designers and top-notch engineering talent working on exciting projects. We work with a different of technologies and tools, spanning from frontend web and mobile to backend and hardware.  We are looking for an exceptional UX/UI Designer to join our team of dreamers and builders. Here is a bit more about how this position impacts our organization and the experience/skills to do it:  Key Qualifications:  Strong knowledge of user interface design process and methodology Strong conceptual thinker Ability to run “Discovery” workshops on site to help a client determine features, requirements and vision on what they want to build Ability to give design estimates and scope a client project Ability to lead projects and delegate tasks within your team Ability to manage 1 to 2 designers Demonstrates strong visual design skill, ability to solve UX problems, ability to work within an existing visual system. Able to take broad, conceptual ideas and turn them into something useful and valuable for its users with supervision from a Design Manager Develops a UX process that is repeatable and shareable. Works well within existing visual and UX patterns. Contribute to high-level strategic decisions with the rest of the design team Identifies scenarios where data would be helpful for making design decisions. Ability to understand customer needs, motivation and behaviors and translate them into actionable deliverables Strong client management skills. You can articulate and lead discussions around your process, explorations and conclusions. Solid up to date understanding of best practices, development and trends in web, mobile, iOS and Material Design  Additional:  Detail-oriented and highly developed organization skills including the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines Must be a self-starter who will bring original ideas and fresh approaches to each project they work on. Must be an ego-free, thick skinned person who can take and give clear feedback Detail oriented Strong self-management skills as well as the ability to work as a contributing member of a multi-discipline team Ability to collaborate with other designers and developers to envision and integrate concepts Shares work frequently with their feature teams, product groups and with the design team Ability to provide thoughtful constructive feedback to other team members Taking initiatives in coming up with ideas/ processes to improve internal process Advanced proficiency with design and prototyping tools such as, Sketch and Invision Ability to juggle multiple projects + task at any given time Agency experience is a plus  Ideally, you will also:  Value teamwork: demonstrated ability to collaborate with cross-functional and distributed teams, including designers, developers and QA engineers Demonstrate skill and commitment to building and maintaining relationships Work enthusiastically: have passion for the work and the role; can-do attitude Remain calm under pressure Communicate efficiently and carefully both verbally and in written form Be meticulously organized Plan and schedule in an effective and productive manner, maintaining focus on key priorities  We are a thriving Community of top technology talent that is globally connected. We Engage, Make, Run and Evolve the technology that makes many brands that you know and love. So let’s take this journey together. No matter where you are on your digital career roadmap, we can help you grow and have fun doing it.  At this time, Softvision LLC will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position. Relocation assistance is available. Softvision LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. No 3rd Party Agency Candidates, please.

Job_Description: We’re on a mission: Are you a people leader with innovative ideas and a passion for delivering market-leading digital customer experiences? Make your mark by helping us reimagine how we interact with our customers and create the experiences that matter to them. We’re building a team of passionate people, working collaboratively to reimagine banking for the digital age. Why now and why BMO? We believe our customers’ lives are changing – and we need to change with them. From day-to-day life to the moments that matter, our customers are increasingly defining success in different ways and we need to be there to help. This means meeting our customers where and how they expect to bank. At BMO, we believe we must respond to our customers by becoming a customer experience-led, digitally-enabled bank. Driven by a deep understanding of our customers and willingness to constantly challenge the status quo, we believe we can meet the challenge before us. We also believe we have the best digital strategy in the industry and best corporate culture to deliver on our goals. How? We are building platform teams, combining people with different skills and knowledge, to accelerate our customer experience. These teams will work in both Agile and Iterative manner, in a vibrant space, and embrace the latest methods, tools, and technologies to drive innovation and change. The team will work in a cross-functional organization, empowered and have the resources and authority to drive a customer-led digital transformation. As a Senior Development Manager, Mobile and Frontend you will:  Report directly to the Director, Mobile Senior Technology Officer Act as a thought leader in Mobile and Frontend software development Champion new approaches and help transform our technological capabilities. Lead development teams to create a culture of collaboration and innovation Demonstrate excellence in managing and motivating cross-functional team Build deeper relationships with key technology stakeholders Collaborate with the business team to drive change throughout the organization, enhancing the customer experience Continue to build team’s capability in the area of new technology developments that support our business strategies, including automation Review and approve requirements and design for a domain Take accountability for overall code quality, ensure code is reviewed, reusable and testable, meeting strategic architectural-design and customer requirements Have expert knowledge to influence and set direction for software development best-practices, concepts, technology and methodology in the mobile and frontend development.  Qualifications What makes you a great fit? You have:  Bachelor or Master in computer science, engineering, information systems, math or business/MBA Minimum of 5 years of experience in leading and managing a software development team. Minimum of 3 years of experience with advance JavaScript including different toolkits, CSS3, HTML5, Swift/Objective C/Java and responsive design. Experience with Application Mobile Development building hybrid apps with some Native components. Strong knowledge of mobile platforms (ie. iOS, Android, mobile devices, etc) and technologies in developing mobile hybrid apps. Experience in continuous delivery pipeline leveraging DevOps tools covering automation of unit testing, build and deployment. Sense of ownership and accountability for technology strategy, projects and production operations. Ability to manage multiple projects, lead developers and vendor partners working on all aspects of solution design and development. Experience in leading medium-sized projects and teams (5-10 developers) Excellent analytic and problem solving skills Good collaboration and multi-tasking capabilities Strong leadership and communication skills Ability to attract and retain top talent Background in banking or finance A focus on delivering results with benefits to the customer  Location:  Downtown Toronto (Yonge and Bloor area)  We’re here to help At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank. As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com. BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Job  Information Technology Primary Location  Canada-Ontario-Toronto Organisation  Technology-X000068 Schedule  full-time Job Posting  01/24/18 Unposting Date  Ongoing

DemandHub helps businesses by powering daily communication, generating reviews and feedback, and gaining insight into the overall customer experience.Our frontend stack is React with our back-end in NodeJS and MySQL. We are looking for highly self-driven people who are creative problem solvers that learn quickly and can thrive in an environment with little guidance. We follow modern software development practices, including TDD, CI, and rigorous code reviews. We are very analytics driven and continuously run A/B tests to inform our product design.Responsibilities and DutiesWrite well designed, testable, and efficient code.Plan, design, and implement core components of our back-end REST API to support our front-end developers.Plan, design, and implement DemandHub’s customer-facing web-based applications.Plan, design, and implement distributed job scripts that support our core applications.Plan, design, and implement tools to monitor the health of our software system, including logging and software alerts for our ops team.Work closely with team members in other functions, including sales, support, and marketing.Support the ops team for automating our testing and production build process.Support continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and technologies.Understand and follow agile development methodologies and the role of testing.Make recommendations for process improvements and best practices.Required SkillsMinimum B.Sc. in a technical field (Computer Science, Software Engineering, etc.).Experience with back-end Node.js development.Experience with modern version control systems such as GIT.Experience with Relational Databases such as MySQL, Postgres.Experience building websites with HTML5, CSS, and AJAX, and jQuery.Experience with Javascript frameworks such as ReactJS or Angular.Experience with ES6 promises and deferred asynchronous operations.Knowledge of REST API development and UI development.Recent experience developing single page applications (SPA).Strong algorithms, data structures and coding background.Disciplined approach to testing and quality assurance.Experience with web infrastructure and distributed systems.Bonus SkillsExperience with CSS preprocessing frameworks such as Sass or Less.Experience with task runners such as Gulp or Grunt.Familiarity with AWS tools such as Elastic Beanstalk, EC2, RDS, SQS, S3, and CloudFront.Experience with PHP or other back-end programming languages.Experience with machine-learning, natural language processing, or other AI disciplines.Experience working in an agile environment.BenefitsGreat startup company culture with an amazing and motivated teamAwesome opportunities for growthHealth benefits (medical & dental)Hands-on opportunity to help shape the future of the companyCasual dress codeWe are looking for people who are passionate about technology, team players, hard-working, and have a positive attitude geared towards getting things done.This is a full-time opportunity in Mississauga, ON (near Hurontario & Matheson).We look forward to receiving your application!Job Type: Full-time
Title: Junior Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: We are currently looking for a .NET Developer based in Montreal for one of our clients.  The main responsibilities of this role are: Use Agile engineering practices and various software and web development technologies to rapidly develop creative and efficient solutions that enhance the client customer and employee experience; Collaborate with other team members to craft clear user stories, design tests for prototypes and products, and continuously deliver product enhancements; Communicate with IT teams about any Digital innovations that are tying into bedrock IT systems; Communicate with business stakeholders about Agile processes to set and manage expectations about delivery methods and timelines; Contribute across the full technology stack, from database and DevOps infrastructure that supports continuous deployment, over native apps, to front end development; Work in a cross-functional team with the Product Owner, Designers and Lead Developer to co-develop the digital products.  The ideal applicant has the following skills: At least 5 years of software development experience working in Agile teams; Excellent programming skills in at least one modern programming language/framework, such as Node.JS, Ruby on Rails, C#, ASP .NET, Python; Experience and working knowledge of HTML/CSS, and a modern frontend JavaScript framework, such as ReactJS, AngularJS, EmberJS, Vue.js; Working knowledge of SQL and one common database technology, such as SQL Server, MySQL, MongoDB; Real passion for development and a demonstrated appetite for continual learning; Knowledge of pair programming, continuous integration and test-driven development; Experience with at least one unit testing framework, such as Mocha, RSpec; Familiarity with the concepts of Functional Programming and Microservices (asset); Community contributions (e.g., open source work, publishing /speaking on technical ideas) (asset).  Why choose Cofomo?  Personalized integration and follow-up Complete career management service Attractive referral program Dynamic social committee Depending on our clients’ policies, possibility to work remotely or on a flexible schedule  We care for your professional success, apply now for your next exciting new challenge!
Title: .NET Developer

Job_Description: Chez Nexus, nous cherchons des développeurs polyvalents, attentionnés, et soucieux de faire la différence dans la livraison d'un projet client. Dans un contexte de services logiciels sur mesure, un bon développeur doit être doué techniquement (frontend, backend, web, bases de données, infrastructure), mais également démontrer une curiosité pour les processus d'affaires des clients. Une facilité pour la communication est un atout important, surtout pour écouter et comprendre les besoins clients. En passant d'un projet à un autre, le développeur doit également montrer une capacité d'adaptation hors de l'ordinaire et aimer sortir de sa zone de confort. Les possibilités d'apprentissage sont sans limites pour les braves qui veulent se joindre à nous! Chez nous, le développeur est au centre des activités quotidiennes car c'est lui qui livre la valeur d'affaire au client. L'environnement de travail et l'équipe sont conçus pour livrer des incréments logiciels de façon agréable et productive. En ce sens, le centre de développement Nexus a été créé par des développeurs, pour des développeurs. Tu veux en savoir plus? https://nexusinno.com/jobs/developpeur-logiciel/  Nexus is looking for versatile, caring developers looking to make a difference in our clients lives. In the custom software development business, a good developer must be technically skilled (frontend, backend, web, databases, infrastructure), but also show curiosity towards client business processes. Strong communication skills are a great asset, especially when listening to client needs and expectations. Having to often switch from one project to another, developers must be ready to adapt and push their boundaries. The learning opportunities are infinite for the braves who dare to join us! Developers are at the center of our daily activities since they deliver the value to our clients. The work environment and the team are tailored to enable our developers and let them reach outstanding efficiency. The Nexus development center was created by developers, for developers. Curious to know more? https://nexusinno.com/jobs/developpeur-logiciel/
Title: Développeur

Job_Description: ACL Impact  ACL exists to help make the world a safer and more ethical place. By enabling Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) professionals that use our software to be recognized for the value they bring to their organizations, we aim to be game-changers: to provide organizations with the software tools, support, and knowledge to dive deep into their data, identify anomalies, and manage GRC across the entire organization. From helping a national agency track down missing children to helping banks find suspicious patterns in their data and state agencies stamp out fraudulent activities, ACL has been at the heart of many investigations that have helped save people and millions… talk about impact!  The ACL R&D Team  The R&D team extends beyond the walls of ACL and stands on the shoulders of giants. We use the innovation of technology partners like Amazon, select OEMs, and the Open Source Community to ensure we’re meeting our challenges with the most current and effective technologies. We give back by contributing time, code and support to our engineers and across the community.  To understand more about software development at ACL, read Landing your Software Engineering Dream Job. To look through the window into R&D, check out our blog or read these articles: Inside ACL R&D Part I — Brigades, and R&D Baymax Team Spirit.  As a DevOps shop, we work quickly to release new stuff on a continuous basis. We own what we build and do not pass it off to others. We continually work to reduce the time required to build and safely deploy software. Security, integrity and performance are not an afterthought. They are built into our development process. If a serious vulnerability is discovered we pause everything else and immediately resolve it.  We have a product development group of 70+ and counting (the company has over 300 employees and counting). We work in small “brigades” comprised of 5 or so Software Engineers, 2 QA Engineers, a Manager, a UX Designer, UX Developer and a Product Manager. It’s our version of a scrum team.  The Challenge Ahead  We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer (Frontend) who has extensive experience with modern Javascript and other frontend technologies. You’ll provide technical leadershipo amongst a team of talented designers and engineers. You'll be instrumental in building visually-stunning user interfaces for Projects module, the heart of our GRC platform.  What Will You Get Out of This?  An amazing dynamic startup environment within a financially stable company (did we mention we just celebrated our 30thanniversary?)Some of the best benefits in the industry (asking for more information can be a great first question for us in the interview process).Working with an awesome team of professional software engineers with plenty of room to learn and grow.  Skills For Success at ACL  You have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience.You have a strong ability and desire to mentor fellow developers providing guidance on technical design and implementation.You have experience writing CSS and JavaScript in an agile team environment at scale. Bonus if you are familiar with React & Redux.You care deeply for code quality, are a TDD ninja, and detest having bugs slip through to production.You are passionate about learning and continuous improvement.You have creative ideas, a collaborative attitude and strong work ethic.  Bonus You have an interest in learning or have experience with backend technologies such as Ruby on Rails, relational databases and AWS services.You are actively involved in local meetups and contribute to open source project we can look at on Github.
Title: Senior Software Engineer (Frontend)

Title: Senior Software Engineer (Frontend)

Job_Description: A rapidly growing real estate software company in downtown Toronto is looking for both Frontend and Fullstack Engineers to join their team and help build out their core product. This is a full time position paying up to $110K. You must have production React and Nodejs to be considered for this role. This company puts real estate agents and homeowners in the center of the transaction world by providing them with more content, data, and more actionable intelligence. Using best in class technologies and applying it to billions of data sets, their software accurately predicts when a property is most likely to sell and when a buyer is most likely to buy. They are currently growing out all departments of the company including engineering, sales, etc looking to by at least 40 people by the end of the year. Required Skills & Experience Production experience with React and Node Bachelor’s degree in a related field (Math/ Engineering/ Com Sci/ etc) Desired Skills & Experience Experience working with Redux Canvas is considered an asset. Build web based applications from scratch What You Will Be Doing Tech Breakdown 80% Front end (React/ Redux) 20% Back end (Nodejs) Daily Responsibilities 90% Hands On 10% Team Collaboration The Offer Competitive Salary: Up to $110K/year, DOE You will receive the following benefits: Statutory Vacation Holiday Pay New technologies Opportunity to pitch ideas and collaborate on new features.  Applicants must be currently authorized to work in Canada on a full-time basis now and in the future. This position does not offer sponsorship. Workbridge Associates, part of the Motion Recruitment network, provides IT Staffing Solutions (Contract, Contract-to-Hire, and Direct Hire) across 11 major North American markets. Our unique expertise in today’s highest demand tech skill sets, paired with our deep networks and knowledge of our local technology markets, results in an exemplary track record with candidates and clients.
Title: Intermediate Front end Developers - React, Node

Job_Description: L'équipe en bref: ------------------------  AppHelp livre des solutions qui aident les entreprises et les consommateurs à optimiser l’adoption et l’utilisation des dernières technologies et solutions infonuagiques. Forte de son approche unique combinant technologies et capital humain, AppHelp accompagne ses clients et s’assure qu’ils disposent du soutien dont ils ont besoin, et ce, tout au long de leur parcours. Comptant à son actif des millions d’incidents de soutien techniques résolus et plusieurs décennies d’expérience en soutien technologique, AppHelp est fière d’assurer les programmes de soutien technique de nombreuses marques prestigieuses à travers le monde, dont Comcast, CincinnatiBell, BellAlliant, Rogers, Telus, Windstream, Virgin Media, Panda Security et plusieurs autres.  À propos de vous: ------------------------  Nous sommes à la recherche d’un développeur sénior, frontend, passionné des technologies Web pour se joindre à notre équipe d’ingénieurs brillants, motivés et déterminés pour nous aider à transformer et revamper notre système Web pour utilisateurs finaux. Au sein d’une équipe multidisciplinaire, le développeur d’interface sénior prendra les rênes de notre système Web pour utilisateurs finaux et mettra en place une direction technique et artistique pour l’équipe. AppHelp offre un environnement où les défis et l’inspiration sont quotidiens. Si vous recherchez la liberté pour mettre sur pied des solutions créatives et réfléchies qui reflètent votre expérience et votre personnalité, il n’y aura pas de limite à ce que vous pourrez accomplir ici.  Ce que vous ferez et ce qui vous fera briller: ----------------------------------------------   Créer des interfaces élégantes et fonctionnelles en utilisant React.js et Redux. sur notre application Web principale afin de réjouir et épater nos clients. Travailler avec une équipe multifonctionnelle pour réussir à atteindre nos objectifs. Participer et contribuer activement au travail d’équipe. Identifier et régler les problèmes de performance. Écrire des scripts JavaScript et CSS, du React.js, et du NodeJS qui sont faciles à entretenir tout en prenant soin de bien documenter le tout.  Votre profil: -------------  Vous avez:  De l'expérience avec React.js et Redux; NodeJS, les préprocesseurs CSS (LESS ou Sass) n’ont pas de secret pour vous. Des compétences solides avec JavaScript, vous êtes au courant de ce que vous ne savez pas encore et vous avez hâte d’apprendre. Une connaissance exceptionnelle des normes du Web, AngularJS 1.x, de HTML5, de la conception CSS3 et des enjeux de compatibilité des navigateurs Web. De bonnes notions de l’expérience utilisateurs et des interfaces et un intérêt marqué pour la conception d’interfaces. Développé et utilisé des API JSON RESTful. Une connaissance pratique du développement backend.  Vous êtes:  Un Leader technique : vous contribuez à la passion de nos équipes de développement et vous êtes connu pour vos solutions créatives et réfléchies. Capable d'obtenir du respect et de la crédibilité et d’influencer les autres. Curieux et innovateur : vous surveillez constamment les nouveautés sur le marché, vous aimez essayer de nouvelles solutions et des technologies que vous ne connaissez pas. Défenseur de la qualité : vous favorisez la création de logiciels de qualité supérieure à l’aide de tests unitaires et de couverture de code. Pro de la méthode Agile : vous avez de l’expérience avec la méthode Agile de développement logiciel et les méthodes de développement piloté par les tests (TDD). Collaboratif : Vous valorisez le travail d’équipe et souhaitez partager vos compétences et vos connaissances ; vous demandez les perspectives de vos pairs, mais vous n’avez pas peur de prendre des décisions. Expert des outils de développement : Les gestionnaires de paquets, logiciels de contrôle des versions et outils d’automatisation vous sont familiers (git, npm, bower, grunt, etc.).  AppDirect est la plateforme de référence pour la vente, la distribution et la gestion de produits et services infonuagiques. Sa technologie flexible et modulaire permet à toutes les entreprises, quelle que soit leur taille, d’entrer sur le marché rapidement selon une approche qui répond à leurs besoins spécifiques, et ce, à moindre coût. Les platformes de commerce en ligne AppMarket, de distribution et d’assistance technique avancée alimentés par AppDirect permettent à de nombreux fournisseurs — dont Comcast, ADP, Zendesk, Deutsche Telekom et plusieurs autres — de connecter plus de 30 millions d’entreprises aux solutions offertes par Microsoft, Google, GoDaddy et plusieurs autres. AppDirect est basée à San Francisco et compte 13 bureaux à travers le monde.  Chez AppDirect, nous croyons que ce sont les contributions uniques de chaque « AppDirecteur » qui forgent notre réussite. Afin de nous assurer que nos produits et notre culture continuent de refléter les perspectives et les expériences de tous, nous ne faisons aucune discrimination en fonction de la race, la religion, la nationalité, l’identité ou l’orientation sexuelle, l’âge, l’état matrimonial, statut d’ancien combattant ou du statut d'handicapé.  -----  About the Team: ---------------  AppHelp delivers solutions that ‘help’ businesses and consumers be more successful with their adoption and use of the latest in technology and cloud services. By leveraging a unique combination of technology and human capital, AppHelp ensures customers have the support they need as they traverse the customer journey. With millions of technical support incidents solved, and decades of experience assisting people with technology, AppHelp is proud to power the technical support programs for premier brands across the globe, including Comcast, CincinnatiBell, BellAlliant, Rogers, Telus, Windstream, Virgin Media, Panda Security and more.  About You: ----------  We are looking for a Senior Front End Developer who is passionate about web technologies to join our team of bright, motivated and strong-willed engineers to help us transform and reimagine our existing end-user web system. As part of a multi-disciplinary team, the Senior Front-End developer will take the reins of our existing end-user web system and provide technical and design guidance to our team. AppHelp provides an environment where you will be challenged and inspired every day. If you relish the freedom to bring creative, thoughtful solutions to the table that reflect your experience and personality, there's no limit to what you can accomplish here.  How You’ll Make an Impact & What You’ll Do: -----------------------------------------------------------   Create beautiful and functional screens using React.js and Redux in our main web application meant to delight and amaze our customers. Work with a cross functional team to successfully deliver on our objectives. Actively take part in and contribute to the team work. Identify and address performance bottlenecks. Write scalable and maintainable AngularJS, React, NodeJS, JavaScript, and CSS code  What You'll Need: -----------------  You have:  Experience with React.js + Redux, NodeJS and CSS preprocessors (LESS or Sass) have no secrets for you. A strong background in JavaScript, you are aware of what you do not know yet and are excited about what to learn next. Exceptional knowledge of web standards, AngularJS 1.x, HTML5, CSS3-based design and cross-browser compatibility. Good notions of UX / UI and a keen interest in interface design. Developed and consumed JSON RESTful API. Practical knowledge of backend development.  You are:  A technical leader: contributing to the passion of our development teams, you are known to bring creative and thoughtful solutions to the table. Able to gain respect and credibility, and influence others. Curious and innovative: you are constantly monitoring what is new on the market and eager to try new things with technologies you are not familiar with. A quality promoter: you value and promote high quality software with unit testing and code coverage. An agilist: you have experience with Agile software development and Test Driven Development methodologies. Collaborative: you value teamwork, you desire to share your skills & knowledge, seek perspective from others, and ultimately you are not afraid to make decisions. Very familiar with development tools: package managers, version control software and automation tools are familiar to you (git, npm, bower, grunt, etc.).  AppDirect is the leading platform for selling, distributing, and managing cloud-based products and services. Its flexible, modular technology enables organizations of all sizes to get to market quickly and cost effectively with an offering that meets their individual business needs. AppDirect-powered marketplaces, billing, distribution, reselling, and premium technical support services help providers— including Comcast, ADP, Zendesk, Deutsche Telekom and others — connect more than 30 million businesses to solutions from Microsoft, Google, GoDaddy, and more. AppDirect is headquartered in San Francisco with 13 global offices.  We believe that the unique contributions of all AppDirectors is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.  #LI-JS1
Title: Développeur sénior, frontend / Senior Frontend Developer

Job_Description: L’équipe en bref: Chez AppDirect, notre but est de changer la manière de trouver, acheter et utiliser des logiciels! Notre équipe d'ingénieurs crée la plateforme SAAS qui est utilisée par plusieurs des meilleures entreprise du monde. Il est difficile de changer le monde mais nous ne voudrions pas qu'il en soit autrement!  La mission de l'équipe plateforme-frontend est de fournir aux développeurs des outils leur permettant d'augmenter leur productivité, la qualité de leurs livrables et de s'assurer de la bonne santé et de l'évolution des technologies frontend d'Appdirect.  À propos de vous: Nous sommes à la recherche d’un développeur qui aime travailler de manière autonome et développer des outils et bibliothèques internes. Vous êtes à l’aise avec une combinaison de technologies d’interface et vous êtes idéalement un développeur « full-stack ». Vous souhaitez travailler au sein d’une équipe qui vous aidera à relever de nouveaux défis, tout en étant motivé à chercher et explorer de manière indépendante.  Ce que vous ferez et ce qui vous fera briller:  Développer et améliorer une bibliothèque complète de composants pour React Participer à l’entretien de nos bibliothèques de type Sass Aider les développeurs à contribuer à notre bibliothèque de composants Marionette Guider les équipes dans leur transition vers le développement basé sur React Soutenir les équipes de produits pour répondre aux problèmes et spécifications d’interface les plus pointus  Votre profil:  Vous avez de fortes compétences en "vanilla" JavaScript Vous avez quelques années d'expérience en création d'applications web Vous avez une compréhension approfondie d'au moins un framework d'application, idéalement plus d'un Vous connaissez NodeJS (backend, build systems, etc)  Bonus:  Vous êtes familier avec Java stack  AppDirect en bref: AppDirect est la plateforme de référence pour la vente, la distribution et la gestion de produits et services infonuagiques. Sa technologie flexible et modulaire permet à toutes les entreprises, quelle que soit leur taille, d’entrer sur le marché rapidement selon une approche qui répond à leurs besoins spécifiques, et ce, à moindre coût. Les platformes de commerce en ligne AppMarket, de distribution et d’assistance technique avancée alimentés par AppDirect permettent à de nombreux fournisseurs — dont Comcast, ADP, Zendesk, Deutsche Telekom et plusieurs autres — de connecter plus de 30 millions d’entreprises aux solutions offertes par Microsoft, Google, GoDaddy et plusieurs autres. AppDirect est basée à San Francisco et compte 13 bureaux à travers le monde.  Chez AppDirect, nous croyons que ce sont les contributions uniques de chaque « AppDirecteur » qui forgent notre réussite. Afin de nous assurer que nos produits et notre culture continuent de refléter les perspectives et les expériences de tous, nous ne faisons aucune discrimination en fonction de la race, la religion, la nationalité, l’identité ou l’orientation sexuelle, l’âge, l’état matrimonial, statut d’ancien combattant ou du statut d'handicapé.  About the team: At AppDirect our goal is to change the way the world finds, buys and uses software! Our Engineering team creates the SAAS platform used by many of the world's top companies to meet this goal. It's hard to change the world, but we wouldn't want it any other way.  The front-end platform team's mission is to provide developers with tools that increase their productivity, the quality of their deliverables and their happiness, and to ensure the health and evolution of AppDirect's front-end technologies.  About you: We are looking for a highly autonomous developer who loves to work on internal tooling and libraries. You are comfortable with a mix of front-end technologies and are ideally a "full-stack" developer. You want to work with a team that will challenge you, but you are driven to research and explore on your own.  How you’ll make an impact & what you’ll do:  Developing and improving a fully featured component library for React Participate in the maintenance of our Sass styles library Help developers contribute to our Marionette component library Guide teams through their transition to React based development Provide support to the product teams with challenging front-end issues and requirements  What you’ll need:  Strong "vanilla" JavaScript skills A few years of experience building web applications A solid grasp of at least one application framework, ideally more than one Some experience with NodeJS (backend, build systems, etc) Familiarity with Java stack an asset  About AppDirect: AppDirect is the leading platform for selling, distributing, and managing cloud-based products and services. Its flexible, modular technology enables organizations of all sizes to get to market quickly and cost effectively with an offering that meets their individual business needs. Title: Senior Java Developer - RESTful API

Job_Description: Kronos is currently recruiting a UI Developer to join its engineering center of excellence in Montreal using a highly mature SCRUM based SDLC.   Implement JavaScript, CSS3 and HTML5. Identify and build a set of reusable, configurable UI components. Adhere to and promote standards and web development best practices. Ensure high performance of frontend experiences. Work with UX team to assess technical feasibility and identify risks. Work closely with scrum master and other team members to prioritize deliverables and adapt to change.  Qualifications  Excellent understanding of current web technologies, expert JavaScript knowledge, expert knowledge in HTML5 and cross browser compatibility. Experience with different Javascript frameworks such as AngularJS and JQuery. Knowledge of UI development patterns such as MVC and MVVM. Enjoy working in a collaborative, fast-paced agile environment. Experience with TDD and Jasmine. Experience working in high complex and large single page applications  Corporate overview  You’re empowered when you’re a Kronite Want to be part of an elite group of highly skilled professionals? We think our employees are a special group of talented, energetic, and innovative people. And for that reason, we refer to ourselves as Kronites. Kronites care about more than just work. We recognize the need to maintain a healthy work-life balance — to live inspired. In fact, it’s expected! Whether you’re playing foosball in one of our game rooms, working up a healthy sweat in group fitness classes, or videoconferencing with Kronites thousands of miles away, you’ll soon learn that we take work and fun seriously. No matter what position you hold at Kronos, you’re a Kronite. And we want you to feel like you have the power to make a difference in your life and the lives of others, at work and beyond.  Kronos is the global leader in workforce management solutions that enable organizations to control labor costs, minimize compliance risk, and improve workforce productivity. Tens of thousands of organizations in 100 countries – including more than half the Fortune 1000® - use Kronos time and attendance, scheduling, absence management, HR and payroll, hiring, and labor analytics applications. Kronos customers include enterprises large and small across diverse industries worldwide including retail, hospitality, healthcare, manufacturing, public sector, services, and distribution.  Kronos is a privately held company and was founded in 1977. Headquartered in Chelmsford, Massachusetts, Kronos employs more than 5,000 people worldwide.  Kronos is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  EEO Statement Kronos is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.

Job_Description: Job Description  Your role: The Program Manager is responsible for the successful planning, implementation and management of key projects across our organization and with external partners. The ideal candidate is highly driven, has superb organization and communication skills, and has a proven understanding of gathering corporate and customer needs to effectively manage a project to success. The role requires an understanding and alignment of Corporate objectives with Technology deliverables, as well as being responsible for the successful planning and management of key projects within the organization. Your tasks: Responsible for managing program/projects to scope, schedule and budget; Program/Project Leadership - provide direction to the project team, conduct regular status meetings to review project activities, periodic reporting; Ensure alignment and execution of program/project deliverables; Be the lead liaison and communicator between personnel, partners, developers and management in regards to championing information to ensure the project's success; Monitor and coordinate activities and responsibilities of those involved for effective program/project progression; Modify, redistribute or assign new tasks and responsibilities as appropriate throughout the entire program/project life cycle; Effectively monitor compliance in the program/project activities to ensure legal compliance, participant satisfaction and timely issue resolution; Conduct post-program evaluations with the ability to identify improvements for optimal process flow; Ad hoc support, as needed, to other projects within the team; Stakeholder Management: ensure that program initiatives meet leadership and/or customer expectations, timely communication / escalation to leadership; Gather relevant information quickly, make timely decisions and respond to challenges decisively; Risk, Issue, Resource management. Qualifications  We want to hear from you if you have the following skillset: 5+ years of relevant experience; University Degree required; Excellent communication, organizational and analytical skills; Skilled with Agile methodology; Highly motivated and very proactive individual; Strategic-thinker, with the ability to develop and implement innovative solutions; Strong collaborative relationship management skills with a variety of stakeholders including partners; Strong negotiation, influencing, decision-making and dispute resolution skills; Excellent attention to detail and organizational skill; Driven personality with a keen ability to meet deadlines; Demonstrated interpersonal skills with the ability to guide and direct project participants for project success; Experience working with and reporting to Senior Management; Experience working in Software Development and/or Technology-driven environment; Ability to manage multiple projects and milestones with competing timelines; Experience using of project management tools and techniques; Bilingualism (English and French) an asset. Additional Information  Why work for Thinking Capital: Our Mission: To own the rails on which small businesses access credit in Canada. Great Team: Surround yourself with high-performing, energetic and passionate group of people dedicated to the Thinking Capital Mission; FinTech Revolution: Be part of a team that is revolutionizing the financial system and redefining how Canadian small businesses access capital; Our Stack: Our backend is a sophisticated service oriented architecture developed mostly in Java with a Spring framework. On the frontend side, our application is developed on an AngularJS framework. We use Git in coordination with the best DevOps practices for Continuous Integration and Deployment to our AWS cloud infrastructure. Fast-Paced Environment: Take on complex projects in a start-up like collaborative environment; Amazing Culture: Amazing work spaces, advanced technology tools, subsidized lunches, Foosball table, super fun work events (Amazing Race, Murder mystery wine and cheeses, Wacky Olympics, Casino nights and legendary holiday parties and more). Take a look at our career page for more information! Thinking Capital Academy: Get the opportunity to grow and advance in the company through continuous professional training; Diverse Team: Join an “at-will” equal opportunity team that prides itself on its diversity and harmony.

Job_Description: This is one of the most unique opportunities currently available in the Toronto tech scene and is being represented exclusively by Prodigy Bank.  We've been retained by our client (a tech analytics company) to identify and engage a highly talented and capable tech lead to essentially "own" their technology platform and technology leadership function.  Our client is succesfull tech based, highly innovative and highly profitable niche analytics company with a client roster that includes some of the largest organizations in the country. What sets this opportunity apart from all the other roles in the market place is this - you will have carte-blanche to dream, build, structure, support and create what you want, however you want it. The founders are looking for fill a third seat at the executive helm, that of their chief technologist. You will envision and define the technical architecture of a SaaS product and hire and lead the team to bring it to life. Your style, your ideas, your methodology and approach...your DNA.  Yes, all the other perks are there...money, culture, future, etc.  This opportunity will resonate with a profoundly driven technologist that covets putting on display his/her experience, knowledge and passion. Lots of opportunities can provide a challenge and stimulus, but very few can provide true actualization of contribution, creativity and creation the way this mandate can. This isn't about rowing, this is about being the Captain. The right candidate is an experienced, motivated platform architect with excellent communications skills, eager to work closely with internal and client teams during requirement and production phases. The candidate must bring a strong SaaS microservice development and infrastructure expertise to the table and be willing to roll-up his/her sleeves to support the development of services and infrastructure required to deliver a scalable enterprise grade user experience.  The right candidate should be ready to work within our existing Microsoft ecosystem while also being open to selecting new complementary technology stacks, approaches and multi-language configurations to aid in the build out of our applications as we grow to meet the high demands of the business intelligence space.  Required Skills and Experience:  Work with leadership to define the company product strategy and roadmap Work with clients directly regarding requirements gathering, feature requests Work with and manage developers to ensure application approach and vision upheld Shape technical Infrastructure And Operations Requirements to support SaaS practices Communicate with third party vendors and partners that interface/provide data to the platform Experience with Public Cloud Services like Azure Proficient in Frontend Backend Languages / Frameworks Examples: .NET MVC, JQuery/AJAX, Responsive HTML5, MS SQL, Mongo DB/Couch base Experience with Private Cloud and on premise hosting architectures Experience with APM tools such as New Relic Ability to stay solution oriented when facing uncertainty Experience with networking concepts and protocols Experience with security, authentication, and identifying such issues Experience with data cleaning, import, caching and post processing (flat files, API, MS SQL) A proven ability to excel in an entrepreneurial, high-growth environment Comfort with or interest in agile/devops development process and test driven development 5yrs Cloud environment SaaS preferred or equivalent experience / certification  The ideal candidate will be a DevOps minded technologist that can be responsible for the laying a foundation and application design that takes in to account the following keys areas.   Application Performance Application Expandability Quality code architecture Microservices opposed to Monolithic application design Error handling and resolution techniques Business level KPI and cost objectives Proficient in Frontend Backend Programming Languages / Frameworks .NET MVC, JQuery/AJAX, Responsive HTML5, MS SQL, Mongo DB/Couch base

Job_Description: NetBrain is the market leader disrupting the network automation space. Our ground-breaking automation platform leverages the power of dynamic maps to provide CIOs and network teams with end-to-end network visibility while enabling adaptive automation across the organization’s physical, virtual and software-defined networks. Today, over 1,800 of the world’s largest enterprises and managed services providers leverage NetBrain’s platform to automate network documentation, troubleshooting, and change management.  “NetBrain’s success is due to our people, and over the years, we have been fortunate to attract top talent because of our unique culture and exciting mission to transform the network management industry.” Lingping Gao, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of NetBrain  Overview Working out of NetBrain’s Toronto office, this role will report directly to CEO and serve in the R&D council that oversees all R&D functions across Boston, Beijing and Toronto office. In addition, this role will be responsible for the evolution of the overall architecture for a very complex enterprise network management software, with state-of-the-art technology such as parallel computing, machine learning, and big data processing.  Responsibilities Besides recruiting and managing local R&D team consisting of software architects, software developers and QA engineers, additional duties include: Supervise architects across all NetBrain offices and ensure consistent product vision and scalable architecture foundation across the entire code base.Drive the right technology choices (e.g. languages, libraries, frameworks) for both immediate and long-term growth through rapid prototype and research.Oversee development of key software components to ensure quality and schedule.Implement best practices for testing, deploying, and developing code. Encourage and enforce the right developer behaviors to ensure both quality and efficiency.Communicate with key customers and eco-system partners to drive product integration and collaboration.Be an active member of industry standard body to drive open-API initiatives of NetBrain.  Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a closely related field of study10+ years of engineering experience of complex, large scale software solution3+ years of management experienceIn-depth knowledge with all development platforms and key frontend/backend technologiesExperience with machine learning, big data processing, network virtualization(SDN/NFV), network management is a plusExcellent communication skillsHands-on Leader  Apply for this job online Refer this job to a friend  Share on your newsfeed

Title: Front End Developer

Job_Description: *Multiple Openings*  Sitecore is the global leader in experience management software that enables context marketing. The Sitecore® Experience Platform™ manages content, supplies contextual intelligence, automates communications, and enables personalized commerce, at scale. It empowers marketers to deliver content in context of how customers have engaged with their brand, across every channel, in real time—before, during, and after a sale. More than 4,900 brands––including American Express, Carnival Cruise Lines, easyJet, and L’Oréal–– have trusted Sitecore for context marketing to deliver the personalized interactions that delight audiences, build loyalty, and drive revenue.  As a Software Engineer, you will be a member of the Product Support Services Team, responsible for assisting Sitecore’s implementation partners with best practices guidance, troubleshooting complex customizations, reverse engineering, and significantly contribute towards ramping up and developing the team in the first year. Sitecore implementations are handled by their network of partners. Because of the complex nature of Sitecore’s products, their partners often need assistance in mapping customer requirements to implementation best practices. The Software Engineer will work with partners to understand customer requirements and determine the proper implementation approach. In addition, the Software Engineer may troubleshoot implementations that are experiencing complex performance or functional issues. Ultimately, the Software Engineer solves problems that developer cannot solve. Sitecore will provide all necessary training on the Sitecore system. You will work with a team of business people and technologists who are smart, experienced and great fun to be around. Ideal candidates will have the following background: Experience in Microsoft technology platform, including: NET web applications C# Visual Studio SQL Server IIS Outstanding problem solving and logical thinking skills NET programming experience, including experience with 3rd-party APIs Experience working with data structures and creating software algorithms Experience defining solution architectures (software or physical) Experience troubleshooting complex software development projects Great communication skills in English Experience in the following would be a plus: Experience in frontend technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS Experience configuring load balancers and other network equipment Experience configuring Windows-based servers No travel required. This position is located in Gatineau.  Sitecore is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity without unlawful regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other local legally protected characteristic.

Job_Description: A fantastic opportunity has arisen to join a SaaS company in the heart of Vancouver as a Senior Front-End Developer. The successful applicant will be joining a cutting-edge team in exciting, large scale projects. This position provides outstanding benefits and a great work/life balance.   COMPANY PROFILE:  This company are making leaps and bounds with their use of technology to improve quality, speed, accuracy and efficiency. As leaders in Digital Transformation they develop, and market communicational software for use within the shipping industry.   JOB DESCRIPTION:   Reporting to the CTO, the Senior Front-End Developer will be responsible to Conceptualize, design, estimate, document, develop, deploy, maintain, operate, support, and test existing and new applications/services based on React, Redux, and Typescript. Other duties include but are not limited to:  Working with the current infrastructure: AWS, Ansible, and Cloudformation Deployment & continuous integration with Jenkins, Codedeploy, and Github/Codeship Data Storage based on MySQL/RDS, S3, Elasticsearch, Memcached/Elasticache Communicating with the Backend: Newer stuff Kotlin + Dropwizard, and Legacy Node.js + Express Frontend: working with React / Redux / RxJS / TypeScript, and legacy Backbone.js Mentor co-op students and junior staff though reviews, coaching and pairing in an informal setting Assist with the transition of their current software to new architecture on the user facing interface Execute future projects, often spanning multiple divisions, all while in constant communication with department or project managers REQUIREMENTS:  A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or other related field, or a combination of education and experience. 4+ years of development experience, with at least 2 years experience developing single page applications You must demonstrate experience in building and maintaining high quality frontends Deep understanding of Web technologies especially as related to browser rendering and networking Practical experience with React.js component life cycles, rendering model, integrating with foreign libraries Experience with popular React.js state, and effect management (such as Flux or Redux) Experience working within Kanban methodologies is an asset   COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:  3 weeks of vacationDental, Extended Medical and Health Plan Competitive Salary based on experience  HOW TO APPLY:  Please reply with a Microsoft Word version of your resume to: smoynihan@impactrecruitment.ca quoting reference # 25224 or visit: http://www.impactrecruitment.ca/ to apply online. If you would like to speak with us directly regarding this role, please contact Sean Moynihan at 6046898687 Ext:253 for a confidential discussion.  Privacy and confidentiality are important to us; as such all applications are kept strictly confidential. We will not share your information with anyone without your prior approval. While we will only be considering qualified applicants for this particular role, if you are interested in pursuing an alternate career path, we would certainly be happy to speak with you about opportunities that fit your profile.

Job_Description: Eagle is currently seeking an AWS Architect . This is a three (3) month, contract position scheduled to start in May.  Key Responsibilities  The successful candidate will be responsible for: Providing recommendations to clients with respect to cloud migrations and preparing technical implementation roadmaps for AWS adoption;  Creating functional design specifications, reference architectures, and assisting with other project deliverables as needed;  Designing state-of-the-art technical solutions on AWS that address customer’s requirements for scalability, reliability, security, and performance;  Collaborating with other project teams on technical solutions and help improve service IP; and,  Staying up-to-date on all technical developments related to AWS.  Skills and Qualifications  The qualified candidate must have: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, other technical field;  Knowledge of building product-quality software on AWS including experience in designing for high availability, building multi-zone and multi-region architectures, and designing across appropriate SQL and NoSQL data layer technologies;  Familiarity with various application stacks such as Java, C#, .Net, etc.;  Configuration and deployment experience in two or more of the following:  AWS apps technologies such as RDS, ElasticBeanstalk, DynamoDB, RedShift;  AWS IaaS Technologies such as EC2, S3, EBS, ELB, VPC, Route 53;  Deployed applications with Web UI frontends;  Deployed application with RESTful/SOAP services interfaces;  Experience building private AMI’s on VPC’s;  Firm grasp on cloud security, leveraging Linux and Windows operating systems, using the AWS console and CLI (command line interface);  Experience as a hands-on technical practitioner/specialist in client facing roles in large enterprises and demonstrated client facing consulting skills, including building strong client relationships;  Excellent verbal, presentation and written communications skills;  Strong team skills including the ability to lead and be a team player; and,  AWS certification in any of the following - Solutions Architect, Developer or Systems Ops (an asset).  Don’t miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!  Eagle is an equal opportunity employer and will provide accommodations during the recruitment process upon request. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that your application does not signify the beginning of employment with Eagle and that employment with Eagle will only commence when placed on an assignment as a temporary employee of Eagle.

Job_Description: Arobas Personnel is looking, for one of its clients, for a senior frontend developer for a full-time position in Montréal.  Do you want to be part of a team that's building applications and services that will revolutionize the management experience in thousands of apartments worldwide? Do you want to help to shape the future of real estate property management as well as communication? Do you want to be part of a team with a startup and a hackathon culture?
