Job_Description: Notre client est le plus grand concepteur et distributeur de systèmes de sécurité et démarreurs à distance pour véhicules de particuliers en Amérique du Nord. Il conçoit, développe et commercialise des solutions de télématique qui permettent le contrôle et l’interaction à distance avec les véhicules.  Vous désirez travailler sur l’art du « Connected car » et les solutions IoT (Internet des objets). Joignez-vous à nous pour faire partie de l'aventure en tant que Développeur Sr. de logiciels front-end de l'équipe télématique ! L'équipe est responsable de développer des applications de types Nuage et IoT, et la plate-forme de messagerie. Dans un environnement en mode Agile, l’équipe logiciel est en constante évolution améliorant les méthodologies et l'environnement de travail.  Relevant du Chef d’équipe du développement des logiciels télématiques, vous devrez concevoir, développer et faire évoluer les services télématiques visant à évaluer le comportement de conducteurs d’automobiles. Les solutions sont composées d’équipements spécialisés dans les automobiles, d’apps sur téléphone intelligents et de systèmes back-end. Votre expérience en développement d’applications vous aidera à être un membre actif au développement de solutions, plus précisément au niveau du front-end.  Vos principales responsabilités seront :  Participer aux définitions des exigences pour les solutions web et UI pour les produits télématiques Fournir une analyse pour les solutions Assurer la facilité d'utilisation, la facilité de support, la robustesse, l'évolution et la sécurité des fonctionnalités : des éléments clés pour les solutions de conception recommandées Développer et coder les solutions web et UI Collaborer avec les autres membres de l’équipe (Mobile, Interface, Embarqué, Test, TI et Marketing) and nos partenaires externes lorsque requis Travailler dans un environnement en mode Agile-Sprint Participer à notre philosophie d’amélioration continue  Qualifications :  Baccalauréat en génie informatique ou équivalent Dix (10) années d’expérience en développement d’applications web Minimum d’une (1) année d’expérience en développement d’applications avec Angular 2 Expérience avec les technologies de cartographie UI (Google, etc.) Expérience avec les conceptions UI/UX Excellentes aptitudes en communication orale et écrite, français et anglais  Atouts :  Expérience en intégration de la télématique à haute disponibilité 24X7 ou des services IoT pour véhicules Expérience avec les technologies basées sur Java o Architectures de micro-service incluant Spring Boot, Spring REST & Spring JPA o Développement d’application web avec Angular 4 et PrimeNG Expérience au niveau de la conceptualisation de systèmes utilisant des services Web (REST, SOAP, XML/JSON) Expérience au niveau de la plate-forme de messagerie télématique de véhicules (traitement des messages GPS, traitement des alertes, configuration de l'appareil OTA) Expérience en technologie des services web Amazon incluant EC2, ECS, RDS, DynamoDB, CloudWatch Expérience en déploiement de l’application Docker et de la gestion du contenu Connaissances de Target Process ou Jira, Confluence, SVN/Git, Jenkins Expérience avec les technologies Microsoft, un atout (ASP.NET, IIS, C#, Visual Studio, MSSQL, etc.) Expérience avec Linux, un atout  -  Our client is the largest designer and marketer in North America of consumer-branded vehicle security and remote start systems. They are designing, developing and promoting telematics solutions targeting the consumer market and the car insurance business.  You want to work on state of the art connected car and IoT solutions. Join us and be part of the adventure as a Sr. Frontend Software Developer of the Telematics team! The team is responsible to develop cloud base and IoT applications, and messaging platform. In an Agile environment, the software group is in constant mutation improving methodologies and working environment.  Reporting to the Team-Lead of the Telematics Software development, you will design, develop and evolve end-to-end telematics services used to assess end-users’ driving behavior and more. The solutions are composed of in-car devices, smartphone apps and backend systems. Your web side developer background will help you taking an active part in the development process specifically in the frontend.  Your main responsibilities are:  Participate in the business requirement definitions for web and UI solutions for telematics products Provide functional analysis for the solutions Ensure feature ease-of-use, ease-of-support, robustness, scalability and security, key ingredients to the recommended design solutions Develop and code web and UI solutions Collaborate with other teams (Mobile, Interface, Embedded, Test, IT Team and Marketing) and outsourced partners when required Work in an Agile-Sprint environment Participate in the Continuous Improvement philosophy  Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent 10 years of professional experiences in web application development 1 year + of experience with Angular 2 application development Experience with UI mapping technologies (Google, etc) Experience in UI/UX design Excellent communication verbal/written skills (English and French)  Assets:  Experience in integration of 24X7 high-availability vehicle telematics or IoT services Experience with Java based technologies o Micro service architectures including Spring Boot, Spring REST & Spring JPA o Thick client web application development with Angular 4 and PrimeNG  Experience with designing systems using web services (REST, SOAP, XML/JSON) Experience with vehicle telematics messaging platform (GPS message processing, alert processing, OTA device configuration) Experience with amazon Web Services technologies including EC2, ECS, RDS, DynamoDB, CloudWatch Experience with docker application deployment and container management Knowledge of those tools: Target Process or Jira, Confluence, SVN/Git, Jenkins Asset experience with Microsoft technologies (ASP.NET, IIS, C#, Visual Studio, MSSQL, etc.) Asset experience with Linux

Job_Description: NetBrain is the market leader disrupting the network automation space. Our ground-breaking automation platform leverages the power of dynamic maps to provide CIOs and network teams with end-to-end network visibility while enabling adaptive automation across the organization’s physical, virtual and software-defined networks. Today, over 1,800 of the world’s largest enterprises and managed services providers leverage NetBrain’s platform to automate network documentation, troubleshooting, and change management.  “NetBrain’s success is due to our people, and over the years, we have been fortunate to attract top talent because of our unique culture and exciting mission to transform the network management industry.” Lingping Gao, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of NetBrain  Overview Working out of NetBrain’s Toronto office, this role will report directly to CEO and serve in the R&D council that oversees all R&D functions across Boston, Beijing and Toronto office. In addition, this role will be responsible for the evolution of the overall architecture for a very complex enterprise network management software, with state-of-the-art technology such as parallel computing, machine learning, and big data processing.  Responsibilities Besides recruiting and managing local R&D team consisting of software architects, software developers and QA engineers, additional duties include: Supervise architects across all NetBrain offices and ensure consistent product vision and scalable architecture foundation across the entire code base.Drive the right technology choices (e.g. languages, libraries, frameworks) for both immediate and long-term growth through rapid prototype and research.Oversee development of key software components to ensure quality and schedule.Implement best practices for testing, deploying, and developing code. Encourage and enforce the right developer behaviors to ensure both quality and efficiency.Communicate with key customers and eco-system partners to drive product integration and collaboration.Be an active member of industry standard body to drive open-API initiatives of NetBrain.  Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a closely related field of study10+ years of engineering experience of complex, large scale software solution3+ years of management experienceIn-depth knowledge with all development platforms and key frontend/backend technologiesExperience with machine learning, big data processing, network virtualization(SDN/NFV), network management is a plusExcellent communication skillsHands-on Leader  Apply for this job online Refer this job to a friend  Share on your newsfeed

Job_Description: On behalf of our client, Affinity Staffing is looking for a highly motivated Software Engineer with a proven knowledge of design patterns and Software Engineering techniques.  If you like working in a small and fun start-up environment, take full ownership and responsibility to deliver tangible results, this is the right place for you! We are looking for a Senior (5 to 7+ years) .NET/C# Developer, to join the engineering team. You will design, develop, and maintain the APIs and Hosted Application. Our current development stack is:  .NET/C#, ASP.NET MVC and WebAPI for backend services and web development HTML5, CSS3, AngularJS, ReactJS and Gulp automation for frontend development Microsoft Azure as a cloud platform Mix of SQL and NoSQL for database (MS SQL Server, Redis, Azure Table/Blob storage, MongoDB)  This is a young, fast moving company so it is essential that you have a can-do, entrepreneurial spirit - ideas are good but execution is better (especially when it’s executing on good ideas)! We are a small team, we are good at what we do and we like working together. You will have autonomy and respect from day one. Learning and keeping abreast of new technology and sharing with the rest of the team are activities we all enjoy and encourage. Job_Description: Global Relay is the leading provider of cloud-based archiving, supervision, eDiscovery, and analytics for the global financial sector. We deliver services to 23,000 customers in 90 countries, including 22 of the top 25 global banks. Our market-leading archiving service supports email, instant messaging, Bloomberg®, Thomson Reuters, social media, mobile messaging, and more – with mobile, Outlook, and web access.  Our Global Operations & Development Center is located in Vancouver, BC, Canada. In addition, we have offices in six other cities across the world, including major financial centers like New York, Chicago, and London.  Over the years, we have won several major awards, including: Company of the Year from the BC Tech Association (2016) Canada’s 50 Best Small and Medium Employers (2014, 2015) Canada’s Top Employers for Young People (2014) Canada’s Top 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures (2013, 2016) Canada’s Best Managed Companies (2013 - present)  We provide fantastic opportunities to individuals passionate about business and technology. For those with international business aspirations, we offer invaluable opportunities for doing business with some of the world’s largest, most influential firms. Our company is also perfect for those who want to create cool technology using massively scalable, big-data architecture, with a strong focus on mobile.  To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com. The Role: The Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) is a developer who specializes in writing code to test the product. They are responsible for the overall test coverage, test code, and automation frameworks within their Agile team.  As a Senior SDET, you will drive growth in your team’s automation coverage while mentoring other SDETs in the team on automation and test practices. You will work directly with the code in a Selenium-based framework to automate testing of a front-end web application. You will support the team’s testing efforts while proposing and implementing improvements in the automation coverage and frameworks.  Role Responsibilities:  Design, develop and maintain automation frameworks, infrastructure and tools Define and automate test cases that verify product requirements Participate in team planning and story grooming Participate in test execution, issue identification and resolution in support of the release Provide suggestions to improve automation and test processes, infrastructure Develop and maintain shared testing libraries Provide training, mentorship and support to other members on the team Conduct code reviews, improve and maintain quality of the automation code Document the automation framework, tools and infrastructure  Technical Skills Requirements:  Minimum 8 years of experience in software testing Minimum 5 years of experience in test development Strong understanding of Java or C# languages Strong understanding of testing practices in an agile environment Experience with Selenium WebDriver and JMeter Experience with web services technology such as REST, JSON or Thrift Experience with multi-threaded programming Experience with design patterns  Desirable:  Experience with CSS3, HTML5 or Extend.JS (Sencha) Experience with network protocols such as HTTP, TLS and TCP Experience with continuous integration systems such as Bamboo or Jenkins Experience with continuous delivery concepts Experience with automated testing tools for Mobile applications  To Apply:  Think you’re a great fit for this job? Apply today with your cover letter and resume in one PDF document. No phone calls please. Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada.
Title: Senior Software Development Engineer in Test (Frontend)

Job_Description: Eagle is currently seeking an AWS Architect . This is a three (3) month, contract position scheduled to start in May.  Key Responsibilities  The successful candidate will be responsible for: Providing recommendations to clients with respect to cloud migrations and preparing technical implementation roadmaps for AWS adoption;  Creating functional design specifications, reference architectures, and assisting with other project deliverables as needed;  Designing state-of-the-art technical solutions on AWS that address customer’s requirements for scalability, reliability, security, and performance;  Collaborating with other project teams on technical solutions and help improve service IP; and,  Staying up-to-date on all technical developments related to AWS.  Skills and Qualifications  The qualified candidate must have: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, other technical field;  Knowledge of building product-quality software on AWS including experience in designing for high availability, building multi-zone and multi-region architectures, and designing across appropriate SQL and NoSQL data layer technologies;  Familiarity with various application stacks such as Java, C#, .Net, etc.;  Configuration and deployment experience in two or more of the following:  AWS apps technologies such as RDS, ElasticBeanstalk, DynamoDB, RedShift;  AWS IaaS Technologies such as EC2, S3, EBS, ELB, VPC, Route 53;  Deployed applications with Web UI frontends;  Deployed application with RESTful/SOAP services interfaces;  Experience building private AMI’s on VPC’s;  Firm grasp on cloud security, leveraging Linux and Windows operating systems, using the AWS console and CLI (command line interface);  Experience as a hands-on technical practitioner/specialist in client facing roles in large enterprises and demonstrated client facing consulting skills, including building strong client relationships;  Excellent verbal, presentation and written communications skills;  Strong team skills including the ability to lead and be a team player; and,  AWS certification in any of the following - Solutions Architect, Developer or Systems Ops (an asset).  Don’t miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!  Eagle is an equal opportunity employer and will provide accommodations during the recruitment process upon request. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that your application does not signify the beginning of employment with Eagle and that employment with Eagle will only commence when placed on an assignment as a temporary employee of Eagle.

Title: Junior Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: *Multiple Openings*  Sitecore is the global leader in experience management software that enables context marketing. The Sitecore® Experience Platform™ manages content, supplies contextual intelligence, automates communications, and enables personalized commerce, at scale. It empowers marketers to deliver content in context of how customers have engaged with their brand, across every channel, in real time—before, during, and after a sale. More than 4,900 brands––including American Express, Carnival Cruise Lines, easyJet, and L’Oréal–– have trusted Sitecore for context marketing to deliver the personalized interactions that delight audiences, build loyalty, and drive revenue.  As a Software Engineer, you will be a member of the Product Support Services Team, responsible for assisting Sitecore’s implementation partners with best practices guidance, troubleshooting complex customizations, reverse engineering, and significantly contribute towards ramping up and developing the team in the first year. Sitecore implementations are handled by their network of partners. Because of the complex nature of Sitecore’s products, their partners often need assistance in mapping customer requirements to implementation best practices. The Software Engineer will work with partners to understand customer requirements and determine the proper implementation approach. In addition, the Software Engineer may troubleshoot implementations that are experiencing complex performance or functional issues. Ultimately, the Software Engineer solves problems that developer cannot solve. Sitecore will provide all necessary training on the Sitecore system. You will work with a team of business people and technologists who are smart, experienced and great fun to be around. Ideal candidates will have the following background: Experience in Microsoft technology platform, including: NET web applications C# Visual Studio SQL Server IIS Outstanding problem solving and logical thinking skills NET programming experience, including experience with 3rd-party APIs Experience working with data structures and creating software algorithms Experience defining solution architectures (software or physical) Experience troubleshooting complex software development projects Great communication skills in English Experience in the following would be a plus: Experience in frontend technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS Experience configuring load balancers and other network equipment Experience configuring Windows-based servers No travel required. This position is located in Gatineau.  Sitecore is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity without unlawful regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other local legally protected characteristic.

Job_Description: We are currently looking for a .NET Developer based in Montreal for one of our clients.  The main responsibilities of this role are: Use Agile engineering practices and various software and web development technologies to rapidly develop creative and efficient solutions that enhance the client customer and employee experience; Collaborate with other team members to craft clear user stories, design tests for prototypes and products, and continuously deliver product enhancements; Communicate with IT teams about any Digital innovations that are tying into bedrock IT systems; Communicate with business stakeholders about Agile processes to set and manage expectations about delivery methods and timelines; Contribute across the full technology stack, from database and DevOps infrastructure that supports continuous deployment, over native apps, to front end development; Work in a cross-functional team with the Product Owner, Designers and Lead Developer to co-develop the digital products.  The ideal applicant has the following skills: At least 5 years of software development experience working in Agile teams; Excellent programming skills in at least one modern programming language/framework, such as Node.JS, Ruby on Rails, C#, ASP .NET, Python; Experience and working knowledge of HTML/CSS, and a modern frontend JavaScript framework, such as ReactJS, AngularJS, EmberJS, Vue.js; Working knowledge of SQL and one common database technology, such as SQL Server, MySQL, MongoDB; Real passion for development and a demonstrated appetite for continual learning; Knowledge of pair programming, continuous integration and test-driven development; Experience with at least one unit testing framework, such as Mocha, RSpec; Familiarity with the concepts of Functional Programming and Microservices (asset); Community contributions (e.g., open source work, publishing /speaking on technical ideas) (asset).  Why choose Cofomo?  Personalized integration and follow-up Complete career management service Attractive referral program Dynamic social committee Depending on our clients’ policies, possibility to work remotely or on a flexible schedule  We care for your professional success, apply now for your next exciting new challenge!

Title: Senior Web Developer

Job_Description: NetBrain is the market leader disrupting the network automation space. Our ground-breaking automation platform leverages the power of dynamic maps to provide CIOs and network teams with end-to-end network visibility while enabling adaptive automation across the organization’s physical, virtual and software-defined networks. Today, over 1,800 of the world’s largest enterprises and managed services providers leverage NetBrain’s platform to automate network documentation, troubleshooting, and change management.  “NetBrain’s success is due to our people, and over the years, we have been fortunate to attract top talent because of our unique culture and exciting mission to transform the network management industry.”  Lingping Gao, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of NetBrain  Overview Working out of NetBrain’s Toronto office, this role will report directly to CEO and serve in the R&D council that oversees all R&D functions across Boston, Beijing and Toronto office. In addition, this role will be responsible for the evolution of the overall architecture for a very complex enterprise network management software, with state-of-the-art technology such as parallel computing, machine learning, and big data processing.  Responsibilities Besides recruiting and managing local R&D team consisting of software architects, software developers and QA engineers, additional duties include:  Supervise architects across all NetBrain offices and ensure consistent product vision and scalable architecture foundation across the entire code base. Drive the right technology choices (e.g. languages, libraries, frameworks) for both immediate and long-term growth through rapid prototype and research. Oversee development of key software components to ensure quality and schedule. Implement best practices for testing, deploying, and developing code. Encourage and enforce the right developer behaviors to ensure both quality and efficiency. Communicate with key customers and eco-system partners to drive product integration and collaboration. Be an active member of industry standard body to drive open-API initiatives of NetBrain.  Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a closely related field of study 10+ years of engineering experience of complex, large scale software solution 3+ years of management experience In-depth knowledge with all development platforms and key frontend/backend technologies Experience with machine learning, big data processing, network virtualization(SDN/NFV), network management is a plus Excellent communication skills Hands-on Leader  Apply for this job online Refer this job to a friend Share on your newsfeed

Job_Description: On behalf of our client, Affinity Staffing is looking for a highly motivated Software Engineer with a proven knowledge of design patterns and Software Engineering techniques.  If you like working in a small and fun start-up environment, take full ownership and responsibility to deliver tangible results, this is the right place for you! We are looking for a Senior (5 to 7+ years) .NET/C# Developer, to join the engineering team. You will design, develop, and maintain the APIs and Hosted Application. Our current development stack is:  .NET/C#, ASP.NET MVC and WebAPI for backend services and web development HTML5, CSS3, AngularJS, ReactJS and Gulp automation for frontend development Microsoft Azure as a cloud platform Mix of SQL and NoSQL for database (MS SQL Server, Redis, Azure Table/Blob storage, MongoDB)  This is a young, fast moving company so it is essential that you have a can-do, entrepreneurial spirit - ideas are good but execution is better (especially when it’s executing on good ideas)! We are a small team, we are good at what we do and we like working together. You will have autonomy and respect from day one. Learning and keeping abreast of new technology and sharing with the rest of the team are activities we all enjoy and encourage.  Skills & Requirements  University Degree in Computer Science/Engineering Minimum 5 years of experience in C# programming Minimum 4 years of development experience with ASP.NET Web API, JavaScript, jQuery, Ajax, CSS, DHTML, T-SQL Solid understanding and experience using both relational (MS SQL) and NoSQL data stores (Mongo, Redis), cloud platforms (Microsoft Azure, Amazon AWS) Proven mentorship and knowledge transfer ability Ability to multitask and prioritize multiple concurrent assignments Ability to learn quickly and effectively apply new knowledge
Title: .NET Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: Global Relay is the leading provider of cloud-based archiving, supervision, eDiscovery, and analytics for the global financial sector. We deliver services to 23,000 customers in 90 countries, including 22 of the top 25 global banks. Our market-leading archiving service supports email, instant messaging, Bloomberg®, Thomson Reuters, social media, mobile messaging, and more – with mobile, Outlook, and web access.  Our Global Operations & Development Center is located in Vancouver, BC, Canada. In addition, we have offices in six other cities across the world, including major financial centers like New York, Chicago, and London.  Over the years, we have won several major awards, including: Company of the Year from the BC Tech Association (2016) Canada’s 50 Best Small and Medium Employers (2014, 2015) Canada’s Top Employers for Young People (2014) Canada’s Top 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures (2013, 2016) Canada’s Best Managed Companies (2013 - present)  We provide fantastic opportunities to individuals passionate about business and technology. For those with international business aspirations, we offer invaluable opportunities for doing business with some of the world’s largest, most influential firms. Our company is also perfect for those who want to create cool technology using massively scalable, big-data architecture, with a strong focus on mobile.  To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com. The Role: The Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) is a developer who specializes in writing code to test the product. They are responsible for the overall test coverage, test code, and automation frameworks within their Agile team.  As a Senior SDET, you will drive growth in your team’s automation coverage while mentoring other SDETs in the team on automation and test practices. You will work directly with the code in a Selenium-based framework to automate testing of a front-end web application. You will support the team’s testing efforts while proposing and implementing improvements in the automation coverage and frameworks.  Role Responsibilities:  Design, develop and maintain automation frameworks, infrastructure and tools Define and automate test cases that verify product requirements Participate in team planning and story grooming Participate in test execution, issue identification and resolution in support of the release Provide suggestions to improve automation and test processes, infrastructure Develop and maintain shared testing libraries Provide training, mentorship and support to other members on the team Conduct code reviews, improve and maintain quality of the automation code Document the automation framework, tools and infrastructure  Technical Skills Requirements:  Minimum 8 years of experience in software testing Minimum 5 years of experience in test development Strong understanding of Java or C# languages Strong understanding of testing practices in an agile environment Experience with Selenium WebDriver and JMeter Experience with web services technology such as REST, JSON or Thrift Experience with multi-threaded programming Experience with design patterns  Desirable:  Experience with CSS3, HTML5 or Extend.JS (Sencha) Experience with network protocols such as HTTP, TLS and TCP Experience with continuous integration systems such as Bamboo or Jenkins Experience with continuous delivery concepts Experience with automated testing tools for Mobile applications  To Apply:  Think you’re a great fit for this job? Apply today with your cover letter and resume in one PDF document. No phone calls please. Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada.
Title: Senior Software Development Engineer in Test (Frontend)

Job_Description: A fantastic opportunity has arisen to join a SaaS company in the heart of Vancouver as a Senior Front-End Developer. The successful applicant will be joining a cutting-edge team in exciting, large scale projects. This position provides outstanding benefits and a great work/life balance.   COMPANY PROFILE:  This company are making leaps and bounds with their use of technology to improve quality, speed, accuracy and efficiency. As leaders in Digital Transformation they develop, and market communicational software for use within the shipping industry.   JOB DESCRIPTION:   Reporting to the CTO, the Senior Front-End Developer will be responsible to Conceptualize, design, estimate, document, develop, deploy, maintain, operate, support, and test existing and new applications/services based on React, Redux, and Typescript. Other duties include but are not limited to:  Working with the current infrastructure: AWS, Ansible, and Cloudformation Deployment & continuous integration with Jenkins, Codedeploy, and Github/Codeship Data Storage based on MySQL/RDS, S3, Elasticsearch, Memcached/Elasticache Communicating with the Backend: Newer stuff Kotlin + Dropwizard, and Legacy Node.js + Express Frontend: working with React / Redux / RxJS / TypeScript, and legacy Backbone.js Mentor co-op students and junior staff though reviews, coaching and pairing in an informal setting Assist with the transition of their current software to new architecture on the user facing interface Execute future projects, often spanning multiple divisions, all while in constant communication with department or project managers REQUIREMENTS:  A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or other related field, or a combination of education and experience. 4+ years of development experience, with at least 2 years experience developing single page applications You must demonstrate experience in building and maintaining high quality frontends Deep understanding of Web technologies especially as related to browser rendering and networking Practical experience with React.js component life cycles, rendering model, integrating with foreign libraries Experience with popular React.js state, and effect management (such as Flux or Redux) Experience working within Kanban methodologies is an asset   COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:  3 weeks of vacationDental, Extended Medical and Health Plan Competitive Salary based on experience  HOW TO APPLY:  Please reply with a Microsoft Word version of your resume to: smoynihan@impactrecruitment.ca quoting reference # 25224 or visit: http://www.impactrecruitment.ca/ to apply online. If you would like to speak with us directly regarding this role, please contact Sean Moynihan at 6046898687 Ext:253 for a confidential discussion.  Privacy and confidentiality are important to us; as such all applications are kept strictly confidential. We will not share your information with anyone without your prior approval. While we will only be considering qualified applicants for this particular role, if you are interested in pursuing an alternate career path, we would certainly be happy to speak with you about opportunities that fit your profile.

Job_Description: TapClicks [www.tapclicks.com] - Montreal,Canada Hi! We're one of the fastest growing companies in Silicon Valley and America. Inc. magazine ranked TapClicks as number 4 for marketing/advertising companies and number 87 overall on its 5000 list of companies in 2016.  Summary: We are seeking a senior-level Frontend Developer who can be part of the team that is designing the next generation TapClicks platform. You will be expected to be internally motivated and use the best practices to deliver this world-class scalable product.  Position Responsibilities: Designing and developing world class UI/UX for our web applications. Writing high quality code. Working closely with team members to make good trade-offs and deliver features that meet or exceed requirements. Tracking down and fixing bugs, performance issues, or display issues.  Position Requirements: BS/MS degree in computer science or a related field or commensurate experience 6+ years of front-end dev experience. 6+ years advanced JavaScript, jQuery 6+ years of HTML and CSS. 6+ years of UI/UX experiance 1+ years in AngularJS  Strong HTML5 and CSS3. Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around such issues.  Experience with web server such as Apache, Ngnix Knowledge of software implementation best practices Ability to adapt quickly to an existing, complex environment, learn new concepts and software Candidate should be a self-motivated, independent, detail oriented, responsible team-player Passionate about building high-quality systems with software implementation best practices  About TapClicks: TapClicks, Inc. is an MarTech company that delivers complete digital marketing reporting and analytics platforms to digital agencies, media companies, and enterprises, for improved marketing ROI. Its suite of products includes flagship TapAnalytics, which consolidates marketing campaign information and performance results into a unified digital dashboard, with automated reporting and analytics. TapClicks was founded in 2009, and operates out of offices in Silicon Valley, Boston, Canada, India and Mexico. For more information, please visit www.TapClicks.com. We're also well funded company. Get in touch and we'll be in touch! Best.

Job_Description: Eagle is currently seeking an AWS Architect . This is a three (3) month, contract position scheduled to start in May.  Key Responsibilities  The successful candidate will be responsible for: Providing recommendations to clients with respect to cloud migrations and preparing technical implementation roadmaps for AWS adoption;  Creating functional design specifications, reference architectures, and assisting with other project deliverables as needed;  Designing state-of-the-art technical solutions on AWS that address customer’s requirements for scalability, reliability, security, and performance;  Collaborating with other project teams on technical solutions and help improve service IP; and,  Staying up-to-date on all technical developments related to AWS.  Skills and Qualifications  The qualified candidate must have: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, other technical field;  Knowledge of building product-quality software on AWS including experience in designing for high availability, building multi-zone and multi-region architectures, and designing across appropriate SQL and NoSQL data layer technologies;  Familiarity with various application stacks such as Java, C#, .Net, etc.;  Configuration and deployment experience in two or more of the following:  AWS apps technologies such as RDS, ElasticBeanstalk, DynamoDB, RedShift;  AWS IaaS Technologies such as EC2, S3, EBS, ELB, VPC, Route 53;  Deployed applications with Web UI frontends;  Deployed application with RESTful/SOAP services interfaces;  Experience building private AMI’s on VPC’s;  Firm grasp on cloud security, leveraging Linux and Windows operating systems, using the AWS console and CLI (command line interface);  Experience as a hands-on technical practitioner/specialist in client facing roles in large enterprises and demonstrated client facing consulting skills, including building strong client relationships;  Excellent verbal, presentation and written communications skills;  Strong team skills including the ability to lead and be a team player; and,  AWS certification in any of the following - Solutions Architect, Developer or Systems Ops (an asset).  Don’t miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!  Eagle is an equal opportunity employer and will provide accommodations during the recruitment process upon request. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that your application does not signify the beginning of employment with Eagle and that employment with Eagle will only commence when placed on an assignment as a temporary employee of Eagle.
Title: AWS Architect

Job_Description: Notre client est le plus grand concepteur et distributeur de systèmes de sécurité et démarreurs à distance pour véhicules de particuliers en Amérique du Nord. Il conçoit, développe et commercialise des solutions de télématique qui permettent le contrôle et l’interaction à distance avec les véhicules.  Vous désirez travailler sur l’art du « Connected car » et les solutions IoT (Internet des objets). Joignez-vous à nous pour faire partie de l'aventure en tant que Développeur Sr. de logiciels front-end de l'équipe télématique ! L'équipe est responsable de développer des applications de types Nuage et IoT, et la plate-forme de messagerie. Dans un environnement en mode Agile, l’équipe logiciel est en constante évolution améliorant les méthodologies et l'environnement de travail.  Relevant du Chef d’équipe du développement des logiciels télématiques, vous devrez concevoir, développer et faire évoluer les services télématiques visant à évaluer le comportement de conducteurs d’automobiles. Les solutions sont composées d’équipements spécialisés dans les automobiles, d’apps sur téléphone intelligents et de systèmes back-end. Votre expérience en développement d’applications vous aidera à être un membre actif au développement de solutions, plus précisément au niveau du front-end.  Vos principales responsabilités seront :  Participer aux définitions des exigences pour les solutions web et UI pour les produits télématiques Fournir une analyse pour les solutions Assurer la facilité d'utilisation, la facilité de support, la robustesse, l'évolution et la sécurité des fonctionnalités : des éléments clés pour les solutions de conception recommandées Développer et coder les solutions web et UI Collaborer avec les autres membres de l’équipe (Mobile, Interface, Embarqué, Test, TI et Marketing) and nos partenaires externes lorsque requis Travailler dans un environnement en mode Agile-Sprint Participer à notre philosophie d’amélioration continue  Qualifications :  Baccalauréat en génie informatique ou équivalent Dix (10) années d’expérience en développement d’applications web Minimum d’une (1) année d’expérience en développement d’applications avec Angular 2 Expérience avec les technologies de cartographie UI (Google, etc.) Expérience avec les conceptions UI/UX Excellentes aptitudes en communication orale et écrite, français et anglais  Atouts :  Expérience en intégration de la télématique à haute disponibilité 24X7 ou des services IoT pour véhicules Expérience avec les technologies basées sur Java o Architectures de micro-service incluant Spring Boot, Spring REST & Spring JPA o Développement d’application web avec Angular 4 et PrimeNG Expérience au niveau de la conceptualisation de systèmes utilisant des services Web (REST, SOAP, XML/JSON) Expérience au niveau de la plate-forme de messagerie télématique de véhicules (traitement des messages GPS, traitement des alertes, configuration de l'appareil OTA) Expérience en technologie des services web Amazon incluant EC2, ECS, RDS, DynamoDB, CloudWatch Expérience en déploiement de Title: Software Engineer

Job_Description: *Multiple Openings*  Sitecore is the global leader in experience management software that enables context marketing. The Sitecore® Experience Platform™ manages content, supplies contextual intelligence, automates communications, and enables personalized commerce, at scale. It empowers marketers to deliver content in context of how customers have engaged with their brand, across every channel, in real time—before, during, and after a sale. More than 4,900 brands––including American Express, Carnival Cruise Lines, easyJet, and L’Oréal–– have trusted Sitecore for context marketing to deliver the personalized interactions that delight audiences, build loyalty, and drive revenue.  As a Software Engineer, you will be a member of the Product Support Services Team, responsible for assisting Sitecore’s implementation partners with best practices guidance, troubleshooting complex customizations, reverse engineering, and significantly contribute towards ramping up and developing the team in the first year. Sitecore implementations are handled by their network of partners. Because of the complex nature of Sitecore’s products, their partners often need assistance in mapping customer requirements to implementation best practices. The Software Engineer will work with partners to understand customer requirements and determine the proper implementation approach. In addition, the Software Engineer may troubleshoot implementations that are experiencing complex performance or functional issues. Ultimately, the Software Engineer solves problems that developer cannot solve. Sitecore will provide all necessary training on the Sitecore system. You will work with a team of business people and technologists who are smart, experienced and great fun to be around. Ideal candidates will have the following background: Experience in Microsoft technology platform, including: NET web applications C# Visual Studio SQL Server IIS Outstanding problem solving and logical thinking skills NET programming experience, including experience with 3rd-party APIs Experience working with data structures and creating software algorithms Experience defining solution architectures (software or physical) Experience troubleshooting complex software development projects Great communication skills in English Experience in the following would be a plus: Experience in frontend technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS Experience configuring load balancers and other network equipment Experience configuring Windows-based servers No travel required. This position is located in Gatineau.  Sitecore is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity without unlawful regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other local legally protected characteristic.
Title: Software Engineer, Product Support
